title: Montinore 2000 Müller-Thurgau (Willamette Valley)

description: The “Reserve” on the label is hardly appropriate in this banal version of what is normally a racy varietal. This version shows a mild fruit in a somewhat stewed version.
title: Turning Leaf 2001 Reserve Riesling (Monterey)

description: A surprisingly good little Syrah. The nose is full and dark, albeit a bit damp. The mouthfeel is big and rubbery but sound, with blackberry and chocolate flavors. Lightly toasted and jammy as well. Good stuff for the money.
title: Gotan 2009 Shiraz (Mendoza)

description: This one is a typical, off-dry Vinho Verde with a light prickle and the crispest fruit. The wine is very light, very bright and clean with attractive acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2015 Vinhas Altas White (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after a local aristocrat, this wine is soft, fruity and fresh. Red berry fruits are light and crisp. Behind them, gentle tannins give a hint of structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2014 Visconde de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a typical, fresh, off-dry Vinho Verde. It has citrus and apple flavors, a light, crisp prickle on the tongue and a candied aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2015 Anjos de Portugal White (Vinho Verde)

description: Candied fruit, cherry liqueur and a touch of Sherry shape a dense wine with a sour finish. The wine will probably taste too bitter if not paired with a soft, slightly sweet dish that makes use of cream or butter elements.
title: Vino dei Fratelli 2006  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

description: How do you make a Riesling this good and sell it for seven bucks? Juicy and fruity, it's absolutely loaded with citrus and stone fruit flavors, but offers supporting acidity, good length, and a touch of minerality.
title: The Ghost in the Machine 2011 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Cranberry and raspberry comprise the red-fruit nose, and next is the aroma of horse hide and a heavy dose of oak. The fruity palate is all about plum and cassis, and on the finish everything is in place and the texture is firm.
title: Carmen 2001 Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Simple melon and vanilla aromas and flavors in a lightweight wine. It'll go fine with carryout rotisserie chicken on a busy weeknight, when something else might be overkill.
title: Cockatoo Ridge 2000 Chardonnay (Australia)

description: The better side of the nose takes time to reveal itself. At first it's all apple cider, peanuts and popcorn, but then fresh apples and spice appear. In the mouth it's a little chewy, with more of that dominant apple character. A serviceable, drinkable wine, but nothing special.
title: Santa Julia 2001 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Just touched by oak, this is a smooth and ripe wine. Tropical fruits, apricots and mango give it a rich character while the acidity holds it all together. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Bridão Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: Cramele Recas's Dreamfish series of international varieties consistently offers bang for your buck, and this vintage of Cabernet Sauvignon is no exception. Rich, full bodied and easy drinking, this offers flavors of bright black cherry and berry, framed by notes of vanilla, toast and wet graphite.
title: Cramele Recas 2011 Dreamfish Cabernet Sauvignon (Viile Timisului)

description: Heading nicely in the crisp and aromatic direction, this is a light and bright wine. It has a citrus flavor that is balanced by richer pear and plum fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Chardonnay-Fernão Pires-Vital White (Lisboa)

description: In a medium sweet style, the wine has a light prickle and fine citrus acidity to balance the soft freshness. It is a refreshing wine, totally drinkable immediately.
title: Messias 2015 Santola White (Vinho Verde)

description: A bit scratchy up front, with some heat and rubber to the bouquet. Feels bold, grippy and alive, with lightly herbal flavors of roasted berry and leather. Herbal and blackened on the finish; ripe but basic in quality.
title: Bodegas Fontana 2010 Mesta Tempranillo (Uclés)

description: Timing is everything with this full-bodied PG. Get at it right away and it will still be almost viscous, but it should also show ripe tropical fruit flavors, core acidity and lots of personality. Just don't let it hang around for long, especially not at room temperature.
title: Santa Julia 2007 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: Wiry currant and plum aromas show a touch of oak in this value-priced wine. It feels somewhat chunky on the palate, with scraping tannins. Herbal plum flavors finish gamy and with a mild note of oaky clove.
title: Santa Rita 2016 120 Reserva Especial Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: This is an open and ready-to-drink wine that has soft tannins and juicy blackberry fruit. With 50% Aragonez in the blend, it is has a smooth character that brings out plenty fruit and not too much structure. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Cuvée B Red (Alentejo)

description: Crisp, bright and fruity, this is a refreshing and ripe wine. With attractive citrus acidity and a bright aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Adega de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

description: Young and fruity, this is a bright and wine for immediate drinking. It has hints of tannins, plenty of red fruits and no wood.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Brado Red (Alentejano)

description: Tightly constructed for an entry-priced Chardonnay, this has faint almond nuttiness accenting pineapple and grapefruit flavors. Drink this medium-bodied wine through mid-2018.
title: Jacob's Creek 2016 Chardonnay (Australia)

description: The winery has dialed back the time in oak for its barrel-fermented Viura to two months from five or six, and it's a decidedly less oaky wine than in years prior. Now it shows a controlled lees character along with lemon and apple flavors. Limited in what it offers, but made well.
title: Marqués de Cáceres 2006 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)

description: Soft, floral and fruity, this is a rounded wine with a gentle texture, yellow fruits and light acidity. There is a good touch of spice to fill the wine out right at the end.
title: Vieil Armand 2013 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: Purple flower and mature dark berry aromas lift out of the glass. Extremely simple and diluted, the palate offers suggestions of morello cherry, a hint of spice and loose-knit fleeting tannins.
title: La Fiera 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

description: This pink wine smells of red-apple skins. The palate is low on acidity but not entirely dull. Dry briny lightly bitter flavors don't show a lot of fruit, while this is pulpy on the finish.
title: Sonsierra 2015 Selección Tempranillo Rosé (Rioja)

description: Smooth and medium-bodied, with modest cherry scents and cassis and tobacco flavors. Soft and lacking energy on the finish, but clean.
title: Black Swan 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (South Eastern Australia)

description: Heavy and gold in color, with aromas of browned butter, wheat and corn cakes. The bouquet and color are heavy, and so is the palate: There you get oak barrel and toast, but little to no fruit. Even the finish is woody, with just a hint of melon and banana. A good experimental wine for those eager to taste oak; otherwise steer clear.
title: Viña Santa Monica 2001 Chardonnay (Rapel Valley)

description: A soft fruitiness and smooth texture make this medium-bodied red easy to enjoy. Strawberry and cherry notes rest easily on a bed of light tannin that adds an appetizing mouthfeel.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2013 Merlot (California)

description: Berry and cherry aromas register as soupy and flat. Like the nose, this feels flat, chewy and dense. Stewed, rubbery prunes and plums finish with a fig-like note and rubbery tannins.
title: Rayun 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Aromas like jam and maple syrup and equally ripe, generous flavors give this medium-bodied wine an easy appeal. The texture is soft for this type, the flavors are not too deep and the finish is light.
title: Twisted 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Soft and fruity with some sweetness, this red-fruit-flavored wine is rounded and warm, crispened by acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2011 Bistro Pinot Noir (Ile de Beauté)

description: Charming and perfumed, with notes of musk, white flowers and wild grapes on the nose and exotic spices in the mouth. This is not a concentrated wine, but there's enough acidity here to balance the slight sweetness and to make it a refreshing apéritif. Drink up.
title: Messina Hof 2009 Muscat Canelli (Texas)

description: At this price, and with a case production of 110,000, lots of Americans will consider themselves lucky to have a solid red wine like this. It's not terribly complicated, but offers easy flavors of cherries and oak.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2012 Zinfandel (California)

description: This is a rich, full wine that has red fruits and soft tannins. With balanced acidity, only a hint of tannins, it is ready to drink.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Montaria Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Moscatel and Arinto, this is light and thin with only the vaguest hint of citrus fruit acidity. It should be drunk now.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Colheita White (Lisboa)

description: Aromas of strawberry sherbet are followed by sweet candy-shop flavors on the palate. Chill it thoroughly before drinking. Screwcap.
title: Viniverde 2011 Estreia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Honey-sweet in orange and vanilla flavors, this wine has a good backbone of acidity that makes it crisp and clean. Drink it with vanilla desserts or even cheesecake.
title: Redtree 2009 Moscato (California)

description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are fragile and sketchy but not broken. This value-priced Cabernet shows a midlevel palate with moderate concentration. Herbal plum and raspberry flavors finish easy.
title: Santa Luz 2014 Alba Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Tomato leaf, rhubarb and herbal aromas come in front of a tight, tannic and prickly palate with green, spicy berry flavors. Turns hot and smacky on the finish, with carob and herbal flavors.
title: Finca El Origen 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Light red wine, with a stalky black currant character. It is very fruity, showing herbs and soft tannins. Almost an apéritif red, certainly one for lightly flavored dishes.
title: Aveleda 2010 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: The tea and raspberry aromas are easygoing, and that best describes this organic Cabernet Sauvignon. It's powerful enough on the palate, with a good berry flavor that tilts towards raspberry. The finish is herbal and peppery.
title: Vicente Gandia 2010 Organic Cabernet Sauvignon (Spain)

description: This is an easy, fruity wine. Soft and light in character, it has attractive red fruits and acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Jose Maria Vieira 2014 Borges Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: Rubbery and roasted, but not too much so. Otherwise one should look for medicinal berry aromas followed by flavors of baked plum, prune and black pepper. The finish is dense, a touch flat, and chocolaty; overall this is a chunky, sweet performer.
title: Bodegas Tarima 2009 Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: A lively, surprising bargain made from Viognier, Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay. That it costs merely $8 makes the melon and apple aromas and flavors all the better. Citrusy as it evolves, and clean throughout, with no wavering. A very nice white quaffing wine.
title: Korta 2009 Viognier-Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay White (Lontué Valley)

description: There is a strong barnyard aroma here, although the palate is cleaner and more modern. With rich tannins and a dark plum character, it's ripe and structured. There is a strong mineral element, giving the wine power and density. Drink from 2016.
title: Borges 2011 Lello Red (Douro)

description: Raspberry and cherry aromas are juicy and wiry, with no fat at all. Pure, simple berry flavors come with a touch of spice, while the finish is short yet juicy. An easy-drinking and approachable selection.
title: Viña Albali 2012 Smooth Red Tempranillo (Valdepeñas)

description: A rich, opulent wine at an unbelievable price, this Chard has layers of ripe peaches, pears and tropical fruits, and a lush overlay of toasty oak. The wonderfully creamy texture leads to a long, spicy finish. Despite the statewide appellation, this is as good as many regional Chardonnays.
title: Esser Cellars 2001 Chardonnay (California)

description: Latex, earth and briar patch aromas are rough on the nose. Cranberry, red plum, olive and herbal flavors finish a bit sour, with a snappy feel.
title: Creación 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: Earthy cherry and prune aromas lack pop and seem damp. This is astringent across the palate, with flavors of prune and oaky vanilla. A raisiny, mealy finish is choppy and exits with the aftertaste of prune.
title: Region 1 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Soft and smooth, this is a rounded, apple and pear flavored wine. With a streak of lemon acidity at the end, it has just the right amount of freshness. Drink now.
title: Caves Aliança 2013 Alabastro Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Light, mildly stalky aromas of grassy red fruits are on the raw and simple side. This feels hard, with a smacking mouthfeel. Earthy flavors of raspberry and plum finish chewy but flat.
title: Juan Gil 2012 Honoro Vera Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: Smells like wet dog, with sweaty red fruit. The palate is high in acid and low in volume, with snappy, semisour flavors of raspberry and red plum. Settles on the finish but still it's sharp and lean. 80% Tempranillo and 20% Malbec.
title: 2 Copas 2009 Red (Mendoza)

description: Touches of ginger and orange zest lighten up the ample fruit flavors of this well-balanced value-priced wine. It has good acidity to match the ripeness of the Anjou pear and white peach flavors.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California)

description: Expanding the Casal Garcia range into the Douro, this light and fruity wine is an easy drink. It has some toast to balance the soft tannins and black currant fruits.
title: Aveleda 2014 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A smoky wine with black currant flavors that bring together spice and fruitiness. The wine has a light touch, licorice and stalky tannins ending with attractive juiciness. It is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: This blend of 75% Pinot Grigio and 15% Vermentino is a light, simple quaff with some snap to it and not much on the finish.
title: Peltier 2011 Hybrid Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

description: This weighty Vermentino has splashes of Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Grigio. It tastes as though it spent a great amount of time in barrel, however the aging vessel is listed as 100% stainless steel.
title: Peltier 2011 Hybrid Vermentino (Lodi)

description: Kudos to Oak Grove for making such a nice wine at this everyday price. Drinks crisp in acidity and dry, with an ultraclean, spicy finish. Flavorwise, you'll find grilled nectarines and pineapples, with a touch of vanilla. This is a tremendous value.
title: Oak Grove 2007 Reserve Viognier (California)

description: Gentle in texture and generous in flavor, this wine is medium bodied, rather soft in mouthfeel and has ripe strawberry and red-cherry notes that are direct and delicious, leaving a fruity, almost sweet finish.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: There's a fair lick of dried wood notes on this straightforward sipper. The fruity strawberry and blueberry core is plush and pleasing, as is the soft grip of tannins at the backend.
title: Hardys 2014 Stamp of Australia Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)

description: This medium-sweet wine brings aromas of acacia flowers and lemon lime zest to the fore. In the mouth there are flavors of honeycomb, lemon and acacia flower. The finish is delightful and slightly sweet.
title: Jidvei 2016 Treasure of Transylvania Medium Sweet Gewurztraminer (Tarnave)

description: Light apple and floral aromas lead to rich flavors like apple, honey and grapefruit and a definite sweetness. This wine is fresh and easy to enjoy.
title: Twisted 2013 Moscato (California)

description: The familiar rosé Lancers is all about crushed strawberries with a touch of sugar. There is a light structure, but the attractive light pink color and the fresh fruit all work together. Screwcap.
title: José Maria da Fonseca NV Lancers Rosé Red (Table wine)

description: Light and fresh, with hints of peach, citrus, melon, spice and slate. The wine serves up a refreshing mix for spring and summertime sipping. Fruity on the finish. -J.M.
title: Firestone 2002 Riesling (Central Coast)

description: Bright, fresh, fruity and light bodied, with pretty peach, apple and spice flavors that leave a crisp, clean and pleasant finish. Fairly sweet, but refreshing.
title: J. Lohr 2002 Bay Mist Riesling (Monterey)

description: An aromatic, fruity nose and balanced fruity/floral flavors recommend this elegant Chardonnay from Recas. Good minerality and acid and a lingering finish add to the appeal. Pair with poultry, pork.
title: Cramele Recas 2008 Chardonnay (Recas)

description: Opens with honest green notes of gooseberry, lime and sea foam, and while the palate is a touch soft in texture, it has true Chilean SB flavors of bell pepper, fresh lettuce and melon. Sturdy on the finish, with a forward attitude.
title: Yali 2009 Wetland Winemaker's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

description: This poised white offers aromas of honeysuckle, pear and flowers, and on the palate, curvy flavors of spice, apples and pear. Charming—serve chilled with cheese, dessert.
title: Heavenly Retreat 2007 Riesling (Recas)

description: Pineapple and other tropical fruits comprise the simple, straightforward nose. Pear and tangerine flavors come across sharp, as does the finish. The wine is a bit edgy and lean on its own.
title: La Palma 2002 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Dark and earthy, slightly pruny and alcoholic, finishing on notes of tar and molasses.
title: L.A. Cetto 1999 Petite Sirah (Valle de Guadalupe)

description: Early aromas of sea water, mushroom and rubber integrate into a more pleasant whole. The flavors are sweet and candied, while on the finish a mild vegetal hint comes on. That said, the wine is decent in the mouth, where the texture is pleasant.
designation: San Francisco de Mostazal Reserva Especial
title: Vino de Eyzaguirre 2001 San Francisco de Mostazal Reserva Especial Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: A great value choice, I Versi Bianco (made with Grecanico, Inzolia and Grillo) is a crisp wine, with easy aromas of lemon zest, cut grass, almond skin and crushed brimstone. Pair it with Southwestern grilled chicken salad.
title: Fondo Antico 2010 I Versi Bianco White (Sicilia)

description: You can't beat the price of this simple, quaffable red from Oak Lane, and certainly this is a wine that could make for very nice everyday sipping. A nose of wood spice and berry unfolds into flavors of toasted oak, bright berry and pepper. Though a bit one-dimensional, the wine offers structure and style.
title: Beau Joubert 2006 Oak Lane Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Stellenbosch)

description: A solid combination of Chenin's curvy, honeyed flavors and the clean crispness of Sauvignon Blanc. An affordable, dependable wine with a go-to personality for everyday enjoyment.
designation: Oak Lane Chenin Blanc - Sauvignon Blanc
title: Beau Joubert 2007 Oak Lane Chenin Blanc - Sauvignon Blanc White (Stellenbosch)

description: For a value-priced wine this scores well. The nose offers a nice mix of earth, warmth and berry fruit, while the palate is juicy, fresh and tastes of zesty berry. Composed on the finish, which is also fresh and lively. Perfect for by-the-glass or casual consumption.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Maximo 2007 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: A popular style, fruity and forward, with the emphasis on citrus, grapefruit and apricot, rather than floral qualities. Sweet fruit set against tangy acid makes it a versatile food wine too.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2001 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A sweet Vinho Verde, it is light, fruity and perfect for the summer. With crisp acidity, a lively, frothy texture and a clean apple aftertaste, it can be drunk now.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2013 Arca Nova White (Vinho Verde)

description: This opens with a lightly fruity aroma that carries a hint of fresh bread, butter and vanilla. These lead to fresh, straightforward fruit flavors like canteloupe and apple, again with a bit of vanilla kicking in on the finish. The texture is smooth, rather lush and the wine is light to medium bodied.
title: Coyote Creek 2013 Chardonnay (California)

description: Here's a ripe, earthy wine that is softly tannic and richly fruity. It has a fine balance between the warm blackberry fruits and solid structure. Made to be drunk young, it is already delicious. Screwcap.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Ciconia Red (Alentejano)

description: Here is a tasty, light-bodied Zin with its own style and a great price. It has a minty, eucalyptus aroma and vivid raspberry flavors, almost sweet in balance. Medium-bodied, it delivers a lingering fruity finish.
title: Oak Grove 2012 Family Reserve Zinfandel (California)

description: The 2015 vintage is a strong one for Woodbridge. Ripe fruit tones, bright acidity and lightly mouth-puckering tannins underpin red cherry, clove and blackberry flavors, while the texture is mouthfilling. It's a treat to find an inexpensive wine with such good backbone.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: There is only a handful of Kosher sparkling Proseccos out there, and this is one of them. Lively and bright, the wine shows citrus, stone fruit and dried hay aromas.
title: Banero NV Banero  (Prosecco)

description: With soft tannins and ripe berry fruits, this is an immediately accessible wine. It has a fresh character, with a smoky edge and a ripe, smooth aftertaste. This would make a great barbecue wine for the summer.
title: Aveleda 2014 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: Briny raspberry aromas are a bit murky. This smacks down hard with acidity, while the flavors run toward earthy, generic plum and berry. A salty finish with animal notes is firm but struggles with cleanliness.
title: Casa de Campo 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Nicely concentrated with a core of ripe red fruit and menthol, this is a fresh, forward Cab that's a bargain at $8. Bright and clean from start to finish, the finish lingers on smooth, velvety tannins and a fresh, herbaceous mint note.
title: Vini 2009 Veni Vidi Vici Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)

description: Peach and lemon curd aromas are good but basic. A plump, melony palate displays freshness and flavors of honeydew, papaya and lime. A soft but not flabby palate is just bright enough.
title: Viña Vilano 2013 Verdejo (Rueda)

description: A blend of Colombard and Ugni Blanc, this crisp, light wine is as fresh as a daisy. Fruity and aromatic, it offers citrus and melon flavors. The fruit explodes in the mouth, leaving a light, bright aftertaste.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2013 Colombelle L'Originel White (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Clean, simple pear, melon and apple aromas are friendly. Reasonably full and fresh on the palate, this value-priced wine tastes of tropical fruits including banana and papaya as well as honey. A slightly oily finish gives weight to closing citrus flavors.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2014 Petirrojo Reserva Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Stony lemon-lime aromas are low on fruit but clean and familiar. This is racy and fresh, with cutting acidity. Flavors of lime and passion fruit register as common, while the finish is zesty, with an emphasis on grapefruit.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2014 Petirrojo Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: Roasted and mildly leafy, and then clacky and a bit tannic in the mouth. The fruit flavors are good and mostly pure as they settle on black cherry and blackberry, while the finish is jammy but short. For $8 this should not disappoint.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Capa 2008 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Going for structure as much as fruit, this is a cool wine with black currant flavors giving high acidity. It feels light, fresh, although there are tannins and spice to give some final weight.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2007 Bridão Classico Red (Ribatejo)

description: Aromas of black olive and black fruits show an almost grilled element. This wine offers energy and balance, with a touch of oak. Plum, berry and cherry flavors end powerfully on a tightly wound finish.
title: Santa Rita 2016 120 Reserva Especial Hero's Red (Central Valley)

description: What a great value! This medium-bodied wine has spicy oak accents and mouth-filling fruit flavors. It's ripe and generous, with plump cherry and raspberry notes and a palate marked by mild tannins and soft texture.
title: Three Thieves 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: From a winery founded 137 years ago, this Grillo-based Sicilian white offers fresh aromas of citrus, honey, exotic fruit and Granny Smith apple. The finish is pure, simple and clean.
title: Baglio Curatolo Arini 1875 2010 Villa Tonino Grillo (Sicilia)

description: A pleasant, softly fruity bubbly with a tad more sweetness than you’d think from “Extra Dry.” It has some pretty flavors of apple juice with a dash of lime. Crisp acidity and fine, distinct bubbles keep things lively and fresh with this very clean crowd-pleaser of a wine.
title: Freixenet NV Cordon Negro Extra Dry  (Penedès)

description: Peach, scented candle wax and matchstick make for a solid bouquet. Feels good, maybe a touch cloying, but not too much. Flavors of crystallized mango and pineapple mix with fresh melon, and the finish is clean. About all you could hope for from an $8 Argentine Moscato.
title: Casa de Campo 2011 Moscato (Mendoza)

description: This wine has a hot-pink color, effusive strawberry and cherry aromas and then sweet fruit flavors that give a sugary impression on the palate. It's very simple in approach and low in alcohol.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 White Zinfandel (California)

description: This is called sweet and that's what it is. The candied sweetness is balanced by some acidity to keep the wine crisp and fruity. It will be fine as an apéritif. Drink now.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Sweet White (Vinho Verde)

description: Powdery berry aromas lead to a basic palate that's chewy but hollow in the middle. Cherry and plum flavors are generic, while this wine displays a solid feel on the finish.
title: Santa Rita 2016 120 Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Valley)

description: This light-bodied wine has aromas of celery and citrus that lead to crisp flavors of fresh herbs and lemon. Good acidity is smoothed out by a hint of sweetness lending a soft effect to the midpalate and finish.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: This inexpensive wine is enjoyable to drink for its raisin aromas, ample fruit flavors and comparatively soft, easy texture for the variety.
title: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Petite Sirah (California)

description: A white this age should be fresh and crisp; this one is a bit dull and shows only faint bitter lemon flavors on the finish to go with tired apple aromas.
title: Seigneurs de Bergerac 1999 White (Bergerac)

description: In a reference to the storks who build nests in the chimneys of the Eiffel-designed DFJ winery, Storks Landing shows bright acidity, layers of citrus plus a touch of more exotic pineapple. A blend of Fernão Pires and Chardonnay, it's fresh and light in the mouth, mineral and crisp at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Storks Landing White (Lisboa)

description: Somewhat watery and simple, this Pinot has pleasant cherry, cola and oak flavors. The mouthfeel is raw.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2012 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This Merlot seems designed for folks who like their red wines with residual sugar. It's soft and sugary, with raspberry jam and oak flavors.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2012 Merlot (California)

description: Lightly sweet, this is a soft, gently fruity wine with a prickle on the tongue and fruit-drop acidity. Screwcap.
title: Aveleda 2012 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after the crickets, or cicadas, whose song fills the summer nights, this soft and lightly perfumed wine has citrus and apple fruit flavors, a tangy, flinty texture and plenty of acidity. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Cigarra Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This opens with a familiar taste of artificial, roasted char, then it moves on to soupy berry aromas. It feels scratchy, with flavors of hickory, baked plum and berry.
title: Funky Llama 2011 Merlot (Mendoza)

description: This Merlot is thin in body and flavor, with sour cherry and white pepper notes. Despite that, it's clean and dry.
title: Butterfield Station 2010 Merlot (California)

description: Dry and silky in texture, but there's not much else going on, except for modest cherry, tobacco and herb flavors.
title: Redtree 2011 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This seems as sweet as fruit juice, with flavors of orange, pineapple and banana. It's creamy and warm, in the way of the modern Chardonnay style.
title: Butterfield Station 2011 Chardonnay (California)

description: This is a spicy, rich, smooth wine, immediately attractive and ready to drink. It has ripe tannins, black fruits in abundance and delicious acidity to give a lift. It's a classic barbecue wine and great for summer parties.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2009 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)

description: I Versi is a youthful blend of Nero d'Avola, Merlot and Syrah that offers plump aromas of ripe cherry and blackberry backed by soft tones of cinnamon and toasted almond. It's a perfect pairing to a heaping plate of spaghetti carbonara with crispy fried bacon.
title: Fondo Antico 2010 I Versi Red (Sicilia)

description: A great entry-level Riesling, fresh, floral and delicate, the Two Vines offers refined, even subtle flavors of green apple and melon, with lovely natural acidity. Despite considerable residual sugar, it does not seem overly sweet.
title: Columbia Crest 2008 Two Vines Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: An attractively fruity wine that's easy to drink and fresh. Lemon and apples give a crisp edge, followed by a zesty, fragrant character. Drink this light wine now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Cassis, raisin, vanilla and rooty spice aromas give this Tempranillo blend some class on the bouquet. It's resiny and fairly heavy feeling, with lightly burnt and earthy flavors of herbal red berry and plum. Dry and peppery on the finish.
title: Bodegas Los Llanos 2005 Señorío de los Llanos Crianza Red (Valdepeñas)

description: A blend of Cabernet and Merlot, this has red fruit notes, a light structure and plenty of final acidity. It finishes with caramel as well as freshness.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2013 Colombelle L'Originel Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: A dose of cherry cough drop adds sweetness to what is otherwise a tart, simple, steely version of Cabernet Sauvignon blended with Malbec. The mouthfeel is sheering and lean, while the finish offers some out of place butter to fatten up the astringent red fruit.
title: Aitor Ider Balbo 2006 El Encanto Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Mendoza)

description: The style is obtuse and the wine is sweet as sin and unctuous. Aromas of canned pear and peach suggest a lot of residual sugar.
title: Bodegas Escorihuela 2006 La Vuelta Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Cherry and blackberry aromas are simple and slightly rubbery and reduced. In the mouth, this is juicy, fruity and a touch scratchy. Flavors of jammy berry and black plum finish regular and easy.
title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2013 El Circo Volatinero Tempranillo (Cariñena)

description: Basic and a little sweet and confected, but consider the price and you should be smiling. There's some bramble and pepper to the nose, but mostly it's just ripe and full of blackberry and black plum character. Candied and almost cloying, but remains flush and happy. Good in the midlevel category.
title: Wrongo Dongo 2009 Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: Flamboyant, exotic aromas of oranges and mangoes emanate from the glass, but the tropical and citrus fruits are more muted in the mouth, finishing with earth and a spicy, clove-pepper note.
title: Agustinos 2001 Estate Chardonnay (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Bone-dry, hard and crisp, this is a basic, stainless-steel fermented, nonmalolactic style of Chardonnay. Brisk and competent, but neutral.
title: Paul Thomas 1999 Chardonnay (Washington)

description: This stylish lightweight has some tasty pear, quince and citrus flavors, finishing with a hint of spice. Best as an apéritif or with a light fish course.
title: Penmara 2000 Chardonnay (New South Wales)

description: A lean, edgy wine, which shows bramble fruits, red berries and tense tannins. There's fine structure and, given a few months, the acidity will turn this into a good food wine.
title: Quinta do Gradil 2005 Cortello Syrah (Estremadura)

description: Incredibly candied and sweet smelling, much like cotton candy or pink marshmallows. The palate has a cloying, sticky mouthfeel and flavors of raisin, milk chocolate and herbal, tart berry fruits. Creamy and carob-like on the finish. Tastes and smells affected.
title: Santa Florentina 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Famatina Valley)

description: A pretty good Cabernet for this everyday price. It's very dry and rich in tannins, with sweet-and-sour flavors of cherries, herbs and mint. Fine for an inexpensive, by-the-glass program.
title: Round Hill 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Although based in Bairrada, further south, Messias does have considerable interests in the Douro. This wine, with its firm, mineral structure, brings out the tannins and concentration of the Douro. That goes with the black fruit flavors that are dark and dry. Drink this wine now.
title: Messias 2013 Messias Selection Red (Douro)

description: Soft, with a light texture and approachable acidity, this is a bright wine that has plenty of apricot and pear flavors. The wine is fresh and ready to drink, with an orange zest finish.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: One of the classic brands of Vinho Verde, this is still one of the best. It has great fruitiness and crisp acidity, only just off dry. Lemon sherbet and fresh orange zest give a delicious lift to the finish.
title: Aveleda 2014 Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: A bit off course as Verdejo goes, with spritz to the palate and then mealy citrus and persimmon flavors. Lingers but doesn't do or say much on the finish. Not bad but it doesn't click.
title: Vicente Gandia 2010 Organic Verdejo (Spain)

description: A mongrel blend of Syrah, Sangiovese, Grenache and Cabernet Franc, this fruity red has a sweet core of blueberry jam, round and forward and quite appealing. It's dusted with baking spices and fades gently into a soft finish. Hard to imagine a more agreeable bottle of Washington red at this price.
title: Columbia Crest 2008 Two Vines Vineyard 10 Red Wine Red (Washington)

description: Apples and strawberry combine easily in this soft, fresh rosé. It's fruity, light, with a slight prickle in the mouth.
title: Aveleda 2010 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Ripe aromas of baked berry and raisin stop short of being too ripe. In the mouth, this basic Tempranillo is chunky but balanced by fresh acids. Plum, prune and spice flavors finish loamy and plump. Good wine for $8.
title: Bodegas Los Llanos 2009 Señorio de los Llanos Crianza Tempranillo (Valdepeñas)

description: Yellow straw, oxidized, with dull and flat flavors showing hints of banana and dried apple.
title: Silver Lake 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: Named after a Portuguese dance, this fresh, fruitcake and blackberry-flavored wine is easily ready to drink, a wine that powers through with its sweet, juicy fruit and final acidity.
title: Aveleda 2005 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: Tropical and forward, and with three months spent in oak, the wine offers some resin and vanilla both on the nose and in flavor. Tastes sweet, honeyed and nutty, with banana and melon notes. An easy drinker that will do best if well chilled.
title: Borsao 2010 White Macabeo (Campo de Borja)

description: Ripe black cherry and a lick of herbs are wrapped up in a solid structure of balanced acidity and tannins, with a slightly savory finish. The oak is prominent, as is the ripe fruit, but for the price, this is the kind of bargain Shiraz Australia once built its Stateside reputation on.
title: Banrock Station 2015 Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)

description: A blend of Syrah, Castelão and Aragonez, this is a ripe, full wine that has fine soft fruit. The tannins give just the right edge to the red fruits and final acidity. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Red (Lisboa)

description: This is an easy-drinking, smooth and generous wine. With its light tannins and red berry fruit, it is ready to drink young. The aftertaste adds some acidity to give a lift.
title: Lobo 2014 Lobocellar Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Sweet melon and apple aromas fall off to cheesy. The palate has some jump in it, but the flavors are generic and sweet, suggesting mealy citrus and banana. A rudimentary wine with a gimmicky name.
title: Arge & Tina 2009 Chardonnay (San Juan)

description: Ripe and fruity, with some sweetness that does not seem to be fully integrated. So the green plum flavors are attractive, as is the acidity, but there is an intrusive sugary edge.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Segada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Fresh apple flavors and a crisp vein of acidity make this medium-bodied wine lively and refreshing, while still delivering delicious Pippin apple and white peach flavors. It feels balanced, clean and easy to enjoy.
title: Twisted 2013 Chardonnay (California)

description: Light berry and sugar cookie aromas kick it off, followed by peach pit and nectarine flavors. For a wine that's basic in composition and a little dilute, it's also fresh and held together by good acidity. Straightforward but solid.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Bodegas Eguren 2007 Reinares Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Jammy berry and pastry aromas are basic but flat. This feels easy and fruity, but not the least bit exact. Generic black fruit and berry flavors end with notes of plum and licorice.
title: Autoritas 2014 Malbec (Central Valley)

description: This is pure fruitiness, a wine packed with spice, berry fruits and soft, open tannins. It is a great barbecue-style wine, ripe, with good acidity and a bright, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2010 Quinta Essência Red (Tejo)

description: Fun and refreshing, this opens with aromas of tropical fruit and a hint of almond while the bright, fruity palate offers green apple and peach. It's simple but well made.
title: Anterra 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This is a touch mealy on the nose, with ripe stone-fruit and melon aromas. A juicy, direct palate follows, with citrus and green-fruit flavors that finish quick and clean.
title: Zagarrón 2013 Hacienda Zargón Sauvignon Blanc (La Mancha)

description: Floral plum and black cherry aromas are nice and fruity. A bright, juicy, simple palate holds flavors of plum, blackberry and chocolate. While nothing sticks out on the finish, this Garnacha ends nicely and overdelivers.
title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2015 El Circo Acróbato Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: Lithe and nicely balanced, this flavorful wine shows a red berry-herb bouquet and a pleasingly dry, gently spicy palate. The mouthfeel is good, and shows some texture despite the fact that it's light-weight on the palate. An interesting chalk note comes in on the back end of this pleasant, easy-drinking surprise.
title: Stone Creek 1998 Special Selection Zinfandel (California)

description: Plenty of herbal, mushroomy notes in the nose. The wine is light, soft and fruity. The mushroom flavors could be a real asset with the right food. Finishes true to form, with nothing off.
title: Talus 1998 Zinfandel (California)

description: This is a satisfying, ripe and rich wine. It has big layers of red fruits, attractive spice from partial wood aging and fresh acidity. Still young, it will be even better from early 2016.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2014 Ciconia Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: More like Zinfandel with its peppery, prickly mouthfeel, but not a bad wine for everyday purposes. It's dry and full-bodied and brisk, with blackberry, currant and herb flavors.
title: Oak Grove 2008 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Lots to admire in this dry, full-bodied Merlot. It's forward and charming in sour red cherry candy, blueberry and herb flavors, with a nice edge of smoky oak. Contains a little Cabernet and Zinfandel for complexity, and the alcohol is nice and low. Great price.
title: Round Hill 2008 Merlot (California)

description: Harmonious on the nose and palate with ripe black plums and cassis enveloped by a layer of char and smoke. Medium to full bodied with structured acidity, it's a straightforward but sound Merlot with powdery, soft tannins and a tasty black cherry and graham cracker finish.
title: Vini 2009 Veni Vidi Vici Merlot (Thracian Valley)

description: Fleshy and fruity, fresh and full bodied, this generous wine offers scents of orange peel and citrus, and the palate exudes ripe flavors of grapefruit, lime and a hint of melon.
title: Snoqualmie 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Fullish and broad in the mouth without going overboard, this is textbook Chardonnay with mass appeal. Peach and vanilla flavors persist nicely on the finish, pointed up with finely judged acids. Drink now.
title: Jacob's Creek 2009 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: Bright pink in color, this 100% Touriga Nacional rosé is ripe with caramel and red berry flavors. It misses out on acidity, leaving the wine flat at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 Rosé (Tejo)

description: A blend of Grenache Blanc and Viognier, this is attractive, fruity and perfumed. Touches of apricot balance with the green fruits and herbal edge. It's an easy wine to drink, best as an apéritif.
title: Cuvée Lion d'Or 2015 White (Vin de France)

description: Fresh, crisp and fruity, this is a citrus and apple-flavored medium-dry wine. With plenty of acidity, bright and packed with easy fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Bold and very clumsy. There are leathery elements to the nose and wild, grapy fruit that stumbles onto the palate. A wall of tannins hits you on the finish, and throughout it's untamed and overdone. Very fruity and forward, but devoid of tact.
title: Château de Pennautier 2001 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: It is amazing that 134,000 cases of this budget bottling can be made to this level of quality. From a classic vintage, it's structured and substantial, overcoming the somewhat overdone vanilla flavors with great fruit and firm acids.
title: Columbia Crest 2006 Two Vines Merlot-Cabernet (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This soft and fruity wine is crisp, fragrant and fresh. It has light acidity that balances with the forward apple flavor, as well as a dry lime edginess and nervy texture. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This wine is young but ripe, with spice and blackberry fruits. It has a core of mineral tannins that are a reminder of the hard schist rocks of the Douro. With this dry structure, it needs to be aged, so drink from 2017.
title: Aveleda 2013 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: While this wine is dry, its warm strawberry fruit rounds out its character with a softness. Lemon sherbet acidity gives another touch of almost sweetness. Drink now.
title: Roquevale 2015 Ossa Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Named after the range of mountains close to the Roquevale winery, this wine is ripe, soft and offers an attractive series of red fruits and rich tannins. Drink this wine now.
title: Roquevale 2015 Ossa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: True bargains are hard to come by, so drop your guard for this $8 SB and you may wind up happy. Xplorador from Concha Y Toro is peachy and simple, with light grassiness and green notes. But it does have a plump, neutral palate and likable pineapple and apple flavors. Inoffensive and not flashy, but good for the money.
title: Concha y Toro 2008 Xplorador Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: This Romanian Riesling has aromas of peach, lemon blossom and honeysuckle. In the mouth there are flavors of apricot and lemon zest. The finish is clean and a bit astringent.
title: Jidvei 2016 Treasure of Transylvania Riesling (Tarnave)

description: Candied yellow apples, sweet honeydew and very ripe Bosc pears show on the nose of this bottling. Tropical flavors of guava and tuberose dominate the sip, proving a tad thick and fruity.
title: Member's Mark 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Pyrazine-based notes of green pepper are most prominent on a basic nose. This feels lean and stony. Briny, salty citrus flavors lack complexity.
title: Santa Alicia 2016 Reserva Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Briny cherry and raspberry aromas offer up a note of tire rubber. Muddled cherry and berry flavors finish short, and overall this wine lacks character.
title: Region 1 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Smells like pineapple blended with lemon candy. Zesty in the mouth, with crisp lemon, lime, bell pepper and a touch of mineral stoniness. Long on the finish, and for a wine of this price it's delivering the max. Likable and not complicated.
title: Viña La Rosa 2009 La Palma Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Herbal red plum and raspberry aromas are jammy yet fresh. This feels a bit scratchy up front, then creamy on the back palate. Flavors of lactic plum and cherry emphasize oak, while the finish is bright but slightly abrasive in feel.
title: La Mano 2011 Roble Mencía (Bierzo)

description: Tastes as sweet as Lifesaver lemon and pineapple candy, with low acidity.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2007 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California)

description: This is a fruity wine with a off-dry character that is balanced by lime and lemon fruitiness. The acidity and the tangy herbal character give the wine an attractive bite. Drink now.
title: Caves Velhas NV Lagosta White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is classic, off-dry Vinho Verde. With its light prickle, crisp fruit that has a tangy lime and lemon character that comes through the candy flavor, it is a refreshing, light wine.
title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a young, fruity wine with fine acidity and plenty of red-fruit flavors. Light spice, generous tannins and a hint of wood all contribute to a balanced wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Santos Jorge 2014 Toutalga Red (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Touriga Nacional with Merlot is perfumed and light. It has a salmon pink color, layers of citrus as well as red-currant fruit and a soft texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Vinho Selection Rosé (Tejo)

description: Castilla y León can be good bargain country, and all of the 2006 Volteo wines are Best Buy qualifiers. This varietal Tempranillo has a clean, fruity nose backed by bright berry flavors built on a floor or two of structure. It's a composed quaffer with pure flavors, adequate length and overall balance.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Volteo 2006 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Fragrant and floral, this is a deliciously easy wine, a blend of the local Gascon Colombard grape with Ugni Blanc. There are flavors of grapefruit, white fruits and a light, crisp green aftertaste. Screwcap.
region_1: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2007 Colombelle White White (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)

description: A terrific value wine, La Piazza (in a screw cap bottle) is a blend of Merlot and Nero d'Avola. Bright aromas of cinnamon, Spanish cedar, mocha, black cherry and bitter almond have a raw, vinous quality.
title: Calatrasi 2009 La Piazza Red (Sicilia)

description: Light and pleasant, with aromas mixing baked pears, citrus and honeycomb, this is really a lovely wine for the price. The fruit flavors follow consistently, pears and apples with a hint of citrus, clean and refreshing, with juicy acidity.
title: Columbia Crest 2008 Two Vines Chardonnay (Washington)

description: Barrel fermented. Scents of new wood dominate; the juice is very tart, the oak not yet well-integrated.
title: Ashland Vineyards 1999 Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)

description: Vaguely floral aromas precede a sweet, cloying palate that tastes candied.
title: Region 1 2013 Moscato (Mendoza)

description: A clean and easy style of Chardonnay with peach and melon aromas followed by a melony palate with nectarine and a touch of sweetness. It flattens out and loses intensity on the finish, but overall it's totally drinkable and solid.
title: La Vuelta 2009 Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Fresh and flowery, with a seductive aromatic profile of gardenia, freesia and honeysuckle that lead to a very likeable, berryish palate. Light-bodied and off-dry, this is a good choice to serve on its own before a meal. Drink now to 2011.
title: Messina Hof 2009 Father and Son Cuvee Riesling (Texas)

description: A little creamy, waxy and scattershot, but also far more exotic and different than most $8 wines. This is barrel-fermented Viura, but the oak level is light and manageable. Flavors of papaya, melon and citrus are almost tropical in scope, and the finish is pretty fresh. Drink right away for maximum freshness.
title: Bodegas Valdemar 2007 Conde de Valdemar Viura (Rioja)

description: A great value wine, its firm tannins surrounded by the freshest berry fruits and acidity. For drinking young, with its attractive ripe, open flavors.
title: Dão Sul 2009 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Red (Dão)

description: Stone-fruit aromas of nectarine and ripe peach drizzled with honey are followed by medium-plus sweet fruit flavors. It's a straight-forward easy drinker.
title: Hogue 2015 Late Harvest Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine does not display the Riesling sweetness scale that's found on most Ste. Michelle Wine Estates Rieslings. This is off dry, and it has punchy peach, pear and apple flavors.
title: Snoqualmie 2011 Winemaker's Select Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A very herbaceous, fish-friendly wine that wins with its lemon and pink grapefruit flavors. It's aromatic and light, with the fruitiness right up front. Screwcap.
title: Barton & Guestier 2012 The Pairing Collection Salmon & Trout  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This medium-bodied wine has fresh red cherry and strawberry aromas followed by light cherry and plum flavors, very mild tannins and a rather soft texture.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2015 Cabernet Merlot (California)

description: Warm and ripe, this is a full-bodied rosé that has the weight and some of the tannins of a red wine. With its vivid pink color and sweet strawberry fruits, it's fruity and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2013 Alandra Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Concentrated berry aromas are basic and hint at sugar beets. This feels jammy and a bit syrupy, while robust berry, beet and chocolate flavors finish a touch heavy and sticky. For the money, this is generous and plenty good.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Pallas 2012 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Lychee, honeydew and cotton candy aromas precede the easy, not-too-serious- palate, which offers candied citrus, melon, pineapple and powdered sugar flavors. Clean on the finish and crafted for those who like sweet-tasting, simple wines.
title: J. Garcia Carrion NV Opera Prima Sparkling Moscato (Spain)

description: Smells sweet as cantaloupe, with perfume tossed in. Shows acidity and a smooth bubble wave on the palate along with flavors of watermelon, lychee and cantaloupe. Fresh but quick on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: J. Garcia Carrion NV Opera Prima Pink Moscato Sparkling (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: A fine bottle at a great price, this fresh and clean-tasting Sauvignon Blanc offers a bracing mix of tree fruit, with just a touch of sweet herb. It's clearly varietal: no frills, just straightforward and very nicely made.
title: Columbia Crest 2010 Two Vines Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

description: Perfumed, with a soft, smooth texture, this has flavors of tropical fruit, peach and a hint of lemongrass that make for a rich wine.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Monte Alentejano Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Smooth and oily in texture, this is round and full of pear juice flavor. There is just a touch of green legume, adding piquancy to this ripe wine. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa)

description: If this Merlot had greater flavor intensity, it would be spectacular. It's a very nice photocopy of a great Merlot, meaning that the berry and spice fruit is soft in focus but pleasurable. A great value—dry and classy in its own way.
title: Oak Grove 2010 Reserve Merlot (California)

description: The Cabernet Franc matches well with the Merlot in this blend. Dark fruits and polished tannins elevate this well-defined wine. It has no frills but plenty of flavor.
title: Columbia Crest 2010 Two Vines Merlot-Cabernet (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is just a bit on the sweet side, but there is plenty of acidity to be found. It's fruity, peachy, succulent and fresh.
title: Columbia Crest 2011 Two Vines Riesling (Washington)

description: With full ripeness, density and concentration, this keeps its superb balance at just 10.8% alcohol and 5% residual sugar. The dynamic tension plays out beautifully, and doesn't veer into any sort of sugary slackness. This has the sort of weight and complexity you would expect in a $30 wine.
title: Snoqualmie 2006 Winemaker's Select Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A bright pinkish-orange color makes this light-bodied wine stand out from the beginning, Fresh watermelon and cherry flavors carry on the rounded palate, with a slight sweetness giving softness.
title: Montevina 2014 Summit Ridge White Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: Soapy on the nose, this feels soft, melony and low in acid, while the flavors suggest banana and mango. It's flabby on the finish.
title: Quasar 2011 Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Molina)

description: There is a curious imbalance here between Muscat's natural honey and very insistent acidity. The result is a wine that wants to be fresh, sweet and fruity, but doesn't fully succeed.
title: Royal Muscato NV White Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: The Cabernet in this blend is Cabernet Franc, making it a Right Bank Bordeaux-style blend, at an astonishingly low price. Tart berry fruit and some stiff tannins suggest that a bit more bottle age may help to soften it; there are already some pleasing suggestions of barrel toast that run through the aromas and on into the finish.
title: Columbia Crest 2011 Two Vines Merlot-Cabernet (Washington)

description: If you're looking for a pedestrian but true sparkling wine for under $10, this Chenin Blanc-based bubbly from Argentina is solid, a touch yeasty and dry. It tastes much like a Loire Valley sparkler, with baked apple, apricot and peach pit flavors. On the negative side, it's fairly foamy across the tongue and doesn't have a top-grade mouthfeel.
title: Cave Extrême NV South Extrême Extra Brut Sparkling (Argentina)

description: This caramel-flavored wine has a light red fruit character. It is off dry and needs to be severely chilled.
title: Calamares 2014 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Yellow in color and heavy on the nose, this smells mostly of match stick and sulfur. On the palate, this is scattered, with no point of reference. Heavy, chunky flavors of nectarine, citrus pith and almond skin finish oily and bitter.
title: La Playa 2015 Estate Series Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: Bland, midland aromas of dusty apple land on vegetal after this airs out. A flat, no-spine palate and green flavors of tropical fruits and vegetables end with green-herb notes of thyme and tarragon.
title: Rayun 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Charred wood notes on the nose and palate lend a smoky, slightly herbal tone to dense, richly concentrated black-cherry flavors. The char subsides substantially with aeration, revealing a well-composed wine that balances power with elegance.
title: SERVE 2010 Terra Romana Chevalier de Dyonis Pinot Noir (Dealurile Munteniei)

description: One of the most popular Vinho Verdes, this is in a light, medium-sweet style. Very fresh and crisp, with some attractive citrus acidity, and ready to drink now. Screwcap.
title: Aveleda 2012 Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Grassy, slightly green aromas are fresh and suggest cactus pad. This is easy on the palate, with flavors of citrus fruits and green herbs, such as tarragon and rosemary. A crisp finish is just solid enough to maintain integrity.
title: Santa Rita 2015 120 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: All white fruit, lemon and grapefruit, soft and with a hint of softness. It's a fine apéritif wine, right up front and friendly. Screwcap.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2009 What's for Dinner? Branco White (Tejo)

description: Most of the grapes come from the southern Central Valley, and they give ripe Chardonnay flavors of pineapples and pears. Oak, in whatever form it was applied, dominates with vanilla, buttered toast and caramel notes. If you like a little sweetness, it's for you.
title: Round Hill 2010 Chardonnay (California)

description: Occupying the bottom rung (in terms of cost) of the Columbia Crest ladder, Two Vines wines are generally light, quite clean and simple, with a minimum exposure to oak. This fits the mold, with flavors of strawberry chews and cotton candy. The tannins are also light and herbal, with an earthy, pleasantly leafy finish.
title: Columbia Crest 2005 Two Vines Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Spunky and clean as a whistle, with pointed cherry aromas leading to a zesty, juicy palate with red plum and red berry flavors. It remains dry and poised on the finish.
title: Volver 2010 Tarima Monastrell (Alicante)

description: The bouquet smells like spiked fruit cocktail, and in the long run what's wrong with that? The palate is open and fairly easy, with a touch of kick pushing citrus, tropical fruit and even some mineral notes. A more citrusy and fresh style of Viognier, with 15% Chardonnay.
title: Estampa 2006 Viognier Chardonnay White (Colchagua Valley)

description: There's a real clean and genuine quality that comes through thanks to aromas of peach, yellow fruit and Golden Delicious apple. It drinks well too—easy and forthcoming—and would make an excellent match to grilled chicken, spicy asian food or stay-at-home pasta.
title: Mezzacorona 2006 Chardonnay (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: With distinctly sweet flavors that cross over beyond off dry, this pleasantly tart Moscato is best thought of as a dessert wine. It has savory flavors of oranges, honey and vanilla.
title: Coastal Ridge 2010 Moscato (California)

description: Restrained on the nose at first, this opens to a mix of mint and red berry aromas. The mouthfeel is plump and fresh, with berry flavors that hang on the finish.
title: La Playa 2013 Estate Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is mucky and sweet. Its best foot is not put forward via the compost-like nose, and from then on there's little more than prune, leather and a sticky mouthfeel.
title: Castillo de Monséran 2006 Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: Overdone aromas of candle wax, incense and air freshener show the musky side of the grape, while the palate is heavy with nectarine and citrus flavors. Finishes a little pithy and mealy, with a final wave of muskiness.
title: Rio Seco 2008 Estate Bottled Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: Briny pithy citrus aromas and a standard-feeling palate tell you this is regular but solidly made. Citrus flavors are largely ripe, while pithy grapefruit notes are found on the finish. Drink now.
title: Viñedos Marchigüe 2016 Marchile Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: Named after the pheasant (Faisão), the wine is crisp enough to be refreshing. It is medium sweet and lightly textured with orange zest. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2016 Faisão White (Vinho Verde)

description: Briny, rubbery aromas of asphalt and blackberry set up a fat, wide palate. Herbal, green-infused berry flavors finish with notes of carob, herbs and field greens. The round mouthfeel and textural balance are this wine's strong points.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2014 Petirrojo Reserva Estate Grown Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: Very floral, citrusy and perfumed upfront, retaining that lemony edge to help the retained carbon dioxide balance the inherent sweetness. Clean and refreshing on the finish.
title: Jacob's Creek 2010 Moscato (South Eastern Australia)

description: Like a photocopy of a good Chardonnay, this wine is indistinct. There are some decent peach and apple flavors and what tastes like a dose of oak, but it's really thin and watery.
title: Woodbridge 2001 Barrel Aged Chardonnay (California)

description: The mixed plum fruit is unremarkable but fine. In terms of texture, there's not much, until some powdery-woody tannins pop up on the back end.
title: Riverina Estates 2002 Kanga's Leap Cabernet Sauvignon (South Eastern Australia)

description: Black cherry and leather aromas aren't complex but they're sturdy and true to the variety. So is the palate, which hits with chewy, semi-rich flavors of baked plum, cola and cocoa. Figgy but flat and short on the finish. Good value wine.
title: Santa Rita 2008 120 Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: The tea and raspberry aromas are easygoing, and that best describes this organic Cabernet Sauvignon. It's powerful enough on the palate, with a good berry flavor that tilts towards raspberry. The finish is herbal and peppery.
title: Vicente Gandia 2010 Organic Cabernet Sauvignon (Spain)

description: This informal red opens with aromas of red berry and a whiff of cellar floor. The simple palate offers black cherry and orange peel alongside zesty acidity and dusty tannins. It's made to be drunk young so enjoy soon.
title: Sorelli 2013  Chianti

description: This is a good Cab for drinking with everyday fare, like burgers or tacos. It's softly tannic and sweet with blackberries, cherries and toasty oak.
title: Kirkland Signature 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Lightly herbal on the nose, but overall there's more ripe berry and toasty chocolate aromas than green. Full, meaty and deep for a value-priced wine, with blackberry and black plum flavors along with a pinch of oregano and basil. Shows good weight and balance throughout. Impressive for a 50,000-case product.
title: Concha y Toro 2010 Xplorador Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Solid as can be, with sweet-styled aromas of berry syrup and tire rubber. In the mouth, the wine shows juicy cherry and raspberry flavors in front of a lively finish. Throughout it shows good form and a bit more roughness than the Volteo varietal Tempranillo or the line's Tempranillo-Shiraz blend.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Volteo 2006 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Shy plum, berry and milk chocolate aromas come in front of a palate with little more than scratchy tannins. Baked plum flavors are flat, and the finish is mild.
title: El Prado 2015 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)

description: This Chilean wine displays two personalities. The nose offers aromas of ripe peaches and cream, with honey and buttered-toast accents. On the tongue it turns crisp and tart, with citrus and green-apple flavors and fairly sharp acidity. It finishes short and bright.
title: Alfasi 1999 Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: A light but flavorful wine with citrus and green-apple aromas and flavors. A mild chalkiness shows on the palate and oak adds some smoke and spice to the picture. Finishes with an herb note.
title: Barkan 1998 Reserve Chardonnay (Galil)

description: Although the wine is closed at the moment, showing only its tannic side, it has a good promise from the weight of fruit that's at the back. Ripe and juicy, it should age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade do Perdigão 2009 Terras de Monforte Red (Alentejo)

description: A versatile white wine, made from Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc, and showing aspects of both. It's rich in creamy oranges, peaches, lemons and limes, brightened with crisp, citrusy acidity.
title: Kenwood 2012 Vintage White (California)

description: Solid and chunky, a wine that fills the mouth with its attractive red fruits, structured tannins and a general juicy feel. A fine barbecue wine.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: Berry and plum aromas are rustic and stalky. Snappy and a bit sharp in feel, this shows leathery, roasted cherry and berry flavors in front of a short finish with black cherry notes.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Venta Morales 2013 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: While the wine has plenty of juicy fruit, it also has a heavy hand with wood that gives a bitter, spice and pepper character. Densely textured, it's tough for the moment although it will round out. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade dos Coelheiros 2012 Ciranda Red (Alentejano)

description: Minerally apple aromas are dusty and yeasty, but straightforward. This feels juicy and a touch plump, with nectarine, citrus and green herb flavors that carry through to the finish.
title: Emina 2013 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

description: The blend includes 6% Syrah, and the wine has a pretty plum and blueberry color, that (perhaps by the power of suggestion) carries through into the aromas. It's tight, tart, and clean, offering a mix of berry fruits and a finish lined with vanilla and tobacco. Overall the balance is excellent, the wine juicy and fresh, and the blend just about perfect.
title: Columbia Crest 2008 Two Vines Merlot (Washington)

description: The wine is simple but satisfying, with blackberry and oak flavors. It would be an easy-drinking wine at parties.
title: Twisted 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This is a pretty basic Zin, fresh and tart in blackberry jam flavor. In its favor, it displays robust full-bodiedness and plenty of Zinny spices. At this price, it's fine with burgers, tacos, ribs.
title: Twisted 2012 Zinfandel (California)

description: Floral red-plum aromas come with a welcome note of wild herbs. A punchy, stout palate is juicy and possesses short, bold plum and boysenberry flavors. This bright Garnacha doesn't fall off on the finish; it's a good choice for burgers or tacos.
title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2013 El Circo Acróbata Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: The Merlot certainly does its job here of smoothing out the Baga tannins. Together, they yield a soft, red fruit-flavored wine with minimal tannins and juicy acidity, adding a burst of flavor on the finish. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2014 Encontro Q do E Merlot-Baga Red (Bairrada)

description: Sweet and medicinal, with candied apricot and honey flavors balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Barefoot Cellars NV Chardonnay (California)

description: Muted on the nose, with flavors of apple and white gumdrops, and finishing with hints of butter and anise.
title: Andrew Peace 2006 Peace Family Vineyard Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: Candied berry fruits are earthy but come with a note of sweet plastic. This feels grabby and firm, with palpable acidity. Salty plum and berry flavors finish warm and long due to lively acidity.
title: Borsao 2015 Monte Oton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

description: Prickly and varietally correct on the nose, this opens with grassy aromas and a pop of citrus. A standard mouthfeel with adequate acidity projects salty citrus and green flavors, while grapefruit pith and lime notes work the finish.
title: Rayun 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: This Sauvignon Blanc is neutral on the nose except for a smack of lime. Mild on the palate, this tastes of briny, salty citrus fruits and peels. A fresh finish confirms that this is straightforward but enjoyable.
title: Santa Rita 2016 120 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: A delicious wine and very much the model for value in Spanish Garnacha. That this has 25% Tempranillo only seems to make it better; the nose is sweet but full and plummy. The palate is pure, flavorful and sweet, with baked cherry, earthiness and a hint of chocolate. A wine to buy in quantity, i.e. by the case.
title: Borsao 2009 Red (Campo de Borja)

description: Fruity and floral smelling, this has key aromas of Fruit Loops, orange blossom and apricot, with graham cracker and peanut shell subtleties. It tastes off-dry, with an unctuous feel, finishing with some cling and a zingy citrus-zest flavor.
title: Les Bourgeois 2011 La Belle Semi Dry White (Missouri)

description: Tastes jammy sweet and bubble gummy, with the gassiness of a Beaujolais Nouveau. It's more full-bodied than that, of course, with black cherry flavors.
title: Redwood Creek 2009 Merlot (California)

description: Here's an easy value wine from the eastern flank of the Italian peninsula that offers nice crispness and easy aromas of cassis and currant berry.
title: Spinelli 2008 Sangiovese (Terre di Chieti)

description: This warm-climate Viura hits with plodding barrel aromas and flavors but there's not a lot of high-quality natural material to support that much faux/forced oak. Along the way it hints at mealy apple, spice, cinnamon powder and resin. A lot of noise but not much music.
title: Borsao 2009 Blanco Viura (Campo de Borja)

description: With fresh, jammy blackberry and cherry fruit, this Cab tastes like it's right out of the fermenting tank. It's bright in acidity and simple, but gets the job done.
title: Redwood Creek 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Simple and sweet in cola, blackberry and oak flavors. At this price, it's suitable for big parties.
title: Round Hill 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Soft in texture and semi-sweet, this simple Merlot has sugary cherry and blackberry flavors.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Merlot (California)

description: Rusty in color, with rubbery cherry and raspberry aromas, this is a sticky, candied rosé with a low freshness quotient. Candied, sugary flavors finish sweet and gooey.
title: Bocopa 2014 Alone Rosé (Alicante)

description: Light, fruity and clean smelling, with a touch of candy to the nose. The palate, especially for an $8 Garnacha rosé, is zesty and spunky, with cherry, plum and citrus flavors. Crisp and crackling through the finish.
title: Borsao 2010 Rosé (Campo de Borja)

description: This reddish-pink quaffer smells like cherry gumballs. Soft and flush, with mild rose hip and berry flavors, this finishes dry and hollow. Drink immediately.
title: Príncipe de Viana 2015 Garnacha Rosado (Navarra)

description: This wine is an eclectic blend of Pinot Noir, Gamay, Mourvèdre and Grenache. The Pinot Noir's red fruits and smooth texture dominate, giving a soft wine with acidity and light tannins. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils NV Roncier Red (Vin de France)

description: This offers pleasant notes of apricot, dark caramel, grapefruit, gooseberry and pineapple. It's medium in weight and texture, with acidity on the finish. Swirl it early and often to get the aromas going.
title: Baron Herzog 2011 Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

description: Ripe, balanced and attractive, this red boasts fine tannins that lend subtle structure to the black plum fruit. Dense with fruitiness and acidity, it's rich enough to savor with meat. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Beira 2014 Faisão Red (Dão)

description: This informal, simple red opens with fruity aromas of black cherry, raspberry and a faint whiff of sweet baking spice that carry over to the juicy, fleeting palate. It's made to be drunk young so enjoy soon.
title: Baglio Curatolo Arini 1875 2014 Paccamora Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

description: The nose has warm, jammy aromas that suggest horsehide and blackberry syrup. It feels chunky and full, with jammy, spicy, slightly herbal flavors of black fruits. On the finish, it turns more herbal and loses its structure.
title: Kirkland Ranch 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Cherry and crisp red currant aromas are racy and tutti-frutti in character. The palate delivers kick and acidity in addition to dry, pithy flavors of citrus fruits and nectarine. Dryness persists onto the finish, which is friendly but modest.
title: Borsao 2011 Rosé (Campo de Borja)

description: A little forced and pickled on the nose, but overall this is pretty much your standard value-priced Chilean Cab, meaning it offers herbal notes and olive along with medium-level currant and plum flavors. Very basic and by no means a bad wine.
title: Concha y Toro 2010 Xplorador Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This light-bodied wine has aromas like strawberries and maple syrup, and flavors that taste almost sweet. It makes a tempting, light and airy drink that's good for casual occasions.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2013 Zinfandel (California)

description: Hints of asparagus and struck flint give an almost Sancerre-like impression before heading in a lemony direction. This lean, citrusy wine offers good value, but consumers should be looking out for stocks of the 2015, a better vintage that should be arriving soon.
title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Ti Point Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A remarkable value, Oxford Landing's GSM is a convincing argument in favor of blending. It offers a complex mélange of leather, spice and cherry notes, medium body and a fresh, vivacious finish. Considering it can probably be found for around $80 per case, this would make a great everyday wine for drinking over the next year or so.
title: Oxford Landing 2007 GSM Grenache-Shiraz-Mourvèdre G-S-M (South Australia)

description: Moscato aromas leap from the glass, taking the form of shampoo, lychee and jasmine. Feels light but choppy, with dilute lychee and green melon flavors. Not too sticky or cloying.
title: J. Garcia Carrion 2010 Opera Prima Sweet White White (La Mancha)

description: Nice value red wine with solid black fruit aromas, licorice and crushed mineral notes. It's flush and showing good volume, and the plum/berry core flavors have a vanilla accent. Mildly medicinal on the finish but overall it offers good power, structure and concentration.
title: Almira 2008 Los Dos Old Vines Grenache-Syrah (Campo de Borja)

description: There is some of the mineral character that is typical of the Douro in this black-fruit-laden wine. It has acidity and tannins and a stalky, juicy character that keeps it crisp. The wine is ready to drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Red (Douro)

description: Sugary sweet and simple, with fruit juice flavors of pineapples, mangoes, oranges and peaches. Gets the basic Chardonnay job done.
title: Wily Jack 2008 Chardonnay (California)

description: Cherry-berry aromas mix with a hint of vinegar and cleanser to create a sketchy, foreboding bouquet. The wine is a little blocky in the mouth, with both weedy-herbal and plum-berry flavors. Finishes with tolerable but noticeable bitterness and burn.
title: Sun Valley 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lontué Valley)

description: So ripe and rich in fruit, you won't even notice the absence of oak. The grapes come mostly from Lodi, with a touch of Monterey. Brightened with crisp acidity, the flavors are of spicy, zesty tangerines and vanilla.
title: Round Hill 2010 Oak Free Chardonnay (California)

description: An attractive, simple wine, with the freshest of citrus and melon flavors, pushed through by crisp acidity and a final hint of almonds. Screwcap.
title: Monte Largo 2008 White (Estremadura)

description: Shows jammy flavors of blackberries and cherries, lightly touched with sweet, smoky oak. It's a bit rough in tannins, with some green notes, but at this price, a pretty good value.
title: Coyote Creek 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Red in color and pretty clean on the nose, where raspberry and rose petal essence come together. The palate is acidic and tight, with tangy watermelon and peach flavors carrying the cleansing finish. Juicy to the extreme, but a good partner for food.
title: Coto de Hayas 2007 Rosado Rosé (Campo de Borja)

description: The principal grapes of Dão are all in this ripe, fruity blend: Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Alfrocheiro are rich, full of blackberry fruits and layered with some firm tannins. The wine is ripe while still retaining the structure from the granite soil. Drink now.
title: Messias 2013 Messias Selection Red (Dão)

description: The ultimate patio/terrace wine has been found, and it's Urban from O. Fournier. True as can be, with lychee, acacia and green melon aromas and flavors, this wine is plump but refreshing, with honest Cafayate character. Maybe the best under-$10 white wine being made in Argentina.
title: O. Fournier 2007 Urban Torrontés (Cafayate)

description: Here's a nice and fresh Sauv Blanc with notes of tropical fruit, ripe gooseberry, tangerine and sweet grass supported by pineapple acidity. Balanced and easy to drink with a crisp, clean finish.
title: Two Oceans 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Exotic to the point that one wonders whether other varieties have been blended in, with spicy hints of cardamom, cinnamon and clove, followed by ripe melon flavors. At least this is not a bland, neutral effort, although it may have a touch of residual sugar. Drink now.
title: Black Swan 2009 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: Aromas of air freshener, lychee and honey introduce a basic, no-bead palate full of tropical flavors that are similar to a Tiki punch with no booze. A mild, low-foam finish is the final act.
