description: The under-$10 high scorer is fast disappearing, so take a good look at this young, jammy Tempranillo-Shiraz blend that hits nicely with ripe boysenberry and black plum. The Shiraz seems to have darkened the wine, and the mouthfeel is ripe and lush.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Volteo 2006 Tempranillo + Shiraz Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: This dry Vinho Verde shows great crisp, green apple and grapefruit flavors, a deliciously fresh wine, with green edges and lively flavors. Great summer drink.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2006 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A mild Sauvignon Blanc, with white grapefruit, grass and mild asparagus aromas. Feels chunky and round, with soft acids creating sweet, green flavors of grapefruit and grass. Round on the finish, with a modest variety of flavor.
title: Odfjell 2011 Babor Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: A ripe and lush style of Chardonnay that's widely available, this has assertive characteristics of pineapple, mango and sweet citrus that are plentiful throughout the nose and mouth. Medium weight, with a straightforward style and a brisk, clean finish.
title: Skalli 2010 Fortant de France Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: Really too sweet, simple and soft to earn a better score, this has syrupy flavors of citrus fruits and raspberries.
title: Turning Leaf 2006 Reserve White Zinfandel (California)

description: What Americans need is a good $8 Zinfandel, and what do you know? That's just what this is. Dry as dust but sweet in fruit, with all kinds of savory spices, this is the perfect everyday wine for barbecue. Production was 8,000 cases, so it shouldn't be too hard to find.
title: Oak Grove 2010 Reserve Zinfandel (California)

description: Here's a clean, dry, light-bodied white wine with green-apple and celery aromas and flavors that are very mild. The first sip is crisp and refreshing, and it turns softer and leaner on the finish.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Crisp, dry, caramel- and red berry-flavored wine that has some crispness as well as good strawberry softness. There is some spice to finish. Screwcap.
region_1: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2007 Colombelle Rosé Red (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This opens with oxidized, creamy aromas while the palate offers mostly acidic, tart citrus flavors that are surrounded by oxidized stone-fruit notes. The finish ends nutty.
title: J. Garcia Carrion 2011 Antaño Viura (Rioja)

description: A pop style of pink wine that the Peter Mondavi family makes from Zinfandel with minor portions of Chenin Blanc and Muscat. It has a light coral color, mild fruit aromas and semisweet red Popsicle flavors.
title: CK Mondavi 2013 Willow Springs White Zinfandel (California)

description: Filled with bouncy aromas of melon, pear and tropical fruit, this lightweight charmer even blends in notes of butter and anise on the finish. It's a fun wine with the accent on fruit. Best Buy.
title: McGuigan 2000 Black Label Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: This wine is produced by the Malan family of Simonsig Estate from purchased grapes. Light, fresh, with crisp, green fruit, it is an easy, pleasant wine to drink, well-made and delicious. There's a lovely, creamy, toffee aftertaste. Best Buy.
title: Malan 2000 Family Vinter's Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)

description: Snappy and pure aromas grace the nose, with Bartlett pear, lees and toasty oak most prominent. The palate is overt and fruity, featuring apple and citrus flavors accented by bright acidity. This seems like a fine appetizer, by-the-glass, or party-friendly wine, but the composite cork the winery is using is madness to get off the corkscrew. Best Buy.
title: Calina 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Light in style and low in price and alcohol, this Chard is tropical and slightly sweet, perfect for your next-door neighbor or tippler aunt who doesn't often drink wine. For more experienced wine drinkers, the sweet doesn't overextend its welcome. Fine for weeknight roast chicken or pasta salad.
title: Redtree 2010 Chardonnay (California)

description: Harsh and jammy, with thin flavors of cherries and pepper, accompanied by sharp acids. Okay in a pinch.
title: Oak Grove 2008 Reserve Shiraz (California)

description: Soft and a bit sweet in jammy blackberries and cherries, with lots of pepper. Compromised by some unripe green mint flavors.
title: Oak Grove 2008 Reserve Zinfandel (California)

description: Wiry plum and earthy cherry aromas announce a lively, medium-bodied Tempranillo with plum and raspberry flavors. A light, solid, adequately fruity finish is clean and tasty.
title: Radio Boca 2012 Tempranillo (Valencia)

description: Aromas of radiator dust, lime and green apple are a bit heavy and scattershot. However the palate is tangy and lean, with cutting acidity. Lead flavors of waxy apricot are backed by orange and lime notes, while the finish is dry and waxy, with a yeasty, leesy flavor bolstered by snappy acidity.
title: Ressò 2013 Old Vines Garnacha Blanca (Catalunya)

description: This is an attractive blend of grapes from different regions of Portugal. It is light, with crisp acidity and refreshing lemon fruit. The wine is soft and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Alandra Branco White (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A popular wine in Portugal, this is ripe, full of black fruits and with a lightly stalky aftertaste. It is rich and fruity, softly tannic with a full-bodied structure. It is easy to drink young.
title: Global Wines 2014 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Red (Dão)

description: At this price, you can expect an honest, workmanlike everyday wine, and you get that here—along with other qualities that will surprise you. Not least is the fruit, nicely ripened and finely etched, and the spices that dance on the tongue. It's dry, of course, with fine acidity. What stands out is the depth of flavor.
title: Caliterra 1999 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Opening with a bouquet of red berries complemented by an earthy element, this Merlot offers more fruit on the palate, together with a spicy note. A medium-weight wine with decent acidity, it finishes dry, with more berry and earth notes.
title: La Palma 1999 Merlot (Rapel Valley)

description: Richly fruity and soft, this wine boasts loads of black-cherry and plum flavors. Clearly made from very ripe fruit, it lacks the herbaceous-vegetal character so often found in Merlot, but also any sense of structure. Finishes with a bit of alcoholic heat.
title: Concha y Toro 1999 Xplorador Merlot (Rapel Valley)

description: The tangy grapefruit, lemon and pear notes on the nose carry over nicely to the palate. Subtle underlying tropical fruit adds dimension, the mouthfeel has a creamy texture (from the Sémillon), and it finishes dry and clean.
title: Jacob's Creek 2000 Semillon-Chardonnay (Barossa Valley)

description: Sometimes you just need a cheap, quaffable, crisp dry white wine to drink in copious amounts, and this one will do just fine, thank you. It's citrusy, spicy, and dry, and has enough acid to cleanse the palate.
title: Caliterra 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: White Merlot? Why not? It's actually a deep rose color, with fresh, exuberant aromas of raspberries and wildflowers. Drinks fruity and clean, with nice strawberry and raspberry flavors and just a tad of sugar. The finish is pretty.
title: Forest Glen 1999 Forest Fire Chardonnay (California)

description: Ripe pear-pineapple fruit is layered with vanilla and tinged with citrus. This is a plump, slightly heavy Chard best served cold at parties and picnics.
title: Concha y Toro 1999 Xplorador Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: The wine tastes young, its fruits and wood characters not quite integrated. But it has a good light touch of redcurrants and blackberries to go with the acidity. The wood gives dry tannins and a firm structure.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Pedras do Monte Castelão (Terras do Sado)

description: Ironstone's track record for this pretty dessert wine continues with the '07. It's off-dry, with residual sugar just under 2%, and polished flavors of pineapples, oranges, marzipan, honey and vanilla. High acidity adds the perfect touch of crispness.
title: Ironstone 2007 Obsession Symphony (California)

description: Is this a dessert wine or a table wine? It straddles the line. Let's call it off dry, with slightly sugared tangerine, apricot, vanilla bean and spice flavors that finish clean and zesty.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Riesling (California)

description: Crisp in a very good way, this wine has lively lemon and green-apple aromas, flavors that are a bit riper than that and a texture that's smooth without giving up a little nip of acidity. The wine has great balance, light body and a high refreshment quotient.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: What deep, supple flavors on this soft, delicious wine. The grapes obviously had no trouble ripening, and offer waves of blackberries, plums and black currants, not to mention spices like fennel and pepper. Very dry and fancy, this wine could sit on the best tables and not hang its head. Best Buy.
title: Caliterra 1999 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Full-bodied and plush in texture, this offers plenty of apricot marmalade fruit and some nasturtium-blossom-like spice, making for a satisfying mouthful of flavor.
title: Yellow Tail 2015 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: This is a pétillant off-dry wine. It has a soapy character that is lifted by citrus fruits, a crisp texture and lively acidity. Drink immediately.
title: Caves Aliança 2016 Aliança White (Vinho Verde)

description: From a small family estate named for the fireflies that live around the vineyard, this is crisp, with enough fruitiness to balance the acidity. It's light, refreshing and ready for warm-weather enjoyment.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Domaine des Bellugues Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Give this wine credit for consistency: in the three years it's been on the market it has scored the same each vintage. This offering is soft, fleshy and slightly green on the nose, with a wet, easy palate that gives mild citrus, apple and peach flavors. Good in the mouth, with just enough acidity to keep it kicking.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Maximo 2009 Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Berry fruit and mild leather open this good little bargain. There's adequate body and fullness, some oak, and then bright, fresh berry, herb and spice flavors. Finishes dry and lightly toasted, with coffee notes.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Maximo 2008 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Open and fruity, this delicious, already drinkable wine is a typical Portuguese blend that's dominated by Touriga Nacional. It has an attractive perfumed aroma along with toasty wood flavors and black currant freshness. The combination is full, forward and delicious now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2012 Bridão Classico Red (Tejo)

description: For a big, simple style of Pinot Noir, this gets the job done. It's dark and mulled on the nose, with boistrous plum and cherry flavors that darken up and turn peppery on the finish. This emphasizes freshness and size more than finesse.
title: Alto Roble 2011 Beach Kite Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)

description: Strange yeasty unfocused aromas are unclean. This is flat and spineless, with yeasty papaya flavors. A diluted, leesy finish confirms that it's not ready for prime time.
title: Hawthorne Ridge 2013 Chardonnay (Cariñena)

description: Rusty in color, this wine features aromas of compost, juniper and a touch of floral red fruit. It comes on strong in the mouth, with a leafy, rustic dried-cherry flavor, before feeling hard and tannic.
title: Region 1 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Raisin and funky leather are the prime aromas on this marginal Tempranillo. Expect a dried-out, tart and herbal wine, with a raisiny sweetness.
title: Bodegas del Mundo 2010 Valdemoreda  (Rioja)

description: This brightly colored rosé from northeastern Italy offers aromas of small berry fruit and delicate floral tones. It tastes clean and crisp and leaves a cheerful endnote of fresh berry flavors.
title: Blason 2007 Rosato Rosé (Venezia Giulia)

description: Here's a supple, velvet-textured Merlot from the all-around successful 2012 vintage in California. It pulls together baking-spice aromas and attractive, ripe flavors of raspberry and cherry on the medium-bodied palate. It conveys a sense of breadth and meatiness without being heavy.
title: Oak Grove 2012 Family Reserve Merlot (California)

description: The bringing together of Malbec and Tempranillo works like a charm here. There's a touch of complexity to the fruit-forward nose, and better depth than what most under-$10 red varietals offer. Look for sweet, smooth raspberry and plum flavors with a tasty, balanced finish.
title: O. Fournier 2005 Urban Uco Blend Malbec-Tempranillo (Uco Valley)

description: Soapy, pungent aromas of lychee nut are atypical for your average Chardonnay. This feel shallow and flat, with lychee and melon flavors that turn bitter and oily on the finish. This is more like Torrontés or Gewürztraminer than standard Chardonnay.
title: Region 1 2014 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Orange peel, anise and honey aromas come before a honeyed, soft palate. Flavors of orange, honey and melon are wan, with little finish. This tastes manufactured more than natural.
title: Region 1 2014 Moscato (Mendoza)

description: Cherry, plum and earth aromas lead into a tart, lean palate that struggles to offer more than a modicum of cherry and cassis flavors. The finish is sweet and spicy, which makes for an odd, not terribly appealing combination.
title: Val d'Orbieu 2001 Reserve St. Martin Cabernet Sauvignon (Languedoc)

description: Sweet aromas of leather and caramel seem murky and tired. The palate comes without snap, and that's despite some plum and raspberry flavors. The finish is lean and basic, and overall it's a simple wine that doesn't really taste much like Syrah.
title: Val d'Orbieu 2001 Reserve St. Martin Syrah (Languedoc)

description: Sweet, light and floral, but not fruity. Lemon and orange flavors yield to a zesty finish. Simple and very high in acidity.
title: Mommessin 2002 Nid D'Abeille Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Tangy cherry flavors are framed in smoky, oaky flavors. Licorice-like at the  end.
title: HRM Rex Goliath NV Merlot (Central Coast)

description: This uncomplicated sparkling wine is fresh and fruity, with a touch of yeastiness. It's light, bright and dry yet also soft and ready to drink.
title: Marcel Martin NV Louise d'Estrée Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Basic berry and plum aromas are a bit foxy and herbal. This feels choppy and scratchy due to raw tannins. Generic black-fruit flavors are short and salty, while this ends with a clipped feel and medicinal berry flavors.
title: Santa Luz 2015 Alba Malbec (Central Valley)

description: Rubbery blackberry aromas are dense and horsey. This feel wide and chunky but loose at the seams. Oaky flavors of generic black fruits finish medicinal and a touch candied.
title: G7 2015 The 7th Generation Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Apple and pear fruit is set in a frame of citrus, grapefruit flesh and rind. Skin flavors are well modulated, with a hint of minerality, as well. This is wine is drinking nicely—clean and persistent.
title: Snoqualmie 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A lemon-scented wine, light and fresh, it has an attractive crispness and lively fruitiness. It's best drunk now.
title: Drouet Frères 2012 La Forcine  (Muscadet)

description: A versatile white wine, made from Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc, and showing aspects of both. It's rich in creamy oranges, peaches, lemons and limes, brightened with crisp, citrusy acidity.
title: Kenwood 2012 Vintage White (California)

description: This dry Vinho Verde shows great crisp, green apple and grapefruit flavors, a deliciously fresh wine, with green edges and lively flavors. Great summer drink.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2006 White (Vinho Verde)

description: The bouquet on this Cab is pretty good, with red-fruit aromas suggestive of plums. The palate is basic, with semisweet red-berry flavors that support the wine's “medium dry” designation. Things run mellow but steady on what amounts to a short, simple finish.
title: Alto Roble 2011 Beach Kite Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: With 19% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a deeply flavored, youthful wine, precocious and sharp with acidity, and fresh as newly crushed grapes. The dominant fruits are blackberries and plums, with a hint of bitter chocolate. The tannins are soft and creamy. It's a bit rough around the edges but is well made and gets the job done.
title: Caliterra 1998 Merlot (Central Valley)

description: Offers varietally correct flavors of black currants and hints of tobacco, but where's the structure and depth? A simple, fruity red for early drinking that would make a decent picnic wine or bar pour.
title: Concha y Toro 1999 Xplorador Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: It's nice to see an ever-increasing number of serviceable kosher wines like this one being made available to consumers from around the world. That said, this one isn't much more than adequate. There's a modest amount of cassis fruit dressed up with earthy chocolate and vaguely minty aromas, but it lacks depth. Still, it's better than the kosher stuff I remember from my friends' bar mitzvahs.
title: Alfasi 1998 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: Strawberry and pink grapefruit aromas mingle enticingly on the nose. But on the palate it seems a bit syrupy and heavy, finishing with a touch of cola.
title: Miguel Torres 2000 Rosé (Curicó Valley)

description: Despite a persistent front-to-back sweetness, this is a nice little Chardonnay for those fastened to the grape. It starts with ripe pineapple and apple aromas, and next you get tropical fruit, citrus and banana flavors. Medium in size and good for what it strives to be.
title: Santa Rita 2008 120 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: The red wine companion to the excellent Two Vines Vineyard 10 White has got some stuffing, tannins and chewy, herbal flavors, but the fruit holds its own with flavors of wild plum and rhubarb.
title: Columbia Crest 2007 Two Vines Vineyard 10 Red Wine Red (Washington)

description: What a great bargain this wine is. It's soft and delicious with blackberry, currant, brown sugar and creamy mocha flavors that lead to a spicy finish. It's easy to drink this Cab with all sorts of foods that pair well with a full-bodied red.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Austere, green aromas are about as much as one can pull from the nose, while the palate is fresh and acidic, but lean. Flavors of lime, citrus and pith are zesty at first but pithy later on. Dull and strained, but not bad for Chardonnay from central Spain.
title: Coto de Hayas 2008 Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)

description: Here's an easy, slightly sweet Pinot Grigio from Terre di Chieti that boasts the mature fruit fragrances of the southern Italian sunshine. You'll get aromas of almond nut, cantaloupe melon and honeysuckle followed by a rich, dense mouthfeel.
title: Spinelli 2008 Pinot Grigio (Terre di Chieti)

description: This medium sweet, easy drinker brings aromatic and flavorful notes of pear, jasmine and white flowers.
title: Ste. Chapelle NV Chateau Series Riesling (Idaho)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Aragonez, this is open, generous and easy. It has attractive red fruits that are balanced by acidity and a soft tannic backbone. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2011 Ciconia Red (Alentejano)

description: A little flat, but the nose is adequately melony, so give it points for that. The palate is on the plump, lower-acid side, so the green fruit and lychee flavors are fleshy. Finishes solid but soft. Drink this year.
title: La Vuelta 2009 Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: Tropical fruit, air freshener and bath soap aromas lead to a candied, sticky palate with a mix of sweet flavors that include papaya, powdered sugar and mango. The finish is confected and soft.
title: Sombras del Sol 2011 Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Soft and ripe, with the warmth of a full, fruity Alentejano wine, this is generous and ready to drink. Red fruits are lifted by acidity, while flavors of wood aging and spice add an extra dimension. Drink now and until 2019.
title: Dão Sul 2013 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Pure, focused fruit flavors like raspberry and red cherry light up this medium-bodied wine. A lively texture of crisp acidity and light tannins adds great balance to the effusive fruitiness. For such a friendly price, what else could one ask for?
title: Twisted 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

description: This medium-bodied bargain-priced sparkler is maybe just a touch on the heavy side, but it should satisfy most party crowds. Hints of toast accent pineapple and tropical fruit notes, finishing soft and short. Worth trying in Mimosas or Bellinis.
title: Beelgara NV The Vines Brut Cuvée Sparkling (South Eastern Australia)

description: This wine offers attractive vanilla and red-cherry aromas plus bright cherry flavors. It has a tangy texture due to crisp acidity and moderate tannins.
title: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Foxy berry and currant flavors carry a note of wet dog fur. This is clampy and saucy feeling on the palate, with herbal flavors of plum, berry and tomato sauce. A hollow finish tastes slightly green.
title: Santa Rita 2016 120 Reserva Especial Merlot (Central Valley)

description: Prune and raisin aromas pour off the bouquet, providing more than a clue that this wine is on the overripe side. That's confirmed in the mouth, where things feel tannic and over the top; flavors of raisin, sugar beet and chocolate finish with heat and hardness.
title: Garnacha de Fuego 2011 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: Slightly rubbery on first impression, but cleaner and better as it opens up. Zesty and full of acidic punch, with juicy black cherry and plum flavors. Registers as healthy and ripe, with a spot of medicinality. Quite good for the price.
title: Vega Sindoa 2009 Tempranillo (Navarra)

description: Spiced berry aromas are dense and suggest raisin, but overall this is a clean, inexpensive blend of Garnacha and Tempranillo that is satisfying and highly competent. Flavors run smoky, rubbery and dark, but not baked or too heavy. Toasty and roasty on the finish, too.
title: Don Ramón 2008 Red (Campo de Borja)

description: This is an honest wine, with an herbal aroma and notes of tomato and red plum. It feels zingy due to tomato-like acidity, with red fruit flavors followed by a lean finish.
title: Quasar 2008 Selection Carmenère (Molina)

description: This pretty, warm wine is touched with caramel and yellow fruit flavors. It gets a kick from crisp lemon zest. Drink in the coming months.
title: Borges 2011 Lello Branco White (Douro)

description: Lots of zingy acidity in this Chardonnay, along with ripe, jammy apricot, tangerine and lemon fruit flavors. It's an easy wine at an easy price.
title: Domino 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: For eight bucks you get a decent Merlot. It's dry and medium-bodied, with jammy blackberry and cherry flavors. Fine to drink with burgers, tacos, pizza.
title: Domino 2012 Merlot (California)

description: This 50-50 blend of Inzolia and Catarratto opens with aromas of white flower and honey, followed by a fat, thick palate.
title: Feudi del Pisciotto 2011 Baglio del Sole White (Sicilia)

description: Spicy wine from the wood and from the ripe berry fruits. The acidity is light, a sideshow to the juicy fruit, flavors of nutmeg and red cherries and a fine kick of dry tannin.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Monte Altentejano Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Briny, wiry red-fruit aromas are mild but saucy. This blend of Garnacha and Tempranillo feels ordinary, while flavors of briny plum are fresh but limited. A finish with a healthy pulse is fine for what this is.
title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2014 Crucillón Garnacha-Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)

description: . Its mouthfeel smacks hard with acidity, leaving a crisp expression of strawberry, raspberry and herb flavors. It turns warm, lactic and chocolaty on the finish.
title: Bodegas Aletta 2010 Veraz Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

description: Bears a striking resemblance to blueberry pie in its aromas. Lighter than expected on the palate, before fading on the finish. A pleasant lunch mate to pâté or charcouterie.
title: Château d'Or et de Gueules 1998 Red (Costières de Nîmes)

description: This well-known Burgundy négociant has branched out into the Rhône, like so many others have before. The good news is that the wine is bursting with bright cherry flavors—tart and juicy. Would make a nice burger or sandwich accompaniment.
title: Mommessin 1999 Château De Domazan Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Pretty strawberries and cherries are paired with softly minty nuances in this lightweight charmer. No, there's not a lot of intensity, but you could even serve it slightly chilled as a picnic wine.
title: Seigneurs de Bergerac 1999 Red (Bergerac)

description: This wine shows the characteristic granitic texture of the region. Berry fruits smother the firm tannins to give a rich, juicy wine that's bold, ripe, and ready to drink.
title: Caves Aliança 2011 Aliança Red (Dão)

description: This is an easy-drinking quaffer, the kind most people think of when they hear Riesling. It's off dry but well balanced, with slightly broad melon and peach notes. A nice patio sipper for summer 2011.
title: Skyleaf 2009 Riesling (Waipara Valley)

description: Watery blackberry, mint and oak flavors mark this simple wine. It's soft and ripe on the finish.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: A tart, foxy style of Rioja with sharp-edged aromas. The palate is crisp as ice chips, with lean, leafy flavors of pie cherry and raspberry. Tight on the finish, with a lasting scratch of peppercorn and acidity.
title: J. Garcia Carrion 2007 Antaño  (Rioja)

description: This no-fuss Montepulciano d'Abruzzo should pair with pizza or grilled sausages, thanks to its simple array of fresh berry aromas. There's are sweet touches of ripe cherry and cinnamon on the close.
title: Spinelli 2008  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

description: A lovely floral streak adds interest to the bright red-berry and ripe rhubarb aromas. Cherry-skin and rich strawberry flavors fill the palate and remain through the clean finish. Light weight with soft tannins and an easy demeanor.
title: Les Vignerons de la Méditerranée 2010 Réserve St. Martin Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: A medium-bodied Shiraz suited to everyday drinking, with cherry-berry fruit accented by hints of leather and smoke. It's a fresh, easy quaff to match with burgers or pizza.
title: Gosford 2009 Reserve Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)

description: Soft, easy drinking. This red has berry fruits, just the right amount of dusty and juicy flavors. Screwcap.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2009 What's for Dinner? Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Light and fragrant, a perfumed wine, with flavors of almond and refreshing acidity. It feels warm, with pear and lime flavors combining well.
title: Quinta do Carneiro 2009 Branco White (Alenquer)

description: The price is right. It's soft and sweet, with jammy, candy flavors.
title: The Original Dark Horse 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Sometimes you get what you pay for. This value-priced wine is feral smelling and strange on the nose. The palate feel is probably the best part, while the flavors are candied and foxy.
title: Sombras del Sol 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is dark in color, with apple cider aromas. The flavors are bland and nutty more than fruity, and the finish is the same.
title: Bodegas del Mundo 2012 Valdemoreda Blanco Viura (Rioja)

description: The best of a very solid group of 2010 reds from StoneCap, this Syrah draws some inspiration from the Australian wines. Spicy and ripe, with lush black fruits and a lick of citrus. Vanilla and tobacco notes highlight the finish.
title: StoneCap 2010 Estate Grown Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This just off-dry wine is fresh, young and fruity. It leads with a lemony scent and crisp acidity that is partnered by a light prickle on the tongue. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: A perennial value, this year's edition boasts plenty of smoky blackberry aromas tinged with slight game notes. Medium-bodied—verging on full—there's loads of fruit and flavor packed into an easily accessible format. Ready to enjoy now and should continue to drink well for a few more years.
title: Domaine Borie de Maurel 1999 Syrah (Minervois)

description: Shiny pink in color, with a crisp and wet nose that powerfully suggests refreshment to come. Juicy and superfresh on the palate, with cherry and raspberry flavors and citrusy undertones. A real winner in Garnacha rosé from Navarra.
title: Vega Sindoa 2010 Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)

description: Just bright fruit, this is a ripe soft wine. The 50% Malvasia Fina in the blend gives it a perfumed, aromatic character while also adding a lemon zest tang. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Branco White (Douro)

description: Light and cheesy smelling, this has herbal red-fruit aromas. It feels quick and hard across the palate, with strawberry, raspberry and herbal flavors.
title: Funky Llama 2011 Shiraz (Mendoza)

description: The nose offers white bread and pancake aromas. It feels angular and acidic, with dry, crisp apple and citrus flavors that finish in a corny, stalky fashion.
title: Bodegas Luzón 2011 Luzón Blanco Macabeo (Jumilla)

description: Slightly candied red fruit aromas bring a touch of herbal to the show, and the feel and flavor profile are equally tangy, zesty, lean and edgy. Red fruits are what it's about, and palate cleansing potential is its best attribute.
title: J. Garcia Carrion 2008 Antaño  (Rioja)

description: Could the scent of microwaved popcorn be any stronger? Obviously, it's heavily oaked, and that carries onto the palate where you'll find heavy, woody flavors in addition to banana and lemon. This needs a lot more charm and style; in all honesty, it's not delivering much.
title: Bodega Norton 1999 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: This one has bland aromatics, with only a touch of oak to grasp at. The palate is almost spritzy, which it shouldn't be, and the flavor resembles Mott's applesauce. A bit weak and only qualifies for an acceptable rating on its best day.
title: Millaman 2000 Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: Earthy, warm berry aromas on the nose avoid being jammy and overripe. The palate on this everyday blend of Garnacha and Tempranillo is comfortable and balanced. Short plum and berry flavors shift to slightly lactic and creamy on the finish.
title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2012 Crucillón Tempranillo-Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

description: A gentle light wine that seems diluted. It has only hints of fruit and acidity, all very easy and ripe to drink. The wine is ready.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2014 Terra de Touros Arinto (Tejo)

description: Labeled late harvest, but not terribly sweet, this includes small amounts of Muscat, Gewürztraminer and Chenin Blanc in the blend. Lemony with both citrus rind and sweet candy flavors, it's a useful, off-dry wine with a slightly sugary finish.
title: Hogue 2010 Late Harvest Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Opens with light but earthy raspberry aromas and plum, and then it breaks up a bit with airing. The palate is lean but fresh and gritty, with cherry and cola flavors in front of a limited, narrow finish. Run-of-the-mill, which isn't bad given the price.
title: Bodega Don Bosco 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipú)

description: Creamy aromas of milk chocolate and berry fruits set up a moderately gripping palate. Nonspecific berry and clove flavors finish plump and chewy, with a strong oak character on the close.
title: Santa Rita 2016 120 Reserva Especial Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: This red-colored rosé smells a bit briny, like pickled strawberry. The palate is somewhat round, with initial flavors of raspberry and strawberry that turn a bit peppery on the finish.
title: Santa Rita 2016 120 Reserva Especial Rosé (Central Valley)

description: The Australian giant has reached across the Tasman to New Zealand for 7% of this wine, but it remains a simple, medium-bodied white dominated by citrus and wax bean aromas and flavors. Drink up.
title: Yellow Tail NV Sauvignon Blanc (Australia-New Zealand)

description: This wine could be the poster boy for Australian Chardonnay. The nectarine and peach aromas and flavors are coddled by a touch of vanilla and the entire package is soft, juicy and easy to drink. It's nothing fancy, just yummy weekday wine.
title: Stonehaven 2001 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: A familiar brand on Portuguese wine shelves, this is a ripe wine, soft and smooth. Light tannins are finely integrated with the red berry fruits and juicy acidity. It's an easy wine that has good structure. Drink now.
title: Dão Sul 2011 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Red (Dão)

description: This is a warm, ripe and spicy wine. It is full of red fruits, black currant and soft tannins, with great acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Herdade das Servas 2012 Monte das Servas Escolha Red (Alentejano)

description: Very fruity, lightly sweet and full bodied, this easygoing blend of Zinfandel, Merlot and other varieties smells like maple syrup, tastes jammy and has enough sweetness to balance its tannic texture.
title: Three Thieves 2014 Red (California)

description: With its fresh fruits, this wine emphasizes its cool origins. The spice is discreet, but the soft tannins go well with the light black currant fruits. It is a wine driven by its acidity and fruit. Give it an hour to open out before drinking, it deserves it.
title: Quinta da Cortezia 2005 Vinha Conchas Red (Estremadura)

description: A light, fresh wine, showing berries, a touch of wood and very soft tannins. The finish shows a more meaty, rustic aftertaste, but also good acidity.
title: Symington Family Estates 2006 Altano Red (Douro)

description: Briny raspberry aromas are a bit murky. This smacks down hard with acidity, while the flavors run toward earthy, generic plum and berry. A salty finish with animal notes is firm but struggles with cleanliness.
title: Casa de Campo 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: This is a simple Merlot, but it's dry in style with tart sour-cherry flavors.
title: Round Hill 2011 Merlot (California)

description: Out of the gate, reductive aromas provide some distraction from the lime-leaf and stone-fruit aromas. It drinks quite sweet with abundant apricot flavors.
title: Snoqualmie 2014 Winemaker's Select Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made in a richer-than-usual style, this wine shows floral and melon aromas, medium to full body, dry honeydew melon flavors and a smooth rather than crisp texture.
title: Backhouse 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Emanating from the heel of the Italian boot, close to the beautiful city of Lecce, this is one of Puglia’s classic wines. The grapes are Negroamaro and Malvasia Nera. Pleasant cherry-berry aromas and flavors predominate. The structure is ample, as is the mouthfeel. The tannins need some softening. The finish is long. Grilled lamb would make a fine accompaniment.
title: Candido 1997 Riserva Red (Salice Salentino)

description: A zippy, lively version, this light-bodied wine smells and tastes like a combo of grapefruit, lemon and peach juices, having a crisp character on first sip, and a rich softness on the second.
title: Twisted 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: While sunny and ripe with scents of tropical fruit, orange and peach, this bang-for-your-buck Riesling reveals surprising complexities. It's sweet and lusciously fruity on the palate, but nuanced with rambling layers of dried herbs, earth and mineral tones. Finishes long with a lingering tea-leaf astringency.
title: Dr. Willkomm 2012 Blue River Riesling (Mosel)

description: Grassy, slightly green aromas are fresh and suggest cactus pad. This is easy on the palate, with flavors of citrus fruits and green herbs, such as tarragon and rosemary. A crisp finish is just solid enough to maintain integrity.
title: Santa Rita 2015 120 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: Raw and harsh in green tannins, with bubblegum and raspberry sour candy flavors.
title: Butterfield Station 2009 Merlot (California)

description: Unoaked Pinot Noir from Corsica, showing ripe berry flavors, fresh acidity and only light tannins. It's what it says on the label: for casual drinking.
region_1: Vin de Pays de l'Ile de Beauté
title: Barton & Guestier 2009 Bistro Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays de l'Ile de Beauté)

description: The Merlot certainly does its job here of smoothing out the Baga tannins. Together, they yield a soft, red fruit-flavored wine with minimal tannins and juicy acidity, adding a burst of flavor on the finish. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2014 Encontro Q do E Merlot-Baga Red (Bairrada)

description: Rubber aromas pervade on the nose. A grippy tannins dominate resin notes of wood and spice over a hint of fruit. A slightly herbaceous finish brings this wine home.
title: Veo 2013 Grande Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: This blend of Shiraz and Castelão is in a soft and ripe rosé style. There is just a touch of tannin from the Shiraz to give weight. The aftertaste is lightly sweet.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Storks Landing Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Scents of lemon wax and a slightly spritzy mouthfeel are followed by somewhat surprisingly sweet fruit for a wine labeled dry. The flavors favor orange juice and orange candy. If you like a fairly heavy, fruit-forward style, this is just right.
title: Kiona 2000 Dry White Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are spunky and simple in front of a crisp edgy palate. Medicinal, lightly rubbery flavors of cherry and plum finish with a raw rub, juicy acidity, a lean body and mild heat.
title: Borsao 2014 Monte Oton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

description: Delicate floral aromas mark this slighty sweet bubbly. The flavors are typically Riesling, including green apple, honeysuckle and apricot, all backed by good acidity. The finish is clean and a little sugary.
title: Ste. Chapelle NV Sparkling Brut  (Idaho)

description: This luminous, hay-colored Grillo imparts measured notes of banana and exotic fruit that add extra richness and dimension to what is a simple and easy-drinking white wine overall. You could pair this wine with a long list of seafood, vegetable and pasta recipes—and you can't beat this low price.
title: Feudo Arancio 2007 Grillo (Sicilia)

description: At this price, buy a bunch and pour it in paper cups at your next big party. You won't get any complaints. Blackberry, chocolate and oak-like flavors are front and center.
title: Cocobon 2011 Red (California)

description: Soft, sugary sweet and simple, with cherry jam and chocolate flavors.
title: The Original Dark Horse NV Big Red (California)

description: This value-priced wine struts like it comes from a better neighborhood. The nose is clean and is centered on berry fruit, while the palate is medium in size, with creamy, sweet berry flavors. Mildly medicinal and candied, but good overall.
title: Santa Rita 2008 120 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: A light, bright wine that has a touch of toast and lively yellow fruits. With a touch of pepper and perfume, the wine is fragrant and ready to drink.
title: Global Wines 2015 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Dão)

description: A slight spritz brightens the mouthfeel of this lemony wine. Aromas are a bit musky, but flavors of peach and lemon are correct, and the finish is harmoniously tart; mouth-watering and with a hint of almond. Best Buy.
title: Castellarin 2001 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Simple, open and ready to drink. The nose is floral, with hints of fresh pear. The flavor profile turns to citrus in the form of orange and pineapple, and then comes a full-force but fairly collected finish.   Best Buy.
title: La Palma 2002 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

description: The nose is standard fare as it offers cherry, plum and a hint of herbaceousness. Good plum and berry fruit carries the mouth, while the finish is round and smooth. The wine is balanced and entirely satisfying even if it is basic in its intent. As per usual, Calina delivers a good wine for the price. -M.S.
title: Calina 2001 Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Quiet on the bouquet except for a dusting of oak and banana. The palate is heavy and wide, if a bit flabby, and the flavors of melon and mango run sweet, much like fruit punch. Soft and sweet on the finish as well, and overall it's good but generic. Not many Chards in the price range will fare better.
title: Concha y Toro 2009 Xplorador Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Funky aromas of animal fur and lively berry are not that inviting. In the mouth, this has a narrow feel and high acidity. Herbal, tart flavors of plum and red currant are almost sour, while the finish is on the green and herbal side.
title: Cruz de Piedra 2013 Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: This value Garnacha is a fruity number with a no-nonsense berry character and clarity throughout. Cherry and plum aromas are vibrant, while flavors of black plum, boysenberry and medicinality are more than fine. Pepper, spice and overall warmth carry the finish.
title: Borsao 2011 Monte Oton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

description: Lively, lip-smacking fruit flavors and a tangy, tannic texture will make this a great pairing with grilled chicken, steak or portobello mushrooms. Medium bodied and well balanced, it's fun to drink.
title: Backhouse 2012 Merlot (California)

description: Aromas of papaya and melon are hit with a slight sulfuric note. This feels plump, with mild citric acidity. Flavors of grapefruit, lime and grass are green and bright, but turn pithy on the finish.
title: G7 2015 The 7th Generation Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: An uninteresting wine despite good dryness and acidity. The blackberry and cherry flavors are thin, and have vegetal notes. The blend is Grenache Noir, Syrah and Zinfandel.
title: Big House 2012 Red (California)

description: Riesling is the star of an excellent lineup of Best Buys from StoneCap. Estate-grown, fragrant and complex, it sends up aromas of lemon oil, orange peel, fresh-brewed tea, pastry and powdered sugar. Mildly sweet, fruity and delicate, it surprises with exceptional length. A very fine effort from new StoneCap winemaker Kendall Mix.
title: StoneCap 2010 Estate Grown Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: There is some of the mineral character that is typical of the Douro in this black-fruit-laden wine. It has acidity and tannins and a stalky, juicy character that keeps it crisp. The wine is ready to drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Red (Douro)

description: The bouquet on this is so neutral there's almost nothing to describe. This is zesty and tangy in the mouth, with pithy orange, lemon and green apple flavors. A crisp finish with citrus zest leaves a clean final impression.
title: Casa de Campo 2012 Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: This is classic, off-dry Vinho Verde. With its light prickle, crisp fruit that has a tangy lime and lemon character that comes through the candy flavor, it is a refreshing, light wine.
title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a young, fruity wine with fine acidity and plenty of red-fruit flavors. Light spice, generous tannins and a hint of wood all contribute to a balanced wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Santos Jorge 2014 Toutalga Red (Alentejano)

description: A lot of shale in the soils adds interest to this elegant, light, fairly soft wine. Off-dry and balanced, it represents good value. Flavors of apples, pears and blossoms lead; a soft finish with a hint of caramel wraps it up.
title: Girardet 2001 Estate Riesling (Umpqua Valley)

description: A soft, simple wine, with apricot and orange flavors that are quite sweet. Unless you like this style, you'll find it cloying.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a light, fruity and off-dry wine. It has splashes of lemon and sweet citrus, with a crisp finish.
title: Mapreco 2014 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Rubbery on the nose, then sharp in the mouth, with herbal, sour plum flavors and weird funk as well. Bitter, tart and hard on the finish.
title: Finca El Origen 2010 Syrah (Mendoza)

description: Sweet and simple, with chocolate, blueberry jam and caramel flavors.
title: Dobbin Lane Wines 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: A smooth and rounded blend of Trincadeira and Aragonez, this is rich, soft and full in the mouth. Red berry fruits dominate this wood-aged wine, allowing spice and acidity to give a generous aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Alente 2013 Red (Alentejo)

description: If you don't mind a bit of herbal character, this is a nice, easy drinking Syrah with raspberry and cherry aromas and timidity as opposed to a forceful attack. Zesty berry fruit rules the palate, which finishes in round, roasted form. Nice but sort of generic.
title: Rayun 2008 Syrah (Rapel Valley)

description: A nose with apples, vanilla and pear, and flavors of flowers and pears are found in this delicate Pinot Grigio. Spicy but floral, with a quaffable character.
title: Cramele Recas 2008 Alb Sec Pinot Grigio (Viile Timis)

description: This wine is very soft, rounded and gentle. A touch of light pepper accompanies melon and creamed pear flavors. It's a good apéritif wine and it can be paired with amuse-bouche.
title: Borges 2011 Meia Encosta White (Dão)

description: This inexpensive wine is relatively low in alcohol and reasonably refreshing, although pear, melon and pineapple flavors leave a slightly sweet impression on the palate. Drink now.
title: Yellow Tail 2015 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: This is a soft wine from the warm white vintage of 2015. It is a touch herbal and much more tropical and white fruits. The balance is just right, so drink now.
title: Saveur des Vins de France 2015 Les Portes de Bordeaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: While the wine is dry, there is a fruitiness to it coupled with a caramel flavor that certainly makes it seem sweeter. With a crisp aftertaste, the raspberry flavored wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Alandra Rosé (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A blend of Nero di Troia and Negroamaro, this simple wine has delicate aromas suggesting red berry, wild flower and a whiff of sea breeze. Bright and informal, the rather diluted palate offers hints of raspberry and strawberry alongside fresh acidity.
title: Teanum 2016 Vento Rosato (Puglia)

description: Zippy, with natural rubbery aromas. This is quite tart and has a personality defined by lemon. There's lemon torte up front, while at the end it's purely tangy and sharp. Not an astringent, scouring wine, but high acidity comes into play.
title: Viña Santa Monica 2001 Riesling (Rapel Valley)

description: Some caramel and candied fruit goes well with the flowery element on the bouquet. In the mouth, lime, peach and mineral run the show. After that comes a clean, light finish with just a hint of stone-fruit flavor. A good mouthfeel ensures that this will be a decent wine for trout caught during the summer.
title: Montecillo 2002 White (Rioja)

description: Bulky and clumsy, with powerful early barnyard aromas that ultimately give way to more refined plum and cherry. While this wine has its virtues, it lacks elegance. And while we admit that it's a country wine that's probably meant to be a sizable, rustic quaff, it seems a bit too basic and borderline to garner a better review.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Riscal 2000 Riscal 1860 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: Tomato and herbal aromas tell you most of what you need to know about this bargain-priced Cab. It's somewhat green and sweet, with a raw feel and tannic bite. Tastes of tomato and herbal red plum. Feels light on the finish.
title: Arge & Tina 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)

description: This off-dry wine falls on the sweet side, with pleasant honey/lemon tea flavors up front. The fruit is followed with some earthier notes, and a quickly fading finish.
title: Columbia Crest 2012 Two Vines Riesling (Washington)

description: Tan in color, with uncomplicated but friendly melon and apple aromas, this feels electric on the palate due to high acidity. The mix of citrus and stone-fruit flavors is lean, tight and lasting on the finish.
title: Ressò 2016 Old Vines Garnacha Blanca (Catalunya)

description: Classic southwest France Sauvignon Blanc, bright, fresh and citrus-flavored. Great for summer drinking, clean and delicious.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Soft, overoaked and clumsy, with sweet vanilla, caramel and buttered toast dominating.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Chardonnay (California)

description: This soft and slightly sweet wine smells like cinnamon and vanilla and tastes like cherry juice. It is medium bodied and smooth in texture.
title: Backhouse 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: A relatively light and civilized version of a notoriously dark and full-bodied varietal. The color is a medium purple. An aroma of grilled vegetables leads to satisfying cherry flavors carried on a moderately tannic but not extreme texture.
title: Oak Grove 2012 Family Reserve Petite Sirah (California)

description: This is thin and uninspiring, but it's dry, with watery berry and spice flavors.
title: Oak Grove 2010 Reserve Shiraz (California)

description: The nonexpressive berry and cherry aromas are closed. Light in feel, this tastes of citrus, plum and rhubarb. The lightweight finish is mildly herbal and green.
title: Funky Llama 2011 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: As its name states quite clearly, this is a plush, lush, smooth red wine. It's sweet and jammy like a shot of Jell-O.
title: Plush 2010 Smooth Red (California)

description: Bringing out all the perfumed herbaceous character of Colombard, this has some softness along with freshness, flavors of pink grapefruit and green plums, finishing brightly. Screwcap.
title: Mont Gravet 2010 Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Soft, ripe, juicy wine, full of bright red berry fruits, soft tannins and a light structure. The wine is ready to drink, the final flavor lifted by acidity.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Fonte do Beco Castelão (Setubal)

description: Very soft and easy going, this has rounded peach and apple flavors. The acidity is light, hinting at citrus. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Storks Landing White (Lisboa)

description: This is dry, with scouring tannins and some twiggy, stalky bitterness. It has just enough blackberry flavor to get by. For the price, it's fine for big parties.
title: Oak Grove 2010 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This is a dry rosé with crisp acidity and smooth strawberry fruits. It is light and soft with a gentle texture that is lightly perfumed and with some citrus zest. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Portada Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Wax bean and citrus notes meet dry, woody elements on the nose, but this wine does feature a plump, appealing texture and a soft, easy finish. Drink now.
title: Banrock Station 2015 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: Matchstick and green pepper lead the aromas of this sweet-and-sour Moscato. Canned-fruit flavors bring some fruit to the palate but finish a bit syrupy.
title: Casa de Campo 2016 Moscato (Argentina)

description: Shows an aggressive, roasted set of aromas that feature leather, meat, olive and char. The palate is full and thick, with chewy, flat tannins and then herbal flavors that mute the wine's black fruit content. A good midlevel wine that delivers within its price range.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2010 Petirrojo Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: This clean, mild quaffer offers basic white-fruit aromas and a light-bodied, fresh palate. Apple and mild citrus flavors are short on the finish, which takes on an apricot flavor as it fades away.
title: Mariposa 2016 Chardonnay (San Juan)

description: This inexpensive wine is relatively low in alcohol and reasonably refreshing, although pear, melon and pineapple flavors leave a slightly sweet impression on the palate. Drink now.
title: Yellow Tail 2015 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

description: Almost impossible to distinguish this nice and easy Garnacha from the winery's Monte Oton label (also rated 89). Open berry and jam aromas keep it together, while the saturated, sweet blackberry palate is living proof of Campo de Borja's sun and terroir. Ripe, deep and easy to enjoy.
title: Borsao 2008 Red (Campo de Borja)

description: Sugary flavors of red-cherry jam and toasted, almost ashy oak mark this simple Merlot.
title: Turning Leaf NV Merlot (California)

description: Smells like pink bubblegum, tastes like sugary cherry pie filling. Even at this price, it's not a bargain.
title: Turning Leaf NV Pinot Noir (California)

description: Off-dry with lemon-drop fruit flavors, a lick of citrus that suggests pear and lime. Though it's a fairly simple, fruit-forward wine, it delivers a concentrated burst of fresh, vivid flavor that's missing from most wines in this price range.
title: Columbia Crest 2007 Two Vines Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Soft blackberry, cinnamon and pepper aromas lead flavors of juicy berry and savory spice in this Merlot from Bulgaria. Good tannins and structure give the wine ageability, which will also temper its oaky character. Overall, an impressive effort from an emerging region.
title: Vini 2006 Veni Vidi Vici Merlot (Thracian Valley)

description: This makes a nice choice for your house white wine to buy by the case. Attractively rich, it seems to be all about the fruit flavor. It brings ripe pear and peach notes, an opulent texture and lingering fruity finish. It is medium-bodied, smooth and complete.
title: Twisted 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Balanced and subtle but with good character, this blend offers flavors of tobacco, leather and clove. Fruit-driven and accessible, it's both elegant and ageable.
title: Beau Joubert 2005 Oak Lane Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Stellenbosch)

description: A little sweet and simple in pineapple and peach jam flavors, but adequately balanced with acidity. A good white wine for parties.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Balanced and subtle but with good character, this blend offers flavors of tobacco, leather and clove. Fruit-driven and accessible, it's both elegant and ageable.
title: Beau Joubert 2005 Oak Lane Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Stellenbosch)

description: The bouquet smells like spiked fruit cocktail, and in the long run what's wrong with that? The palate is open and fairly easy, with a touch of kick pushing citrus, tropical fruit and even some mineral notes. A more citrusy and fresh style of Viognier, with 15% Chardonnay.
title: Estampa 2006 Viognier Chardonnay White (Colchagua Valley)

description: Here's a very fruity wine just brimming with sun-ripened cherry, raspberry and blackberry flavors, with a kiss of smoky oak. It's nice, dry and balanced, and a good value for the money.
title: Talus 2005 Merlot (Lodi)

description: Savory and satisfying, this is one of the best Pinot Grigios at this price point. It shows real class, with brisk acidity framing flavors of lemons, limes, mangoes and honey. Perfect for drinking with today's Asian, Indian, Ethiopian and Mexican fare, or on its own as an apéritif.
title: Oak Grove 2011 Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Melon, pear and apple aromas are standard and sweet. The palate is soft, maybe a bit mushy, with banana, pear and tropical fruit flavors. Finishes easy and flat, with lasting tropical sweetness.
title: Santa Rita 2010 120 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Sugary sweet and simple in the modern style, with vanilla, caramel, buttered popcorn, orange jam and toast flavors.
title: Foodies 2010 Chardonnay (California)

description: This sweet Moscato is barely acceptable and it smells strange. Creamy notes of vanilla and lychee finish bitter.
title: Twisted 2012 Moscato (Mendoza)

description: A bright magenta color and aromas of blueberry juice and wet dog suggest a basic wine that's all about fruit and not much about style or complexity. The palate is lively and juicy, the flavors are vivacious but immature, and the finish falls off fast.
title: Sombras del Sol 2011 Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Aromas of paint and vanilla come with stalky fragrances that are low on freshness and fruit. The palate is weighty, while the flavor profile is muddled and briny.
title: Viña Vilano 2013 Tempranillo Rosado (Ribera del Duero)

description: This is a young, fresh wine that's laced both with black currants and some dry tannins. It's so young and fruity that is all up front freshness. In fact it could do with a few months in bottle to give it more weight and round it out.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2013 Reguengos Red (Alentejo)

description: This blackberry-flavored wine has ripe tannins and a soft texture. It presents a warm feeling, tempered by its fresher acidity and stalky aftertaste. Drink from late 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: Hay and green apple aromas are about all that you can extract from the nose. It feels top heavy and awkward, with mealy citrus and maderized apple flavors. The finish is full, fruity and baked. Drink now.
title: Funky Llama 2011 Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Soupy aromas lead to a sharp palate, with citrusy, sour red-berry flavors. It's tangy and edgy on the finish.
title: Suter 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Young, clean, fresh Vinho Verde, ready to drink, with refreshing acidity. It has crisp apples and citrus, with just some sweetness to round it out.
title: Aveleda 2010 Fonte White (Vinho Verde)

description: A wonderful appetizer wine, dry, clean and zesty in acidity, with appealing citrus, apple, lemongrass, vanilla and honeysuckle flavors. A great restaurant by-the-glass sipper. Production was 136,000 cases.
title: Turning Leaf 2009 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Slightly mulchy at first, with coffee grinds, leafy notes and mildly soupy red-fruit aromas. Airing helps it out, and it evolves into a sweet, herbal wine with baked berry fruit flavors and olive accents. Standard Chilean Cabernet that's a touch syrupy and herbal.
title: Viña La Rosa 2008 La Palma Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Richer and riper than the '06, this wine shows why Pinot Grigio is such a hit in America, especially at this price. The wine is crisp and savory in acids, with a wealth of citrus, fig, green apple, honeydew melon and vanilla flavors that have an off-dry sweetness.
title: Redtree 2007 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Orange peel, anise and honey aromas come before a honeyed, soft palate. Flavors of orange, honey and melon are wan, with little finish. This tastes manufactured more than natural.
title: Region 1 2014 Moscato (Mendoza)

description: A blend of Grenache Blanc and Viognier, this is attractive, fruity and perfumed. Touches of apricot balance with the green fruits and herbal edge. It's an easy wine to drink, best as an apéritif.
title: Cuvée Lion d'Or 2015 White (Vin de France)

description: This is off dry, low alcohol (11.5%), spiced up with tart acidity and loaded with rich, ripe fruit flavors mixing pears and peaches. Sweet without being sugary, it should appeal to a wide spectrum of wine drinkers, and snap together the flavors of a Thai food. Columbia Crest makes 18,000 cases of this wine.
title: Columbia Crest 2009 Two Vines Gewürztraminer (Washington)

description: An aroma like white pepper and onion is strong in this medium-bodied wine that has decent olive and berry flavors underneath.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2013 Cabernet Merlot (California)

description: This is a spunky, jumpy Tempranillo with horsey aromas of cherry and plum. A light, fresh palate delivers lightly herbal flavors of plum and pie cherry, with an earthy twist. Mild and hollow on the finish.
title: Faustino Rivero Ulecia 2013 White Label  (Rioja)

description: If the choice is between sleek packaging and good product, take the product every time. And with Garnacha de Fuego, the product is sound to the point of surprising. A bouquet of huge berry aromas is the opening act, followed by flavors of red apple, kirsch and plum. Offers lots of fruit in front of a short, simple finish. And then it's time to open another bottle.
title: Bodegas Ateca 2007 Garnacha de Fuego Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: Cherry cola, violets and aromas of Dr. Pepper soda lead the way to flavors of tart cherry pie and cherry juice. The tannins are slightly astringent and the finish is pleasantly tart.
title: Domeniile Sahateni 2014 Nomad Dealurie Munteniei Pinot Noir (Dealu Mare)

description: Made by the team at Wrath, this is one of the better canned wines on the shelves right now. Light in the glass, it offers very refreshing, mineral-driven aromas of wet riverstone and rain on cement as well as slight touches of Pink Lady apples and green hay. Asian pear flesh mixes with slightly sour lime peel and sweet chives on the palate.
title: Al 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

description: Chewing gum, plum and raspberry aromas are raw and suggestive of grape skins. The wine is juicy but without much body or spine. Flavors of generic red fruits and watermelon finish rubbery and slightly bitter. Drink in 2014.
title: Cruz de Piedra 2013 Garnacha Rosé (Calatayud)

description: This simple wine holds somewhat oxidized aromas of caramelized orange slices and flint that carry over to the palate along with lemon-lime.
title: Feudi del Pisciotto 2012 Baglio del Sole Inzolia (Terre Siciliane)

description: A solid Zinfandel, dry and stylish. Not a blockbuster, just a well-crafted wine that offers nice berry, cherry, tobacco and spice flavors.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Zinfandel (California)

description: Not much fruit shows up on the bouquet but there is a bland sense of vanilla and cookies. Feels heavy but with adequate citric acidity. Tastes monotone and lemony.
title: Casa de Campo 2011 Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: Woodbridge makes two styles of Chardonnay, and this is the richer one. Attractive layering of fruit, cream and hazelnut flavors on a nicely viscous texture makes this full-bodied wine something special. It has a good sense of concentration and depth, along with a lingering finish.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Chardonnay (California)

description: here too many Pinot Grigios are sweet and sugary, this one's dry, and it has a crisp acidity that makes the mouth water. The flavors are of ripe Meyer lemons, limes, minerals, honeysuckle flowers and vanilla. Great with Asian-fusion fare.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2007 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This light and pleasing wine smells like apples and pistachios, and tastes mildly fruity and nicely crisp.
title: Oak Grove 2014 Family Reserve Chardonnay (California)

description: Earthy gritty berry aromas come with a hint of animal. This is juicy and in good shape across the palate, while bright plum and berry flavors are dusted with spice and chocolate notes. A wiry finish with lightly medicinal berry flavors shows kick.
title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2015 El Circo Volatinero Tempranillo (Cariñena)

description: Light aromas of ash, herb, berry, vanilla and cherry lead to sweet plush cranberry and cherry flavors that linger along with baking spice notes on the finish. It brings a lot of enjoyment for the price.
title: Hogue 2014 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Fiery red-fruit aromas precede a rough palate. It tastes like herbal red plums; the finish turns a bit sweet.
title: Funky Llama 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Very young, this is a fine follow-up to the winery's outstanding 2009. Dark and rich, the estate-grown fruit offers far more flavor than almost any domestic Merlot in this price range. Blackberries, black cherry, smoke and espresso lead into a grainy, chocolaty, tannic finish.
title: StoneCap 2010 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: An easy, lush Viognier, front-loaded with tropical fruit, lemon, ripe peach, vanilla bean, buttered toast and honeysuckle flavors. Drink up.
title: Oak Grove 2012 Reserve Viognier (California)

description: Bigode, the mustache, is a soft and juicy wine, light in texture with strong acidity. Red berry fruits are prominent, fragrant and perfumed. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: An intriguing blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon as well as Castelão and Trincadeira. gives a firm yet full black fruited wine. It's packed with firm tannins, and its full black-fruit flavors are structured and layered with acidity. The perfumed aftertaste suggests a more plummy character.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2009 Terra de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: Produced from old vine Castelão, this wine is ripe and full of dark fruits. With the background acidity and spice, it has a crisp edge that gives the wine a great lift. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Quinta da Mimosa Castelão (Palmela)

description: Wiry cherry and berry aromas include a note of olive. This value Cab is lean and light in body, with leafy red-fruit flavors. An inoffensive finish with no new flavors struggles but holds it together.
title: Balduzzi 2015 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: Generic apple aromas are short on intensity and length. This tastes of melon but not much more. A light, dilute finish with bready flavor notes ensures that this is O.K. for easy quaffing.
title: Tololo 2014 Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Aromas like black pepper and red cherries, and flavors like lightly sweet strawberries give this medium-bodied wine a lot to like, besides the very affordable price. It has just a touch of tannin to add some good texture.
title: Domino 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Strawberry, tea and sandalwood aromas make for an interesting, unusual bouquet. This is a fresh, young wine that shouldn't solicit much contemplation, but will register positively due to its light, smooth feel. It's medium in depth, with airy finishing notes of mushroom and cherry.
title: Rioja Vega 2006  Rioja

description: Quite floral smelling and fruity tasting, this is not your usual Chardonnay. It smells like rose petals, tastes like Anjou pears and has a soft mouthfeel and medium body.
title: Buffalo Grove 2013 Chardonnay (California)

description: Plum and raspberry aromas are honest and pleasant. This is fruity and plummy on first take, but soon it becomes narrow and acidic, with tart, shrill berry and plum flavors that finish juicy and angular, then bitter.
title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2013 El Circo Equilibrista Cariñena (Cariñena)

description: Zesty and tongue prickling, this is fresh, fruity and ready to drink. It has a sugar sweety character which is tempered by acidity and a touch of red currant.
title: Mapreco 2014 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Made in the Aussie style, this is a big, exuberant Shiraz filled with jammy cherry, cola and spice flavors. With its smooth tannins and crisp acids, the wine is clean and balanced. Great with barbecue.
title: Barefoot Cellars NV Shiraz (California)

description: A pretty good red for those on a budget. The nose falls into the generic but pleasant raspberry and cherry realm, while the feel and flavors are of mouthfilling, mostly clean red fruit. No real varietal character but a good enough red wine.
title: Silvertop de Argentina 2005 Shiraz (Mendoza)

description: This is an easy-going Merlot, at a very affordable price with a brilliant ruby appearance and simple aromas of berry fruit, cedar, spice and leather. The wine has a short, no-fuss finish and ends with crisp freshness.
title: Cantina Tudernum 2005 Merlot Merlot (Umbria)

description: This mildly prickly, red-fruit dominated Malbec is perfectly drinkable. The nose is drying, while the palate shows red cherries and raspberry along with some forceful buttery oak. Reasonably long on the finish.
title: Conquista de Argentina 2006 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Cherry and plum aromas come with a dusty note, however things turn sharper and more brambly with airing. It feels citrusy and choppy, with sweet-and-sour flavors of raspberry and red plum. Juicy, but fiery on the finish.
title: Bodegas la Aldea 2010 La Aldea Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: Gritty, toasty and burnt smelling, with stalky aromas of burning hay and rubber. It feels solid, with herbal flavors of tomato and basil that are given heft via additional flavors of grilled beef and leather. This has a medium-long on the finish.
title: Coto de Hayas 2010 Garnacha-Syrah (Campo de Borja)

description: Roasted red berry and tangy woodsy notes on both the nose and on the palate. Finishes with more oak, plus a tart metallic-herbal note that is softened by chalky tannins.
title: Caliterra 2000 Syrah (Central Valley)

description: Sharp red-fruit aromas include notes of vinegar and asphalt. Angular and bumpy on the palate, this is tart and foxy tasting, with a sour, herbal finish.
title: Lost Vineyards NV Malbec-Bonarda (Argentina)

description: A tight, freshly acid wine, with stalkiness but also good juicy fruit. There is a green pepper element, leaving a wine that is light, simple.
title: Caves Aliança 2006 Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: A bit edgy in tannins and with some green flavors, but not a bad Cabernet for the price. Dry and robust, it shows blackberry and currant flavors, with a touch of smoky oak.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Dark, fruity and common in every way, but sometimes that's all you need. The wine has a clean, ordinary cassis and berry nose followed by a juicy palate with dark fruit flavors that show accents of vanilla, spice and chocolate. Totally drinkable and likable.
title: Korta 2009 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Lontué Valley)

description: Dry and reedy smelling, with juicy berry-cherry aromas and flavors. The wine is snappy, zesty and juicy, with accents of cocoa and pepper. Clean, simple Cabernet with ample pop and freshness.
title: Morandé 2009 Pionero Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: A rustic, simple wine, with ripe, sweet cherry and cola flavors. Feels rough and sharp in the mouth, but not bad for the price.
title: Round Hill 2010 Merlot (California)

description: Rustic and thin, showing green mint and stemmy flavors. Even at this price, it's no bargain.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Less adequate than in the past. The wine lacks aromatic zest and pungency before showing tart apple and ultimately vegetal flavors. Canned pea notes are prevalent.
title: Santa Rita 2010 120 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Wooly aromas of white orchard fruit and toasty peanut shell define the nose. On the palate, zesty acids propel the modest white-peach flavor, leading to a slightly short but clean finish.
title: Les Bourgeois 2011 Solay White (Missouri)

description: A leathery, herbal aroma outmuscles the distant berry and cherry scents. It feels hard and high in acidity, with raspberry and snappy red-plum flavors. It's citrusy and crisp on the finish, with lasting tang.
title: Finca Vieja 2010 Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: Earthy, rubbery dark-berry aromas feed into a lean palate supported by drawing tannins. Like the nose, this tastes herbal and leafy, with generic berry flavors and a touch of mushroom. The finish is light and short.
title: Creación 2013 Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Light aromas of apple and pear are followed by lightly concentrated fruit flavors. It's enjoyable but seems a bit faint.
title: Hogue 2015 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The aromas are barely a whisper, with notes of citrus and herb. It drinks dry with lightly concentrated fruit flavors. The variety seems hard to find.
title: Hogue 2015 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This lively, medium-bodied and well-balanced wine smells of raspberries and dried herbs. It tastes invitingly fresh, combining bright fruit with earthy and savory accents. The color is relatively light, matching the overall tangy personality.
title: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Zinfandel (California)

description: A mild, softly fruity wine, with unusual grace notes of sandalwood and incense. The fruit suggests cinnamon-sprinkled pears, and the acidity has been cut and softened. A little bit of a plastic, Band-Aid flavor infuses the finish.
title: Columbia Crest 2009 Two Vines Pinot Grigio (Washington)

description: This is a bright, frothy, light Vinho Verde that is very crisp and soft. A perfumed wine that demands to be drunk as a fresh, it has ample acidity and just a touch of sweetness. Screwcap.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2012 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde)

description: Light in body for a Shiraz, with savory elements of meat and pepper complemented by touches of plum and berry fruit. Drink up.
title: Cockatoo Ridge 2007 Shiraz (South Australia)

description: Crushed strawberry aromas, followed by flavors that are fresh, sweet and a palate that has the delicious prickle of a young wine. Screwcap.
title: Aveleda 2009 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A pleasant, nondescript wine. There's 10% Sauvignon Blanc in the blend, which gives it a little spicy lift, but the mainstay Chardonnay core seems generically lemony and falls away in the finish.
title: Pine & Post 2007 Chardonnay (Washington)

description: A zippy, lively version, this light-bodied wine smells and tastes like a combo of grapefruit, lemon and peach juices, having a crisp character on first sip, and a rich softness on the second.
title: Twisted 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a lively, fruity wine that is great as an apéritif. With yellow fruits that are cut with acidity, it is a fresh, bright wine that is ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A good $8 wine with snap, crackle and pop. The nose brings black cherry and saucy aromas, while the palate is sweet, a bit medicinal and just a little herbal. There's a creamy sweetness to the finish and another modest dose of herbs and medicinality. Any faults should be offset by the cost.
title: Odfjell 2008 Babor Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: The aromas of apricot, flowers and beeswax are like a welcome mat. The mouth is full and properly acidic; flavors of honey, ripe white fruits and some mustard seed make for a wine that's got a lot of power working for it. Best Buy.
title: Santa Ema 2002 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Spicy, earthy aromas are warm and fairly deep, while a snappy, acidic palate of berry fruit supported buy buttery oak does the trick. The finish is substantive and only mildly tannic, while the overall personality is fresh and clean.
title: Santa Alicia 2001 Estate Bottled Reserve Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Pear and apple aromas receive a kick from some creamy, vanilla-tinged oak. The palate is mostly tangerine and lime, with some rich baked-apple undertones. The lengthy finish is solid, as is the mouthfeel. Best Buy.
title: Carmen 2002 Classic Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Highly perfumed, with delicate floral and peach notes leaping out of the glass. Melon and peach flavors combine on the palate. Lightweight and finishes short, but it's a solid apéritif. Best Buy.
title: Mezzacorona 2002 Vigneti delle Dolomiti Chardonnay (Trentino)

description: A nice Sauvignon Blanc for the price. It's basically dry, with honeysuckle, pineapple, lime, gooseberry and green apple flavors brightened by crisp acidity. Easy to drink at a good price.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: Here's a light, sweet and aromatic pink wine with a definite Moscato flavor. A slight spritz and welcome acidity keep the texture lively, and the floral, candylike flavors last on the finish. Should go well with appetizers or dessert.
title: Barefoot Refresh NV Rosé (California)

description: Salmon-colored and dense, with aromas of clay, cherry and brown sugar. Pinot Noir-ish in its smoky, dried-berry palate and peppery finish. Robust, solid and with texture.
title: Cristalino NV Rose Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Slightly earthy and rubbery smelling, with a pinch of wet dog fur on the nose. It feels full and hefty, with sweet blackberry flavors leading to a round, sweet finish. This is solid and easy to like.
title: Vicente Gandia 2010 Organic Tempranillo (Spain)

description: This is a wonderfully dry, crisp and super-drinkable white wine, perfect for a first cocktail of the afternoon. It's clean and brisk in acidity, with a flourish of lemon, lime and vanilla flavors. Spicy, too. Great with little puff pastry appetizers.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2009 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Jumpy, candied-cherry and berry aromas are straight from Kool-Aid city. Fresh on the palate, with pure but simple cherry, plum and raspberry flavors, this is meant for simple sipping. Serve lightly chilled for best results.
title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2014 El Circo Acróbata Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: This has a bright yellow-gold color and subtle aromas of honey, pear and fig. The rather rich texture supports pear, fig and baking spice flavors. It's a pleasantly ripe, somewhat soft but not overtly flavored wine that's easy to drink and enjoy.
title: Maple Ridge 2013 Chardonnay (California)

description: With notable sweetness, this Moscato should be considered a dessert wine. It has sugary flavors of apricots, tangerines and peaches. Crisp acidity provides clean balance.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2010 Moscato (California)

description: Strawberry and raspberry aromas set up a reedy, flush palate with stemmy, candied strawberry flavors. Turns green and bitter on the finish.
