description: An enjoyable, easy drinker with notes of ripe red apple, apricot and granulated sugar. It's broad in feel, drinking a touch off dry.
title: WildHaven 2012 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Chewing gum and light berry aromas come with a floral note. Crystal clear and lean on the palate, this tastes of mild citrus fruits and peach pit. Dry on the finish, with a nip of grapefruit.
title: Arrumaco 2015 Garnacha Rosé (Spain)

description: Chemical-leaning aromas jump out on a last-legs nose. This feels dull and low on pulse, with only a hint of acidity. Mealy bitter apricot flavors finish pithy.
title: Borsao 2015 Rosé (Campo de Borja)

description: Scattershot aromas of generic berry and cinnamon smell forced and fake. This has a tannic scrubbing mouthfeel and artificial flavors of chocolate and cheap oak. A green note and burn on the finish do nothing to help this along.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Love 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Muddled candied aromas smell uniquely unnatural and forced. This is choppy and jagged in the mouth, while a strange set of fake-oak and murky berry flavors are prominently on display.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Love 2015 Merlot (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: This is a very perfumed wine, with the addition of Moscatel in the blend, adding the lychee flavor. It's textured with a crisp edge that allows the wine to retain its fresh character. This is a wine to be drunk young.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2012 JP Azeitão Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Bical produces delicious pear and apple flavored wines. This bright, fruity wine is a fine example of this creamy freshness. It is a wine for drinking now, while fresh and crisp at the end.
title: Caves Aliança 2012 Galeria Bical (Bairrada)

description: With its ripe tannins and soft, juicy black fruit, this is an immediately drinkable wine. It has a crisp layer of acidity, giving it a light touch. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Vinha Maria Premium Red (Dão)

description: Aromas of brown baking spices and black cherry open the bouquet of this wine. There are soft tannins with flavors of red cherry, black cherry and cherry cola in the smooth and round finish.
title: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Pinot Noir (Danube River Plains)

description: There's a slight note of oxidation in the bouquet that leads to aromas of pineapple upside down cake, apple and Meyer lemon. Flavors of apple pie and canned peaches precede a dry, crisp finish.
title: Lion-Gri 2014 Golden Land Dry Pinot Gris (Moldova)

description: The briary, red fruit aromas are slightly prickly slightly, becoming fuller and deeper with time in glass. This feels solid and fairly dense for the price, with berry, peppery spice and light herb flavors. Fruity and friendly on the finish.
title: Bodegas Luzón 2010 Luzon Verde Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: Rubbery, woodsy aromas of wild berries and balsamic vinegar are spicy and suggestive of Bordeaux. Leafy flavors of plum, pie cherry and spice are herbal but not green, while this value blend's peppery, dry finish is juicy and composed.
title: Príncipe de Viana 2009 Crianza Red (Navarra)

description: Made from 100% Cabernet, this is a great house wine for the price. It's dry, full-bodied and tannic, with proper black currant, blackberry, mocha and oak flavors. Easy to find, with 20,000 cases produced.
title: Alias 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Comes out of the chute showing a funky, rubbery edge, but that blows off with a little time to reveal dark, somewhat earthy notes of cola and blackberry. It's medium-bodied, with good length to the finish, where it picks up enough dusty tannins to give it backbone.
title: Ironberry 2005 Cabernet Shiraz Merlot Red (Western Australia)

description: Malbec from Chile may not seem as natural as from Argentina, but you will not go wrong with this stocky, soft, lightly baked offering. The palate has a touch of herbal lift to accent the black fruit, while the finish is firm, comfortable and consistent.
title: Santa Alicia 2006 Reserve Malbec (Maipo Valley)

description: Quite strange and funky smelling, with uncommon grass, floral, hickory and blueberry aromas. The palate feels fine but has a sweet, faux-weedy core flavor that's offset by candied berry flavors. Tastes of licorice and lactic creaminess on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Bodegas Navarro López 2009 Rojo Granrojo Tempranillo-Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Smells like tobacco and pepper, and then turns tannic and dry in the mouth, with blackberry flavors emerging after it warms up. A decent everyday Zin.
title: Smoking Loon 2007 Zinfandel (California)

description: Strange spice and ground cinnamon aromas shadow the fruit, which may be a good thing because the palate is flat and murky, with jammy, sweet flavors and not much follow up on the backside. Finishes creamy but bitter tasting.
title: Terra Andina 2009 Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Light, bright and fruity this is an easy-to-drink off-dry wine for the summer. It is clean and crisp, apples and pears set off by floral aromas. Drink now.
title: Vinihold 2016 Caiua a Noite White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is all tangy zesty fruit. With plenty of apple and grapefruit acidity, it is lively, textured and bright. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Montes Claros Colheita White (Alentejo)

description: This is an attractive fruity wine. With its soft texture, perfumed white fruits and balanced acidity, it is the sort of wine that is ready for a warm day. Drink now.
title: Adega Mãe 2016 Pinta Negra White (Lisboa)

description: Light, clean apple aromas lead to a basic palate with skin-driven texture. Airy green fruit and citrus peel flavors finish mild and fresh. At 11.5% abv, this is about as light as good wine gets.
title: Camina 2016 Verdejo Verdejo (La Mancha)

description: The wine, named after a typical mustache from the 19th century, is all fruit: ripe blackberries with balancing acidity. This is an easy ripe wine that will be great with barbecues this summer thanks to its soft tannins and drinkability.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Bigode Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Chardonnay offers the roundness while Fernão Pires offers perfume in this attractive, ready-to-drink wine. It has bright, crisp lemon and green-apple acidity that is immediately appealing. Screwcap.
designation: Tagus Creek Chardonnay and Fernão Pires
title: Falua 2012 Tagus Creek Chardonnay and Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: Smells dusty and peppery at first, and then milk chocolate and herbal aromas take over. Feels grabby, with bland, average blackberry flavors that are covered by faux oak, vanilla and milk chocolate. Hollow and confected as a whole.
title: San Elias 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Smells a bit pickled and green at first, with a thick and sweet palate that's not easy to wade through. Sweet lime and orange-mango flavors set up a pithy finish.
title: Freixenet NV Spumante Sparkling (Cava)

description: A very herbal wine, with vegetal flavors of celery and asparagus. Citrusy acidity comes through at the end.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2010 Cister da Ribeira Branco White (Douro)

description: Herbal and briary on the nose, with green aromas of oregano and sage. Feels rather lean and abrasive, with high acidity and minty flavors of herbal plum and pie cherry. Tight, hot and spicy on the finish.
title: Echeverria 2010 Carmenère (Curicó Valley)

description: For basic Chardonnay, this fits the bill as a good quaffer. Pithy citrus aromas lead to a zesty, citrusy palate with flavors of green fruits, lemongrass and green herbs. It's lasting on the finish and a touch ripe.
title: Viña La Rosa 2012 La Palma Chardonnay (Cachapoal Valley)

description: This Tempranillo is rubbery and leathery smelling, with roasted berry overtones. The palate has a round mouthfeel, with lightly burnt and bitter flavors riding atop chunky plum notes. This feels healthy, with blueberry and herbal notes on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Peñascal 2009 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: Heavy and dense up front, with dark, forceful aromas. The palate is crisp and tight, with firm plum and berry fruit in front of a short, basic finish. A good, standard wine with good depth and character; 100% Tempranillo.
title: Bodegas Luis Gurpegui Muga 2009 Pintoresco Tempranillo (Extremadura)

description: This informal red has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of black-skinned fruit and a suggestion of cooking spice. The simple palate delivers black cherry and vanilla alongside laid-back tannins. Drink soon.
title: Famiglia Cielo 2014 Pinot Nero (Delle Venezie)

description: This straw-colored Chardonnay has aromas of apple and citrus blossom with flavors of creamy apple, vanilla and citrus pith. It has nice weight on the palate with a clean acidic finish.
title: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Chardonnay (Thracian Valley)

description: A lightweight and easygoing white, this offers soft aromas and flavors of green apple, melon rind and citrus, all framed by bright acidity. The finish is short, but mouthwatering. Drink now.
title: Fat Barrel 2015 Bob's Chenin Blanc (South Africa)

description: Produced in eastern Alentejo, near Spain, this light and soft wine is easy and drinkable. It has a smooth texture, just hinting at lemony acidity. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: Off the bat, this smells a bit like fruit punch, although with time it stiffens. A chunky heavy somewhat flat palate tastes of clove, chocolate and berry and plum.
title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2014 Don Ramón Red (Campo de Borja)

description: This is a fruit-forward, almost-Beaujolais-like wine, with bouncy cherry and raspberry fruit, medium weight in the mouth and a simple but satisfying finish. Drink it over the next several months.
title: Les Trois Couronnes 2012 Grenache-Syrah (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Earthy, oaky and ripe on the nose, this Tempranillo feels taut and drying due to heavy pulling tannins. Flavors of wood grain, raisin and toasty black fruits finish with a lasting sense of forced oak.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Paso a Paso 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: A fruit-forward nose with earthy plum and berry aromas leads to a sharp, lively palate with high acidity. Plum and berry flavors are rendered angular by said acidity, while mild salty notes rise up on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Finca La Estacada 2015 Ocho y Media Tinto Velasco (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Bright and fruity, with a tannic edge, this is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah. This is food friendly, with a rich red-fruit flavor that's cut with a caramel note and strawberry acidity.
title: Falua 2011 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Tejo)

description: This earns its Best Buy designation for the rich, creamy orange, peach and tropical fruit flavors and the note of caramel-tinged vanilla from oak aging. It tastes sweet, but it provides what many consumers love about Chardonnay.
title: Lucky Star 2011 Chardonnay (California)

description: Previously known as Feudo Arancio, Stemmari is a beautiful estate in Sicily owned by the Mezzacorona Group in northern Italy. This sun-drenched expression of Pinot Grigio offers aromas of ripe melon, dried grass and stone fruit.
title: Stemmari 2011 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)

description: Simple aromas of apple cider come with a hint of match stick and brine. This feels round and fleshy, like an unfiltered apple cider. Flavors of generic citrus and apple juice finish pulpy and round. Drink now.
title: Arrumaco 2014 Verdejo (Spain)

description: Mild peachy aromas are friendly but nothing serious or intense. This varietal Macabeo feels citrusy, while lightly bitter flavors of almond skins, citrus pith and green melon finish with simplicity and a note of nectarine.
title: Bocopa 2014 Castillo de Alicante Gran Selección Macabeo (Alicante)

description: Named after the grapes in the blend (Negroamaro, Primitivo and Cabernet Sauvignon), this easygoing, savory wine doles out juicy blackberry, black currant, black cherry and a hint of licorice. Soft, round tannins provide the framework.
title: Tormaresca 2012 Neprica Red (Puglia)

description: Spicy and minty on the nose, with hard primary aromas and lots of cinnamon. There isn't much fruit or body to this youngster, which seems wood-infused and short on substance. 45,000 cases made.
title: Terra Andina 2007 Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Sharp and grapey, with sweet, jellied flavors of cherries, blackberries and chocolate. With a production of nearly a half-million cases, lots and lots of folks will happily wash down their meats and pasta with this easy red wine.
title: Fetzer 2005 Valley Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: The oak flavoring overpowers, with smoky char, buttered toast, caramel and sweet vanilla dominating the pineapple and pear fruit.
title: Fetzer 2007 Valley Oaks Chardonnay (California)

description: The Douro version of Paxis is a blend of Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz. It is a rounded, smooth and spicy wine, with weight and richness. Packed with red berries and plums, it is fruity and structured, with tannins providing a strong base of support. Drink from 2014.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Paxis Red (Douro)

description: Aromas of lemon zest and freshly cut grass abound on the nose. Flavors of lemon curd and lemon pith bring nuance to the palate.
title: Vini 2013 Veni Vidi Vici Chardonnay (Thracian Valley)

description: The opening is a touch scratchy and herbal, but there are also nice berry fruit aromas. The palate is ripe and substantial in feel. Flavors of sweet black plum and spice come with a touch of wood, while the finish is spicy like a licorice gumdrop.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2013 Petirrojo Reserva Estate Grown Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: Spicy and bright, this blend of Cabernet and five other black grapes is a bit diffuse. A mix of berries and astringent tannins dominate, with black tea in the finish. Will show best with grilled meats.
title: Washington Hills 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: Mild, clean and peachy on the nose, with a pinch of sweet banana. It feels chunky but honest, with apple, sweet citrus and peach flavors. The finish is solid; a good wine for under $10.
title: Bodega Norton 2011 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Represents a very nice value in a refreshing, balanced Chardonnay. The wine, which was aged in lots of new American oak and stirred on the lees, is rich and creamy, with citrus, mineral and yeasty flavors that are brightened by crisp acidity.
title: Bogle 2006 Chardonnay (California)

description: Bright aromas of apricot, pear, lavender and jasmine capture the senses while the richly sweet stone fruit flavors also bring pleasure. The concentration and acid don't entirely match up but there's still much to enjoy.
title: Washington Hills 2013 Late Harvest Riesling (Washington)

description: Here's a nice dessert sipper that's perfect for nights on the patio, with some fresh fruit or a simple butter cookie. It's sweet and clean in acids, with savory Asian pear, tangerine, vanilla and cinnamon flavors. With only 11.5% alcohol, it won't go to your head.
title: Castoro Cellars 2006 Muscat Canelli (Paso Robles)

description: With 20% barrel fermentation, this wine is surprisingly rich and spicy for a low-end Chard. The aromas and flavors bring to mind pears and golden-delicious apples, before turning tart on the finish.
title: Pindar Vineyards 1998 Peacock Chardonnay (Long Island)

description: Great price for a big, powerful red like this. Tough in tannins now, it shows classic flavors of currants, mocha, anise and pepper, and will develop over time. Classy and impressive.
title: Rendition 2007 Petite Sirah (Alexander Valley)

description: Quite aromatically restrained for the variety with notes of jasmine and flowers. It's medium sweet but lacks cohesion to hold it all together.
title: Summit Estates 2012 Gewürztraminer (Washington)

description: Very light in color, such that it's almost pink. The nose on this Cabernet-Syrah blend is accented by chewing gum and spice aromas. The palate is clean but light in weight, with crisp cherry skin and watermelon flavors. It's not very deep or long, but what's here is tasty and ready to drink now.
title: Estampa 2007 Rosé Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Neutral for the most part, but this light-framed white slips in pear, orange and spice notes while maintaining a nice, juicy profile. Nothing more than a refreshing, lime-infused dandy. But what's wrong with that?
title: Valentin Bianchi 2007 Elsa Bianchi Torrontés

description: If what you're looking for is a medium-weight red wine with bright fruit and bounce, this is it. It's not complex or weighty stuff; instead it's focused on jumpy cherry and raspberry flavors and a snappy feel. Totally pedestrian but good in its price category.
title: Santa Rita 2005 120 Shiraz (Maipo Valley)

description: This is a terrific wine to pair with pizza or a heaping plate of spaghetti and meat sauce. Informal, bright and fruity, this Montepulciano d'Abruzzo delivers clean blackberry aromas and an easy but sufficiently extracted finish.
title: Farnese 2009  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

description: Simple but solid apple and nectarine aromas are straight forward. This feels round and easy, without much acid-based cut. Flavors of melon, mango and nectarine finish short, with a note of apple.
title: Esperanza 2014 Estate Grown & Bottled Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

description: This wine is still young, crisp and needs time to bring out its fruit. It has lively acidity, to be sure, with hints of the citrus and white currant flavors that are to come. Give this wine until 2016.
title: Château de l'Enclos 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Opens with decent dusty apple and peach aromas, but they don't really hold together for long. And the palate is similar in that it offers adequate opening flavors of green apple and citrus but no improvement after that. Drink right away; it won't age well.
title: Basico 2008 Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (La Mancha)

description: Briar and rhubarb aromas suggest stemminess, but the palate is fairly clean and clear, with tight, rubbery tannins supporting red fruit flavors of cherry and plum. Short, rubbery and unexceptional, but good enough despite a whiff of green that's probably due to the Cabernet in the wine.
title: Basico 2008 Rojo Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (La Mancha)

description: A medium-bodied blend of Grenache Blanc, Bourboulenc, Ugni Blanc and Roussanne, this simple white from the Perrin family of Beaucastel offers fruity notes of melon and citrus that finish crisp and clean.
title: La Vieille Ferme 2008 White (Côtes du Luberon)

description: The Perrin family, with its long tradition of winemaking, consistently turn out delicious bargain-priced wines from the Côtes du Ventoux. This rosé blends cherries and chocolate with citrus and even touches of minerality and length rare in a $9 wine. Drink now.
title: La Vieille Ferme 2007 Rosé (Côtes-du-Ventoux)

description: Bona fide Best Buys aren't as ubiquitous as they once were, so take note of this affordable Garnacha from northeast Spain. The wine features clean aromas of dried fruits, spice and licorice. The palate is just as proper, with sweet plum and berry flavors. It may be a tiny bit screechy and gritty, but we're talking $9 here, so get on board.
title: Marqués de Reala 2006 Grenache (Campo de Borja)

description: A far better wine than the previous vintage. This is big, beefy and clean, with bacon on the nose. The palate is perky, zesty and high in acidity, and thus the flavors of cherry and plum are forward and alert. Finishes with snap and pop as it begs for pizza, grilled chicken or a hamburger off the grill.
title: Espiritu de Argentina 2008 Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Mineral, peach and apple aromas are straightforward and mild. Citric acidity gives life to an otherwise soft palate, while flavors of nectarine and orange finish with a chalky feel.
title: El Cortijillo 2012 Verdejo (La Mancha)

description: Typical of Volver's wines, this everyday Monastrell opens with oaky, toasty, charred aromas of black cherry and blackberry. This is a little wiry and acidic, but it's also full and dense. Charred, spicy flavors of baked plum and clove finish with gusto and some heat.
title: Volver 2014 Tarima Monastrell (Alicante)

description: Perfect apéritif Vinho Verde, light as a feather, attractively laced with citrus and peach flavors. It has a light prickle on the tongue, with a soft aftertaste.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Salsus Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: Herbal, earthy aromas tell the story. The wine has heft and stemmy qualities, with sweet berry and coffee flavors along with mounting warmth. Turns more herbal and earthy as it airs out, with staunch acidity and a rubbery tannic grip.
title: Silvae 2009 Made With Organic Grapes Monastrell (Spain)

description: Big and bold stuff from southern Spain with burnt, hot aromas of roasted black fruits and stems. Better on the palate, where it brings plum and berry flavors but also some heat and saline. Slightly stemmy and roasted on the finish, much like the bouquet.
title: Bodegas Mähler-Besse 2007 Taja Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: This typically fresh, lemon- and herbal-accented wine is light as a feather and deliciously aromatic. Drink this carefree wine this summer.
title: Mont Gravet 2014 Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Sweetly fragrant, with hints of pear and melon. The palate is wet, lean and acidic, which helps push the lychee and melon flavors. A clean, light, mild refresher with sharper-than-expected acids. Nothing more than that.
title: Callia 2008 Alta Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

description: Named after the valley where the vineyard is situated, this red-fruited spicy wine is crisp. There are soft tannins and attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2014 Vale das Donas Red (Tejo)

description: From the south of Vinho Verde, close to the Douro, this is a lively and fresh wine, bright with acidity and lifted by its prickle on the tongue. It is dry, although a soft touch of baked apple gives a gentle, fruity aftertaste.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2014 Conde Vilar Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This medium-sweet rosé is bursting with ripe strawberry aromas and flavors. It is soft, just edged by crispness and ready to drink with its light, fruity finish.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Coreto Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Neutral and clean, with hints of melon, apple and cucumber. For a 2007, this is still holding its own. It offers just enough richness and body to tease, but mostly it's a textbook Chilean SB with apple, grapefruit and gooseberry flavors along with a pithy finish. Gracious and tasty, but drink now.
title: Santa Ema 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Apple juice aromas don't hold it together for long, and the palate is spritzy and acidic. Apple cider and a touch of vinegar and citrus are the flavors. Not the type of Chardonnay we can recommend.
title: Echeverria 2009 Unwooded Chardonnay (Molina)

description: Saline, apple and not much else create an innocuous bouquet. The palate is short and lemony, with tangy acidity and stalky flavors of lemon and pineapple. Burns a little on the finish, which tastes stemmy.
title: Tamaya 2010 Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Funky and sweet smelling, with odd fruit aromas and unfamiliar spice notes. The palate has a snappy, clacky feel and flavors of red fruits, citrus, herbs, tomato and oregano. Sharp on the finish, and overall it tastes like pizza.
title: Terra Andina 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Pointed and herbal on the nose, with olive and a hardness that suggests paint or chemical. The palate is tight, grating and tastes of jumbled fruit and olive. Herbal and minty on the finish.
title: Santa Alicia 2010 Reserva Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: A metallic note accents cherry and raspberry aromas. This is one part jammy and one part tannic in the mouth, with lightly herbal, spicy, medicinal flavors of plum and berry. Oak, latex and heat are the characteristics that drive the finish.
title: Amathia NV Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: Mineral and lime aromas are key on the bouquet. It feels wide, with fleshy but not flabby flavors of peach, nectarine and apple. This is quiet, clean and just juicy enough.
title: Bodega Norton 2011 Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: Lean raspberry and cherry aromas are the best part because the palate is rather raw and acidic, which causes raspiness and a tough mouthfeel. Flavors are sharp and red fruited, and there's an oak and vanilla element that's not that well integrated.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Fundatio 2008 Selección Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: This Moldovan white offers value and a great bang for the buck, with its fresh, fragrant nose and fun, assertive flavors. Buoyed by minerality, the citrus and spice on the palate offer clean quenching on a hot day. Not terribly elegant, but it doesn't need to be.
title: Château Vartely 2006 Pinot Gris (Moldova)

description: Red berry fruit with touches of vanilla and spice give this bargain-priced Pinot a candied but inviting set of aromas. The palate runs on fresh fruit, and overall it's all about clean, forward juicy flavors and very little extra. A nice aperitif Pinot Noir.
title: Familia Schroeder 2006 Saurus Patagonia Pinot Noir (Neuquén)

description: Gets the job done with modest tangerine, pineapple and cream flavors. Nice and crisp and dry, but it's pretty thin.
title: Happy Camper 2009 Chardonnay (California)

description: Tomato, red fruit and resiny oak aromas don't exactly scream “fresh.” Feels rustic and scratchy, with herbal, sawdust and vanilla flavors clouding out any quality fruit that might exist. Not much here, really.
title: San Elias 2010 Merlot (Central Valley)

description: Fresh and crisp, this is a wine that has little flavor and only the thinest palate. It is bright to drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Terra de Touros Arinto (Tejo)

description: Mealy aromas of compostable white fruits lack freshness. This is high in acid but low on body. Briny flavors scream sauerkraut, while the finish tastes pickled and feels caustic.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Maximo 2013 Edicion Limitada Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: This is an earthy, rustic wine that has high acidity and stalky fruit. It will round out as it develops although that rustic character is likely to remain.
title: Adega Mãe 2014 Pinta Negra Red (Lisboa)

description: This Malbec's high-toned floral aromas of plum and blueberry come in front of a raw, abrasive palate. This tastes like pickled cranberry, while a citric finish is an enamel-peeler.
title: Luis Segundo Correas 2015 El Cipres Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Light, citrusy aromas also are suggestive of bath soap. The feel is juicy yet innocuous, while flavors of tropical fruits finish mild and simple. This is the definition of a quaffing wine.
title: Callia 2013 Alta Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

description: Waxy, yeasty aromas are not very fresh. A citric mouthfeel lacks clarity and foundation, while orange and nectarine flavors are briny. This tastes pickled on the finish.
title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2014 Royal Viura (Rioja)

description: Definitely a riper, more solid version of Carmenère with blackberry, pine, herbs and chocolate on the nose. The palate is typically herbal but it's full of smooth, simple dark-fruit flavors and spice. Tasty, wholesome and well worth a go in this category.
title: Santa Alicia 2006 Reserve Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Hooray for Novy for producing this fine, inexpensive wine and for putting their name proudly on it, instead of hiding behind a second label. It's dry and crisp and totally drinkable, with pleasant berry, cherry and spice flavors.
title: Novy 2008 Four Mile Creek Red (North Coast)

description: The aromas of ripe peach, honeysuckle and jasmine are bright. It's medium sweet and finishes with a floral soap flourish. It needs more acid to stand it up but goes down easy.
title: Sagelands 2014 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This sparkling red wine made from Muscat is cherry red in color. It has pleasant aromas and flavors of red raspberry, black cherry and sweet pomegranate juice. It could use a few more bubbles but it will satisfy the palates of wine drinkers looking for sweet red sparkling wines.
title: Lion-Gri 2015 Château d'Or Sparkling Red Muscat (Moldova)

description: Bland, sweet aromas are not persuasive. This feels cloying and sticky due to a lot of sugar and not much acidity. Soapy, sweet flavors finish with bitter notes.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Love 2015 Moscato (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: If you catch this wine young and properly chilled, it isn't that bad. It's very sweet and sugary, with candied melon, mango and citrus flavors. Then it gets more tropical on the finish, with ending notes of banana and mango. On the verge of tasting fake but not quite.
title: Marqués de Cáceres 2007 Satinela Medium-Sweet White (Rioja)

description: Green melon and lettuce aromas are fresh and clean. The wine feels solid and good, and there's a jumble of baked apple and melon flavors. Yeasty on the finish, it's made entirely from Macabeo grapes.
title: Idilicum NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Floral berry aromas are fresh and carry only the slightest grassy, green element. The wine feels crisp and tight, with nice red plum and raspberry flavors. Mild, focused and not very hefty or thick on the finish.
title: Castillo de Monséran 2010 Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: This is a soft, rounded and fruity wine that is already ready to drink. It has dark berry notes, spicy accents and a strong layer of acidity to keep it fresh. Tannins show through gently, softly, just enough to give the wine structure. Drink now and until 2018.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Casa do Lago Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: Perhaps with a nod to the battlefields of the Napoleonic wars fought in this region north of Lisbon, this is a crisp, apple- and lime-flavored wine. It has bright acidity and a delicate texture, with notes of pear skin and grapefruit. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Forgotten Field Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This Pinot Grigio has a slightly greenish hue and fragrant aromas of citrus, white flower and exotic fruit. You can really taste its sunny Sicilian roots: the wine has light density but is fuller and softer than wines from the north.
title: Feudo Arancio 2007 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)

description: Candied cherry aromas are mildly rubbery and suggestive of nail polish. On the palate, this Malbec feels round, fair and balanced. Flavors of pasty fruit and oak accent red-fruit notes.
title: Acordeón 2011 Malbec (Tupungato)

description: Typical for the region, and nicely done for the price. Apple and almond aromas yield to citrus and passion fruit, while the palate deals peach, melon and citrus flavors. There is nothing special or out of the ordinary here; the wine is clean, tasty and textbook.
title: Solar de la Vega 2007 Verdejo (Rueda)

description: With its little seasoning of Muscadelle in the blend, this is an attractively perfumed wine. It has bright acidity, plenty of herbaceous flavors and a final pear and crisp apple aftertaste. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Château Maison Noble 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Starts out varietally correct, with zest in the mouth and citrusy, green aromas. Time doesn't really help it along; the lime and grapefruity crispness is surface-level. Turns more pithy and less focused as it airs out. Drink immediately before it fades.
title: Sundance 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Bright aromas of rose petals and lychee are followed by lightly spritzy, off-dry fruit flavors. It delivers easy-drinking appeal.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Plump, ripe notes of blackberry jam, prune, spice cake, tobacco and black tea steal the show and make for a very prominent, sweet and intense nose. The mouthfeel is less bulky but it does offer the length you should expect.
title: Farnese 2007  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

description: Here is a cheerful, distinctive Sangiovese with aromas that recall eucalyptus, blackberry, spice and cherry cola. It has personality and a clean, polished feel with succulent sweetness that would pair seamlessly with lamb marinated in rosemary olive oil.
title: Farnese 2007 Sangiovese (Terre di Chieti)

description: A blend that is dominated by Arinto, this is crisp and lemon flavored with hints of riper yellow fruits. It has a lively, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Rotas de Portugal Branco White (Alentejano)

description: An attractive, fruity blend that brings in a fair number of local and international grapes. The result is a seamless, fruity, soft wine that is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Coreto Red (Lisboa)

description: Alvarinho and Chardonnay are the chosen grapes for this blend. As its name suggests, a salty taste from the ocean spices up the ripe yellow and green plum fruits. It's soft with a fine balance of acidity and a soft honey touch at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Point West White (Lisboa)

description: A musky perfume accents fresh lemon and tangerine aromas on this off-dry wine. It's ripe and rich on the palate with flavors of quince and yellow peach. Zesty with lime, it finishes moderately long with a hint of savory herbs.
title: Peter Mertes 2012 Platinum Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: This wine's suntan lotion aromas and mild volatility are a bit disconcerting. On the palate, it's full and dark, with abrasive, rubbery tannins and jammy currant and black cherry flavors that finish strong.
title: Jardín de Lúculo 2015 Los Bohemios Garnacha (Navarra)

description: Rose pink with a perfumed, confected aroma of strawberry jam and Love's Baby Soft perfume, this semisweet late harvest Merlot rosé from Romania is sugary and syrupy.
title: Dreamer 2009 Late Harvest Merlot Rosé (Dealurile Munteniei)

description: Murky and soupy at worst and “earthy” at best, this soft, beefy Carmenère is loaded down with green, herbal flavors that can't be saved by touches of mocha and coffee. The finish is downright green, and overall the fruit is weak.
title: Santa Alicia 2009 Reserva Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: There's a vegetal, tinned nature to this late harvest Riesling from Romania that dominates both the nose and the palate. Honeyed apple and pear flavors peek through the off-dry palate, but overall, it's a disjointed, tired wine with bracingly high acidity.
title: Dreamer 2008 Late Harvest Riesling (Dealurile Munteniei)

description: Made in the popular style, with sweetened vanilla cream and orange butterscotch flavors.
title: Fetzer 2009 Chardonnay (California)

description: Though pleasant aromatically with lots of freshly cut grass and gooseberry notes, this full-bodied, dry Bulgarian Sauvignon Blanc has a dense, clunky mouthfeel and a bracingly high acidity. There's some decent lemon and grapefruit flavors, but plenty of tinned green asparagus as well.
title: Targovishte 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Bulgaria)

description: Berry aromas are matched by toasty charred notes on this blend of Garnacha Tintorera and Monastrell. The palate is generous, with a touch of stickiness. Roasted, woody flavors of baked black fruits finish with a medicinal twinge and modest heat.
title: Atalaya 2012 Laya Old Vines Red (Almansa)

description: This vintage seems to have taken a step forward compared to past years. It's bright pink in color, with tight, salinic aromas of cherry and apple skins. Tastes tangy and crisp, with plum, nectarine and citrus flavors. Real good for the price.
title: Bodegas Julián Chivite 2010 Gran Feudo Rosado Rosé (Navarra)

description: A warm, ripe vintage of Altano, its berry and red plum fruits rich and generous. It has attractive, well-balanced, soft tannins. A layer of acidity and spice completes this harmonious wine.
title: Symington Family Estates 2009 Altano Red (Douro)

description: This budget-priced Syrah offers hints of why the grape does so well in Washington. It has a bit of peppery bite, some very tart cranberry fruit, crisp acids and a lifted, citrusy finish. Clean and varietal, it's a good everyday effort.
title: Covey Run 2004 Quail Series Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a ripe and juicy blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tinta Roriz. The tannins are present although well integrated into the fine juicy red-fruit flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Pedras do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: Cotton candy and warm, dusty aromas give the wine pleasant, semisweet opening aromas. The palate is round and solidly formed, with creamsicle flavors and a bit of brown sugar or treacle. A good wine with just a touch of sweetness in the middle; must be a touch of residual sugar here.
title: Marqués de Cáceres 2007 Rosé (Rioja)

description: Of all the Cavas made by Freixenet, this oddly sweet Spumante is the weakest. This is briny, pickled and candied on the nose, with hints of lychee and banana. Flavors of Sprite, cane sugar and banana finish with sulfur, honeydew and a faux kiwi note.
title: Freixenet NV Spumante Sparkling (Cava)

description: Crisp yet slightly tart in the mouth, this wine exhibits pleasant flavors of Granny Smith apple, lemon custard, and fresh white peach.
title: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Sauvignon Blanc (Thracian Valley)

description: For a sweet wine, it's clean, light and airy, with pear and powdered sugar on the nose. The flavors are definitely sweet but the feel isn't particularly sticky, and the finishing flavors of candied fruit, vanilla and honeydew are good. Made from late-harvest Viura and Malvasia.
title: Marqués de Cáceres 2009 Satinela Medium Sweet White (Rioja)

description: The De Bortoli family does a solid job with Chardonnay—even this entry-level wine shows some complexity and finesse. Hints of smoke and graphite frame bright pineapple and lime flavors, delivered without excessive weight or richness.
title: De Bortoli 2013 DB Family Selection Chardonnay (Australia)

description: This has simple aromas of plum, berry and sweet vanilla. The palate feels fresh, with a citrusy bounce and flavors of raspberry, red plum and mellow spice. The finish is sweet and comported.
title: Alma del Sur 2011 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Light gold in color, this opens with easy aromas of garden herb, tangerine and white flower. Pair this with snack foods, such as toasted almonds or fried corn nuts.
title: Progettidivini 2011 Brut  (Prosecco Treviso)

description: A green, struggling wine from front to back. The nose kicks up underripe aromas to go with distant red fruit, while the palate is edgy and prickly, with high acidity creating snappy cherry and green flavors.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra del Bajo Aragón
title: Bodegas y Vinos de Lécera NV Esenzia Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra del Bajo Aragón)

description: This is a fresh, lemon-scented wine. It is light both in texture and in the fruity department with just a bright citrus character finished with acidity. The wine is ready now.
title: Les Vignerons du Pallet 2014 La Marinière Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

description: Plum and raspberry aromas are modest on the nose. This everyday Tempranillo feels a bit choppy and edgy, while plum, raspberry and prune flavors end slightly bitter.
title: Bocopa 2014 Conde de Alicante Selección Tempranillo (Alicante)

description: This is a rich and smooth wine that has the lightest hint of minerality. Ripe yellow fruits and elegant green plum and citrus flavors give this wine both a fruity character and a fine texture. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 White (Douro)

description: Shows good Chardonnay character in the creamy texture and peach, pineapple and pear flavors. It's a little rustic, but this is a good price for what you get.
title: Butterfield Station 2007 Chardonnay (California)

description: This is a full, fruity, rich and concentrated wine. It has bright red berries, some firm tannins and a good dense texture. It's also light and crisp, with acidity that cuts through the ripe fruitiness. Drink now through 2019.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Paxis Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a rich wine, smoky with vanilla and apple flavors. It has some good intensity, as well as a textured character that gives it some aging potential. Bright, fresh acidity cuts through the riper fruits. Drink now and until 2019.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Segada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Made with organic grapes, this straightforward wine opens with plum aromas and a whiff of cinnamon. The round easygoing palate doles out black cherry and a hint of cake spice accompanied by mellow tannins.
title: Barone Cornacchia 2015 Casanova  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: Pleasantly fruity and almost sweet, this medium-bodied wine offers a fruit bowl of flavor and freshness on the palate.
title: AVA Grace Vineyards 2014 Peach, Bright, Lovely Chardonnay (California)

description: Lightly prickly on the tongue, this is a refreshing, almost dry wine. It is bright, lively and fruity with citrus and crisp apple flavors. The wine is light and bright with plenty of acidity at the end.
title: Aveleda 2015 Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: Tasty and smooth, this Rioja shows sweet black cherry fruit and licorice aromas and flavors. There's plenty of oak here, too, plus some tannins to lose on the even, dry menthol and leather-tinged close. Will benefit from a year or two in bottle, and may shine quite nicely if the fruit comes forward a bit more. Drink now–2007. Best Buy. —M.M.
title: Martinez Bujanda 1998 Conde de Valdemar Crianza 1998  (Rioja)

description: This Rhone blend drinks candied and off-dry, with ripe berry, fruit, and spice flavors, and on the soft side. Strives to combine the freshness and lightness of a white with the weight of a red, and does a pretty good job of it.
title: McDowell 2000 Rose Grenache (California)

description: At two-thirds Grenache and one-third Mourvèdre, this wine comes across full and rich, and a trifle alcoholic. The overall sensation is of a cherry-vanilla sundae smothered in toffee and chocolate—too much of a good thing for some tasters, heaven in a glass to others. —J.C.
title: Tatachilla 1999 Grenache-Mourvedre Red (South Australia)

description: DFJ is one of a few producers who grow Caladoc, which is here blended with Tinta Roriz. A cross between Grenache and Malbec, it gives a dark colored, structured wine that is shown well here. Berry fruits come through the texture strongly, giving a rich character and plenty of final acidity. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Alta Corte Red (Lisboa)

description: Arinto is a grape that has just crossed the Tejo river from the western Lisboa vineyards. In this wine, it seems to have preserved its fresh and crisp character that is bright and packed with lemon and grapefruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 Arinto (Tejo)

description: Aromas of grapefruit skins and iodine open this wine A flat palate and baked red-fruit flavors with bitterness end full and grabby.
title: Almacruz 2016 Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: Herbal and peppery, with secondary aromas of floral raspberry. Snappy and grassy on the palate, with generic red-fruit flavors at the base. Candied and fairly weak on the finish.
title: Simone 2007 Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: This is a green Cabernet, no two ways of cutting it. The nose is all herbs and bell pepper, while in the mouth this feels ultradry and drawing. A buttery oak flavor is unintegrated and fails to help out underripe berry and pepper notes.
title: El Solar de Orfila 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Broken-down aromas of haystack and sulfur are sketchy. This feels pinched, citric and rubbery, while salty sour flavors fail to suggest any particular fruit. As a whole, not much good is going on with this Chardonnay.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Finca La Estacada 2015 Ocho y Media Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: This smells confected—neither natural nor convincing. Vanilla and milk chocolate aromas recall a cheap ice cream sundae. This feels scattered and hollow. Plum and chocolate flavors taste artificial and forced.
title: Callia 2015 Alta Cabernet Sauvignon (Tulum Valley)

description: This yeasty funky Chardonnay is on its last legs. The mouthfeel is mealy and the flavors are dull, yeasty, generic and lightly oxidized on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Love 2015 Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: A lemon flavored wine that is soft and fruity. With its zesty, tight texture and really crisp acidity, the wine is lively and crisp. Drinkable now, it will be better from early 2017.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Vila Santa Lois White (Alentejano)

description: Lightly prickly on the tongue, this is a refreshing, almost dry wine. It is bright, lively and fruity with citrus and crisp apple flavors. The wine is light and bright with plenty of acidity at the end.
title: Aveleda 2015 Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: Definitely inexpensive, but for a few dollars more, one might find more fruit and texture. This is an earthy, basic quaffer that'll please mostly on price.
title: Kirkland Signature 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Almost cool in character, this crisp Douro comes from high-altitude vineyards. The grapes yield a fruity citrus- and pear-driven wine that's minerally, with just the right amount of acidity to push its freshness forward.
title: Aveleda 2012 Vinho Branco White (Douro)

description: A full, ripe vanilla- and strawberry-flavored wine that hits the spot for the summer, with an emphasis on dryness, but with a soft, fruity, food-friendly aftertaste.
title: Falua 2007 Conde de Vimioso Vinho Rosé Red (Ribatejano)

description: Here's a light, easy Chardonnay from Friuli in Northern Italy that offers measured aromatic intensity and notes of stone fruit, flowers and white mineral. The wine would wash down an easy salad thanks to its lean consistency and fresh finish.
title: Cabert 2007 Chardonnay (Friuli Grave)

description: This Merlot has a nose of violets, cherry cola and talc powder. In the mouth, it tastes like red berries, blackberries and finishes with touch of milk chocolate.
title: Bostavan 2013 Via Etulia Reserve Merlot (Moldova)

description: A simple, everyday wine. Tastes grapey and jammy, with blackberries, cherries and raspberries that are distinctly sweet.
title: Butterfield Station 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Dusty, flat and about half oxidized, this is a bland version of Verdejo that isn't unpalatable but lags behind the field. Hits with a thud; very little life to it.
title: Viña Cantosán 2008 Verdejo (Rueda)

description: This has ripe Sonoma flavors of green apples, pears and tropical fruits, along with balancing acids and a touch of honey-sweet oak. Overall, it achieves harmonious balance. Production was 3,690 cases. Worth a special search.
title: Wheelhouse 2011 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A touch green and vegetal on the nose, with hints of canned peas and bell pepper. Fortunately there's enough lime and minerality to keep it fresh. Feels crisp, tight and wet, with green notes pervading core citrus flavors. Finishes pithy and zesty, with mild bitterness.
title: Botalcura 2011 El Delirio Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: This is an easy-drinking, crowd-pleaser of a wine. Light to medium bodied, it has fresh strawberry and cherry flavors and a soft, smooth texture.
title: Coast 2014 Merlot (California)

description: Simple, sweet-tasting and slightly candied, this bouncy drink is best served slightly chilled. Think of it as an introduction to wine—something to explore after white Zinfandel. —J.C.
title: Rosemount 2001 Grenache-Shiraz Red (Australia)

description: Mostly Sangiovese, with a touch of Cabernet Sauvignon, this “mini” Tuscan blends fruit from Chianti and Scansano in a spicy, lightweight red. Leather and chocolate accent the juicy finish.  White Wine
title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2000 Remole Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: There are some Chard elements in this rustic, countrified wine. The apple and peach flavors, with oaky vanilla overtones, are familiar. But itÕs a rough wine, with some odd, vegetal qualities. Satisfactory, if youÕre not very fussy.
title: Woodbridge 2000 Chardonnay (California)

description: A new, Aussie-style line from K-J, a series of varietal blends. This wine is a little too stewed and overripe, with raisiny, pruny aromas and flavors. The finish is a bit jammy and treacly, but it's not a bad casual sipper. —S.H.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2000 Collage Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz (California)

description: Ruby red with garnet hues in color, this easy-drinking Merlot brings aromas of cherry, black berry and black raspberry on the nose. Tones of black plum and black cherry are ripe and persistent on the finish.
title: Vini 2013 Veni Vidi Vici Merlot (Thracian Valley)

description: There's plenty of appeal to this well-priced wine with its aromas of flowers, pear and ice tea. It drinks off dry, with the flavor concentration lighter in style.
title: StoneCap 2013 Estate Grown Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Rough cherry and plum aromas are indicative of what's to come. This feels fresh but raw, with high acidity and not much body or depth. Tart plum and cranberry flavors finish with sharp acidity and a drawing sensation.
title: Bodega Privada 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Oak and mild perfume notes accent red berry aromas on the nose. The palate feels disjointed, with mild, ripe berry flavors and a hint of spice on the finish.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2013 Petirrojo Reserva Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Kudos to Ste. Michelle for accurately labeling this wine, and also for the Riesling sweetness scale on the back of all their Rieslings. Firm Yakima Valley fruit is the backbone here, tart and spicy, with bright flavors of pear and apple. A juicy, palate-cleansing style.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2010 Dry Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Rustic wine, its fruit angular and its tannins cutting into the wine awkwardly. Final acidity gives more sharpness.
title: Monte Novo e Figueirinha 2007 Herdade da Figueirinha Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: There's a reason Airén is used as a base grape for brandy and Sherry wines, and it's because it's not up to table-wine quality, even at the value price point. This wine is corny and lacks freshness. It's dull, wayward and offers little to no structure. Barely drinkable.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Sierra Virgen 2009 Airén Airen (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Subtle and fairly deep, with aromas of berry, pastry and cherry cough drop. It feels lively and good, with blueberry and plum flavors in front of a textured, medium-deep finish.
title: Callia 2011 Alta Malbec (Tulum Valley)

description: This is a thick, ripe Aussie red in which you can stand up a fork. The bold blackberry, vanilla, black pepper and dark earth flavors are not about finesse or elegance; this is stick-to-your-ribs stuff. Best Buy. —J.C.
title: Tatachilla 2000 Breakneck Creek Shiraz (South Australia)

description: Elegant, fresh wine, full of delicious red berry fruits, a fruit salad of red and black plums and a light touch of spice. Bright, juicy, ready to drink.
title: Parras Vinhos 2008 Castelo do Sulco Colheita Red (Lisboa)

description: One whiff and you know what you have. The nose offers wild flower, mustard seed and telltale lychee fruit. The body is fairly rich, and there are flavors of custard, apple, banana and nutmeg-like spice. The finish is simultaneously chewy and fresh, which is a testament to the wine's forward acidity.
title: Undurraga 2002 Gewürztraminer (Maipo Valley)

description: This old-school winery sticks to tradition, so if this new-release Merlot seems older than it is, that's by intention. The color is light, and the wine already carries fading edges. The nose is earthy and the flavors are spicy.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2001 Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Made with organically farmed fruit, this is light and easy, showing aromas of citrus, white flower and peach. The mouthfeel is creamy and slightly viscous on the finish.
title: Saladini Pilastri 2011 White (Falerio dei Colli Ascolani)

description: This opens with lightly perfumed red-fruit aromas of raspberry and plum, with a bright palate that shows mostly red plum, raspberry and cherry flavors. This is a basic, clean wine comprised of 75% Garnacha and 25% Tempranillo.
title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2008 Castillo de Fuendejalon Crianza Red (Campo de Borja)

description: Crisp acidity gives this off-dry Riesling just the edge of tartness it needs to balance out the sweet citrus and flower flavors. It's the perfect inexpensive summer picnic white wine.
title: Hacienda 2010 Riesling (California)

description: Piccini shows confidence and consistency with this best-selling value wine. Easy aromas of wild berry, blue violet and moist earth reveal its Tuscan soul.
title: Piccini 2010  Chianti

description: sweet-tart candy, vanilla, and pineapple scent this Traminer and Chardonnay blend. It's zesty in the mouth, tasting of grapefruit and lemon zest.
title: Bostavan 2014 Dor Traminer-Chardonnay White (Moldova)

description: Citrus blossom, apricot, peach, minerals and white peppercorn emerge from the nose of this attractively priced Chard. It boasts medium build and persistency with nice acidity and a spice-filled finish.
title: Farnese 2006 Farneto Valley Chardonnay (Terre di Chieti)

description: This blend of Chardonnay, Viura and Verdejo is light in body, with stalky haystack aromas and dilute nectarine and melon flavors. Its yeasty finish is somewhat bland.
title: Viña San Juan 2015 White (La Mancha)

description: With a smoked char aftertaste, this wine is lacking in fruit and fairly simple. A weediness could be interpreted as cedar or dried herb, but teeter-totters on the borderline.
title: Kirkland Signature 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This wine has been too heavily extracted, giving a series of tough tannins and a hard edge without the fruit to balance things out. It is a blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25/25 Merlot and Cabernet Franc.
title: Château de Seguin 2013 La Vieille Cour de Seguin  (Bordeaux)

description: The aroma is stalky and leathery on the nose. The palate is grabby, with sulfuric, bitter flavors of uncomplicated berry fruits. This is 65% Bobal and 35% Tempranillo.
title: Sierra Norte 2012 Ananto Red (Utiel-Requena)

description: Really charming, with a nose of green plums, red berries and earth that jumps out of the glass and curls up in your lap. The palate is lacking a bit in intensity but makes up for it with iresistable cassis flavor followed by fresh-roasted coffee. The bracing acidity would be well matched by a cheese-laden dish such as lasagna. Drink now to one year.
title: Veglio 2007  Dolcetto d'Alba

description: Sweet it is, but given the price it is good wine with mass appeal. Apple, pear and mellow citrus aromas and flavors feature zero funk or mealy character, and the finish offers a dab of butterscotch. Shows mild residual sugar but many consumers will like that.
title: Valentin Bianchi 2008 Elsa Chardonnay

description: A springy nose of cherry, raspberry and chocolate is a good opener, while the palate boasts a mix of herbs, tobacco, olive and plum flavors. The feel is a high point, with lushness and balancing acidity each making a cameo. Finishes mildly peppery. Good Merlot for the money.
title: Santa Alicia 2007 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: A ripe, full-bodied and spicy wine, defiantly dry, with a tight acid character. Aromatic fruit finish with intense perfumes, so that the wine is both rich and fresh.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2009 JP Azeitão Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This has raisin, earth, mint and dried herb aromas. It feels narrow, but concentrated, tasting of earthy tomato, baked plum and fresh green herb. It has a solid mouthfeel, with a mildly briney finish.
title: Finca Vieja 2007 Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: Lemon and tangerine aromas are slightly dusty. In the mouth, this Viura-Verdejo combo is lively and bouncy. Pithy citrus, almond-skin and apple flavors finish juicy.
title: Esperanza 2016 Estate Grown and Bottled White (Rueda)

description: The Cabernet Sauvignon structure shows strongly in this firm wine. Mint and black currant flavors are dense and concentrated. The tannins give a dry character to the wine that contrasts with its fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Península de Setúbal)

description: A richly fruity wine, warm and ripe. Spice, tannins and black plums are all there in a concentrated package that projects richness. It's perfumed although it does need to age. Drink from 2016.
title: C. da Silva 2011 Dalva Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Simple but solid apple and nectarine aromas are straight forward. This feels round and easy, without much acid-based cut. Flavors of melon, mango and nectarine finish short, with a note of apple.
title: Esperanza 2014 Estate Grown & Bottled Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

description: Besides the usual notes of citrus, pear and peach usually associated with Pinot Grigio, this expression offers added dimension in the form of roasted almonds. It has a creamy, honey-rich nose backed by chewy sweetness and refreshing zest. It's nice to see more screwcaps from Italy, especially on these light, easy wines.
title: Villa Pozzi 2006 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Features an impresive array of tropical fruit aromas and flavors, all delivered in a soft, round, mouthfilling style. It's easy to drink and easy to like. Imported by International Cellars.
title: Hardys 2006 Nottage Hill Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: Neutral for the most part, but this light-framed white slips in pear, orange and spice notes while maintaining a nice, juicy profile. Nothing more than a refreshing, lime-infused dandy. But what's wrong with that?
title: Valentin Bianchi 2007 Elsa Bianchi Torrontés

description: This is a fresh wine with attractive ripe fruits. Apples, bitter orange and a streak of citrus are coupled with pineapple acidity. It's a well-made, immediately drinkable wine.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Audaz White (Alentejano)

description: Generous tones of banana, mature pear and stone fruit shape a fragrant and broad white wine from Sicily (made with Catarratto grapes). The wine's flat texture is a bit fat and thick in the mouth.
title: Calatrasi 2007 La Piazza Catarratto (Sicilia)

description: Dusty apple, pear and other dry-fruit aromas give this clean wine a good but basic starting point. The palate is fresh but exceedingly simple in terms of its apple, kiwi and nectarine flavors. Pithy and bitter on the finish, but fresh. Tastes and smells like a standard white Rioja.
title: Falernia 2008 Reserva Pedro Ximénez (Elqui Valley)

description: This is a quaffable (about 10% alcohol), off, dry white wine, with intense, clean, lovely floral flavors. Citrus and citrus blossom mingle, making it almost like a still version of Prosecco. There is a surprisingly long finish with spicy floral flavors, intense and flavorful.
title: Henry Estate 2001 Müller-Thurgau (Umpqua Valley)

description: Good color, and the kind of flavor that many countries would kill for in so inexpensive a wine. It's ripely fruity, with firm tannins and dry acidity. Well-rounded and supple, this is an excellent value in an elegant dinner wine. —S.H.
title: Fetzer 1999 Valley Oaks Syrah (California)

description: Toast and leather aromas support modest berry scents. This is full, loud and banging on the palate. Roasted blackened flavors of blackberry and plum carry a meaty note, while this remains dark and toasty on an aggressive finish.
title: Volver 2015 Tarima Monastrell (Alicante)

description: Saucy aromas of red plum and tomato are fresh but not overly ripe or fruity. This is also fresh on the palate, but somewhat lean. Slightly salty berry flavors are mildly spicy, while this maintains a theme of freshness and modest fruit on the finish.
title: Finca Flichman 2016 Roble Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Fruity, with plum flavors soaked in a good dose of vanilla, this is an easygoing wine for casual entertaining or everyday use. The blend includes 8% Syrah.
title: Kirkland Signature 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a moderately aromatic wine with notes of toast, spice and caraway seed. It's medium bodied and on the sweeter side of off-dry with tart citrus flavors.
title: Radius 2011 Chardonnay (Washington)

description: Leather, plum and berry aromas form a nice opening as minty chocolate notes emerge. It feels spunky, with edgy, rubbery tannins and full flavors of plum, cherry, mint and herb. Dry and controlled on the finish, this has an overall fresh character. Mostly Garnacha with some Monastrell.
title: Atalaya 2010 Laya Old Vines Garnacha-Monastrell (Almansa)

description: Pretty aromas of white spring blossoms and Bartlett pear lead the nose on this bright, easy-drinking white. The lively palate offers tart green-apple and light mineral notes alongside crisp acidity.
title: Mezzacorona 2014 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Arguably one of the best value wines from Italy this year, this has beautifully intense aromas of jasmine, honey and exotic fruit. It's simple and well made, with a sweet softness and a fruity succulence on the finish.
title: Mezzacorona 2011 Moscato (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: This rosé, made from Pinot Noir and Syrah, is brilliant pink in color, with aromas of strawberry and cream. The silky palate shows pronounced red cherry and vanilla flavors.
title: Vini 2013 Veni Vidi Vici Pinot Noir-Syrah Rosé (Thracian Valley)

description: Smooth and fruity on the nose, with ample lushness and fairly ripe berry and cassis flavors. This is basically a Cabernet Sauvignon (with 20% Merlot), and it offers comfortable, medium-intensity flavors of raspberry, strawberry and currants. It's what you can drink with pizza or a grilled skirt steak.
title: Estampa 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: A mostly neutral bouquet shows mild notes of almond and apple, but little more. Flavorwise, this delivers modest almond and papaya flavors in front of a wan, nutty tasting finish.
title: Vega Sindoa 2014 Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra)

description: Citrus and floral aromas are mild. This blend of Viura and Chardonnay feels round and chunky, but hardly stocky. Bland flavors of orange and grapefruit fall off on the finish.
title: Las Valles 2014 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

description: Lightly floral aromas are dilute while hinting at quince jelly. There's not a lot of vitality to the palate, while tangerine and nectarine flavors are watery. Pithy citrus notes carry the finish before it putters out.
title: Vicente Gandia 2014 Hoya de Cadenas Organic Verdejo (Spain)

description: Red fruit aromas of plum and cranberry are green and grassy, with snap. This has an edgy, grating feel and herbal flavors of raspberry and red plum that turn green before finishing short.
title: Juan Gil 2013 Honoro Vera Organic Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: Year in and year out, this around where this wine shakes out. The nose is clean and nice for an under-$10 white, with minerality and fresh white-fruit aromas. A light, focused palate offers up green melon, apple, herb and white pepper flavors in front of a crisp finish. This varietal Viura outperforms its price.
title: Marqués de Cáceres 2012 Viura (Rioja)

description: Hard, pickled aromas settle on leathery and burnt after airing. The palate is jammy and sticky, with sweet, heavy, roasted, burnt-tasting black fruit flavors. Resiny as well. Tempranillo with 10% Syrah.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Montgó 2009 Picos del Montgó Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: This wine is ruby red in color, with aromas of black fruits and berries. The palate shows additional notes of tart black plums, fringed by soft tannins on the finish.
title: Vini 2013 Veni Vidi Vici Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)

description: Uncomplicated and tasty, this is a nice Cabernet for everyday purposes. It's dry and silky, with pleasant cherry, blackberry, mocha and cedar flavors.
title: Fetzer 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This is mustardy smelling, with salad-like aromas. It feels round, plump and a little heavy, with spiced apple and mild citrus flavors. Chunky in feel and briny in taste on the finish. Not as good as past vintages.
title: Analivia 2011 Verdejo (Rueda)

description: Fresh on the nose, with red cherry and apple skin aromas. This feels rather sharp and acidic, with flavors of tart cherry pie and red plum.
title: Aletta 2010 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

description: Stalky aromas give off the impression of corn and funk. It feels ultrasnappy, with medicinal fruit, forced oak and berry flavors that don't really click. The finish is grating and slightly bitter.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Bodegas Navarro López 2010 Rojo Granrojo Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: A tough wine to enjoy. The nose has a cheesy top layer, while the base aromas are of bell pepper and lettuce. It's very tangy and juicy in the mouth, with searing red-cherry flavors and green accents. Snappy and whispy to the max.
title: Príncipe de Viana 2005 Crianza Red (Navarra)

description: Dry and crisp, but so watered down, there's practically nothing there. Shows the barest hint of of citrus and flower flavors.
title: Surf Point 2007 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: A wonderful nose mixes pineapple/tropical fruits, honeysuckle and some spicy herbs. The crisp and clean flavors are of green berries, melon and vanilla. Best Buy.
title: Hedges 1999 Fume Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Named after the kingfisher bird, this wine has a warm, yellow-fruit and ripe character. It is perfumed, with a full texture and the richness that comes from aging on the lees. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Guarda Rios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This tangy wine is crisp while also fruity. With its hints of herbal flavors along with green plum and apples, it is a juicy wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Paris-Simoneau 2016 Antoine Simoneau Cuvée AS Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

description: This is a stylish attractive wine. It has an herbal touch although it is more about delicious bright fruit. Citrus and crisp apples dominate, laced with acidity. This refreshing wine is ready to drink now.
title: Paris-Simoneau 2016 Antoine Simoneau Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

description: This soft, spicy wine has easy fruitiness. Black currants are balanced with acidity and a bright aftertaste. This great-value wine is ready to drink.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Guarda Rios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Part of a range of single-varietal wines from this producer, this bottling features richly structured and perfumed Touriga Nacional. A firm core gives a minty edge to the blackberry fruits. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Despite having mildly cheesy, oily aromas, this ranks as a perfectly quaffable everyday white, with modest acidity and a round, easygoing attitude. Flavors of peach and melon finish a touch mealy.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Maximo 2012 Edicion Limitada Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: A full and ripe wine, it is richly layered with black fruits, soft tannins and a juicy, warm aftertaste. The acidity at the end adds a little freshness. It's made to be drunk now.
title: Kirkland Signature 2011  Médoc

description: Slightly mealy aromas of melon and papaya set up an easygoing, creamy palate, with green banana and nectarine flavors. A plump, fairly balanced finish ensures that this quaffer makes it to the finish line in decent shape. Drink immediately.
title: Paso a Paso 2012 Verdejo (La Mancha)

description: Dusty strawberry and cherry aromas are hollow but easy. The palate is plump but short on edge and framing. Flavors of strawberry and raspberry roll awkwardly into a low-acid, soft finish.
title: Jardín de Lúculo 2013 Los Bohemios Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)

description: Zinfandels from the large Clockspring vineyard are made by a variety of wineries, and they vary in quality. This one shows very ripe blackberry, cherry, tangerine, cola and date flavors, and is dry. The tannins are intricate, with a jalapeño pepper finish.
title: Clockspring 2004 Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: Tart, dry and simple, this Cab will happily wash down tri-tip at your next tailgate party. The flavors are of grilled blackberries and dark, unsweetened chocolate.
title: Montevina 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Creamy, rich and loaded with apricot and peach, this would pair well with creamy vegetable risotto.
title: Feudo Arancio 2011 Chardonnay (Sicilia)

description: While there's lots of candied black cherry and coffee grinds on the nose, on the palate, this medium-bodied Romanian Pinot Noir is rustic and herbaceous with balanced sour cherry fruit and notes of grass and earth. With such mild tannins, it lacks impact on the midpalate, but bright acidity carries it through a fairly long finish.
title: Werewolf 2008 Pinot Noir (Romania)

description: Redolent of fresh citrus, peach, pear and fragrant white flower, this is a wine to drink on a hot summer day by the pool.
title: Canaletto 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: You may or may not fancy the blue bottle, but the juice inside is a good example of Yakima Valley Riesling. Tea, honey and lemon flavors are co-mingled; and the 5% residual sugar adds sweetness without becoming grainy or cloying.
title: Hyatt 2007 Riesling (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: This Sauvignon Blanc has scents of lemon pith, honeydew and cantaloupe. It is soft on entry into the mouth with flavors of peach, apricot and lemon zest.
title: Cramele Recas 2014 Legendary Estate Series Sauvignon Blanc (Romania)

description: Stone-fruit and apple aromas grace a mild bouquet. This feels solid but generic, with chunky peach, citrus and pithy flavors. On the finish, this Verdejo becomes more waxy and heavy in feel.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Paso a Paso 2014 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Here's solid, everyday red wine here, rugged and fruity, but there's something about it that makes you think of pizza and burgers. The blend is Zinfandel, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah.
title: Kitchen Sink NV Red Table Wine Red (California)

description: Light red-fruit aromas include a note of chewing gum. This wine is medium in body and solid in feel. Currant and nectarine flavors are basic and snappy, persisting on the finish.
title: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Camina Rosé Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: This is a wine that brings out a soft, tropical character allied to a citrus and a herbaceous element. It's open, attractive and soft, and it's ready to drink.
title: Augey 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Light and fruity, this wine's berry flavor dominates the gentle tannins, while the bright acidity adds lift. Drink this in the next two years.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2011 Château Campot Lafont  (Bordeaux)

description: If you are curious about Sicily's Nero d'Avola grape, this is the perfect wine for beginners. It shows great fruit integrity, with characteristic aromas of cherry, wild berry and toasted pistachio.
title: Stemmari 2011 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: For under $10, this wine delivers an admirable blend of cherry fruit and savory underpinnings. Hints of asphalt and black olive finish on a mouthwatering note, joined by the suggestion of caramelized fruit. Drink now.
title: De Bortoli 2013 DB Family Selection Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)

description: Broad and easy in texture, this is tempting to drink because of its near sweetness. Baking spices, possibly from oak add-ins, fill the aroma, and candylike cherry and strawberry flavors flood the mouth.
title: Happy Camper 2012 Merlot (California)

description: A thin, watery wine that does a great job of keeping the mouth refreshed and clean. Would pair well with sliced cheese or cured meat.
title: Begali 2008  Valpolicella Classico

description: Smells like tarmac and tire rubber initially, and it remains stemmy and staunch even with air. The feel is dilute yet edgy, and the flavors suggest generic red berry and a dash of spice. Fades quickly on the finish, which is probably a good thing.
title: Conde de Jauregui 2009 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Rioja)

description: Year in and year out, this around where this wine shakes out. The nose is clean and nice for an under-$10 white, with minerality and fresh white-fruit aromas. A light, focused palate offers up green melon, apple, herb and white pepper flavors in front of a crisp finish. This varietal Viura outperforms its price.
title: Marqués de Cáceres 2012 Viura (Rioja)

description: With its dark color and rich fruit, this is instantly approachable. Tannins are well integrated into the ripe plum and black cherry fruits. With fresh acidity and a core of dry tannins at the end, the wine could age. Drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Casa do Lago Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: You could do a lot worse at the U.S. Open than to sip a glass of this. Keeping it well-chilled will help rein in the broad, weighty notes of peach and melon and allow hints of peppery spice to emerge on the finish. Drink now.
title: Jacob's Creek 2015 Classic Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: Aromas of black plum, black cherry, green bramble and a touch of eucalyptus precede flavors of blackberry, raspberry and red plum.
title: Cramele Recas 2014 Legendary Estate Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Romania)

description: Pineapple, citrus blossom, and white peach aromas prepare your palate for tastes of green apple, lemon zest and apricots. The finish is crisp and acidic.
title: Cramele Recas 2014 Legendary Estate Series Pinot Grigio (Romania)

description: Easygoing and not too complex this straightforward Cabernet Sauvignon offers aromas and flavors of red cherry, plum and black currant. The finish is medium length with persistent soft tannins.
title: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)

description: You get your money's worth with this Cabernet. It's dry and richly textured, bearing flavors of blackberries, currants and prunes, with a seemingly sweet finish.
title: Snap Dragon 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This is dry and medium bodied, with flavors of hay, spice and sour cherry candy. Drink this rustic wine with simple fare, like burgers or pizza.
title: Snap Dragon 2009 Red (California)

description: This attractive, spicy and fruity wine brings out the warmth of the Alentejo while also keeping crispness and black-currant acidity. It is smooth, rich and very ready to drink.
title: Santos & Seixo 2016 Rotas de Portugal Red (Alentejano)

description: Green plums, freshly sliced melon and some pineapple all come together in this fruit-salad-fresh wine. It is ripe, but retains plenty of crispness, a light structure of orange zest giving shape and piquancy.
title: Dão Sul 2007 Q do E Encontro Bical (Bairrada)

description: Here's a bright and easy-drinking expression of Nero d'Avola that offers sour cherry, ripe blackberry and pleasantly tart cranberry. Pair this with hearty first courses like four cheese gnocchi.
title: Stemmari 2012 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

description: Despite Romanian labeling standards, this demidulce is only a shade off-dry. The palate is intensely juicy with a ripe cherry flavor that's accented by layers of violet, fresh herb and a striking crushed-granite minerality. Easygoing elegance for an incredible value price.
title: Murfatlar 2010 Zestrea Demidulce Feteasca Neagra (Murfatlar)

description: Affordable and friendly, this refreshing wine offers strawberry jam and orange marmalade on the nose and a mineral-driven flavor profile. The fruit is overtaken by the acidity to some extent, but the wine still makes for a tasty warm weather sip.
title: Long Point 2006 Ciera Rosé (New York)

description: This pale rosé blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is fruity with crisp strawberry fruits and acidity. It has a soft perfumed aftertaste that makes it immediately attractive. Drink now.
title: Château Bélingard 2015 Bélingard  (Bergerac Rosé)

description: This white wine is fruity and crisp with a deliciously refreshing herbal edge. Lemon and pink grapefruit are cut by some zingy acidity and finished with a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Touja 2015 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: A French version of a brand that is more familiar in Chile as Viña San Esteban, this wine has more stylistically to do with South America than southwest France. It is soft, juicy, rounded and with attractive ripe tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vino San Esteban 2015 Réserve Malbec

description: This is an easygoing fruity wine. It has soft tannins and bright juicy red fruits. The structure is just right to give the wine its shape along with the acidity and generous aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Le Temps des Vendanges Malbec-Merlot

description: Prickly pickled aromas are offset by candied fruit notes, while the palate is thin and candied, with nectarine and other less-than-berry flavors. An edgy wine that does little for the image of the obscure Bonarda grape.
title: El Encanto 2006 Bonarda-Malbec Red (Mendoza)

description: Pickled on the nose, with aromas that hint at white grapes such as Verdejo. This is jumpy and unsettled, with citrus and white grapefruit flavors leaving a tangy burn on the finish. Jangled and sharp.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Osborne 2007 Solaz Rosado Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Two rounded, ripe varietals give a rich, smooth wine. It has just a touch of perfume from Fernão Pires, made ripe by the creamy Chardonnay. Pear fruit is cut with balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek Chardonnay-Fernão Pires White (Tejo)
