region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Tapeña 2006 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: White raisin and touches of lettuce and celery give this multigrape blend some richness but also a bit of green character. The palate shows lemon, green apple and pineapple, and this lean quality is confirmed by the wine's modest 11% alcohol level. Drink now to catch it at its scouring, sorbet-like best.
title: Bodegas Campante 2006 Versatus White (Ribeiro)

description: This is a straightforward quaffer. Aromas of herbs, jasmine and stone fruit lead to sugary-sweet fruit flavors.
title: Washington Hills 2014 Late Harvest Riesling (Washington)

description: Charred, blackened aromas of mint, licorice and burnt tire overshadow the wine's black-fruit components. This feels thick and dense, with chewy weight. Medicinal, herbal flavors of black fruits are peppery and a bit green, while mint and cough drop notes control the finish of this 85% Garnacha Tintorera and 15% Monastrell blend.
title: Niel Santofimia 2013 Red (Almansa)

description: The local grape Castelão is blended with Cabernet Sauvignon in this soft, spicy and fruity wine. Red fruits and balanced acidity are given a shove by a lightly tannic structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Vanilla and maple aromas lead to overtly fruity red cherry flavors with a touch of sweetness and a soft texture. It's pleasant to drink for those looking for a soft touch, with very mild acidity and no tannin to speak of.
title: Alias 2013 Secret Agent Red (California)

description: Blackberry and cassis aromas share the bouquet with tougher, more masculine notes of earth, rubber and char. Once it opens on the palate, there's ripe raspberry, plum and a nod to the black side of the fruit spectrum. Finishes with a mild kick of tannins and the essence of coffee and pepper. A solid blend of Cabernet and Merlot from the improving Uco Valley.
title: Carlos Basso 2006 Dos Fincas Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Uco Valley)

description: Scratchy berry aromas come with a hint of sweet-smelling plastic, but overall this bargain-priced Cab is good and welcoming. The palate has a pure, medium-bodied feel, while flavors of baked berry, cassis and chocolate finish with a mocha taste and mild heat.
title: Mancura 2011 Guardián Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Cherry and blackberry notes dominate this ripe, full wine. It has a smoky, toasty character that lends good balance and aging potential. The estate is planted with Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Château de Bordes-Quancard 2010  Bordeaux

description: Dusty aromas of red cherry are muddled by oaky notes of plastic and latex. A jumpy, bright palate is rudimentary, as are lightly spiced plum and raspberry flavors. A fresh, dry, basic finish seems appropriate.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Mureda 2012 Oak Aged Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Dry, spicy aromas aren't overly ripe or expressive. In the mouth, this basic Cab is raw, racy and spiky in feel. Flavors of herbal red-berry fruits are leafy, while finishing flavors of carob and pepper register as adequate.
title: San Felipe 2012 Oak Cask Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Blackberry, tobacco and spice flavors give this an appropriate air of sophistication. It should pair with pizza or pasta.
title: Bersano 2009 Costalunga  (Barbera d'Asti)

description: Here's a rustic zesty red that has aromas of ripe berry, game and whiff of tilled soil. The gamy note carries over to the simple, quaffable palate along with ripe black cherry and a hint of dark spice. Drink soon.
title: Carletto 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

description: Grassy stalky berry aromas lean towards green. This feels grippy, while spicy herbal berry flavors stay the course and finish with minty green notes on top of basic plum and berry.
title: Trapiche 2014 Oak Cask Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: This easygoing, informal wine offers subdued aromas suggesting cassis, raisin and a note of dried herb. The simple palate shows mature plum and a hint of clove alongside fleeting tannins.
title: Umani Ronchi 2015 Podere  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: A blend of predominantly Merlot and Syrah, this wine offers aromas of raspberries, herbs, plum and vanilla. The flavors are sweet, plump and juicy, delivering a lot of bang for the buck.
title: 14 Hands 2013 Hot to Trot Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Vibrant aromas of tangerine and flowers lead to sweet fruit flavors that show persistence. Enjoy it as an apéritif.
title: 14 Hands 2014 Moscato (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Light aromas of passion fruit and grapefruit are followed by tropical flavors that linger. It's an easy drinking quaffer.
title: 14 Hands 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

description: Vivid plum and prune aromas and flavors define this generous and rather soft-textured wine. The fruit component is so rich it's jammy, and the tannins are very mild. The overall effect is grapy, almost sweet.
title: Alias 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This doesn't taste true to the grape variety, but it's a good white wine with orange peel, jasmine and tangerine aromas, fairly quiet fruit flavors and then a floral, citrus finish. Light to medium bodied, it has an appetizing texture.
title: One Leaf 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: Light aromas of herbs, woodspice, tire rubber and red fruit lead to jammy raspberry and spice flavors that provide easy drinking pleasure.
title: Sagelands 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A soft-textured, rather light-bodied and fruit-forward offering, this smells and tastes like pear, apple and grape juices with a touch of sweetness and low acidity.
title: Koz 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: This wine comes from vineyards outside the boundaries of the Dão region but has the same typical blend. It shows minerality as well as rich fruit and soft tannins. The wine is balanced, stylish and deliciously ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 D. Fuas Reserva Red (Terras do Dão)

description: This ripe, full-bodied rosé is made from 100% rich, perfumed Touriga Nacional. Good balance between ripe strawberry fruits and the crisp acidity make it both fruity and warm. Drink now.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2016 Vale da Poupa Rosé (Douro)

description: Based in Burgundy, this producer understands Chardonnay. That's why this wine is so finely balanced, with a ripe and perfumed character and a warm, full aftertaste. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Tramier Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This delivers great Pinot-like character for its price tier. Give it credit for the dry silkiness, clean acidity and vibrant cherry, cola and oak flavors.
title: Newman's Own 2010 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This moderately aromatic wine offers notes of pear, citrus and apricot. It drinks medium sweet with stone-fruit and citrus flavors along with spritely acidity, bringing a whole lot of appeal.
title: 14 Hands 2014 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Only very slight citrus notes appear on the nose. The palate opens into soft fruitiness with slight hints of apricot and peach. The chief attraction, though, is a central, vivid theme of white pepper. This is light bodied but full of subtle charms.
title: Nastl 2015 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: Soft and sweet, with canned apricot and syrupy peach flavors.
title: Jenica Peak 2006 Coastal Series Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Fresh and clean, with light, lemony aromas in addition to tropical fruit. The palate is textured and full, with fairly pure apple and pineapple flavors and some nuttiness. Everything works here, including the smooth, lengthy finish.  Best Buy.
title: La Playa 2002 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Creamy aromas of vanilla and pears also carry some typical Sauvignon Blanc pungency. For a rounder style, which it is, it's quite refreshing. The mix across the palate of banana, grapefruit and almonds is attractive, and so is the round, pretty finish. Drink it very soon.
title: Santa Ines 2001 Legado de Armida Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Despite the modest price, this wine needs some time in the glass or in a decanter to open up. It starts off slowly, then builds pear and quince aromas and flavors through the long, tart, minerally finish. Best Buy.
title: Pradio 1999 Teraje Chardonnay (Friuli Grave)

description: Made from the local Sciaccarellu grape, this is a delicious, light and perfumed wine. It has tight acidity to go with the red currant flavors and the crisp texture. The wine is poised and refreshing.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2015 Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: This wine is tangy and textured with light tannins, a bite of citrus acidity and plenty of fruit. It's bright and has a juicy, lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Bonhur 2015 Château Terres Douces Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A pleasant mix of dark berries and fruit lead the bouquet of this friendly wine, with solid notes of black cherry, blackberry and boysenberry throughout. A hint of spice adds interest to the finish, with medium-light tannins and ample acidity resulting in good overall balance.
title: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Pays d'Oc)

description: A very drinkable, light and easy to like Merlot, this offers ripe notes of black plum, cherry and berry on the nose and mouth, with a faint hint of milk chocolate in the background. The soft mouthfeel and fruity palate finish short, but clean.
title: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Merlot (Pays d'Oc)

description: Underripe aromas of bell pepper and scallion correctly announce a shearing, high-acid palate. Salty, tart flavors of citrus fruits finish with pyrazine-driven green notes.
title: Santa Alicia 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Simple, dry and one dimensional, this has cola and cherry jam flavors, and a silky, delicate texture.
title: Kirkland Signature 2009 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Made from a bunch of different varieties, including Viognier and Pinot Grigio, this white blend is off-dry, with a sweet edge to the orange and peach fruit.
title: Lost Angel 2009 Ruckus White (California)

description: Apple and white fruit aromas set up a balanced, reasonably full palate, with banana, creamy oak, vanilla and apple flavors. It feels solid and round, with a clean finish.
title: Valentin Bianchi 2011 Elsa Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Here's a good, robust red wine. It's made in a country-style, with tobacco, cherry and spice flavors and a jagged mouthfeel. Drink it with tacos and burgers.
title: Rare NV 4 Grape Blend Red (California)

description: An exceptional value for a Bordeaux, this is ripe, full and fruity. Smoky tannins and juicy black currant flavors are bright and generous. It will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Murets de Mez  (Bordeaux)

description: Still toasty, this is a fruity, spicy wine. Firm tannins form the backdrop to the red berry fruits and fresh acidity. It will develop attractively over the next few years, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Maison Noble 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Aromas of ripe peaches, white flowers and fresh jasmine explode from the glass. The wine tastes sweet but still shows delicacy, with enough acid to balance it all out.
title: Ste. Chapelle 2015 Special Harvest Riesling

description: Dusty apple aromas are less citrusy than ideal, and the palate is cidery and tangy. Finishes with heft, length and weight, which all seems a little overbearing given the wine's simplicity. Just good enough but doesn't fully click.
title: Carmen 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: Aromas of white grapefruit, celery and other prickly fruits lose steam with airing, while the green apple and lime flavors are solid and offer some sweetness. Wet in the mouth, which is what you want, but standard fare as a whole.
title: Doña Paula 2009 Los Cardos Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

description: Mildly smoky and toasty aromas lead to a lightly oaked palate that's largely defined by black cherry and some rich berry syrup. It's a full, colorful Syrah with a chunky mouthfeel and a satisfying but short finish. Drink now.
title: Doña Paula 2006 Los Cardos Syrah (Luján de Cuyo)

description: With polished blackberry, cherry and oak flavors, this affordable Cab represents a good value. It's soft, dry and stylish, and easy to drink.
title: Sonoma Crest 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: The best Paso a Paso white yet; it's ripe and smells of pineapple and melon, while the palate is pure and has a solid feel. Flavors of apple, peach and pithy citrus are honest, and the finish is clean. Delivers what it should and more.
title: Paso a Paso 2009 Verdejo (La Mancha)

description: A strong pineapple and mango imprint persists throughout this Chardonnay, along with bright acidity and a floral finish.
title: un4seen 2011 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: With sweet oak, buttered toast, vanilla, pineapple and mango flavors, this is an easy Chardonnay to drink now. The price is good for a Chard this rich and creamy.
title: Guenoc 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: Not many wines come from Bucelas today, as its vineyards get eaten up by the northern Lisbon suburbs. This Arinto-based wine suggests there should be some more of this ultra-crisp white, which bears a passing resemblance to a Vinho Verde in its super-fresh apple and grapefruit flavors.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2007 Prova Régia Arinto (Bucelas)

description: An attractive salmon pink-colored wine, very fresh, with bright red currant acidity, fleshed out with some caramel, raspberry and a dash of red apple skins texture.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Casa do Lago Rosé Touriga Nacional (Estremadura)

description: Here's an easy-going Salice Salentino (90% Negroamaro and 10% Malvasia Nera) with spice, cherry and cola notes that are weaved nicely together. There's harmony and elegance here and the wine leaves a spicy imprint on the close.
title: Leone de Castris 2005 Maiana Rosso Red (Salice Salentino)

description: Pleasant and fruity to sip, soft in texture, light- to medium bodied, it has a rich yellow-gold color, butter-candy aromas, ripe apple flavors and a slightly sweet finish.
title: Stomping Ground 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: A young, fresh blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, the wine is fruity, light and with a crisp, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 White (Tejo)

description: Melon, nectarine and mild citrus aromas are clean and direct. This basic white is firm and balanced, while stone fruit, melon and white-pepper flavors end easy and fresh.
title: Palma Real 2015 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

description: This is a light-bodied and full-flavored wine with a good, gripping texture and plenty of ripe plum and black pepper aromas. A fruity and beefy flavor carries through the finish.
title: Leaping Lizard 2014 Merlot (California)

description: It's said that Viognier is difficult to grow, but then how can bargains such as this continue to exist? For $10, you get truffled pear aromas rounded out by the addition of melon, decent concentration and a long, dusty-minerally finish. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Gournier 2008 Viognier (Vin de Pays des Cévennes)

description: A fresh, juicy wine with berry fruits, ripe but intense tannins and a black cherry flavor. There is a delicious, final burst of acidity.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2007 Porca de Murça Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A good sense of concentration and depth make this medium-bodied wine taste big and satisfying without overdoing it. It has a very dark color, fruity and lightly spicy aromas, rich plum and black cherry flavors and rather mild tannins.
title: Dark Horse NV Big Red Blend No 33-1 Red (California)

description: Feels flat and syrupy feeling, with sweet, herb flavors that suggest blueberry and baked plum. Finishes herbal.
title: Arauco 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Funky and odd smelling, with exotic aromas that are unfamiliar and not that inviting. Feels thick and soupy, with black fruit flavors, cumin, candy and some bitterness on the finish.
title: Arauco 2011 Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Light and herbal, with a modest core of grapefruit flavors. Grassy notes soften on the finish, allowing some chalky notes to come through. Drink up.
title: Frenzy 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Opens with a mix of toast and dusty, herbal aromas, and with time it turns more saucy than precisely fruity. A bulky wine with a chunky mouthfeel and fleshy flavors of herbal plum. A late wave of tartness and more herbal flavors cements things into place.
title: Santa Ema 2008 Selected Terroir Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: A fruity, direct Chardonnay that will appeal to fans for its peach, pear and oak flavors. Not especially complicated, but a fine example of the variety at a good price.
title: Shiloh Road 2008 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: A soft, approachable Sauvignon Blanc with aromas of yellow florals, ruby red grapefruit and yellow pepper. Riper peach flavors unfold in the mouth supported by solid acidity and a clean finish, Drink now.
title: Robertson Winery 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

description: Soft and buttery, this medium-bodied Chardonnay smells like lemon meringue and tastes lightly sweet like marshmallows and bananas.
title: HandCraft 2014 Artisan Collection Chardonnay (California)

description: Attractively aromatic, this is a crisp blend of Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc from the same area as many of the Armagnac vineyards. It is fruity with a zesty lemon texture and so light and perfumed. It is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine de Ménard 2015 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Aromas of citrus and corn chips are a bit ponderous but do the job in advance of a citrusy, drawn-in palate. Briny grapefruit and orange flavors finish solid but salty.
title: Dominio de la Vega NV Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Herbal aromas of tomato leaf and earthy plum are a bit green. This feels chunky, with some grab. Herbal plum flavors are like the nose, meaning they lean towards green. Finishing flavors of olive, spice and herbs are common for value-priced Chilean Cabernet.
designation: Puerto Viejo Estate Bottled Single Vineyard Reserve
title: Viña Requingua 2014 Puerto Viejo Estate Bottled Single Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: In just a few years 14 Hands Riesling production has jumped from around 15,000 to more than 700,000 cases. Clearly the brand is doing something that consumers love. This is a fairly dry style, with forward, fruity flavors of ripe orange, apple and apricot. The length and concentration are spot on.
title: 14 Hands 2013 Riesling (Washington)

description: Dark berry aromas are dense and a touch rubbery. This is a full, chunky, bold Cabernet with wild berry, cassis and woody flavors that meld together well. Finishing flavors of mint, licorice and oak are generous.
title: Máscara de Feugo 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: This new vintage is head and shoulders better than the previous effort. Light and pretty, with a delicate mix of citrus, melon, tangerine, lemon and lime, it's showing good length and impressive detail.
title: Mercer Canyons 2013 Riesling (Yakima Valley)

description: At 2.3% residual sugar, this is nicely balanced between sweet and dry. The fruit links peach, apricot and pear with a honey in tea streak that carries into the finish.
title: Washington Hills 2008 Riesling (Washington)

description: As with the Avery Lane Merlot, this is a rather complex blend, here including Syrah, Cab Franc and Lemberger. Fruity and spicy, with strawberry and cherry candy flavors. Very pleasing picnic wine.
title: Avery Lane 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: Pretty good for the price, with jammy cherry, berry, cocoa and spice flavors. An easy Zin to drink with BBQ or pasta with tomato sauce.
title: Glen Ellen 2009 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)

description: Heavy and stalky smelling, with burnt aromas. The leaden palate is weighty and short on freshness; tastes pithy and stalky, with some nectarine and plum thrown in. Seems to be fading.
title: Caligiore 2010 Pianissimo Rosé (Mendoza)

description: Simple and sweet, with jammy pineapple, orange and apricot flavors leading to a soft, honeyed finish.
title: Concannon 2010 Selected Vineyards Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Yellow Tail's sparkler is an aromatic blend of Semillon, Traminer, Viognier and Trebbiano that manages to be largely neutral on the palate at the same time it's perfumed on the nose. Frothy and off dry.
title: Yellow Tail NV Bubbles Sparkling White Wine Sparkling (South Eastern Australia)

description: Starts out with leather and cheesy aromas, and beyond that there's not a lot of fruit on the bouquet. It's a chunky, heavy wine with thick, jammy plum flavors that have strong herbal undertones. Warm, grabby and baked on the finish, which is plodding.
title: Figaro 2009 Tinto Red (Calatayud)

description: The aromas of herbs and jammy fruit are light while the palate offers plush-feeling cocoa and berry flavors. This offers a lot of enjoyment for the price.
title: Snoqualmie 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A blend of Cabernet (70%) and Merlot, it offers aromas of dried herbs and rasinated dark fruit along with a kiss of vanilla. The fruit flavors are plump in feel with a sweet finish.
title: Snoqualmie 2013 Whistle Stop Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Abundant and ripe cherry aromas combine with rich plum flavors and a soft, easy texture in this medium-bodied wine. It's all about sweet fruit and softness.
title: Belle Ambiance 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This is a fruit-forward wine, with aromas of red and black currant and herbs with a spice top note. The flavors are sweet and tangy, going down easy.
title: Hogue 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Dusty strawberry and cherry aromas are modest and fruity. This Garnacha Tintorera is fresh and zesty on the palate, with candied raspberry and red-plum flavors. A mellow, light finish will raise no eyebrows.
title: Santa Quiteria 2013 BT Bodega Tintoralba Garnacha Tintorera (Almansa)

description: Pure and fruity, this medium-bodied wine is supersmooth in texture, quietly flavorful and well balanced. The light acidity and mild tannins are well integrated and support delicious black-cherry and blueberry flavors perfectly.
title: Fetzer 2015 Eagle Peak Merlot (California)

description: Easy, slender and fresh, this bright Chianti (85% Sangiovese with Merlot) reveals green notes of olive and herb followed by wild berry and spice.
title: Straccali 2011  Chianti

description: The nose is big and rubbery, with aromas of bacon, tar and black plum. It feels young and choppy, with a lightly herbal berry flavor that turns more roasted in character as the wine opens. This gets the job done despite showing a roasted flavor throughout.
title: Señorio de Uñuela 2010  Rioja

description: This blend of Sangiovese and Canaiolo is enhanced with a small percentage of Merlot. That addition heightens the wine's softness and renders a richer mouthfeel.
title: Straccali 2010  Chianti

description: An easygoing, crisp and well-priced Chardonnay, this has swirls of smooth apple and pear.
title: Cable Car 2010 Chardonnay (California)

description: Opening with a bouquet of dried apricot and almond paste, this is a full style of Sauvignon Blanc, with tons of lemon on the finish. Pair this with seafood.
title: Clos du Lac 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

description: Rubbery, mulchy aromas never clean up and rank as rough. Roughness describes the palate, too, while flavors of herbal fruit, bitterness, hard spices and buttery oak fail to come around.
title: Cornellana 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

description: This wine is ripe, fruity and balanced. It has red-berry flavors along with acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2019
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2015 Esteva Red (Douro)

description: This softly perfumed wine has red-fruit flavors and plenty of acidity. It is jammy and juicy with succulent red berries. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Paxis Pinot Noir (Lisboa)

description: This is an attractive, perfumed wine that is a blend of Síria, Arinto and Viognier. It's the Viognier that gives the perfumed character that makes it so distinctive. It's fruity, lightly textured and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter White (Alentejano)

description: Freshly snipped thyme and bramble notes are prominent, yet unobtrusive against a backdrop of honey-kissed lemon and lime in this brisk off-dry Riesling. It's a zesty sprightly wine to drink young.
title: Schmitt Söhne 2014 Relax Riesling (Mosel)

description: The wine is young, still more structure than fruit. It has firm tannins as well as juicy blackberry fruits. A blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional, it is likely to age for a few months, so drink from the end of 2016.
title: Fiuza 2014 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: This Moschofilero starts with honeyed peach, spice and lemon aromas, followed by a light touch of peach and minerals on the palate. Easy drinking and linear, this wine will pair well with cheese and light fare.
title: Lafazanis 2010 Electus Moschofilero (Mantinia)

description: You almost have to classify this Riesling as a dessert wine, because it crosses the line from off-dry into frankly sweet. It's an easy sipper, with honeyed tangerine and pear flavors. Could be a little brighter in acidity, though.
title: Bogle 2010 Riesling (California)

description: Pungent aromas of wet stones, citrus fruits, grass and bell pepper are lively and intense. This has a crisp, clean palate and pyrazine-based flavors of nettle, bell pepper and lime. On the finish, it remains racy until the end.
title: Quintay 2015 Q Grand Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: A mixed bag of varieties went into this soft and fruity wine. It has gentle tannins that are lifted by acidity and black currant fruitiness. With its lifestyle label (a small Vespa motor scooter), it is obviously meant to be an easy-going ready-to-drink wine. And it succeeds.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Bonavita Red (Lisboa)

description: The style of this wine is fruity with blackberry flavors giving a bright and lively character. Black currant acidity joins in the fruitiness while allowing room for some structured tannins. The wine will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Red (Alentejano)

description: Veteran producer Oak Knoll remains one of Oregon's most underrated value wineries. This full-bodied, super-fruity Riesling offers bright, off-dry, well-balanced flavors of citrus, honey and tea.
title: Oak Knoll 2013 Semi-Sweet Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: This value-priced label has turned out a notably successful 2009 Shiraz, combining red currants with enough meaty, savory elements to possess real interest. It's medium in body and fleshy yet crisp, making it very drinkable over the near term.
title: Bulletin Place 2009 Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)

description: Quite why Smart Dog is a good name for a wine is a mystery. The wine itself a rich, soft Syrah with attractive ripe blackberry and plum flavors and soft, finely integrated tannins. It's an enjoyable wine that's ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Smart Dog Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Snappy, dry red-fruit and citrus aromas are a good opening. The palate is fresh and bouncy, with punchy pomegranate and grapefruit flavors. A zesty finish with mild citrus and nectarine flavors is par for the course.
title: Enanzo 2013 Garnacha Rosado (Navarra)

description: Scratchy berry aromas come with a hint of sweet-smelling plastic, but overall this bargain-priced Cab is good and welcoming. The palate has a pure, medium-bodied feel, while flavors of baked berry, cassis and chocolate finish with a mocha taste and mild heat.
title: Mancura 2011 Guardián Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Despite the inexpensive price tag, this is a solid Shiraz, offering ripe black cherry fruit and touches of tree bark and orris root. It's medium-bodied, yet features a velvety texture and plenty of length on the finish. Drink now–2015.
title: Rolling 2009 Shiraz (Central Ranges)

description: Red in color, with fresh aromas of nectarine, orange peel and red currant. For a 2010 this is still fresh and sturdy, with cleansing acidity and focused flavors of citrus and red berry fruit. Eminently drinkable, with a long finish for basic rosé. Drink immediately.
title: Carlos Serres 2010 Serres Tempranillo-Garnacha Rosé (Rioja)

description: Smoke, rubber and spice aromas mix with ripe berry scents to form a solid and impressive bouquet. It's thick and saturated but balanced, with harmonious, easy to like flavors of blackberry and cassis. Long and solid on the finish; captures the essence of value-priced Malbec.
title: Trapiche 2010 Oak Cask Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Cardomam seed and Indian spice give this wine a sassy and exotic personality. There's also plenty of plush fruit here as well followed by dry notes of crushed mineral at the back.
title: Natale Verga 2010  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

description: Modest citrus, earth and almond notes come up from the glass, and continue in the flavors of this smooth, rounded, and straightforward wine. The balance is on the soft side, and the body is quite light.
title: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

description: A soft and indistinct wine that is fat and has only the merest hint of fruit. It is round with some fresh acidity at the end.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2014 Vale das Donas White (Tejo)

description: Leafy, earthy cherry and plum aromas lead to a clampy, astringent palate with saucy, tart, rubbery plum flavors. Savory spice notes come up on a tannic, drying, unyielding finish.
title: Pata Negra 2012 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Barnyard aromas with coffee grinds and lemony blackberry are less than inviting. This feels raw, scratchy and abrasive; flavors of herbal cherry and plum turn green and weedy on the finish.
title: Santa Ema 2014 Select Terroir Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Chunky aromas of hay and mealy stone fruits are acceptable. This Sauvignon Blanc has a melony, creamy palate and mealy flavors of melon and papaya that match the bouquet. A yeasty, undefined finish indicates this is past its prime.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Trencalòs 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: A soft, lightly fruity wine, this is light in texture and flavor, with the merest hints of citrus fruits, apples and tangy orange. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This wine is a soft, lean selection, with closed aromas and tight flavors of black currant and cherry that struggle to appear fully. The palate is clean but fleeting, with little texture and a short finish.
title: Voiturette 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: There's a wild character to the nose of this lean, tart Pinot. It offers aromas and flavors of game, sour cherry, tart raspberry and red currant, framed by soft tannins and a fleeting finish.
title: Maison de la Villette 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This offers assertive aromas and flavors of banana, strawberry bubblegum, watermelon and blueberry. The palate is lightweight and fruity, with a sharp acidic edge and a short, fleeting finish.
title: Romantic 2015 Authentic & Chic Merlot (Vin de France)

description: This rosé is an extremely pale-pink color, with similarly light aromas of red cherry and currant on the nose. The palate is surprisingly round and somewhat flabby, with ripe red-fruit flavors and a touch of white chocolate on the finish.
title: Café du Midi 2015 Grenache Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Horsey berry and vinegar aromas lack freshness and appeal. This feels both tight and dilute, while flavors of forced oak, tomato and tart berry fruits finish drawing and bitter.
title: Figaro 2013 Tinto Red (Calatayud)

description: This rusty-looking rosé smells rustic, with cherry and raspberry notes. In the mouth, it registers as full-bodied, while the flavor profile is chunky and dry, with early signs of oxidation that are confirmed on a low-steam finish. Drink right away.
title: Real Compañia de Vinos 2013 Rosado (Spain)

description: A crisp and strongly lemon-flavored wine, this is light and bright with an herbaceous hint and a softer aftertaste that has melon and a rounder texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2013 Vila Jardim Siria (Tejo)

description: Sturdy and flavorful, this is a well-made, dry and moderately tannic wine that smells beefy, salt-and-peppery, and tastes juicy like raspberries and cherries with a little bit of meatiness coming through for complexity. The texture has good grip and acidity so the wine will pair well with big proteins.
title: Beringer 2015 Founders' Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Subtle minerality lends surprising elegance to this otherwise buoyantly fruity wine. Succulent, soft yellow peach and apricot flavors are brightened by streaks of lemony acidity on the midpalate. The finish is refreshingly brisk. Drink now through 2018.
title: Peter Mertes 2015 Platinum Riesling (Mosel)

description: Shows little on the nose, while the palate is bland and flat, with simple apple and lemon flavors. Soft and chunky white wine with some drab tropicality.
title: Trapiche 2010 Zaphy Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: This wood-laden wine has light berry fruit and burnt toast flavors. The acidity cuts through, offering a glimpse of stalky black currant flavors.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008  Bordeaux

description: Soft, lightly creamy Chardonnay, pleasantly fruity, offering some apple and pear flavors along with gentle acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2009  Mâcon-Villages

description: The flavors of this medium-bodied wine are hearty, with bell pepper, black pepper and green olive notes, and in this vein it's tasty and fairly concentrated. The balance is good, the palate sensation is nicely dry and the finish lingers a bit.
title: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: This easily affordable wine is a full-blown oaky version that has prominent toasted oak and wood smoke aromas that meld with butter, caramel and ripe pear flavors. It feels almost sweet and is full-bodied with mild acidity.
title: Bogle 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: A blend of the two major grapes of the region, Alvarinho and Loureiro, and grown at the home estate of the producer, this is delicious Vinho Verde. It is dry, crisp, light and piercingly bright, perfect either as an apéritif or with seafood. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2016 Quinta da Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: Attractive fragrance and a pleasureable mouthfeel characterize this medium-weight offering. A 50-50 Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc blend, it offers  pear, lemon, and vanilla-oak flavors on the nose and mouth. The long smooth finish is unexpectedly elegant, something not often found at this price. Best Buy.
title: Calvet 1998 Reserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Fruit-forward is the best way to describe this juicy, totally accessible red. Rich berry flavors, just a faint meaty-leathery note for a touch of complexity, and a smooth even finish complete the package. Best Buy.
title: Heritage Road 1998 Shiraz (South Australia)

description: This is a concentrated, well-oaked Cabernet with blackberry, cassis, leather and woody aromas. The palate is fairly tight and tannic, with good structure, while flavors of toasty, spicy plum and berry finish woody and with elasticity.
title: Tilia 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Bright aromas of orange and mixed citrus fruits start this wine. The flavors are round and lively, with citric acidity pushing tangerine, grapefruit and mango tones. Citrus fruits give way to orange peel on the finish of this voluminous aromatic white. Drink now.
title: Tilia 2014 Torrontés (Salta)

description: This is an intensely perfumed wine, with typical Syrah earthiness and acidity. It is soft, fruity, full of black plum flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2014 Ciconia Reserva Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Light, fruity and off dry, this is a fresh and crisp wine. It has sweetened lemon juice flavors that are cut by intense, young acidity. Balanced and ready to drink now.
designation: Salsus Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Salsus Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Vinho Verde)

description: Adding Syrah (Shiraz as the producer calls it) to the blend with Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional gives a strongly perfumed character to this firm, still structured wine. It also has a fresh element from the black currant acidity that cuts through the wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: Produced from Touriga Nacional, this fresh wine keeps the acidity of the grape while losing any tough tannins. The result is an attractive, crisp wine, with final strawberry flavors.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Brigando Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Spicy and light at heart, this is a perfumed wine that the winemaker reckons will go with Asian food. Apples, a touch of green herbs and peaches abound in this refreshing, drinkable wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)

description: If you're new to Pinot Noir and curious, but not ready to spend a lot, check this out. It gets the idea across, with a dry, silky mouthfeel and basic flavors of raspberries, red currants and oak.
title: Montpellier 2012 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Sparse in flavor, this blend of Merlot, Zinfandel and Syrah is one-dimensional, soft in cranberry and slightly underripe.
title: Road i Red NV Red (California)

description: This wine from the mountain vineyards of eastern Portugal is rich, fruity and made to be drunk young. With soft tannins and juicy red berry fruit, it's open and ripe. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Barão de Figueira Red (Beira Interior)

description: This wine is full of red berry flavor and soft tannins. With its forward fruit and smooth texture, it's made to be drunk young, so drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: Classic aromas of cassis and black cherries dominate this impressive effort from the south of France. Sinewy tannins and good concentration make for a fine balance in the mouth while notes of earth and mineral persist on the finish. Drink up.
title: Château de Pennautier 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon de Pennautier Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This wine gives a big, ripe nose and flavors of apricot, honey and melon, with balanced fruit and acid and a clean but rounded character. Full bodied and complex with a lingering finish.
title: Blue Cove 2007 Viognier (Western Cape)

description: Easygoing and fresh—with a very attractive price tag—Corvo Bianco is a historic and steady Best Buy contender. The wine exhibits fresh citrus notes and has a lean, compact feel.
title: Corvo 2007 Bianco White (Sicilia)

description: This unoaked white offers rounded tropical fruit aromas and flavors like pineapple, melon and pear. The style is straightforward and exuberant, with balanced acidity and a fruity, lush finish. Keep on the table for everyday enjoyment.
title: Fairvalley 2008 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: An elegant white with a nose that combines zippy citrus, minerals and a touch of guava. The palate offers clean and spritzy character with a wave of rounding tropical fruit and a spin of spice. Pair with spicy food—think Indian or Thai.
title: Fleur Du Cap 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: This is a soft, bland wine, with light fruit flavors, a creamy texture and a final tang of lemon zest. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2014 Terra Grande Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Wiry and volatile aromas of vinegar and saucy berry fruits fail to impress. This Monastrell-Tempranillo blend is hard and tannic, with murky berry flavors that are also a bit weedy. Heat and a lack of ripeness mar the finish.
title: Marques Escriba 2013 Monastrell-Tempranillo Red (Jumilla)

description: Dusty apple aromas set up a foamy palate with no depth or structure. This tastes of bready apple and pear in front of a bland, yeasty finish that nose dives at the count of three.
title: Bodegas Lozano NV Ophicus Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Spain)

description: This brut sparkler is out there on the nose, as earthy, not-too-fresh aromas of peanuts and compost set up a coarse palate. Nutty stale citrus flavors end in sour fashion, with a hint of mustard.
title: Hacienda del Carche NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Light in color, sketchy on the nose and dilute on the palate, all of which means this has discernible issues. Bland flavors suggest grape skins, while this is flat, wheaty and yeasty tasting on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Trencalòs 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: There's virtually no bouquet to this wine, and the palate follows suit with a flat feel and hollow, faded flavors of balsamic-doused cherry and herb. It seems aged and dried out.
title: Finca Vieja 2004 Reserva Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: This has a reedy red-berry aroma and a citrus note. Confirmation of the bouquet comes on the palate, which is lean and scouring, with red plum, pomegranate and herb flavors. The finish is cleansing, but it doesn't show much substance.
title: Santa Quiteria 2010 Altitud 1.100 Garnacha Tintorera Alicante Bouschet (Almansa)

description: Dusty and yeasty on the nose, this has an eggy, sweaty note. It feels good but drifts a bit on the palate, while the flavors run stalky and sweet, with a touch of apple for crispness.
title: Jaume Serra NV Cristalino Extra-Dry Sparkling (Cava)

description: There's a raw cut of acidity that gives this simple wine a sour taste. On the plus side, it's nice and dry, with some cherry fruit. For the price, it's a helpful introduction to the charms of Pinot Noir.
title: Lost Angel 2011 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Hot and fiery, this red is meaty, spicy and herbal on the nose. The disjointed palate shows baked, spicy plum and herbal flavors. A smoky, meaty flavor and forced, creamy-oak tone carry the finish.
title: Santa Alba 2013 Reserve Carmenère (Curicó Valley)

description: Fruit-bowl aromas, fresh but neutral flavors and a fairly soft texture make this light-bodied wine pleasant and easy to drink.
title: Clos du Lac 2014 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

description: This Viognier from the outlands region of Elqui is minerally but low on fruit aromas. A fresh, linear palate offers lettuce, lime and other limited green-leaning flavors, while the finish is lasting and firm, with zesty acidity.
title: Falernia 2014 Reserva Viognier (Elqui Valley)

description: Bell pepper and citrus aromas are limited in scope. The palate feels acidic, with quick-hitting flavors of green herbs, bell pepper and tropical fruits. Pyrazine-based flavors of bell pepper and bitter herbs push the finish.
title: Millaman 2014 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: This overall good, refreshing Chard is a go-to white for everyday sipping. On the nose, citrus, apples, and fresh Chardonnay fruit leads, and on the palate, straightforward fruit is both elegant and approachable. The finish is substantial. Pair with poultry, seafood, or sip alone.
title: Shark Trust 2007 Great White Unwooded Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: Sweet but not too sweet for some entrées, such as spicy Thai food, this brings a fruity mix of pear, pineapple and orange-creamsickle flavors. It's smooth and soft, not at all sugary, and framed with fresh acids.
title: Pacific Rim 2012 Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Heady aromas of yellow stone fruit, grapefruit and a touch of light baking spice lead the way. The full-bodied palate shows apricot, yellow peach, mineral and a hint of nutmeg alongside lively acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
title: Mezzacorona 2015 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

description: This blend is dominated by one of the two grapes of Vinho Verde: the Loureiro. That gives both a crisp texture and ripe apple and green-plum fruits. It is a ripe wine, juicy and ready to drink now.
title: Quinta de Paços 2016 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Apple, melon and a touch of vanilla give a tasty spectrum of aromas and flavors to this medium-bodied wine. It's light enough to sip easily but has a bit of depth to the flavors that makes it interesting.
title: Belle Ambiance 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Charred oak aromas settle on creamy, with a note of plastic to go with heavy spice and secondary berry scents. This feels raw, tannic and grabby. Flavors of plum and clove are woody, while this has the texture of grape-skin extract on the finish, meaning it's rough and grabby.
title: Chilensis 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Malbec (Maule Valley)

description: This wine is packed with flavor from the ripe blend of Shiraz, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional. Its berry fruits and balanced acidity give the wine an easy, juicy character. The gentle tannins are easily integrated with the fruit. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: Leesy, creamy aromas of vanilla are simple, with a note of apple offering some crispness. The palate is regular in feel, with adequate acidity. Flavors of green apple, lettuce and herbs culminate with mild bitterness and green notes.
title: Baron De Ley 2014 White (Rioja)

description: This is clean, fruity and appealing, with no aromas or flavors of heavy oak or weedy, roasted fruit. It offers cherry and berry flavors, with a healthy, quick finish that ends on a vanilla and mild spice note.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Volteo 2010 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Meaty, spicy accents enliven this full-bodied and ripe-tasting wine, adding a layer of interest and depth. The aromas and flavors show blackberries and black pepper, while the texture is smooth and a sense of richness on the lingering the finish.
title: Montevina 2013 Skyland Ridge Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: This is a ripe and soft blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. Well balanced, it has rich, spicy fruit lifted by lemon and apple flavors and by the final acidity. It's ready to drink now.
title: Château Vircoulon 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Made in the sweet, sugary style that many consumers like, this is almost like an off-dry dessert wine. Tastes like a citrus and peach power drink, with alcohol.
title: Montevina 2006 Pinot Grigio (Amador County)

description: Ketchup aromas are pungent and a bit overwhelming. It's too bad because the wine tastes good thanks to its firm structure.
title: Tenuta Sette Ponti 2005 Vigna di Pallino Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: Sweet and simple, with jellied blackberry and cherry flavors, harsh tannins and a sugary finish.
title: Esser Cellars 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Too sweet by far for a table wine, with simple, medicinal cherry and blackberry flavors and a harshly tannic mouthfeel.
title: Esser Cellars 2005 Zinfandel (California)

description: A solid effort, in the mainstream style that you'll find on many restaurant-chain wine lists. Apricot jelly—not jam—flavors carry through all the way, with a clean, crisp, well-balanced finish. The residual sugar is just under 30 g/L.
title: Pacific Rim 2012 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Dusty dark-fruit aromas are lusty and full of oaky notes including sawdust and chocolate. This value-priced winner is full, round, saturated and generous on the palate, where savory, resiny black-fruit flavors finish woody in flavor and firm in feel.
title: Trapiche 2012 Oak Cask Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This wine seems to reach out to the mainstream: flavors and aromas of sweet vanilla, cinnamon toast and brown sugar are met with lightweight red fruit, a soft balance and just a touch of white pepper. Inoffensive on all counts, but lacks the depth needed to set it apart.
title: New World 2002 Syrah (Western Cape)

description: While this wine is labeled "dry," it's technically not. There's some sugar left in it, it just seems dry if you compare it to the winery's regular, semi-dry version. Aromas of spiced pears and musky, evening flowers blend with flavors of pears, peaches and dried spices.
title: Glenora 2002 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Pine needle, lilac and some musk on the nose. Citrus is the driving force from then on. There's tangerine and some melon for flavor, and plenty or orange and passion fruit on the finish. A drink-now citrus ball that's full and flavorful.
title: Torres 2002 Viña Sol White (Penedès)

description: Sometimes concept exceeds the wine itself, and this may be a case in point. The blend is odd, and the fact that each grape comes from a different part of Spain is potentially more odd. As for the wine, it has a nice perfume to it, courtesy of the Rhone varieties in the mix. And while the cherry/berry fruit is forward, it's maybe too sweet and basic in terms of length, structure and mouthfeel. Still, it's worth a try for the experimental tasters out there.
title: Bodegas Concavins 2000 Proyecto 4 Red (Conca de Barberà)

description: Light scents of fresh grass, white flowers, waxy melon and sweet orange dance in the bouquet of this easy-drinking white. Those notes continue through to the fruity palate, with a pleasant roundness to the midpalate. Drink now.
title: Wild Pig 2016 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

description: Minty berry aromas settle well and hold up to airing. This everyday Merlot is more than competent on the palate. Berry and spice flavors finish chewy, with standard ripeness and follow through.
title: Cuyen 2016 Merlot (Central Valley)

description: This is an odd duck for Gewürz; lacking any of the floral character generally associated with that grape. It's lemony and slightly sweet, with good acid. It makes a pleasant, if generic white wine to accompany spicy noodles or light seafood.
title: Bridgeview 2006 Gewürztraminer (Southern Oregon)

description: A great deal from Tuscany, this bright Sangiovese-based wine offers playful aromas of cassis, cherry and wild berry with red rose and a touch of toasted almond.
title: Vignamaggio 2008 Il Morino Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: This totally fresh wine has benefited from the quality of whites in 2007 Bordeaux. It is lemony with pink grapefruit flavors giving an intense lift. There is some herbaceousness, with green herbs and juicy fruits. To drink now.
title: Yvon Mau 2007 Premius Bordeaux Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Mildly baked plum and berry aromas are big and solid, while the big-boned palate revolves around plum and rhubarb flavors. Straightforward and a touch herbal, with sticky, chewy fruit to ponder on the finish.
title: Pasion de Tango 2007 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

description: A heavy dose of Sauvignon Blanc brings herbaceous, grassy, white currants and gooseberry flavors. It's young, and needs more time to coalesce. It is certainly fresh, fruity, right up front.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2008 Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Light, fresh and soft, this is a perfect starter for an evening for two. It has attractive sweet lime and peach flavors, with attendant acidity.
title: Pommery NV POP Extra Dry  (Champagne)

description: Lean and spicy in the nose, with a hint of pepper and some green vegetables. The palate is a continuation of the nose: there's mild red fruit but also some strong green-bean and bell-pepper flavors. The finish is dry and tannic, as it should be.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2001 Los Vascos Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Light, and seems mature already, with modest cherry and tobacco flavors and tea leaves on the finish.
title: Piccini 2001  Chianti

description: A deep gold color sends up warning flags, and the flavors bear that out. Has simple apple flavors with a touch of shellac and no depth. Kosher.
title: Bartenura 2000 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Nicely balanced and fairly fruity, this wine is easy to like for its crisp apple and grapefruit aromas, fresh and ripe flavors and smooth and lively texture.
title: Fetzer 2016 Echo Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: The wine that first introduced Americans to Sicily, this classic Corvo blend offers a light, bright appearance followed by easy tones of red berry, bitter almond and cassis.
title: Corvo 2008 Red (Sicilia)

description: Corvo Bianco is a tried and true white wine that helped introduce Sicilian wines to international markets. It's worth revisiting this wine if you are looking for something fresh to wash down seafood.
title: Corvo 2010 Bianco White (Sicilia)

description: Soft and easy-drinking, this plum and cherry Merlot drinks like an older wine, as if it's been gently oxidized. It's probably at its peak, the fruit generous and round, the finish tailing off gently into a Milky Way sort of confection.
title: Eliseo Silva 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This pretty wine shows how well this variety thrives in Lodi. There's a mushu pork note, with peppery plum aromas and flavors that are delicious, and yet the wine is bone dry. Adequate acids and tannins make for balance. It may not be a complex wine but it's a thoroughly enjoyable one. Best Buy.
title: Peirano 1998 Shiraz (Lodi)

description: The winery's penchant for delicate, lightly balanced wines is again evident here. This has some pleasant herb flavors, gentle nuances of grass and citrus. Cleanly made and finished with a touch of spice. —P.G.
title: Ste. Chapelle 2000 Fumé Blanc (Idaho)

description: This structured, medium-weight wine's nose offers dried apple and nutty aromas. Crisp lime and stony notes come up strongly on the palate. The mouth shows good tension and decent acidity, the flavors are persistent on the solid finish of this tasty white. Drink now–2004. Best Buy. —M.M.
title: Huguet de Can Feixes 2000 Can Feixes Blanc Selecciò White (Catalonia)

description: This wine is brightly aromatic with notes of tangerine, lychee, ripe peach and white flowers. It drinks medium sweet with a very light spritz and a full feel.
title: Original House Wine 2013 Market Moscato (America)

description: Packaged in a screwcap bottle with an eye-catching purple label, Re Midas is a textbook expression of Soave with fresh aromas of melon, peach and honey. This well-priced white delivers a compact but crisp mouthfeel.
title: Cantina di Soave 2010 Re Midas  (Soave)

description: A blend of Antão Vaz and Arinto, this is a deliciously fresh wine, lighted by acidity and with a tight texture. Drink now for summer pleasure.
title: Alente 2009 White (Alentejano)

description: Fresh and creamy, this is a smooth, rich wine. It has citrus and baked apple flavors that meld easily and fully into a fruity texture. With some weight, it also has a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Audaz Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is an interesting and useful wine, and the price helps make it a bargain. It's pretty close, in texture and flavor, to Pinot Noir, with silky tannins, brisk acids and cherry, cola and cranberry flavors.
title: J. Lohr 2011 Wildflower Valdiguié (Monterey County)

description: Grassy, slightly stalky apple and nectarine aromas feed into a fresh, citrusy palate that brings a mix of white stone-fruit flavors as well as green citrus. A solid, lasting finish is dry and fresh.
title: Segura Viudas NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Intensely fruity, this delicious, ripe wine explodes with fresh acidity and fragrant fruitiness. Apricots, lemon and juicy apples give a fruit salad of flavors. Drink through 2015.
title: Domaine de Ménard 2013 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Apple flavors dominate this attractive blend of seven grapes, including three aromatic varieties, that give the wine its perfumed character. So although it is young and with enough acidity, it is the hints of lychee and peppered pear that add interest to the wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Plush and plump, this is an easygoing off-dry Riesling with wide appeal. Fresh white grapefruit, apple and lemon flavors are cushioned by soft acidity. The finish is brisk and clean. Drink now through 2018.
title: Heinz Eifel 2015 Shine Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Nice and dry, with good varietal flavors of blackberries and currants, wrapped into rich tannins. It's a fine Cabernet to drink with ordinary food, and a good value.
title: Salvatore Principe 2007 Running with the Bulls Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: Gently wood aged, the wine is rich in tannins and with generous red fruits. It is ripe with pepper as well as red-fruit flavors. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Opta 2016 Red (Dão)

description: Produced from organic grapes, this lightly structured wine is full of black currant fruitiness. With a touch of spice from wood aging, it's soft and easy to drink now.
title: Château la Guillaumette 2015  Bordeaux

description: A little sweet and candied on the nose but there are also floral aromas that are alluring. The palate is plump but offers good balance and structure, while the flavors run toward beefy dark berry fruit, spice and chocolate. Long, deep and roasted on the finish. Quite good for ten bucks.
title: Valentin Bianchi 2009 Sensual Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Crusty on the nose, this has an asphalt note that transitions into hard spice and sour berry notes. It has flavors of creamy, minty oak and medicinal berry fruit. A lasting flavor of oak-driven spice and a hint of green carry some heat.
title: oops 2011 Red (Central Valley)

description: Pretty good for the the price. It's bone dry and zesty in acidity, with mouthwatering flavors of oranges, lemons and limes, finished with a touch of vanilla and white pepper.
title: Big House 2010 Unchained Naked Chardonnay (California)

description: For an affordable, everyday red, this is a pretty good investment. It's dry and full-bodied, with berry, earth, mocha and spice flavors.
title: Grayson 2006 Merlot (Paso Robles)

description: Vibrant to the point of spritzy, with more tartness than cushion. This is a sharp rendition of Viura that emphasizes grapefruit and lemon. It stretches astringency to its limit, and yet some may like it because it will never be confused for plodding.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Osborne 2006 Solaz Blanco Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Burnt hay, grapefruit and waxy apple aromas lead to a palate with briny citrus flavors. Pithy grapefruit and orange flavors carry the finish, which is quick and light in weight.
title: Monte Clavijo 2012 Viura (Rioja)

description: As delicate as water, with faint hints of citrus fruits and buttered toast.
title: Castle Rock 2012 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Scratchy, horsey berry aromas set up a fresh, regular palate. Plum, berry and peppery flavors are basic, while the finish dries out fast while showing a wood character along with juicy acidity.
title: Pagos del Rey 2012 Castillo de Albai  (Rioja)

description: Crisp, not quite dry, this incorporates lively, fruity Loureiro grapes with a touch of Trajadura and Arinto culled from Lima Valley vineyards. With its light squeeze of lemon and sliced apple and grapefruit flavors, it's all about freshness. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2013 Ponte White (Vinho Verde)

description: This lightly perfumed wine is crisp and clear. Apple and pear flavors are attractively packaged in fresh acidity and an orange-peel tang. The wine is still young, with its tight aftertaste, so wait until later in 2015 to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Palha Canas White (Lisboa)

description: Unctuously ripe yellow peach and cherry aromas entice on the nose of this sprightly late-harvest Riesling. It's semi-sweet and fruity, with tart tangerine acidity that takes the spotlight on the palate. A refreshing, tasty quaffer for a remarkable price.
title: Johann Falkenburg 2012 Late Harvest Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: This blend of 70% Chenin Blanc and 30% Sauvignon Blanc is clean, direct and easy to like. Aromas and flavors of orange pith, firm pear, melon rind and green plum abound. It's balanced and refreshing, with a bright, mouthwatering finish. Enjoy now.
title: Beau Joubert 2013 Oak Lane Chenin Blanc-Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: Floral, leafy, citrusy aromas lead to a fresh, light-bodied palate. Dry, peppery red-fruit flavors finish short but clean, with textural ease.
designation: Puerto Viejo Single Vineyard Reserve Estate Bottled
title: Viña Requingua 2012 Puerto Viejo Single Vineyard Reserve Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: This aromatically unusual wine features notes of peppermint, honeycomb and apricot. It's front loaded in feel, pulling up short on the back half.
title: For a Song 2012 Caliche Lake Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: In this plush pillow of a wine, smoothness and easy drinkability come along with medium body, soft tannins, not too much crispness and just-ripe-enough flavors.
title: Leaping Horse 2013 Merlot (California)

description: Aromas of balsam wood, dry leather, and slightly herbal berry fruit are generally appealing, while the palate has size, balance and a healthy feel to it. More woody and spicy than outright fruity, with a touch of zesty raspberry and strawberry at the core. Nice but simple red wine.
title: Pago de la Jaraba 2007 Azagador Viñedos Propios Crianza Red (La Mancha)

description: Opens with good berry fruit aromas, mineral notes and coconutty sweetness, which is followed by a plump, well-balanced palate of black fruits, plum and licorice. Finishes solid and warm, with enough vitality and juiciness to maintain balance. More or less what you want from affordable Monastrell.
title: Bodegas Bleda 2008 Castillo de Jumilla Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: Candied peach, melon and grape notes are sweet and simple in this fruity white wine. Made from Diamond, a Concord-grape hybrid, with just a splash of Riesling, it's forward and easy but finishes with a crush of sweet-tart citrus. Drink now.
title: Fulkerson 2016 Juicy Sweet Estate Diamond (Finger Lakes)

description: A bouquet of jasmine, honeysuckle and green apple entice you in to sip of this refined Traminer. There are balanced flavors of ginger, passion fruit and apricot and a clean, acidic finish.
title: Domaine Boyar 2015 Traminer (Thracian Valley)

description: Interesting aromas of graham cracker, pastry, blackberry, dark cherry and tomato all work well together. The palate is full and easy, with some weight to it along with flavors of black plum and berry. Not exuberant on the finish; it ends in mellow, lightly medicinal fashion.
title: Alma del Sur 2010 Colección Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: The lightest wine from Cartuxa, EA stands for Eugénio de Almeida, the creator of the charity that owns the winery. It's simple and fruity, with attractive tannins and red cherry fruit. Ready to drink.
title: Cartuxa 2010 EA Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Plum and blueberry aromas come with a hint of green herbs. Feels fresh and clamps down with good tannins in the mouth before unleashing dark plum along with toast and peppery spice flavors. Juicy on the finish.
title: Paso a Paso 2010 Made with Organic Grapes Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: This is an attractive, perfumed wine that is a blend of Síria, Arinto and Viognier. It's the Viognier that gives the perfumed character that makes it so distinctive. It's fruity, lightly textured and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter White (Alentejano)

description: Light apple and spice aromas are simple, straightforward and appealing. The palate shows good balance, freshness and tasty flavors of candied pineapple and orange. Finishes juicy and correct.
title: Marques de Monistrol NV Selección Especial Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: A fairly full, rich and creamy version of Vinho Verde, with floral and anise aromas. Big and yet refreshing, sparked by some lively spritz. The finish echoes the anise and blends in some bright lime notes as well.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 1998 Couto de Frades Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine has good spiciness, ripe fruits and firm tannins. There is a good balance between acidity from red berry fruits and a dense, tannic character. It is solid and concentrated, and needing to age longer. Drink from 2015.
title: Caves de Rauzan 2011 Château Villotte  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Saucy, leathery berry and cherry aromas are totally adequate. This feels good for the most part, with rubbery tannins and some grab. Blackberry and plum flavors are basic and finish with savory notes.
title: Taron 2014  Rioja

description: Soft sweet spice and black tea characters mingle with black cherry and plum flesh aromas and flavors. Medium weight and approachable, with dusty tannins and a clean, licorice-kissed finish. Drink now.
title: Two Oceans 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Western Cape)

description: Suggestions of soft spice and bark jazz-up the dark fruit center of this blend, made with 75% Syrah, 13% Cinsault, 7% Mourvèdre, 4% Carignan and 3% Grenache. Mouthwatering black cherry and raspberry sauce flavors flood the mouth and stay through the solid finish. Drink now.
title: Goats do Roam Wine Co. 2010 Red Red (Western Cape)

description: Slightly herbal plum and berry aromas come with a pinch of spice and meatiness. Feels medium-bodied and crisp, with juicy red-fruit flavors of plum, tomato and raspberry. Dries out on the finish, where it becomes more herbal and roasted.
title: Espuela del Gaucho 2010 Limited Edition Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This stylish and affordable Chenin hits all the right notes with its full-bodied nose of fresh fruit, spice and citrus and balanced, pretty flavors of tropical fruit. Slightly curvy but still fresh, it's a white with energy and extra character.
title: Spier 2006 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: A zippy, spicy nose offering minerality, earthiness and red berries starts this pert Zinfandel. The wine offers balanced tannins, fruit and a fresh acidity. Friendly and fun.
title: Diamond River 2005 Shiraz (Olifants River)

description: Welcoming jammy fruit aromas are clean and robust, while the palate on this value-priced bottling is creamy, balanced and generous. The flavors are naturally a bit herbal, but there's so much beefy blackberry and dark plum fruit that the package is downright commendable. For everyday Carmenère, this is where to look.
title: Echeverria 2007 Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: A cheerful nose of raspberry, strawberry and lemon starts this rosé blend, and like flavors follow in layers that offer substance beyond the typical rosé. The wine has a touch of sweetness and a more unctuous mouthfeel than the nose might suggest, giving it the weight to pair with more complex dishes. Overall, an affordable, elegant choice.
title: Goats do Roam Wine Co. 2008 Rosé (Coastal Region)

description: This is a fat, soft and smooth wine. It has juicy red fruit and acidity, with light tannins that lend support. It's ready to drink.
title: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Le Phare Merlot Merlot (Atlantique)

description: Named after the many lighthouses which guide sailors on the French Atlantic coast, this soft and fruity wine is made from 100% Merlot. Crisp, with plenty of red fruit, it's light and ready to drink.
title: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Le Phare Rosé (Atlantique)

description: With its signature herbal aromas with tangy, grapefruit-like acidity, this wine is light, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Calvet 2016 Limited Release  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A great value wine to pair with homemade spaghetti sauce or grilled sausage with onions and bell peppers, this wine is soft and lush, with cherry, almond and blackberry notes. There's a touch of sweet strawberry on the close.
title: Feudo Arancio 2010 Stemmari Merlot (Sicilia)

description: This is mildly herbal and dilute on the nose, but not unappealing. It feels medium in body, with a timid structure and simple red-berry flavors that taste slightly sweet. Fresh and mild as a whole.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Altozano 2010 Finca Constancia Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: This is a toasty, black-currant-fruited wine. Its structural tannins give a dry character. A touch of green herb and a hard edge of toast indicate that the wine needs another year to soften.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2010 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: Packaged in a fun screwcap bottle, this easy Primitivo opens with bitter almond and cherry flavors, followed by crisp fruit and citrus freshness. It would pair with grilled pork chops.
title: Cortenova 2010 Primitivo (Salento)

description: A cool cherry aroma and a mild, creamy paste note open the nose. The feel is fiery and untamed, while full flavors of cherry and plum seem raw. A cocoa flavor and juicy feel define the finish.
title: Finca Los Maza 2010 Colección Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Fruit-forward aromas of blueberry, orange peel and spice lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors. It's respectable, though it's near impossible to peg it as Cabernet.
title: Washington Hills 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: Here's an extremely simple, slightly sweet sparkler that offers suggestions of white peach, pear and a candied note. Fresh acidity gives the finish a slight boost.
title: Amore di Amanti NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

description: Light, bright and crisp, this is a tangy wine. Its floral aroma and its juicy tropical fruits are both part of a wine that has been made to be drunk young, fruity and easily. Drink now.
title: Les Vignerons du Pallet 2015 La Marinière Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

description: Tropical fruit and hay aromas open this plump but basic SB that's low on acidity. Low-energy green-melon flavors are a bit briny, while a lack of punchy acidity leaves a short finish.
title: Carmen 2016 Wave Series Left Wave Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a ripe, easy and fruity wine. It has light tannins, juicy black-currant fruit and acidity. It is still young, showing off its fruitiness and will be ready to drink soon, from early 2017.
title: Château Champ du Moulin 2015  Bordeaux

description: A fruity, lightly tannic blend that comes from a region just to the east of Bordeaux itself. It has ripe berry fruits, a sense of dry structure enveloped with juicy black currants and is finished with crisp acidity.
title: Vincent Lataste 2010 Chevalier du Grand Loc Red (Côtes de Duras)

description: Slightly herbal aromas and vivid citrus flavors lend a unique personality to this light-bodied wine. A whiff of just-chopped parsley precedes bright lemon-lime flavors and definite acidity that will help it pair smashingly with all kinds of seafood, salads and light pastas.
title: Gnarly Head 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Smooth and appealing, with ample fresh citrus flavors and a supple mouthfeel, this isn't so assertive that it gets in the way of the conversation or the food. Sourcing good quality grapes from non-premier regions keeps the price down.
title: Cookies & Cream 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Apple and peach aromas are dusty and lightly tropical. With no oak, fruit is all you get in this Chardonnay; flavors of apple, nectarine and melon run clean, sweet and ripe, while the finish is mellow and lands smack in the middle of the fairway.
title: Echeverria 2013 Classic Collection Unwooded Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: Full bodied and rich, this has flavors of apple and lemon, with a warm and ripe feel that is balanced by a final mineral character. It needs several months to come together.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2011 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This lightly oxidized Chard is powdery but not entirely fresh, as it shows aromas of pool water and mealy melon. The palate is chunky and just O.K. in feel, while fleshy flavors of melon and peach end briny and mildly bitter.
title: O. Fournier 2012 Urban Uco Chardonnay (Uco Valley)

description: Has the silky weight and flavors of a nice Pinot Noir, with pleasant orange rind and sour-cherry candy notes. But there's a green scouriness that cuts through the palate like a sharp knife.
title: Michael Pozzan 2011 Dante Reserve Pinot Noir (California)

description: Described as medium-sweet on the label, this light white wine offers tones of peach nectar, honey and white flower. It is a simple and one dimensional wine with a subtle touch of sweetness on the close. Pair it with salty appetizers.
title: Canti NV White (Italy)

description: It is the Verdelho that gives this wine its attractive, perfumed character. Crisp and bright with a tangy, lemon zest texture, the wine is rich. fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2016 White (Tejo)

description: Cherry and plum aromas come with a note of rubbery latex, like a Band-Aid. This feels compact and dense, as if the palate were balled up. Medicinal black cherry and chocolate flavors finish in a bunched blocky mass.
title: Chilensis 2014 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Candied, slightly volatile red-berry aromas are topped with chocolaty oak. In the mouth, this is simple and medium-bodied. Salty berry and plum flavors are just ripe enough before this falls off on the finish.
title: Santa Luz 2015 Alba Merlot (Central Valley)

description: Savory, slightly saucy aromas of plum, berry, tomato and leather come with a hint of oak. This is a bit choppy and tannic, with savory, roasted flavors of tomato, plum, currant and spice. A touch of saltiness and raw-oak flavor rise up on the finish.
title: Pata Negra 2010 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: Scratchy berry and cassis aromas are earthy but perfectly presentable. This feels full and chewy on the palate, with firm tannins. Flavors of plum and berry come with dried spice notes and raw oak, while the finish is spicy, dry and mildly herbal.
title: Santa Alba 2013 Reserve Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: Rustic and a little sweet tasting, this has flavors of cherry pie, red currant and toast. Drink it with cheeseburgers.
title: Insomnia 2010 Red (California)

description: This wine has the weight and silkiness of a Pinot Noir, but it has Merlot's cherry, currant and anise flavors.
title: Grayson 2011 Lot 6 Merlot (California)

description: This has flavors of oranges, Meyer lemons and tropical fruits, and there's a good burst of acidity that lends balance. The finish tastes a bit sweet. Pair this selection with Vietnamese, Chinese, Thai, Indian or Ethiopian dishes.
title: Insomnia 2011 White (California)

description: Subdued aromas of red apple and melon are followed by a dry, medium-bodied palate with a tart, drawn-out finish.
title: Hogue 2014 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aromas feature underbrush, dark berry, tilled soil and allspice. The dense, straightforward palate delivers ripe blackberry, spicy blueberry, clove and black licorice alongside hearty tannins. It closes on a tobacco note.
title: Tenute Girolamo 2012 La Voliera Negroamaro (Puglia)

description: Light in color, with transparency, something you usually don't see with Malbec. The nose is rubbery, saucy and a touch grassy, while the palate is tannic and grabby, with stewy, rustic, roasted berry flavors. Finishes with the taste of barbecue sauce.
title: Medrano 2008 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

description: A perfect wine to pair with salad, grilled tuna or chicken salad, this is fresh and crisp, with bright tones of green melon and apple. The finish is zesty and clean feeling.
title: Matané 2011 White (Salento)

description: A firm wine, based on dry tannins and some dense fruit. It has acidity, driven by black berry flavors. The core of the wine is dry, both from wood and acidity, and it will benefit from 2–3 years' aging.
title: Quinta do Portal 2007 Mural Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a basic but nice Chardonnay with lightly oaked aromas of pear, apple and tropical fruits. The palate is fresh and healthy, while apple, mango and peach flavors settle with a hint of bitter matchstick and leftover tropical notes.
title: Tololo 2012 Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: A tasty, satisfying everyday red with an easy-drinking style and an affordable price. Light in texture, it's marked by jammy aromas, berry and herb flavors, and a soft finish.
title: Cookies & Cream 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This is a simple North Coast Cabernet with herbal and green olive and pepper tones.
title: Line 39 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: This smells of funk, yeast and cured meat. Tangy and acidic in the mouth, it has peach, citrus and ham flavors, finishing a bit mealy.
title: Federico Paternina 2010 Banda Dorada White Viura (Rioja)

description: Crisp plum and raspberry aromas set up a snappy, tight palate with green flavors of plum, raspberry and herb. It tastes vegetal on the finish, with cutting acidity.
title: Camboral 2010  Rioja

description: Dull and simple, this has thinned-down blackberry and steamed vegetable flavors. But at this price, it will get you through a big party.
title: Scrapbook 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This has rich flavors of black currants, licorice and sandalwood, and it finishes dry and spicy. This should be relatively easy to find thanks to its 50,000-case production.
title: Avalon 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: There's not much pulp or grit here, but this easygoing (and well-priced) Chardonnay does offer distant aromas of stone fruit and honey. Citrus flavors and sharp acidity best describe the mouthfeel.
title: Moletto 2007 Chardonnay (Veneto Orientale)

description: Simple, regular peach and pear aromas lead to a palate of sweet apple flavor and mild citric bite. This is the ultimate in basic Chilean Chardonnay: it's clean, a little dull and melony, and sweet. Drink soon.
title: Cono Sur 2008 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Gritty and dry, this rustic blend of Zin, Syrah and Cabernet has earthy flavors of cherries and spices. It's a fine everyday red to drink with everything from pasta or cold cuts to pizza and burgers.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Rosso Red (California)
