description: Simple but well made, this offers aromas and flavors of citrus, pear and a hint of bitter almond. Bright acidity gives it clean finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
title: Umani Ronchi 2015 Villa Bianchi  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)

description: This is pretty good Zin, fully ripened and showing classic wild berry and spice notes, although there’s an earthy, cardboardy aroma that’s a little off-putting. The tannins are very soft, and the acidity is a bit low, making it simple and one-dimensional. Still, not a bad deal at this price.
title: Montevina 1998 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

description: Some rosés are darker in color than this flyweight. But the bouquet and palate each pack some punch. Orange-rind and cranberry scents pave the way for the chocolate and black-plum flavors that blanket the thick palate. At the end, though, it lacks the sleekness mandatory for a very good Pinot Noir.
title: Firesteed 1998 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Strong wood aromas are more than compensated for by the ripe fruits and generous character of the wine. It is a solid effort, full of both fruit and rich texture. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Sainte-Barbe 2012 Merlot de Sainte-Barbe  (Bordeaux)

description: Sweet oak aromas, ripe fruit flavors and a firm texture make a complete and enjoyable package in this full-bodied wine. It has a toasted oak flavor, tasty plum and cinnamon nuances, good acidity and supportive tannins.
title: Fetzer 2012 Eagle Peak Merlot (California)

description: Tough cherry and plum aromas lead it off, followed by simple, semitart raspberry flavors. There's not much depth or complexity; the palate bounces along inoffensively, and the finish is quick and light. Clean and basic wine.
title: Doña Paula 2008 Los Cardos Syrah (Mendoza)

description: Respectable red fruit aromas carry a slight pickled sharpness and the scent of a matchstick, while the palate is lactic and creamy, with strawberry, raspberry, plum and herbal notes. Plump and reasonably well balanced, with an herbal finish.
title: Ku Dé Ta 2008 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Aromas of standard berry fruit have a cheesy accent, while the palate is on the flat side in terms of feel and flavors. With respect to flavor, expect mildly herbal berry tastes and cherry tomato. Snappy on the finish but stretched thin.
title: Viña La Fortuna 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lontué Valley)

description: Despite its Vin de France designation, this is a typical wine from the Gascony area. With its crisp, lightly herbal character and deliciously light texture, it's fruity with citrus and red currant notes. Drink now.
title: Rubus 2015 White (Vin de France)

description: Aromas of Bosc pear and candle wax lead to off-dry fruit flavors. It brings some easy-drinking appeal but lacks a sense of clarity.
title: 14 Hands 2015 Hot to Trot White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This opens with a delicate fragrance of white flower and tropical fruit. The easygoing palate offers green apple and Bartlett pear alongside crisp acidity.
title: Santa Sofia 2014  Lugana

description: A wine with great juicy swathes of fruit that combine well with the natural structure of the Dão. It is textured and firmly tannic, with delicious black fruits coming through. It's ready to drink, but will certainly benefit from 1–2 years' aging.
title: Caves Aliança 2010 Aliança Reserva Red (Dão)

description: This wine has a savory overall character, with clove, cinnamon and plum on the nose and espresso, red fruit and leather on the palate. A balanced spin of minerals gives it lift. Pair with roast lamb or poultry. A great deal and a good wine.
title: Tsantali 2009 Agiorgitiko (Nemea)

description: There's a lot of oak on this value-priced Chard, to the point that any fruit aromas are blanketed. In the mouth, there's ample acidity affording good cut, while flavors of pear and apple are spiced up by aforementioned forceful oak. Fortunately a resiny tasting finish isn't too heavy
designation: Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled
title: Santa Alicia 2013 Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: This opens with grassy, green aromas of candied raspberry. A chunky palate delivers candied, caramelized, slightly weedy red-fruit flavors. Not a lot besides acidity and heat is driving the finish.
title: Agustinos 2015 Reserva Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)

description: This wine is soft and creamy with melon and green apple flavors. Light, fruity and crisp, it is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Bonavita White (Lisboa)

description: Candied strawberry and grassy aromas unfold on the nose. On the palate, this blend of Monastrell and Pinot Noir feels heavy. A mix of candied red-fruit flavors and weedy notes finish short.
title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 Federico Paternina Banda Azul Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: This is a simple, red-fruit-flavored wine. It has soft tannins, a bright texture and fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Meyblum et Fils 2014 Les Illustres Chateaubriand Malbec (Cahors)

description: Vivid grapefruit and crisp apple notes give a big personality to this medium-bodied wine. A light sweetness takes off the acidic edge, while oaky and earthy accents linger on the finish. It's a terrific value and not hard to find.
title: Castle Rock 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

description: Smells like spiced applesauce. The palate is more full than light, with roundness but lemony, tart flavors of citrus and green apple. Tart again on the finish, with an odd oily feel. Seems green as well.
title: Chilcas 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Named in tribute to the many wine rivers of Portugal (Foz means estuary), this generous, fruity and soft wine is quite ready to drink. It is smooth with black fruits and light tannins well balanced and cut by acidity.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 F'Oz Red (Alentejano)

description: Ripe, minty and exuberant on the front end, this has a hint of animal in addition to a note of blueberry. Saturated and simple, this has a ripe red-berry flavor that comes across as red licorice. Fruity and fun.
title: Bodegas Medina 2011 Jaloco Joven Red (Ribera del Guadiana)

description: This smells a bit wayward and sulfuric, but it's juicy and acidic on the tongue, with lemony and oily, nutty flavors. It holds steady on the finish, which is lemony in character.
title: Altozano 2010 Finca Constancia Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Toledo)

description: Nicely behaved and well balanced, this gentle wine offers medium body, fresh plum flavors and a texture that's smooth and lightly tannic. The color is relatively deep and aromas are fruity, with a touch of earth.
title: Bogle 2014 Merlot (California)

description: The winery continues a trend of fine, everyday Merlots at an affordable price with this dry, elegant 2009. It's full-bodied and deeply flavored with black currants and plums.
title: Dynamite Vineyards 2010 Merlot (North Coast)

description: Not an expressive Rueda but it sizzles. Despite being young and driving, it's more neutral in flavor and texture than the winery's Verdejo, which is excellent. This wine shows all citrus with light green accents, and with shrimp or Asian foods it'll do well.
title: Valdelainos 2007 White (Rueda)

description: A cherry-pink-colored wine, soft and full-bodied. Flavors are of wild strawberries, red cherry with a touch of pepper. The wine feels fat, missing acidity.
title: Paxá Wines 2009 Paxá Rosé (Algarve)

description: Bacco in Toscana is an easy and slightly awkward blend of Sangiovese and 20% Syrah with bright berry notes and background aromas of moist earth and tobacco.
title: Podere Guado al Melo 2007 Bacco in Toscana  (Bolgheri)

description: Spicy and dry smelling, with red fruit aromas and a hint of prickle and brine to the nose. Smooth in the mouth and full through the midpalate as plum and red berry flavors blend with herbal notes. Mellow and full on the finish. Good value.
title: Vistamar 2010 Sepia Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Neutral smelling, with mild apple and briney aromas. Feels heavy, flat and on the thick side, with average flavors of melon but little to no citrus or smack. Melony, soft and bitter on the finish.
title: Siegel 2011 Crucero Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: Light and prickly in style, with citrus aromas along with tight cherry and plum scents. Runs lean in the mouth, with short, tart red fruit flavors in front of a crisp, sheer finish.
title: Cono Sur 2010 Pinot Noir (Central Valley)

description: This murky Malbec has odd, horsey, berry aromas. It's rough and raw on the palate, with leafy, herbal plum flavors that finish rugged and with a dull spiciness.
title: Restivo 2015 Silver Series Malbec (Mendoza)

description: It's rich in mango, peach, vanilla, buttered toast and brown sugar flavors, with a clean, tart mouthfeel.
title: Gnarly Head 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: Scratchy plum and cherry aromas come with creamy oak scents. The grippy palate houses harsh tannins, while plum and berry flavors yield to an overriding oak character on the finish. Monastrell, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon comprise the blend.
title: Caracol Serrano 2012 Tinto Monastrell-Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Jumilla)

description: Wild berry and meaty sausage aromas introduce a creamy, concentrated palate. Jammy cassis flavors have a peppery edge, while the finish is toasty at first, transitioning to bitter.
title: VinEcol 2013 Made With Organic Grapes Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Intensely fruity, this simple dessert sparkler offers juicy raspberry, crushed red cherry and strawberry alongside vanilla and a confectionary note. Bright acidity offsets the semisweet flavors.
title: Cantina di Sorbara NV Amorosa Amabile Rosato  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

description: A ripe and smooth wine that brings out all the fruitiness of the vintage. Just enough structure gives the wine shape, while yielding pride of place to the juicy fruits and attractive berry flavors. Drink now.
title: Château Garrineau 2012  Bordeaux

description: A minty strangeness permeates this wine, which comes off as artificial in flavor. Rumblings of cherry grenadine try to emerge from the muddled midpalate, which otherwise lacks flavor. The quick finish is medicinal and sweet.
title: Kirkland Signature 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Pickled and briny smelling up front, this semisweet wine doesn't open well. A cloying, low-acid palate is another strike against it, while flavors of candied apple, canned peaches and vanilla finish sticky.
title: Marqués de Cáceres 2014 Satinela Semi Dulce Malvasia-Viura (Rioja)

description: Beautifully feminine, with a delicate cherry-blossom perfume, this off-dry rosé sparkler blends juicy cherry and strawberry flavors, with a hint of earthy, mushroom goodness. Medium sized bubbles are brisk and tonic on the finish.
title: Ambition NV Gabrielle Rosé Sparkling Wine Sparkling (New York)

description: Even at this price, this Cab is hard to like. It's soft and somewhat vegetal, with bizarre sweet oak and cherry jam flavors.
title: Coyote Creek 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This wine starts with an attractive nose of melons and lemons, followed by bright and exuberant melon and fruit flavors. Balanced with curvy midpalate weight and a clean but exotic finish, it's a fun wine that offers complexity with charm.
title: Sebeka 2008 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: The curve on this wine has been going up and up, and this '09 is their best yet. It's bone dry and savory in acids, with ultraclean citrus, mineral and white flower flavors. Just delicious as a cocktail sipper.
title: Line 39 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

description: Nervy, herbal aromas and vivid grapefruit alongside lemon flavors make this wine stand out from the pack. It is light to medium in body and has a crisp, tangy texture and refreshing finish.
title: McManis 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This lightly herbal wine is crisp and has a tangy mineral character. It's tight, green and full of citrus fruits. The acidity is right up front, keeping the wine fresh and bright at the end.
title: Le Val 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Soft, jammy dried plum and berry flavors fill this juicy, slightly tutti–frutti red. A semidry blend of three French-American hybrid grapes, Chambourcin, Marechal Foch and Vincent, it's easy drinking with just a whisper of tannins marking the finish.
title: Thousand Islands Winery NV Saint Lawrence Red (New York)

description: Persistent bubbles lead the way to aromas of citrus blossom, green apple and yeasty bread. There are flavors of apple juice and lemon preserves in the midpalate. The finish is pleasantly sweet.
title: Marengo NV Semi-Sweet Bianco Sparkling (Ukraine)

description: This sparkling rosé has aromas of honeydew melon and dried red cherries. In the mouth, it has persistent bubbles, flavors of ripe strawberry and a sweet red-fruit finish.
title: Marengo NV Rose Sparkling (Ukraine)

description: This pale lemon sparkling wine has aromas of citrus flowers, brioche and yeast in the bouquet. It is slightly sweet on the palate with flavors of green apple, peach and sweet lime juice.
title: Marengo NV Semi-Dry Sparkling (Ukraine)

description: A perfumed wine with notes of candied orange, peach and lavender. The palate is sweet and easy drinking. Chill down and enjoy.
title: Paradise Peak 2012 Sweet Riesling (Washington)

description: A little sharp and ringing on the nose, with pine and citrus keeping it ultra fresh. The palate is mildly aggressive and zesty, with herbal raspberry and cherry flavors. With light oak and acidity kicking all the way to the end, this shows the crisp side of Pinot Noir.
title: Alfredo Roca 2006 Pinot Noir

description: Line 39 is a consistently solid name in Lake County Sauvignon Blanc. The 2011 delivers an aromatically inviting, grassy, New Zealand-style wine, with layers of citrus and grapefruit.
title: Line 39 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

description: After whiffs of burnt rubber and char blow off, this berry-packed Cabernet hits like a small brick with black fruit flavor, which packs punch and aftershocks of cocoa and coffee. Chunky, rough and warm.
title: Trapiche 2011 Oak Cask Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: A very nice wine, and more proof, if it's needed, that PG can make a crisp, interesting dry white even at an everyday price. Acidity is high and clean, giving a vibrancy to the citrus, honeysuckle, mineral and vanilla flavors.
title: Little Black Dress 2006 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: With what seems a stylistic change, this 2005 version of Periquita is firm, tannic, structured, with dark fruits and plenty of dry tannins. It is impressive for a big brand, dark and concentrated.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2005 Periquita Red (Terras do Sado)

description: This Macabeo (Viura) blend is neutral on the nose but fairly big and bulky on the palate. Flavors of lemon-lime and banana are spritzy at first and then stickier late. The rest of the composition (Macabeo and Parellada) dictates that the flavors will be short; but what's on display is nice and creamy.
title: Bodegas Concavins 2006 Proyecto Cu4tro Blanco White (Catalunya)

description: A ripe, juicy and fruity wine that has attractive black currant aromas, lively acidity on the palate and a light, bright feel. With open berry fruits, this wine is ready to drink.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2010 Quinta do Alqueve Tradicional Red (Tejo)

description: This easy Pinot Grigio is marked by ripe orange, peach, tropical fruit and green apple flavors, brightened with crisp, mouthwatering acidity. Moderate in alcohol, it's a versatile, lush white wine to drink now.
title: Coastline 2012 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

description: A single-vineyard wine from property owned by the Messias family, this is structured and packed full of tannins. A chocolate and spice character partners with the red fruits and acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Messias 2014 Quinta do Cachão Red (Douro)

description: The wine is light and crisp with lemon acidity and with a zesty bright texture. There is a touch of minerality and a clean lively aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Domaine de la Grenaudière Sur Lie
title: Ollivier Frères 2016 Domaine de la Grenaudière Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

description: Coming from the series of single-varietal wines produced by this estate, this wine adds a southern warmth to the crispness and elegant green-fruit flavors of the Alvarinho. It is tangy, hinting at minerality and with a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Alvarinho (Tejo)

description: A ripe and perfumed wine, this is well structured with a touch of crisp minerality as well as melon and peach fruits. It is smooth, balanced and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Verdelho (Tejo)

description: This is a good bargain for a varietal that's very difficult to make inexpensively. Whiffs of wood smoke meet ripe concentrated black-cherry flavors in this full-bodied smooth-textured wine. It has moderate fine-grained tannins for grip and a lingering spice and smoke finish.
title: Belle Ambiance 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: The nose on this easygoing Riesling is a bit reserved, suggesting hints of stone and bramble. It's quite vibrant on the palate though, offering loads of sweet-tart apple and pear flavors bolstered by zesty tangerine acidity. The finish wraps up brisk and clean.
title: Schmitt Söhne 2015 Relax Riesling (Mosel)

description: Elegant and smooth with just a touch of wood and vanilla to bring out the blueberry fruit flavors. It's deliciously perfumed with soft tannins and a gentle, fruity aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2010 Quartilho Red (Tejo)

description: On first whiff, you may not be convinced that this Tempranillo-Cabernet blend is up to snuff. The nose has carob, rubbery oak, creamy vanilla and cookie aromas along with jammy berry. The palate is capped with tannins and feels rubbery, while flavors of milk chocolate, baked cherry and rubber finish with blackened flavors of barbecue. For $10 it's pretty good, but don't expect a miracle.
title: Cellers Unió 2006 Mil Cepas Gran Reserva Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Terra Alta)

description: This is a solid Chardonnay for a great price. It has full body and an oaky, buttery personality that will make few enemies. It's richly textured, with an almost-sweet quality to its fruit.
title: Dark Horse 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: Plump, juicy yellow cherry and plum aromas on the nose contrast the taut, steely nature of this off-dry Riesling. Zesty lime and lemon acidity makes it refreshingly brisk and easy-drinking.
title: St. Christopher 2015 Piesporter Michelsberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: This bright and well-balanced wine opens with typical aromas of gooseberry, green plum and fresh herbs, all of which carry through to the light, easygoing palate alongside additional notes of lime and grapefruit peel. It's approachable and clean, with crisp acidity and a mouthwatering finish.
title: Vintales 2016 Sea Breeze Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: There's a pleasant and subtle chalky texture to this refreshing white, with aromas and flavors of white peach, underripe kiwi and orange peel. The cleanly fruited palate boasts great verve and liveliness, with tart gooseberry and lime flavors that unfold on the close. Drink now.
title: Fleur Du Cap 2016 Bergkelder Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: There's quite a showy, fragrant nose on this widely available bottling, with apple blossoms, tuberose and a touch of quinine. The palate also takes on a gin-and-tonic character, powered by lime juice, white peach and botanical notes.
title: Castle Rock 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Peach pit and apricot aromas are subdued. The palate is pulpy and fruity, with a light cut of acidity. Pithy flavors of orange and quince end with minor notes of bitterness and greens.
title: Alto Los Romeros 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: The subdued nose eventually reveals black cherry, anise and a whiff of chopped herb that carry over to the straightforward, informal palate. Dusty, drying tannins and a note of bitter sage leave an astringent finish.
title: Cantine Ermes 2014 Marchese Montefusco Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

description: This young, purple-colored wine has young fruit to match. It offers stalky red plum and blueberry flavors, light acidity and a fresh character. It is ready to drink.
title: Château la Rose de Vitrac 2014  Bordeaux

description: Dry, lightly herbal aromas of spicy raspberry and currant precede a tomatoey palate with bright acidity and modest weight. Short, spicy flavors of tomato and plum finish simply, without much flavor or force.
title: Chilensis 2013 Reserva Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Pineapple, grapefruit, and apricot show brightly on the nose and palate. Simultaneously refreshing and sophisticated on the palate, this wine has a crisp, lingering finish laced with flavors of almond blossom.
title: Sula 2013 Chenin Blanc (Nashik)

description: This mellowed-out red is ready to drink now. A good level of flavor complexity and a layered texture that is smooth but firm with tannins make this medium-bodied Merlot tasty. It feels so soothing and appetizing that one forgives the fruit and spice notes for being subtle.
title: Twin Arches 2010 Merlot (California)

description: MandraRossa's well-priced Fiano  offers Golden Delicious apple, banana and almond skin. The wine has a candy-like quality overall, but it's also genuine and simple with an easy approach.
title: MandraRossa 2007 Fiano (Sicilia)

description: This is a screaming deal for such an admirably good wine, blended with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah and Syrah. Compressed black fruit meets fresh leather on the perfumed nose. The palate follows with thick tannins and mouthcoating flavors of licorice and cinnamon.
title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

description: An attractive floral, appley aroma and generous, ripe apple and herb flavors give this medium-bodied wine plenty of personality.
title: Castle Rock 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

description: Full bodied and rich, this has flavors of apple and lemon, with a warm and ripe feel that is balanced by a final mineral character. It needs several months to come together.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2011 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Golden in color, with a nose of gardenia, green herb and lychee. This feels solid, but it's softening, with adequate grip despite no overt acidity. It tastes peachy and oily. Drink immediately.
title: San Felipe 2010 Selección Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: From a dynamic, family-run wine estate in northern Italy, this light Pinot Grigio offers aromas of lemon soda, peach and tangerine skin.
title: Stival 2010 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: There are tons of juicy raspberry and cherry flavors in this soft, gentle red blend.
title: Ensemble 2010 Red (California)

description: On the nose, aromas of sweet, red hard candy mingle with a note of animal fur. Fairly tannic and lively in the mouth, this has herbal, rubbery flavors alongside jumpy red-berry fruit. The finish is a bit abrasive.
designation: Staccato Made with Organically Grown Grapes
title: Caligiore 2011 Staccato Made with Organically Grown Grapes Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Spiced meat, chocolate and brambly berry notes lead the bouquet of this wine and follow through to the medium-weight palate. It's juicy, with a short finish and easy structure. Drink now.
title: Robertson Winery 2011 Pinotage (Robertson)

description: A savory nose of balsamic vinegar and smoked sausage gives this Merlot a spirited start. Big, juicy fruit flavors meld with wooded spice on the palate, offering a fun, easygoing wine with a long finish. Affordable and versatile.
title: Blue Cove 2007 Merlot (Western Cape)

description: This enjoyable, informal red delivers fruity flavors of juicy red cherry and crushed raspberry. Fresh and easy drinking, it would match nicely with pizza and pasta dishes topped with tomato sauce.
title: Piccini 2013 Orange  (Chianti)

description: Lightly herbal and scratchy on the nose, this somewhat sharp Merlot is linear and piercing, with bright, semitart flavors of raspberry, cherry pie and herbs.
title: Caliterra 2014 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: Savory rather than simply fruity flavors are the strong point of this medium-bodied and well-balanced wine. It tastes almost like melon wrapped in prosciutto as meaty, earthy nuances blend with modest fruit accents.
title: Pepi 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: This has fresh berry and flower aromas that lead to a healthy-feeling palate, which is full of cherry, boysenberry and blackberry flavors. Mildly toasty and chocolaty on the finish.
title: Valentin Bianchi 2011 Elsa Malbec (Mendoza)

description: 15% Alicante Bouschet gives this wine its dark color and rich, plummy texture. It has weight, ripe, bold fruit and soft tannins and is ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Portas da Herdade Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This leads with bright aromas of orange blossom, just-ripe red apple and firm nectarine. The medium-weight palate offers ample acidic lift that complements the apple and citrus flavors. Though the finish is short, it's clean, and the wine is just so easy to like and drink. Enjoy now.
title: Excelsior 2016 Chardonnay (Robertson)

description: This is a solid Chardonnay for a great price. It has full body and an oaky, buttery personality that will make few enemies. It's richly textured, with an almost-sweet quality to its fruit.
title: Dark Horse 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: Cherry and cassis aromas are generic. This feels raw and choppy, with sharp tartartic acidity. Limited, herbal flavors of mint and red fruits end in abrasive style.
title: Santa Ema 2014 Select Terroir Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Here is a concentrated wine that has dense tannins and acidity. Black currant freshness offers lively pleasure already, but should intensify in fruitiness in two years.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2011 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: Earthy aromas are a bit muddled and suggest tomato and herbs, but in the mouth, this is fresh and rigid in feel. Flavors of zesty berry come with oaky, savory notes and a touch of woody residue on the finish.
title: Villa Atuel 2012 El Tractor Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: This is a succulent and juicy red wine with pretty cherry nuances, mature prune and spice. The wine tastes slightly sweet and offers clean flavors of blueberry and bright red fruit on the close.
title: Cusumano 2007 Merlot (Sicilia)

description: An herbal Sauvignon that is fresh and on the lean side. The flavors are of crisp green apples, very fruity, with a structure of lime zest and vivid acidity on the finish. Screwcap.
region_1: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Lovely natural acidity keeps this sweet wine light on its feet, underscoring the honeyed pear fruit flavors with grapefruit and a hint of minerality. For a wine in this price range, with 11,000 case production levels, it's a marvelous achievement.
title: Ste. Chapelle 2008 Special Harvest Riesling

description: Lively and juicy, this is packed with fresh red cherry fruits, red currants and some wood. It's round, soft, only lightly tannic.
title: Barton & Guestier 2005 Bistro Wine Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Dark berry and a light, tropical fruit quality on the nose add to the appeal of this Pinotage. On the palate, the flavors of juicy berry and banana are rounded and smooth, offering assertive spice but in a gentle package.
title: Indaba 2006 Pinotage (Western Cape)

description: There is a layer of tannins here that impart a dry edge to what is otherwise sweetly fruity wine. It is full and juicy, with strawberry fruit flavors.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: Sweet in sugary pineapple and lime flavors, with the caramel and buttered toast of oak, this is a simple Chardonnay made in the popular style.
title: Gnarly Head 2010 Chardonnay (California)

description: Soft and simple, with sweet, easy cherry and strawberry jam flavors and a silky texture.
title: Concannon 2010 Selected Vineyards Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Yellow in color, then fleshy and floral on the nose, with a hint of peach but also corn stalks. Feels full and clumsy, with sharp acidity and corny, cidery key flavors. Struggles to reach that next level.
title: Raimat 2010 Castell de Raimat Chardonnay (Costers del Segre)

description: Simple and green, with mint, tobacco and cherry flavors. It's a sound, clean wine. Even though the fruit isn't exactly concentrated, it's an easy wine to drink at parties.
title: Glen Ellen 2010 Proprietor's Reserve Merlot (California)

description: Made from undisclosed grape varieties, this wine is simple and candied. It tastes like red cherry jam, spread on buttered white toast and sprinkled with brown sugar and cinnamon.
title: Amberhill 2010 Secret Blend Red (California)

description: A little heat on the nose is acceptable given that the remaining cherry and plum aromas are pure. A bit acidic on the palate but staunchly fresh, with good fruit flavor in the red plum category. Cleansing due to higher acidity, with hints of mocha and mineral.
title: Quo 2008 Grenache (Campo de Borja)

description: Cherrylike aromas and crisp red cherry and cranberry flavors give this medium-bodied wine a tart and lean personality. It has firm tannins and a slightly astringent finish.
title: One Leaf 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: From high-altitude vineyards, this is a crisp wine with fine acidity and white fruits. Light, bright and deliciously fruity it has a tangy, very drinkable aftertaste.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Lab Branco White (Douro)

description: Warm, earthy and stewed smelling, but then sharp and tangy and acidic in the mouth. Red fruits are dominant, but there's a persistent scour to the wine that doesn't allow it to get to the next level of quality or ripeness.
title: Siegel 2007 Crucero Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: Simple and sweet, like a mango, pineapple and peach fruit juice blend. Not much going on, but will appeal to lots of Chard lovers at this price. Production was half a million cases.
title: Sterling 2008 Vintner's Collection Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Dense and syrupy like black cherry juice, this semisweet Romanian Pinot Noir is not a wine with much finesse, but if you're looking for a sugary red wine low in tannins and acidity, this is right up your alley.
title: Dreamer 2007 Selected Harvest Pinot Noir (Dealurile Munteniei)

description: Simple lime and salinic aromas are clean and fresh. The palate is juicy and tight, with lime, apple and dry spice flavors. Finishes balanced and citrusy, with proper length and mouthfeel. A good but regular Cava that's done right for the price.
title: Berberana NV Gran Tradición Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Fresh, spicy cherry aromas are nice and clean. The palate is racy and staunch, with good acidity and tasty plum and berry flavors. Solid and medium-long on the finish, with a touch of minty herb flavor. Juicy and moderately oaky for a $10 value wine.
title: Dolmo 2009 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Calina usually makes a nice value Chardonnay, and this vintage is no different. The wine has a chunky dry-peach opening, which is backed by a round, smooth palate and flavors of sweet pear, baked apple and roasted corn. Honey and orange notes make cameo appearances. Good for the price.
title: Calina 2009 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Broad and ripe on the nose, with sappy blackberry, plum and youthful aromas. The palate is big, full and tannic, with roasted plum and berry flavors in front of a smoky, hickory-driven finish. Chewy, blowsy and generous for $10 Tempranillo.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Dominio de Eguren 2009 Codice Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: A blend of 37% Shiraz, 19% Gamay, 18% Mourvèdre, 14% Grenache and 12% Cinsault, this soft rosé has an herbaceous kick that lends depth to the red currant and cherry fruit core. The palate is ripe and fruity, but not overdone, with supporting acidity and subtle hints of pepper and blackberry leaf on the finish. Drink now.
title: Goats do Roam Wine Co. 2015 Rosé (Western Cape)

description: The Grand Lieu lake gives extra ripeness to the Melon grapes grown close to its shores, resulting in a rich, smooth and creamy-textured wine. Of course there is also plenty of citrus and mineral acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: La Berrière 2015  Muscadet Côtes de Grandlieu

description: Fresh-pressed boysenberries give zest to dusty aromas of tobacco and strong shoe leather on the nose of this bottling. Tobacco shows powerfully on the palate, as do dill, marjoram and black pepper. Dark fruit, from blackcurrant to elderberry, provides the base.
title: Magistrate 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Pretty good for a ten buck red, this has proper varietal flavors of blackberries, cherries and oak, and is fullbodied and tannic. There's a rustic edge, but it will do fine with roast chicken or even macaroni and cheese.
title: McManis 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This light-colored Cortese is an easy-going white that manages to be both very light and quite complex. The aromas of roasted peaches and apricots is lovely but low in intensity. The same can be said for the palate; complex and a touch dilute. The finish on this surprising, it has a real persistence to it.
title: Castelvero 2006 Cortese (Piedmont)

description: Light, fresh, slightly grassy but more in the white fruit flavor profile. It's soft, with a citrus twang to it, great to drink as an apéritif, leaving a soft, creamy aftertaste.
title: Caves Fleury 2006 Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Pretty in color, with a clean nose that's not too forced, pungent or potent. The palate has a good feel and lift, with light bubbles, nice acidity and dry flavors of red plum and nectarine. Finishes dry and composed, with a bit of elegance.
designation: MM Masia 1882 Selección Especial Brut Rosé
title: Mas de Monistrol NV MM Masia 1882 Selección Especial Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: What a nice Sauvignon Blanc, so savory and rich in fruit. It's a little sweet, with a honeyed edge to the peach, pineapple, lemon and green grass flavors. Nice with an Asian-style chicken salad with ginger and spices. From Mason.
title: Pomelo 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: White fruits and candied apple aromas turn a little dusty with airing. The palate is crisp and standard, with no issues and juicy flavors of lightly sweetened apple, nectarine and citrus. Clean on the finish.
title: Segura Viudas NV Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)

description: Fresh green plum, apricot and pears freshen this light, soft wine, clean, crisp and finishing with lime juice.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2008 Forgotten Field White (Estremadura)

description: Starts off strong, with pleasant tangelo aromas and flavors.  But somwehere along the line the flavors turn varnishy, finishing with a strong note of lacquer.
title: Castello di Borghese 1999 Hargrave Vineyard Pinot Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Rather dilute, it shows slight black-cherry and blackberry aromas and flavors. The overall impression is really little more than alcohol and faint body. Finishes very dry, with innocuous tannins.
title: Alfasi 1998 Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Modest cherry and strawberry notes appear on the nose and the palate, with some slightly herbal flavors as well. It's light in body, with soft acids and a relatively quick finish.
title: Jindalee 2007 Circle Collection Rosé (South Eastern Australia)

description: Slightly prickly and peppery on the nose, but there's enough clean red-fruit aromas and dustiness to bring it along. The palate is simple and nice enough, with tight acidity, stanching dryness and zest. A good but limited wine that delivers what it should but nothing beyond that.
title: Darien 2006  Rioja

description: Intense and extracted but also well balanced and smooth, with minerality and asphalt on the nose. The palate mixes deep black fruit weight and flavors with snappy acids, and overall this is bright, bullish and full of berry and black cherry along with chocolate. A ripe, satisfying wine for the money.
title: Altos Las Hormigas 2009 Colonia Las Liebres Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Looking for a medium-bodied Chardonnay with a citrusy edge? Look no further. Peach and lime scents ease into tropical fruit while retaining that zestiness on the finish. Drink now.
title: Yalumba 2009 Y Series Unwooded Chardonnay (South Australia)

description: Light and fresh, this 100% Chardonnay sparkler features slightly gingery, briny, biscuity aromas and crisp, balanced finish. At the price, the only serious competition is Cava, with its decidedly different flavors.
title: De Bortoli NV dB Sparkling Brut Sparkling (South Eastern Australia)

description: This contends for the best $10 Riesling in the country. It's off dry, with 30g/L of residual sugar, but not too sweet for some Asian noodle entrées. The mouthfeel is thick and borders on syrupy, with penetrating flavors of mango, papaya and peaches. It could also be served after dinner with fruit and soft cheeses.
title: Lujon 2015 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: Slightly minty and grassy on the nose, and that mild green character persists. The palate is a bit clacky and acidic, yet the flavors evolve and ultimately rest at candied and medicinal. A touch biting but it tastes pretty good and it's decidedly not sour. A blend of 55% Monastrell with 25% Cabernet Savuignon and 20% Syrah.
title: Caracol Serrano 2009 Red (Jumilla)

description: This blend of 45% Grenache, 28% Shiraz and 27% Mourvèdre does show a trace of heat in its finish, but is otherwise a pleasant, medium-bodied sipper at a realistic price. Tart, slightly minty cherries feature undercurrents of chocolate and coffee, turning crisp and lemony on the finish. Drink now.
title: Oxford Landing 2008 GSM Grenache-Shiraz-Mourvèdre Red (South Australia)

description: With residual sugar measuring 17 g/L, this puts the emphasis on fruit flavors that are forward, round, ripe and slightly sweet. It's right down the heart of the plate in terms of Washington styles; apple and peach the main flavors.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The spark of freshly cut lime and lemon is met by riper notions of yellow Mirabelle and Reine Claude plums. There is delicacy and slenderness but above all a bracing clean, sprightly character. Utterly refreshing.
title: Johann Donabaum 2015 Bergterrassen Federspiel Riesling (Wachau)

description: Soft and fruity, this easy-drinking, ripe wine has soft tannins, plenty of acidity from the red berry fruits, and a light-bodied character. Drink now, although it will be best from 2016.
title: Perescuma 2013 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: Simple and refreshing, this opens with a light floral fragrance and a whiff of pear. The easy palate offers tart green apple and a citrus note alongside bright acidity.
title: Cabert 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

description: This is a light, fruity wine with fresh red berry flavors and soft tannins. It has a cool feel from the nearby Atlantic Ocean, giving a bright, character and a wine that's ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Quinta de Bons-Ventos Red (Lisboa)

description: Fairly neutral on the nose, but clean and easy to get into. The palate offers good acidity and vitality for Maule SB, with tropical fruit leading the flavor profile followed by pithy green notes. Overall this is a good value white.
title: Viña Requingua 2010 Puerto Viejo Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Light and sweet, with raspberry jelly flavors and lots of acidity.
title: Glen Ellen 2009 Zinfandel Rosé (California)

description: Vegetal, with an asparagus edge to the citrus fruit flavors. That mars this otherwise clean, dry and zesty Chardonnay.
title: Concannon 2008 Selected Vineyards Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: The fragrance of black cherries and violet lay the groundwork for flavors of cherry, Fuji apple, eucalyptus, violet and a touch of iodine. Although labeled medium-dry, this blend of two grapes native to Georgia—one red, one white—is truly on the dry side. It is very soft in the mouth, with a nice touch of menthol on the finish.
title: Tbilvino 2015 Sachino Red (Kakheti)

description: Made from certified organic grapes, this is a medium-bodied blend of Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Merlot. Bay leaf and black olive aromas add earthy notes on the palate, giving this ripe, chocolaty wine an anchor in the south of France. Drink now.
title: Famille Perrin 2014 L'Oustalet Red (Vin de France)

description: Fruity like grape jam and blackberry syrup, this is a rich, almost-sweet wine. It has a very dark color, impressive fruit concentration and a smooth texture.
title: Belle Ambiance 2015 Dark Red (California)

description: Citrus and apricot aromas are basic. This feels dilute but fresh. Peppery, slightly bitter and stalky white-fruit flavors finish similarly.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Mureda 2015 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Concentrated and intense, but typical of Bonarda this is a fierce wine with a rock-hard mouthfeel and slightly tart, limited raspberry flavors. Not exactly sour but it makes your mouth seize up and take notice.
title: Sur de los Andes 2006 Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: A very pretty, opulent floral nose with hints of spice lead on this Hungarian sparkler. On the palate, it has a clean, minerally flavor that lacks some of the dimension and finesse that the nose would lead one to expect. A good food wine, though—and fun. Imported by MHW Ltd.
title: Törley NV Gála Sparkling (Hungary)

description: Burnt popcorn and some ammonia make the nose fairly harsh. Time softens it a bit as it yields to green-fruit flavors. Finishes dry as a soda cracker, with some Old World touches. Not an easy wine to enjoy; it's very lean and underdeveloped.
title: Pascual Toso NV Toso Brut Sparkling (Mendoza)

description: Simple and rough in texture, with medicinal citrus fruit and dough flavors.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Premium Extra Dry Chardonnay Champagne Sparkling (California)

description: Still young, this rich wine has a stalky character that contrasts with the ripe black currant flavors and good acidity. With a few months aging, this will fill out and be an attractive and fruity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Roc de Ségur 2014  Bordeaux

description: Floral blackberry aromas are concentrated. The saturated palate is somewhat narrow in breadth, while boysenberry and minty oak flavors rank as dark. A wiry but juicy finish is lasting and offers a note of chocolaty oak.
title: Tilia 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Spanish producer Vicente Gandia continues its venture into Portugal with this ripe, spicy and toasty wine. Wood flavors mingle with the red fruits and bright acidity. It is rich, full and ready to drink.
title: Vicente Gandia 2013 Boâbrisa Red (Alentejo)

description: Fresh and inviting notes of pineapple and tropical fruit are balanced by orange oil citrus and medium acidity in the mouth. The palate is round with a nice weight and a medium-length finish.
title: Indaba 2011 Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: Cherry, spice and vanilla on the nose are followed by flavors of cherry, pepper, and spicy sausage on the palate. Smooth, balanced and easy drinking, this is a good go-to red with a slightly exotic spin.
title: My Big Fat Greek Wine 2010 Agiorgitiko (Peloponnese)

description: Vibrant and bright, this Chenin boasts lively notes of tropical fruit, white peach, blood orange and ripe melon. Balanced and refreshing with a clean, citrus-infused finish. Drink now.
title: Orange River Wine Cellars 2011 Star Tree Chenin Blanc (Northern Cape)

description: Scents of rapberry, cherry and earth make for a nice begining and lead into some attractive pepperiness on the palate but the finish drops off quickly. The wine's refreshing acidity will pair nicely with spare ribs.
title: Bulletin Place 2006 Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)

description: Shows good Chardonnay character in the rich texture and upfront flavors of pineapples, peaches and cream. This is a pretty decent price for the quality.
title: Ironstone 2007 Chardonnay (California)

description: Mildly tropical on the nose and pleasant overall, with a touch of match stick to the bouquet. The palate is lemony and sheer, with flavors of Meyer lemon, white peach and apple. Pointed on the finish but clean. Good but normal in the scheme of things.
title: Vistamar 2010 Sepia Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: With firm tannins, rich berry fruits and more typical red cherry flavors, this has weight and a ripe juicy core. It's ready to drink, but could be kept for another year.
title: Barton & Guestier 2009  Beaujolais-Villages

description: A fruit-forward style of Pinotage, this boasts ripe notes of raspberry, strawberry and blueberry upfront, with subtle accents of black pepper, vanilla oak and purple flowers in the background. Medium tannins lend some structure to the rich fruitiness of the palate, but fade fast on the finish.
title: Stellar Organics 2014 Pinotage (Western Cape)

description: A pleasantly smooth texture, mellow fruit flavors and not-too-heavy body give easy drinkability to this very affordable wine. The fruit flavors are quiet but present and the balance is on the soft side.
title: Belle Ambiance 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This is a fruity but also structured blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Alicante Bouschet and Touriga Nacional. It's full of red fruit, dusty tannins with a dry core and balancing acidity. Drink until 2020.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Pancas Red (Lisboa)

description: This wine has more body and a richer mouthfeel than many of its peers, with mild floral and almond flavors and a touch of butterscotch.
title: Belle Ambiance 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a crisp, fresh wine. It has attractive red fruits that are cut by juicy lemons. The touch of caramel in this blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional is lit by the acidity and spiced by a final touch of pepper.
title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek Rosé (Tejo)

description: In the style of a Côtes de Gascogne white blend, this is a crisp, herbal and citrusy wine. It has considerable acidity along with pink grapefruit and lime flavors. Drink this light, bright wine now.
title: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Interesting scents of spice, herb and pine mix with tropical pineapple fruit. It all leads into a buttery finish, delivering a lot of flavor for the price. Barrel fermented, malolactic and sur lie aging—the full Monty.
title: Hyatt 1999 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

description: The grapes come from the Chicken Dinner vineyard, which says it all. Pop this tart, tangy wine, with its Zin-like red berry flavors and hints of white pepper, and bring on the fried chicken. —P.G.
title: Ste. Chapelle 2000 Winemaker's Series Syrah (Idaho)

description: This is a large-production Sauvignon Blanc that tastes delicious. If you like grapefruit and pomelo flavors, you will love this enticingly priced white that's got razor sharp acidity, a touch of New Zealand-like grass and a long finish.
title: Pomelo 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: Ripe and rich, it's full of tropical fruit, pineapple and mango flavors. Fresh acidity balances the full fruitiness. The aftertaste brings out a more mineral character.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Pretty aromas of crushed blue flower and red berry lead the nose on this easygoing red. The fresh palate offers up juicy black cherry and savory herb alongside supple tannins and bright acidity.
title: La Mozza 2013 I Perazzi  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Standard value-priced Chilean Syrah in that it's herbal and leafy on the nose, with a mix of olive, earth, spice and dried red fruit aromas. The palate is a bit stretched out and tannic, while the flavor profile is pure olive, herbs and dried cherry. Finishes solid but herbal.
title: Veo 2008 Ultima Reserve Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Light red cherry-flavored wine from a fine year for Beaujolais. The wine is all juicy fruit, rounded tannins and light, smoky acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2009  Beaujolais

description: Fresh as well as ripe, with layers of toast, creamy pear and red apple flavors. Attractively spicy, ready to drink.
title: Barton & Guestier 2009  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Peachy aromas are friendly, while the palate has a good feel to it along with green flavors of melon, lime and fresh veggies. Finishes with fruit, dryness and a touch of bitterness, yet in the end it fails to deliver on the promise of the bouquet.
title: Caligiore 2008 Grazioso Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: Spicy, buttery aromas lead this lean-style white from Crete. Medium-bodied with a combination of citrus and spices, and a touch of flowers. Angular but interesting.
title: Kourtaki 2007 Vin de Crete White (Crete)

description: Stemmy and fiery on the nose, with light raspberry aromas. The palate is lightweight and acidic, while the generic palate shows cherry and plum fruit and heat. Plows on through but doesn't register more than the basics.
title: Espiritu de Argentina 2007 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Wet earth, pine needle and floral aromas and assertive menthol and lanolin flavors lend a bold, unorthodox personality to this full-bodied wine-in-a-can.
title: Sans Wine Co 2016 Finley Road Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

description: The wine is unexpectedly perfumed by the addition of Muscat. That gives the wine a full character, including touches of spice and acidity. The wine is unbalanced, the fruit and the spice at odds.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Jas des Vignes Rosé

description: Flat and somewhat disjointed, this wine offers a strong taste of eucalyptus in a light-bodied, simply structured frame.
title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Boldly grapey, this blend of Diamond, Cayuga White and Catawba grapes is a fun fruity sip with that characteristic “foxiness” of American grapes. It's simple and a bit sugary, but light footed and fresh.
title: Thousand Islands Winery NV Wellesley Island White (New York)

description: This bright and simple wine offers citrus, Mediterranean brush and peach aromas and flavors. It closes on a saline touch.
title: Cantine Ermes 2016 Vento di Mare Vino Biologico Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

description: This is a crisp fruity wine with delicious red currants. It has fine acidity as well, with a burst of freshness in the midst of the spicy, ripe wine. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Cuvée du Lion Rosé (Var)

description: The over-exuberance of wood aging spoils this wine. With strong spice and equally tannic elements, it's all about the skeleton and not about the flesh of the fruit.
title: Château Mayne Guyon 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a light and fruity wine from J. Portugal Ramos. It's crisp, with lemon and citrus flavor, and bright with grapefruit acidity. Drink now and over the next year.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: You can't beat the price versus quality ratio on offer here. Yes, this is an easy and thin wine, but it also delivers just enough fruit freshness and personality to pair with easy vegetable dishes or salads. Great for pool side parties or barbecues.
title: Cantina di Soave 2011 Re Midas  (Soave)

description: Clean but neutral, with decent lift, zest and body. The flavors run sweet to tropical, with pithy notes and a hint of green vegetables on the finish. Very basic and worthwhile, but regular in every sense of the word.
title: Valle Frio 2007 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Made in an inexpensive Aussie style, this Shiraz is dry and rich in blackberry, currant, tobacco, Dr. Pepper, mocha and peppery spice flavors. At this price, it's great for barbecues.
title: Virgin 2005 Shiraz (California)

description: Refreshing and simple, this is dryish and spicy, with orange, apricot and peach flavors all accented with crisp acidity. It's easy to drink as a cocktail sipper, with little snacks, like tempura or cheesy puff pastries.
title: McManis 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Packaged in a short, squat bottle, this a clean, modern wine, with bright aromas of cut grass, apricot and bright lemon zest.
title: Astoria 2011 Alìsia Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Fresh and full of lime on the nose, and overall this is simple, smooth and gives you little reason to worry or fuss. The palate is smooth, creamy and a little low on acids, thus the lemon-lime and melon flavors have a fullness that's sweet and good.
title: Segura Viudas NV Extra Dry Sparkling (Cava)

description: Smooth caramel and raspberry flavored wine, with a fat, full texture. The wine misses out on fresh acidity, but certainly has ripe fruit richness.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2008 Serras de Azeitão White (Terras do Sado)

description: Fresh green plum, apricot and pears freshen this light, soft wine, clean, crisp and finishing with lime juice.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2008 Forgotten Field White (Estremadura)

description: Leans toward burnt and acrid on the nose, yet the palate is fresh but tight and scouring. Raspberry and red plum account for the flavors, while the finish is quick and fades off quietly. Tart and innocuous, but not problematic.
title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2007 Royal  (Rioja)

description: This is a tough wine to love, although the price makes it an everyday sipper. With blackberry, licorice and herb flavors, it's dry and tannic.
title: Fog Head 2012 Red (California)

description: This Merlot is okay for everyday drinking, but it's pretty simple. It has modest cherry flavors, with some green, vegetal notes.
title: Bogle 2011 Merlot (California)

description: With small percentages of Syrah and Viognier, this Petite Sirah is simple and has a pronounced smoky personality.
title: Peltier 2011 Hybrid Petite Sirah (Lodi)

description: Low intensity red fruit aromas are better than the sour orange peel and stemmy bramble that mar the wine's nose and core flavors. Tart, tight red wine with a narrow mouthfeel, tannic grab and rhubarb on the finish.
title: Espiritu de Argentina 2007 Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Overtly sugary, basically a dessert wine, with raspberry, vanilla and spice flavors.
title: Glen Ellen 2008 Zinfandel Rosé (California)

description: The melon and pineapple aromas are pure and carry a waxy edge. It feels simple and well comported, with green apple, pear and vanilla flavors. This is tasty, smooth, lively and classy; drink right away.
title: Pradorey 2011 Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

description: Fresh and fruity, this wine is full of generous red berry fruits. It is soft, open and ripe. With both Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, it does have some structure, just there to support the fruitiness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Portas de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)

description: Fairly mute on the nose, with an oily note and peachy aromas. Basic in the mouth, with good weight and balance along with oily flavors of peach and melon. Sweet and waxy on the finish, with the flavor of green banana.
title: Vintage Sun 2010 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: This is an extremely aromatic and floral Sauvignon that delivers an intense bouquet of sage, exotic fruit and tomato leaf. It earns high marks for personality and good cheer and offers zesty lemon flavors on the finish.
title: Banear 2007 Tentazioni d'Aba Sauvignon (Friuli Grave)

description: A mineral, dry wine, relatively light but still packing plenty of firm red fruits, solid tannins and a dry core. It could age for 2–3 years; with its fresh aftertaste, this is already a great food wine.
title: Castello d'Alba 2005 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: Subtle aromas of white fruits, talc and powdered sugar are totally what they should be given that this is an extra dry Cava. The palate is a little sudsy and active, but the flavors of citrus and white pepper are balanced and not overly sweet or confected. Shows good clarity from start to finish.
title: Segura Viudas NV Extra Dry Sparkling (Cava)

description: Distinct aromas of wood grain and pine crowd out any fruit scents. This feels somewhat flat, with resiny oak flavors resting on top of melony notes. A second wave of wood spice controls the finish.
title: Autoritas 2015 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: This orange-colored rosado offers aromas of peach flesh, peach pit and sea shell. Dry, pithy, mildly bitter flavors of citrus and stone fruits end pithy. Contains 25% white Viura.
title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2015 Rioja Bordón Rosé (Rioja)

description: Yeasty aromas accent pear and apple scents. On the palate, zesty acidity creates juiciness but also a sense of coarseness. Straightforward apple and lime flavors finish quiet.
title: Covides NV Elocuente Sparkling (Cava)

description: Raw, earthy plum aromas are spicy and lightly herbal. This feels saucy yet monotone. Tomato, red-plum and herbal flavors end with a hint of brown sugar and a continuation of the wine's herbal plum character.
title: Chilensis 2013 Reserva Estate Bottled Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: This light and fruity wine has fresh acidity as well as lemon and ripe pear fruits. It is soft, smooth, and with a creamy texture, is very ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Medium-pink in color, apple and berry aromas are followed by spritzy, moderately sweet fruit flavors. It goes down easy.
title: Latah Creek NV Huckleberry D'Latah White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pithy citrus aromas are plump but wayward. This feels a bit flabby but holds it together for the most part. Flavors of citrus fruits, melon and green herbs are good in the most basic sense of the word.
title: Carlos Serres 2012 Serres Viura (Rioja)

description: The nose is true to the variety: there's grapefruit and lime aromas along with grassy notes. The palate is solid, maybe a bit plump and vapid, with lemon, lime and other citrus flavors. A bell pepper and jalapeño sharpness comes up on the finish.
title: Terrapura 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: Light in color, this blend of 51% Syrah, 42% Merlot and 7% Cabernet Sauvignon is perfumed with orange peel, coffee, plum and herbs. It drinks off dry, quite light and elegant in style with grainy tannins.
title: Sagelands 2013 Riverbed Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This contends for the best $10 Riesling in the country. It's off dry, with 30g/L of residual sugar, but not too sweet for some Asian noodle entrées. The mouthfeel is thick and borders on syrupy, with penetrating flavors of mango, papaya and peaches. It could also be served after dinner with fruit and soft cheeses.
title: Lujon 2015 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: Very dry and slightly musty, the fruit tastes lightly of apple and citrus, but the wine already seems to be heading over a cliff. —P.G.
title: Ste. Chapelle 1999 Chardonnay (Idaho)

description: Sweet and simple, tastes like that syrup they pack canned peaches in, except of course it has good acidity. Make that super acidity, which is its saving grace. The acids get up under the fruit and push it, saving the wine from being insipid. —S.H.
title: Yalumba 2000 Y Series Viognier (South Australia)

description: This is a whole different critter than the winery's quaffable '99. It is tart and resiny, with a strong scent of licorice. The rustic flavors are earthy and rough, with a bitter, alcoholic finish.
title: Hyatt 2000 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

description: Earthy, herbal aromas veer into cardboard, and a distinct waft of raw green peppercorn. The grapes didn't fully ripen. But the wine is dry, tart and clean and there's a certain food friendliness. Try it with stews or barbecue and you might discover hidden charms. —S.H.
title: Stonehedge 2000 Syrah (California)

description: Fruity, clean, and on the sweet side, this is an everyday quaffer whose sugary flavors are just fine for a sunny afternoon with ripe peaches or apricots. ItÕs Cailfornia soft, a country style wine that will appeal to those who find some whites tart or sour.
title: Forest Glen 2000 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: A light, smooth quaffer that'll get you through the summer, this blend of 71% Shiraz and 29% Cabernet Sauvignon boasts aromas and flavors of charcoal-grilled black cherries tinged with chocolate. —J.C.
title: Jacob's Creek 2000 Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon (South Eastern Australia)

description: Earth, leather, rubber and black-cherry aromas set up a tight, restrainted palate. The palate brings wood grain and raspberry tones to the mix, while the finish feels slightly hot.
title: El Ganador 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This wine is dry, full and brimming with ripe red-berry fruits. A blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional, it has a rich character that gives the wine more weight than freshness. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Tagus Creek Rosé (Tejo)

description: Prune is the most distinct aroma on a generic yet ripe nose. This feels shearing and high in acidity, while raspberry flavors fold in sharp tartaric notes. Short on the finish, as might be expected.
title: Vila 2012 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Unsteady stone-fruit aromas set up a chunky, cidery palate. Flavors of tropical fruits are short and turn toward grassy lime and scallion on the finish. As Torrontés goes, this is decently enjoyable.
title: Ocaso 2014 Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: Oaky notes of buttered toast, dried apple slices and baked peach are upfront in the bouquet of this wine. The palate is similarly rich and round, but with ample acidity to keep it from falling completely flat. Flavors of orange creamsicle and spiced apple linger on the close.
title: Phantom Bay 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This is a ripe and fruity rosé, with forward notes of lychee, rose water, peach gummies and tropical fruit salad. The palate is round and plump in similarly rich fruit flavors, with just enough acidity to keep it from feeling completely flat. Drink up.
title: Scarlet of Paris 2015 Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This is a fruity, crisp wine with an attractive balance between acidity and sweetness. Ripe strawberries give the fruit flavor while the acidity at the light prickle on the palate add a crisper aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Viniverde 2015 Alto Lima Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Red-cherry flavors dominate this soft fruity wine. It is aromatic, full of ripe fruitiness and with just the right touch of acidity. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Rosé (Douro)

description: Earthy tones of menthol, licorice, black pepper and blackcurrant leaf compliment the blackberry and plum core of this lush yet soft Cab. The palate is plush and round, with light tannins and a sweet-oak finish.
title: Phantom Bay 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: A pleasant and easy-drinking selection, this leads with softly medicinal aromas of raspberry and red plum alongside a touch of violet. The palate is light and direct, with bright red-fruit flavors that finish short but clean.
title: Phantom Bay 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This is a ripe, wood-aged wine that is rich with dark plum and ripe berry tones. Its big, bold character is primary and a far cry from subtle. Drink now.
title: Ribafreixo 2012 Barrancôa Red (Alentejano)

description: It’s funny how a wine like this, so austere in both aroma and flavor, can be so appealing. For one thing, the acidity is enormously high, and really turns on the taste buds. What flavors there are tend toward limes and unripe peaches, but the real deal is mineral and herb. It really shines in cleanliness, zestiness and liveliness.
title: Tenuta Cocci Grifoni NV Passerina  (Marche)

description: A wine made in memory of Catherine (Caterina) of Bragança, a Portuguese princess who married Charles II of England in the 17th century. It is a superripe wine, full of tropical fruit flavors and only the lightest of acidity. Wood aging gives the wine a plush character and suggests it could age for another year. Drink from 2016.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2013 Catarina Chardonnay (Península de Setúbal)

description: Simple and a little vegetal, but the blackberry, currant and oak flavors are sound.
title: Glen Ellen 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: The welcoming aromas of red berry and cherry are slightly smoky and spicy. Showing good body, this has light tannins, with flavors of toasty plum, berry, chocolate and spice. It's round, mellow and easy on the finish.
title: Salvatore Principe 2011 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: A blend of six varietals including Cabernet Franc and Syrah, this wine is utterly distinctive. The raspberry liqueur aroma has a meaty edge complemented with things like ground coffee, violets and white chocolate. All these flavors mingle in the mouth, and yet the wine is dry. The supple, silky texture is notable. Best Buy. —S.H.
title: Ca' del Solo 2000 Big House Red Red (California)

description: Okay, Idaho Cabernet is never going to be an easy sell. But new winemaker Chuck Devlin is a talent, and he gives this wine a distinct core of sweet black cherry fruit; not big, but perfectly ripe. It's set in a slightly earthy framework of root and rock, with a lightly chalky finish. —P.G.
title: Ste. Chapelle 2000 Winemaker's Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Idaho)

description: Fragrant, with scents and flavors of pears and orange blossoms. This wine has 1.8% residual sugar, which qualifies it as off-dry, but it is still quite suitable for a wide range of foods, especially spicy Asian dishes. Full, fleshy and well-made, it delivers plenty of fresh fruit flavor with enough spice and acid to give a lift to the finish.
title: Seven Hills 2001 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A neutral cava with white candy and mango on the nose. The palate is both foamy and scouring, with soda cracker, apple and citrus pith creating the flavor profile and finish. Shows basic flavors, normal mouthfeel and scouring acidity.
title: Sàniger 2007 Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: A useful wine that will play well against umami-flavored appetizers. It's dryish to off-dry and crisp in acids, with pleasant pineapple, orange and vanilla flavors. The blend is Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier, Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay and Grenache Blanc.
title: Novella 2009 Synergy Blanc White (Paso Robles)

description: Creamy in the nose, with a hint of vanilla and Bartlett pear. The palate isn't boring; there's cantaloupe and nutmeg nuances along with some papaya and banana. The weakness: The wine turns soft almost immediately upon pouring.
title: De Martino 2001 Estate Bottled - Prima Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: A light, easy-drinking Pinot Grigio, with peach, lime and fresh herb aromas and flavors. The lemony finish shows fine persistence.
title: Pozzi 2001 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Smells crisp and pineapple-y and tastes of tart pineapple and pear, but the mouthfeel is thick and syrupy. Finishes relatively clean and tangy.
title: L.A. Cetto 2001 Chardonnay (Valle de Guadalupe)

description: Pungent aromas of pine needles and saw mill start it off. Next comes a juicy palate with flavors of orange and pineapple. The finish is fine, but it's kind of dull. The is a basic wine that veers toward flatness. But for now it's hanging in there.
title: Dallas Conté 2002 Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: This is a pretty nice wine for drinking with every­day fare, and at this price, it's a real value. It packs a punch, with solid blackberry and licorice flavors that finish dry and spicy.
title: Lost Angel 2008 Mischief Red (California)

description: This bright blend of 75% Sangiovese, 15% Merlot and 10% Ciliegiolo discloses aromas of ripe berry and cooking spice. The soft, easy-drinking palate offers black cherry, white pepper and grilled sage alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Erik Banti 2012 Carato Red (Toscana)

description: This attractive and medium-bodied wine smells a bit like ginger cookies. It tastes nicely dry, fruity and well structured with tannins and acidity. Nutmeg and ginger notes add extra interest to black cherry and pomegranate flavors.
title: Alias 2013 Merlot (California)

description: Soft and honeyed, with vanilla-tinged flavors of all sorts of tropical fruits that finish with a spicy hit of butterscotch. A blend of Chardonnay, Muscat and Chenin Blanc.
designation: Ménage à Trois White Table Wine
title: Folie à Deux 2006 Ménage à Trois White Table Wine White (California)

description: Spicy, fruity and nicely rounded, this wine boasts great flavor intensity without the sharp points sometimes associated with Montepulciano. It's an easy, approachable wine perfect for everyday dining with solid tannins and good length.
title: Masciarelli 2003  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

description: Made entirely with the native grape Bombino Nero, this informal light-bodied wine has subdued aromas of wild cherry and a hint of crushed herb. The aromas carry over to the über-simple palate along with a hint of pink grapefruit.
title: Rivera 2016 Rosé (Castel del Monte)

description: Earthy mossy spicy aromas are the high point on this edgy rubbery amped-up Carmenère. This is blocky and chunky on the palate, with blueberry and leathery flavors. Lively but rough feeling on a peppery, herbal finish.
title: Viña La Fortuna 2013 Twelvestone Carmenère (Lontué Valley)

description: This wine's neutral nose includes mild citrus scents. It's tired and bland on the palate, with yeasty flavors, finishing with papaya and commercial white bread notes.
title: Marques de Toledo 2015 Verdejo (La Mancha)

description: This simple rosato has subdued aromas suggesting red berry and a whiff of wild flower. The light informal palate evokes sour cherry and orange zest alongside tangy acidity.
title: Cantine Ermes 2016 Marchese Montefusco Rosato (Terre Siciliane)

description: Lime and orange aromas smell more like a household cleanser than honest fruit. A chunky palate is low on acidity, while this tastes of yeast and white bread more than fruit. Bitterness on the finish transitions to yeasty as this fades.
title: Cuyen 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Cavit is an important wine cooperative in northern Italy that is largely responsible for Pinot Grigio's immense popularity in the United States. This bottle shows easy tones of peach and citrus.
title: Cavit 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This no-fuss wine is redolent of lemon soda, cut grass and bitter almond. The mouthfeel is clean and fresh.
title: Barone 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Yeasty, bland, unconvincing aromas make for an unremarkable opening. This is flabby and broken on the palate, with yeasty flavors of canned peas.
title: Falernia 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

description: This is an elegant, slightly restrained Pinotage that maintains the local character but offers a more palatable choice for everyday drinking. Pepper, rich berry and spice are balanced by a quiet acidity and long, rich finish. Pair with Moroccan or Indian cuisine.
title: Stormhoek 2006 Pinotage (Western Cape)

description: Fairly big and full-bodied, but not overoaked or overripe, so you get true plum and red-berry flavors, some of Carmenère's herbal side, and a solid finish that offers good spice flavors and proper tannins. Sometimes simple is better, and this wine's no-nonsense approach is what works.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2006 Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: A straightforward quaffer with off-dry notes of fresh herbs, whole bell pepper and black currant.
title: Sagelands 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Ripe in color and aromas, this chunky wine delivers heavy baked-berry and raisin aromas in front of a jammy, extracted palate. Raisin and cooked berry flavors finish plump, with earthy notes.
title: Balduzzi 2012 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Briny nectarine aromas set up a fresh palate. Standard stone-fruit flavors and apple notes finish steady and a touch sweet, with citric acidity.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2013 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: An appealing quaffer with notes of passion fruit, papaya and citrus. It drinks a hair off dry (1.2g/L residual sugar), with moderate concentration, and goes down easy.
title: Original House Wine 2013 Fish House Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Crisp and light on its feet, this easy-drinker serves up exotic aromas of ginger backed by raspberry jam, tobacco and strawberry liqueur flavors that show just a bit of persistence. Very impressive for the price. With nonexistent tannin, this wine would be a perfect choice for pizza night.
title: Duchessa Lia 2007  Barbera d'Asti

description: Reddish in color, with raspberry and other high-toned aromas. The palate is fleshy but clean, with good acidity pushing slightly sweet cherry and raspberry flavors. Finishes with sugar and a good mouthfeel. Gets the job done.
title: Ilurce 2008 Rosado Rosé (Rioja)

description: Rubber and earth aromas lead to a mix of berry fruit scents and a pinch of vinegar. It's firm in the mouth, with cranberry and herbal raspberry flavors. Gives about as much as it can but at the same time it shows a tart, basic, mildly herbal DNA.
title: Santa Ema 2009 Selected Terroir Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Bright, fresh wine with a light wood touch. The acidity highlights black currant flavors exacerbated by some greenness.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2008 La Patache  (Médoc)

description: Violet, blackberry and plums on the nose are followed by unctuous, dark berry flavors in his affordable red. The wine has body but is buoyed by good structure and acidity. A very god alternative to everyday reds, and with a more mysterious overall character.
title: Katogi & Strofilia 2013 Mountain Fish Agiorgitiko (Peloponnese)

description: There is a lot of fruit in the aroma and flavor of this wine. That, along with a touch of floral influence, make this medium-bodied wine fresh and alluring. Notes like Anjou pear, jasmine, ripe peach and a hint of vanilla swirl softly around the palate.
title: McManis 2016 Chardonnay (River Junction)

description: Made from Sangiovese, this opens with delicate aromas of red berry and baking spice. The fresh simple palate presents red plum and clove alongside easygoing tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Il Bastardo 2015 Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: Apple aromas are standard, clean and direct. This everyday Chardonnay feels plump, with modest acidic boost. Peach, melon and mild salty flavors finish solid, with no added complexity.
title: Cousiño-Macul 2015 Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Sharp berry and cherry aromas are like nail polish. A hard palate offers zero give, while plum and cherry flavors are tart before turning more sour and medicinal on the finish.
title: 25 Lagunas 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)

description: This Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon blend smells like mushy strawberries, loamy earth and animal fur. It's jammy and not well balanced, with gummy, candied raspberry and plum flavors. Flat and earthy on the finish.
title: Torre Oria 2009 Gran Reserva Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Valencia)

description: Made of 50% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot, 10% Cabernet and 10% Syrah, this opens with aromas of violet, red berry and a whiff of espresso. On the easy-drinking palate, a note of white pepper accents a core of juicy black cherry. It's balanced with fresh acidity and polished tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Capezzana 2013 Monna Nera Red (Toscana)

description: Apple, orange and pear aromas lead this distinctive white blend. On the palate, the wine has an appealing balance of chalkiness paired with exotic fruits. The finish offers complexity with a wash of lively acidity.
title: Hatzimichalis 2012 Lefkos White (Atalanti Valley)

description: Meaty, condensed and full of understated plum and berry fruit. This is a nice bargain Merlot with currant, plum and pepper for flavors, and then a dash of mellow coffee on the finish. With solid core flavors and an integrated mouthfeel, it ranks as a positive wine for the money.
title: Quasar 2006 Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: Horsey, grassy berry aromas are unconvincing. This is plump but also edgy in feel, with a pronounced but weird buttery oak flavor and marginal fruit character. A leafy, oaky finish includes notes of stalky berry and plum.
title: Kenos 2013 Carignan (Curicó Valley)

description: Judged even by its high alcohol, this is not a fresh rosé. While it does have fruit, it is dragged down by its weight. Super-ripe strawberry fruits and pepper complete the overdrawn picture.
title: Domaine de Cause 2015 Bouquet de Cavagnac Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

description: An aroma like canned fruit and rather lean flavors make this a basic wine with a narrow profile.
title: Rotation Vineyards 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: Burnt, acrid, sweaty aromas are less than appealing. This tastes weedy and bitter, while the finish is sour, stalky and underripe.
title: Albada 2014 Viñas Viejas Macabeo (Calatayud)

description: With a touch of honey and ripe white-peach flavors, this crisp wine has a warm side. It is also certainly fruity, lively with acidity and citrus. This is an easy wine, refreshing for the summer, ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Haut Marin 2016 Haut Marin Fossiles White (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: A veritable fruit punch of honeydew, cantaloupe and white-peach flavors, this sweet juicy wine is approachable and appealing. Striking acidity startles the midpalate but freshens the finish nicely.
title: Damiani NV Dolce Bianco White (Finger Lakes)

description: Dusty peach aromas are round and hold up to scrutiny. This densely colored Malbec rosé is ready to drink, with flavors of melon and peach. A touch of skins character adds complexity and texture to the finish. Drink immediately.
title: Bodini 2016 Rosé of Malbec (Mendoza)
