description: Perfumed, chunky and almondy on the nose. Feels full and oily but also a bit juicy, with driving, penetrating orange and grapefruit flavors. Offers proper weight and spicy citrus flavors on the finish. Drink immediately as it's losing freshness and turning yellow.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Volteo 2010 Verdejo-Viognier-Sauvignon Blanc White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: This is a great example of how an affordable wine can still offer quality and character. A compelling nose of tobacco, berry and spice is followed by a play of plum and clean minerality. Balanced and slightly restrained, the wine will pair well with heartier foods like steak or stew.
title: Serengeti 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Coastal Region)

description: This Maipo estate is now aligned with Chateau Ste. Michelle of Washington, which doesn't exactly impact this nice everyday Cabernet. Bramble and fresh berry aromas offer an entry, then there's chewy raspberry on the palate along with a grace of vanilla and some warmth. A bone-warming wine for fall and winter.
title: Haras de Pirque 2004 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Normally the Maipo Valley produces warm, dull Sauvignon Blancs. But this one has more kick and purity of fruit than most. The nose delivers tropical and melon aromas, while the palate is packed with lime, citrus and grapefruit flavors. It's on the big side and a little clingy on the finish, but mostly it gets things right.
title: Haras de Pirque 2006 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Green apple, stone fruit and citrus aromas carry over to the palate with lemon-lime. This easy-drinking wine would make a nice apéritif or pair it with lightly seasoned pastas dishes.
title: Fazio 2013 U Cantu Catarratto (Terre Siciliane)

description: The opening of smoke, rubber and black cherry comes across as being dark and good. The palate holds form with lively cherry, plum and currant flavors and finally a medium-long, somewhat warm and meaty finish. Good for an everyday, no-frills Garnacha.
title: Bodegas y Vinedos del Jalón 2008 Viña Alarba Old Vines Grenache (Calatayud)

description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this easygoing, friendly red opens with aromas of fresh plum and crushed blue flowers. The juicy palate offers up fleshy black cherry, raspberry and a hint of Mediterranean herb alongside round, soft tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Tenuta di Trecciano 2013  Chianti Colli Senesi

description: Slightly lactic notes on the nose detract from the citrusy freshness of the simply refreshing, easy-drinking palate.
title: Martinshof 2014 Lobster Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: Dark plum and berry aromas are fairly full and concentrated, with a boost from spicy oak. A medium-bodied palate offers up tannic rub, while cherry, black plum and oak-based spice flavors finish creamy, dry and spicy, with a hint of tobacco along with mild heat.
title: Vallobera 2013 Pago Malarina  (Rioja)

description: It's a bit simple and a bit soft, but this value-priced wine accomplishes its mission of bringing authentic Marlborough SB flavor to the U.S. at an affordable price. Gooseberry and lime flavors are touched with hints of honey and mint, finishing with a bit of sweetness.
title: Monkey Bay 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This rusty-looking rosé smells rustic, with cherry and raspberry notes. In the mouth, it registers as full-bodied, while the flavor profile is chunky and dry, with early signs of oxidation that are confirmed on a low-steam finish. Drink right away.
title: Real Compañia de Vinos 2013 Rosado (Spain)

description: Herbal and dill infuse the light flavors, and the tannins feel as if they've been softened up in the winemaking process. The wine does a quick fade.
title: Snoqualmie 2007 Whistle Stop Red Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Open-knit aromas of apple, pear, green melon and mineral are perfectly good, while the palate is high in acid and kick. Flavors of grapefruit, generic citrus and grass are solid, as is the finish, which keeps its line. A snappy, alert, easygoing wine.
title: Cono Sur 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Vanilla and white fruits on the nose lead this fuller bodied organic Chard. On the palate, a spicy, robust style of white unfolds, making it ideal for everything from salmon to creamy poultry dishes. Nice spicy finish.
title: Sunshine Organics 2009 Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: Spicy, leafy and dry, with mild red berry aromas. The palate is much the same, with a fresh, acidic mouthfeel and solid, snappy flavors of leafy red berry fruit, pepper and dry spice. Simple but competent wine.
title: Pacifico Sur 2007 Carmenère (Curicó Valley)

description: This unusual white from the southeast corner of Spain smells cidery, with stone-fruit notes and a hint of mustard seed. The palate is juicy but doesn't offer shape or structure. Flavors of peach, mango and celery finish mild, with modest acidity.
title: Bodegas Luzón 2013 Luzón Blanco White (Jumilla)

description: Syrah performs well in the hot, dry climate of Alentejo. This is a perfumed wine, richly tannic although the tannins are cushioned by the red fruits, spice and fresh acidity. It is ready to drink now.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Ciconia Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Aromas of chamomile and citrus zest waft from the glass. The palate is rather lean but offers nectarine and pineapple alongside crisp acidity that gives it a clean finish.
title: Masseria del Feudo 2013 Il Giglio Inzolia (Sicilia)

description: This wine offers a balance of apple and citrus crispness with a touch of buttery oak. The nose is redolent of crisp fruits; on the palate it's refreshing and seafood-friendly. Pair with shellfish or creamy egg dishes.
title: Indaba 2009 Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: Impressively silky for the price, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (53%), Shiraz (35%), Petit Verdot (7%) and Malbec (5%) is a bargain that should be easy enough to find, with 10,000 cases imported. Toasty oak and vanilla notes frame mixed berries and olives, marrying sweet and savory elements into a pleasing, medium-bodied red for early consumption.
title: Bleasdale 2008 Langhorne Crossing Red (Langhorne Creek)

description: Sauvignon Blanc has long been the winery's calling card, but this vintage isn't quite up to past standards. Some high-toned scents add edginess to the tropical fruit, and some bitter skin flavors are borderline too much. Good, but they can do better.
title: Arbor Crest 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pinot Gris is starting to have a presence in Washington, and the straightforward, citrus-flavored fruit shown here suggests a middle-of-the-road style. It's a tart, palate-cleaning wine with a hint of citrus-rind bitterness in the finish.
title: Columbia Winery 2000 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

description: . Racy and strong, and comes down firmly on the grass, hay and grapefruit side, brimming with bright, tart fruit. A touch of sugar puts it just this side of sweet, with an intriguing taste of white chocolate on the finish. Gets the nod because it's so ultra-clean and zesty. —S.H.
title: Geyser Peak 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: This Merlot is dry and scratchy on the nose, with raspberry and spice aromas. It's fresh and clean on the palate, with a quick wave of spicy red-berry flavor. It remains spicy and a touch minty on the finish.
title: Con Carne 2011 Merlot (Central Valley)

description: From the Messina area in northern Sicily, this is a 50-50 blend of Nero d'Avola and Nerello Mascalese that bursts with bright berry freshness. The finish is clean, bright and tight.
title: Cambria 2010 Bazia Rosso Red (Sicilia)

description: Earthy raisin and prune aromas are good in an overripe way. Following the nose, this Garnacha-Tempranillo blend feels dense, thick and chewy. Spicy stewy berry flavors taste chocolaty on a gummy finish.
title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2013 Castillo de Fuendejalon Crianza Red (Campo de Borja)

description: This smells toasted and heady, with a baked apple aroma. The mouthfeel is full, while the flavors tend toward citrus and pith. Solid on the finish.
title: Castellví de la Marca NV Santa Monica Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Here's a fun everyday rosé that offers delicate raspberry and citrus flavors alongside fresh acidity. It's simple but well made, with a clean finish.
title: Stemmari 2016 Rosato (Terre Siciliane)

description: Named after a local order of monks in the Middle Ages, the wine is rounded and easy. The gentle fruitiness gives the wine a zing of acidity. That's balanced by the open and smooth texture and flavors of creamed apple. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A gritty element shares space on the nose with peach and melon aromas. This feels round and basic. Flavors of lightly buttered white fruits don't amount to much, while this tastes a bit like salted butter on the finish.
title: Tres Palacios 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this rosé gives ripe red fruits that are cut with lively acidity. There is a jammy, caramel-flavored backdrop to this wine that makes it heavy rather than fresh. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

description: Great price for a Chardonnay this rich and tasty. It has a buttery, creamy texture, framing tart flavors of pineapples, peaches and vanilla oak.
title: McManis 2008 River Junction Chardonnay (California)

description: Smooth and easy-drinking, this medium-bodied wine has the attributes many people enjoy: vanilla and coconut aromas, lightly sweet apple flavors that coat the palate, and a pear syrup quality that lingers on the finish.
title: Dark Horse 2015 Chardonnay (California)

description: The notes of ash, cherry, and plum are faint and soft in feel but it's well priced for the quality and delivers enough tannic heft to live up to its name.
title: Magnificent Wine Company 2010 Steak House Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Lightly aromatic with notes of pear, spice, and a kiss of caramel. The small amounts of Viognier (9%) and Sémillon (2%) contribute to its medium bodied, viscous feel before leading to a tart, somewhat thin finish.
title: Original House Wine 2011 House Wine Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aromas of peach blossom and mature Bartlett pear lead the nose on this pretty wine. The crisp palate offers green apple and juicy nectarine alongside bright acidity.
title: La Cappuccina 2013 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: A stylish wine, with mineral tannins and a dusty texture. It is cool, elegant and with a tight layer of acidity. There's plenty of firm structure, with berries and sweet fruit to finish. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Falua 2009 Red (Tejo)

description: Spice, apple, light peach and a gentle fruitiness characterize this Riesling. There are deeper notes as well, skin phenolics that add texture and earthiness. But fruit is front and center, with crisp acidity right behind it.
title: Barnard Griffin 2009 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This blend of Petit Verdot (40%), Grenache (29%), Shiraz (29%) and Mataro (2%) ends up being a pleasing recipe at an even more pleasing price. Mulberry, plum and vanilla flavors emerge from the glass, while the mouthfeel is full and lush. Probably best over the next year or so.
title: Rocland Estate 2007 Ass Kisser Fine Red Wine Red (South Australia)

description: This is a dense wine with firm tannins and a solid structure. The black currant fruits are stalky and still developing, along with the acidity. It's a lean wine and needs to age for a few more months to fill out, so drink from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2013 Maria Mora Red (Alentejano)

description: Yes, this is a rosé of Merlot from high altitude vineyards in the south of France. It's medium in weight, offering hints of red berries, wild herbs and wet stones and a clean, refreshing finish. Drink now.
title: Marrenon 2015 Rosé de Merlot Les Grains Merlot (Mediterranée)

description: The welcoming aromas of red berry and cherry are slightly smoky and spicy. Showing good body, this has light tannins, with flavors of toasty plum, berry, chocolate and spice. It's round, mellow and easy on the finish.
title: Salvatore Principe 2011 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: A little sweet, like a fruit juice blend of oranges and pineapples, but nicely crisp, with balancing acidity and a firm touch of minerals. It's a sound house white wine for everyday purposes.
title: Ca' Momi 2009 Bianco di Napa White (Napa Valley)

description: This sophisticated and stylish Pinot Noir from the south of France was made a Burgundy producer. It has fine tannins, juicy red cherry-driven acidity and a warm, ripe aftertaste.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Tramier Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: A hint of green-floral perfume wafts amidst notes of honey and apple on this off-dry Riesling. Spine-tingling with acidity, it's balanced with sweet yellow peach and cherry flavors. Irresistibly easy drinking, it finishes moderately long.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2013 Riesling (Mosel)

description: This light-bodied Chardonnay makes a nice break from rich, heavy, oaky versions. Aromas of dried thyme and parsley lead to pleasing fruit flavors of pear and peach. It has enough texture to fill the mouth and enough crispness to stay clean on the finish.
title: McManis 2013 Chardonnay (River Junction)

description: A bright pink wine that tastes drier than it looks. It has bright strawberry aromas, as well as touches of caramel and lively final acidity. It's not for aging.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Rosé (Dão)

description: This smells light and soapy at first, with modest berry fruit aromas and a pinch of leather. In the mouth, the structure is soft. Flavors of warm, syrupy berry fruits finish sweet and generic.
title: Pueblo del Sol 2010 Tannat (Juanico)

description: This is a lively, fruity wine that is ready to drink now. It has juicy fruitiness from black currant and strawberry notes, along with soft tannins.
title: Château la France 2011 Cuvée Gallus  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: As crisp as possible, this is a light, strawberry fruited wine with balanced acidity and a fresh, delicious aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Fresh and ripe, packed with red berry fruits, this is a young and fruity wine that is perfect to drink right away. It's light, bright and refreshing.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Alandra Rosé (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A light color goes along with light plum and red cherry flavors, a soft texture and light to medium body. This wine is pleasant and straightforward.
title: Paranoia 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: An inexpensive, large-production Pinot that's overly earthy and a little thin on the finish with a smidgen of residual sugar thrown in too, but reasonably priced and decently quaffable with food.
title: Concannon 2009 Selected Vineyards, Central Coast Pinot Noir (Livermore Valley)

description: A smooth wine, feeling light in style, with a touch of acidity to go with the gentle tannins. It is now quite ready to drink, easy and approachable.
title: Caves Aliança 2008 Vista Tinto Tinta Roriz (Beiras)

description: Clean and light with easy-pleasing notes of red apple flesh and tropical fruit acidity. A touch of buttered toasted challah bread adds depth to the close. Drink now.
title: Two Oceans 2010 Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: Stalky aromas suggest hay and green herbs, with raspberry in the backdrop. It's hot and short in terms of mouthfeel, with herbal flavors leading the way and berry fruit running behind. Dry red fruit and herbal notes dominate the finish.
title: Don Cristobal 1492 2010 Finca La Niña Malbec (Mendoza)

description: A generous wine that still manages to keep elegance and style. It offers black, juicy fruits that are blended with the spice from wood aging. There are blackberries, plenty of acidity and a dry but always fruity aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Vilalva 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This ripe, bold wine is rich in black fruits. They cushion the naturally prominent tannins of Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional that form part of the blend. It is a solid effort, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Perescuma 2014 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft wine, fruity without great definition. A ripe, red fruit character contrasts with a bitter acidity. It is ready to drink. The blend is 50/50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Château Taussin 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Vanilla, apple juice and banana aromas comprise the nose on this flat feeling, sugary tasting Cava that claims to be “dry” but tastes anything but. Flavors of ripe banana, vanilla and papaya taste like powdered sugar on the finish.
title: Dominio de Punctum NV Bubbles by Lobetia Sparkling (Spain)

description: Gritty aromas of raisin and dusty earth are jumbled. This has a heavy, somewhat awkward palate, while raisiny flavors finish chunky, candied and slightly bitter.
title: Valdelana 2013 Selección Braille  (Rioja)

description: Welcoming but basic cassis and berry aromas carrry a leathery accent and a hint of rubber. The palate is mildly creamy and comfortable, with cassis, cherry and plum flavors but little beyond that. A clean finish cements this well-made wine's value position.
title: Santa Helena 2011 Selección del Directorio Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Light, tart, slightly green fruit flavors don't add up to much. There is an undertone of old barrel or something not quite fresh. Simple and plain.
title: Oak Knoll 2008 Winemakers Select Unoaked Chardonnay (Oregon)

description: Pretty harsh, with unripe, green tannins and tart pepper and blackberry flavors. The price is pretty good, at least.
title: Glen Ellen 2008 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Jammy and flat smelling, with little to no depth to the nose. The palate is snappy but there's just enough body to offset the acidity, while the flavors of red fruits are tart and regular. Dull tasting, with a fairly long finish that's unexciting.
title: Bodegas Iranzo 2009 Vertus Tempranillo (Utiel-Requena)

description: Hard to like this dry, bitter wine. It's cutting and tannic in the mouth, with very modest blackberry fruit.
title: Napa Family Vineyards 2007 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Soft and simple, with jammy berry-cherry flavors and some bitterness throughout.
title: Big House 2008 Red Red (California)

description: Here's a terrific value wine that would pair with ground beef, grilled sausage or oven-baked lasagna with meat sauce. The wine has a dark, concentrated color, and it opens with generous aromas of black berry and tobacco.
title: Talamonti 2008 Modà  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: Plum, berry and milk chocolate aromas are not too aggressive. The palate is round and friendly feeling, with flavors of wild berry, sweet oak and carob. Finishes with solid oaky flavors. Good Syrah that's uncomplicated and generally well made.
title: Siegel 2010 Crucero Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

description: Lean and racy, with limes and tart green apples playing major roles. If not for a dollop of sugar, it might seem a bit sour, but as it is it comes across as pleasantly tart and properly acidic.
title: Shelton Vineyards 2002 Riesling (North Carolina)

description: A lovely wine, teetering on the edge of sweetness. The pretty apple, apricot, and honeysuckle flavors have a crisp, steely edge of acidity, and there's a rich streak of mineral and diesel that adds complexity.
title: Jekel 2001 Riesling (Monterey)

description: Slightly floral on the nose, with some pear and nectarine as well, this light-bodied wine blends sweet stone-fruit flavors with tart green apples on the palate, giving it a degree of balance.
title: Lucas Vineyards 2002 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Goes down so easy; if you can't get away to Cancun for vacation, this is the next best thing. This is a tropical Chardonnay if ever there was one, with pineapple and melon notes on the palate, and with pineapple and coconut on the nose. Finishes dry, with some citrus peel.
title: Riverina Estates 2001 Warburn Chardonnay (New South Wales)

description: A good buy in a dry, full-bodied red wine. Clean and balanced, with jammy flavors of plums, earth and blackberry, it has well-etched and accessible tannins, a rich mouthfeel, and a spicy finish. Value.
title: Ravenswood 2000 Vintners Blend Merlot (California)

description: There's a zippy citrus note on the nose, though the underlying aroma is of cracker, or flour; the citrusy streak resurfaces on the palate and carries through to the finish. A little creaminess rounds out the nose. Quite a value for Barossa Chardonnay.
title: Barossa Valley Estate 2002 Spires Chardonnay (Barossa Valley)

description: A light barnyard note is accompanied by grilled meat, red plum and tobacco that carries to the palate. The acidity is somewhat spritzy and the tannins are sheer, so this is very juicy and suited to everyday fare.
title: Rawson's 2002 Shiraz (Breede River Valley)

description: This blended white combines Tocai Friulano (60%) with Pinot Bianco (25%) and Pinot Grigio (15%) in a tasty, corpulent wine well worth its modest price. Bold flavors of oranges, pink grapefruits and ripe cherries mingle in the mouth; the only quibble is that it finishes a little short.
title: Maculan 2002 Pino & Toi White (Veneto)

description: With its flamboyant aromas of oranges, tangerines and apricots, this screams “Muscat” at the top of its lungs. The plump flavors of tropical and citrus fruits make it easy to like and easy to drink. Great as an apéritif.
title: João Pires 2001 Muscat of Alexandria Muscat (Terras do Sado)

description: This is a late release, but it's in good shape. The nose is earthy and dense, with just a nip of wet fur and forest floor. The palate is all about sweet berries and ripeness, while the finish is warm and lengthy. It's solid and without any obvious flaws even if it doesn't thump its chest and overwhelm you.
title: La Playa 1999 Estate Reserve Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: There's matchstick to the nose along with aromas of lychee and tropical fruits. This is a bit heavy and creamy on the tongue, with sweet, lightly grassy flavors of melon and citrus.
title: Finca La Luz 2013 Callejon del Crimen Estate Torrontés (Uco Valley)

description: Hearty and rustic, this is a blend of several varieties—including Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah—it's an all-purpose, slightly sweet red wine for drinking with spaghetti and meatballs, burgers and chili.
title: St. Francis 2007 Red Splash Red (Sonoma County)

description: This smells flat and stewy, with jammy sweetness and little punch. Conversely, it's pointy on the palate, with tart, generic red-berry flavors and warmth on the finish. A blend of Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Vicente Gandia 2007 Hoya de Cadenas Reserva Privada Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Utiel-Requena)

description: The Arinto grape and the town of Bucelas go together. This small enclave in the larger Lisboa region produces this crisp fruity style, like a southern version of dry Vinho Verde but with extra weight. Drink this attractive, lemon and red-apple flavored wine now.
title: Caves Velhas 2016 Arinto (Bucelas)

description: This is a crisp wine, full of acidity. It holds the potential of crisp green and citrus fruits that are developing. A nutty edge contrasts with the tense acidity. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Terres Douces 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a finely made wine, fresh and crisp. It is dry but with a soft texture that turns it into a wine that's both good with food and as an apéritif. The aftertaste is crisp and still fruity.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Portugal Ramos Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A smooth, easy-drinking Chardonnay, with mild, understated aromas of green apple and toast, but also sweet tropical fruit flavors and a ripe pineapple-citrus finish that picks up hints of oranges. Best Buy.
title: McGuigan 2001 Bin 7000 Chardonnay (Hunter Valley)

description: Past its sell-by date, with mealy aromas and dull flavors of apple and banana. The feel is flat, the acidity is not there, and the finish is bland and a little bitter.
title: Carlos Basso 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

description: Rubbery and rhubarby on the nose, then confected and frankly sweet-tasting on the palate, with a short finish.
title: Friday Monkey 2006 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

description: Soft and syrupy, with semisweet flavors of berries and anise.
title: Ca' Momi 2007 Rosso Di California Red (California)

description: This wine sports a green-apple and pear nose with some extra weight from barrel fermentation. Well-balanced and right on the border between stainless- steel and barrel-fermented styles: steel meets butter on the palate. Best Buy.
title: Covey Run 1998 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Black fruit and soft tannins yield a wine that is rounded with some attractive texture. Its ripe black currant fruitiness is lifted by its crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015 Merlot (Vin de France)

description: A creamy style of Sauvignon Blanc, showing soft pear juice and flora flavors, fresh with a feeling of richness. Screwcap.
region_1: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2009 Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Here's an earthy, dark red with soft tannins that's perfectly approachable now. Menthol, blackberries, cassis and leathery spice fill the nose and mouth, with moderate weight and a medium finish. A nice choice for grilled or herb-crusted lamb chops.
title: Graham Beck 2008 Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon (Western Cape)

description: From vines in the upper Douro valley, this is an intense wine that's still young. Its smooth, ripe black cherry fruits are followed by blueberry, spice from wood and bitter chocolate. This is a complex wine that finishes fresh.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2005 Fronteira Red (Douro)

description: Flavors of banana and red berry come with some tannin. This exudes vibrant, in-your-face fruit that's crisp and juicy.
title: Mommessin 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: There's a touch of ripe fruit followed by prune and dark tobacco. This Nero d'Avola is smooth and soft on the palate, with a touch of ripe fruit, plus notes of prune and dark tobacco. It would pair well with spicy chicken wings.
title: Botter 2011 Caleo Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: As tasty as a pear tart, this combines mild pear, vanilla and almond flavors on a smooth texture. Medium bodied, balanced slightly to the soft side, and quite fruity, it will make a satisfying glass at cocktail time or with dinner.
title: Fetzer 2013 Sundial Chardonnay (California)

description: Lime and passion fruit aromas are subtle and appealing. This delivers a fresh, alert palate and crisp, lightly brined flavors of lettuce, apple and cucumber. On the finish, it runs peppery but not overly aggressive.
title: Santa Alba 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: This fresh, fruity wine offers pure red fruits with light tannins. Very much in a Beaujolais style, this is juicy, with balancing acidity over sweet raspberry fruit flavors. Screwcap.
title: Hafner 2006 St. Laurent Classique St. Laurent (Burgenland)

description: Can't really say there's much difference between this and Carta Vieja's Classico SB. Both are bland, with chunky apple and pear characteristics. Neither has much of a pulse, but on the plus side they aren't nasty or aggressive. This “limited release” turns out to be a basic wine for basicoccasions.
title: Carta Vieja 2008 Single Vineyard Limited Release Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Loncomilla Valley)

description: Both the gorgeous purple color and the nose of fresh grapes make this wine a dead ringer for Beaujolais. The soft palate shows notes of sweet strawberries but has sufficient acidity to leave a refreshing impression in the mouth. Drink now.
title: Les Jamelles 2007 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays de L'Aude)

description: Luminous and bright, this well-priced Pinot Grigio doles out fresh fruit flavors of peach, apricot and tangerine. The wine is lean and firm with an easygoing approach and spicy crispness on the finish.
title: Blason 2007 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

description: A bit rough and edgy, but for the price, you get a pretty nice glassful of wine. This dry Cab offers rich black currant, blackberry, mulberry and cedar flavors.
title: Ironstone 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Lovely cassis and jam scents are hampered by some slight musty aromas, which eventually give way to a blast of black licorice. Burnt sugar and cassis dominate the soft, sweetish palate that offers just a bit of grip. The short finish is reminiscent of a raspberry cordial. Drink up.
title: Les Jamelles 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Rich waves of red berries and cinnamon spice lead this soft, dry red. On the palate, it's slightly aimless with quiet berry fruit flavors and a spin of minerals. This is an easy-drinking red that's nice with cheese and tomato-based dishes.
title: Achaia Clauss NV Demestica Red Red (Greece)

description: Sweet apple aromas are probably the most defined thing coming off the innocuous nose, while the palate is forceful and citrusy, with jangly pineapple, peach and lemon flavors. Amplified white wine with a vague Viognier identity.
title: Lagarde 2009 Altas Cumbres Viognier (Luján de Cuyo)

description: This is a soft wine, ripe with lime and grapefruit flavors that are sweetened with juicy red apple. It's tangy as well, laced with orange zest and filled with steely acidity. It should age a few months, so drink from late 2015.
title: Château la France 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Here's a classic example of why Americans are buying Pinot Grigio. The wine is marked by fresh, zesty acidity that cleanses the palate and is so compatible with things like goat cheese and grilled veggies. Very slightly sweet, it shows flavors of limes, Meyer lemons, pineapples and clover honey.
title: Meridian 2006 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Stocky and warm, with mild baked-fruit aromas and a hint of bramble. This venerable table wine is made from 65% Garnacha and 35 Cariñena, and from 2005 it's pretty much on the money. Expect earthy, mildly brambly flavors, lively acidity and soft tannins. Good for a wide range of simple foods and appetizers.
title: Torres 2005 Sangre de Toro Red (Catalunya)

description: A decent effort, with notes of spice, brambly wild berries, smoke and licorice mingling together. It doesn't quite snap into focus, but there's never a dull moment. The finish gets chalky as the tannins take over.
title: Snoqualmie 2006 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: For the price, you get a fair deal with this dry, clean wine. It has flavors of cherries and oak and spice, and goes down nice and easy.
title: Ironstone 2006 Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

description: Slightly sharp and brambly on the nose, with muddled fruit aromas. The palate is both lactic and snappy, with spiky acidity mixed with buttery, creamy notes. Finishes kind of pasty, with bite and grab. Even at $10 this Maule Valley Pinot struggles with the pleasure factor.
title: Santa Carolina 2007 Reserva Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Bold and modern in style, this blend of Merlot and Syrah shows ripe fruit and blackberry, with soft endnotes of leather and chocolate.
title: Feudi del Pisciotto 2010 Baglio del Sole Red (Sicilia)

description: This opens with aromas of black cherry, chocolate, prune and blackberry jam. Freshness and subtle softness picks up on the rear of the wine.
title: Feudo Arancio 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sicilia)

description: Yeasty white-fruit aromas of melon and peach set up a narrow feeling palate with nectarine and peach flavors. This is straightforward Verdejo with no frills. The finish is lasting but simple in feel and flavor. Drink this fresh, quaffable wine right away.
title: Cantarranas 2012 Verdejo (Rueda)

description: Dark in color, this wine has an oaky and earthy nose, with a compost streak. It feels full and stocky, and it tastes of resiny oak and dry berry fruits. It finishes with a citrus-like juiciness.
title: Viña La Fortuna 2011 Culpeo Made with Organic Grapes Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)

description: Flat on the nose, this has a mild whiff of paint or turpentine along with touches of banana and melon. The palate is flat and chunky in feel, with clipped, pithy flavors of mealy citrus.
title: San Nicolas 2011 Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: This simple, slightly sweet Pinot Grigio has some veggie-like underripeness, but offers enough orange and peach fruit to satisfy.
title: Beautiful Dream 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: The flabby citrus aroma is dusty and shows a tinge of vanilla, which is an aroma that isn't normally associated with Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is big and globby, with an oily note and flavors of citrus, green herb and nettle.
title: Viña Requingua 2012 Puerto Viejo Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Dry, tart and simple, this has a flavor of sour cherry candy. A fine wine for pouring at big parties.
title: Bogle 2010 Merlot (California)

description: Warm, syrupy, jammy and brambly up front, with the grape's typical meaty, herbal aromas. The palate is soft save for core acidity, while the flavors run medium-rich and plummy, with controlled sourness. Solid for the money, with a chunky disposition.
title: Calina 2009 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Generic Chardonnay but still pretty good, with oily, nutty, tropical aromas followed by a zesty, acidic palate that loads up on apple and citrusy orange-like flavors. Shows good length and clarity on the finish, and overall it outperforms the winery's so-called “reserva” Chard from the same year.
title: Siegel 2009 Crucero Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is a fruit-forward wine (aged only in stainless steel to maintain the freshness of the berry aromas) that would pair with cheesy pasta dishes. It's an easy, no-fuss Barbera with a refreshing note of acidity on the close.
title: Cantine San Silvestro 2009 Ottone I  (Barbera di Piemonte)

description: Simple, bright and genuine, this Cabernet Sauvignon offers layers of blackberry, leather and prune.
title: Cavit 2010 Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Trentino)

description: A good everyday Merlot that's dry and softly tannic, with pleasant cherry, cola and spice flavors.
title: Grayson 2010 Lot 6 Merlot (California)

description: Rugged and roasted on the bouquet, with rubbery blackberry and freshly laid tar aromas. It feels big and solid, but simple, with raspberry, strawberry and a hint of green herb on the palate. The finish is mild tasting, with a cocoa note.
title: Bodegas Pirineos 2010 Selección Mesache Tinto Garnacha-Monastrell (Somontano)

description: Drawn down on the nose and showing a chemical edge to the berry fruit aromas. The palate is wayward and candied, with heavy plum and vanilla flavors. Creamy but dull on the finish, with a sticky, raisiny quality. Lacks focus and vitality.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2008 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Tropical fruit and a touch of lemon lead on this gentle white. Elegant and approachable, its combination of crisp lemon and citrus with rounded tropical fruit flavors gives it a balanced, complex edge. Soft spice and a lemon zing finish it off.
title: Robertson Winery 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

description: A balanced Malbec with red fruit aromas and just a touch of aged cheese on the nose. The palate is creamy and slightly candied, with layered black fruit, fig and chocolate flavors. Creamy and candied but lively on the finish, with enough integrity and structure to rank as a Best Buy.
title: Condor's Summit 2009 Malbec (Famatina Valley)

description: Saucy, spicy berry aromas are earthy. This has a fleshy, jammy mouthfeel and flavors of blueberry, cassis and blackberry. A dry, spicy, lightly herbal finish confirms the wine's above-average status.
title: Dancing Flame 2014 Ojos del Salado Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Smoky berry aromas are natural but nothing special. This has a regular, balanced mouthfeel along with flavors of cherry, cassis, herbs and spice. A modest finish is fresh and holds it together.
title: Alto Los Romeros 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Though unstated on the label, this is made from Pinot Gris. It seems to be glowing, an almost day-glo shade of orange, and is quite dry, with flavors of pine needles and watermelon.
title: Château Bianca 2014 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: This is an attractive wine that is crisp while also having a soft background texture. It is fruity, perfumed and balanced. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Tres Castas White (Vinho Verde)

description: Aromas of forced oak, plastic and berry fruits don't forecast how tight, shrill and acidic the palate is. Snappy flavors of red plum and red currant teeter on being sour, while acidity is what keeps this cranking through a sharp, oaky finish.
title: Viña La Fortuna 2011 Culpeo Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: An aromatic opening of raisin and prune is a clarion announcement that this is on the overripe side. The mouthfeel, which is heavy and chunky but also fruity, is confirmation of the wine's ripeness level. Flavors of baked plum, raisin and chocolate finish deep and raisiny.
title: J. Garcia Carrion 2009 Antaño Crianza  (Rioja)

description: Citrus and passion fruit aromas emphasize the SB over the Verdejo component, even though the blend is 70% Verdejo and 30% SB. A zesty, pithy feeling palate houses citrus peel and pithy flavors, while the finish tastes the same.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Volteo 2012 Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: One wants to be kind to this wine, which seeks to be affordable to everyone who desires a Pinot Noir. It's dry and silky, with simple cherry candy and cola flavors.
title: Insatiable 2012 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Fleshy stone-fruit aromas announce a fuller-bodied wine made from Garnacha. Straightforward citrus and nectarine flavors are fresh and clean, continuing to a pithy, slightly briny-tasting finish.
title: Aragus 2016 Rosado Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

description: Ripe and structured, this is a concentrated wine. Its blackberry fruits are powerful and dense with tannins as well as acidity. It will take some time for the juiciness to really show, so wait until late 2018.
title: Château Lauzanet 2015  Bordeaux

description: A slightly volatile nose hints at ripeness but does not suggest much fruit. The off-dry palate rounds out flavors and adds a hint of strawberry to a tart lemon core. The body is light and slightly diffuse. Drink soon.
title: una.wine 2016 Rosé (Burgenland)

description: Chocolaty and malty to start with, then more meaty, rubbery and traditional on the nose. The palate is round and just right in feel, while the palate is meaty, layered and savory, with juicy acidity and savory undercurrents. Cutting and food-friendly, and very well-made for a $10 wine.
title: Dolce Stefania 2007 Bonarda (Mendoza)

description:
Brisk and clean, this dry white is the 
anti-Chardonnay, marked by tart citrus flavors that make it versatile with a wide range of foods.
title: Montevina 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Initially austere, this wine is driven by notes of bitter chocolate and lean fruit. The fruit weight promises some attractive aging, but for the present, it is firm, dry and solidly tannic.
title: Château Bois Redon 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Jammy and fruit forward, this has intense notes of strawberry, blueberry and plum flesh throughout. The lively palate is bright and juicy, ending with an easy, mouthwatering finish. Mevushal.
title: Dovev 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)

description: Dark in color, this delivers black fruit aromas along with a toasty note. While it's slightly hollow in the middle, it's wide around the edges, tasting of mossy blackberry and herb. The finish is toasty, big and grabby.
title: Viña La Fortuna 2010 Culpeo Made with Organic Grapes Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: This is an aromatic wine with generous fruit and soft tannins. Its wood aging has given the wine extra richness as well as spice. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Alteza Red (Lisboa)

description: Named after an Arabic battle cry and now an expression that's shouted at wine festivals, the wine is lightly wood aged, ripe although with a stalky edge. It's easy and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Conde 2016 Algazarra Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a strongly perfumed wine with a curious barnyard flavor that hides the fruitiness. This spoils the tangy texture and acidity that are there in the back.
title: Quinta de Paços 2016 Fernão Pires (Minho)

description: Lightly perfumed, this is a simple, fruity wine that is ready to drink. It is floral, with a citrus flavor and a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2016 Rota de Cabral Fernão Pires (Tejo)

description: This earthy wine has barnyard aromas and a rough edge. The redeeming feature is the juicy black-currant fruit that provides a crisp aftertaste.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Terraços do Tejo Red (Tejo)

description: The fresh berry aromas are solid, and the palate is plucky and lively, with plenty of acidity to push the ripe, standard Malbec flavors of blackberry and spice. It shows some tartaric crispness and bite on the finish, but tastes right.
title: Alma del Sur 2011 Colección Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Packed with jammy fruit and sweet raspberry flavors, this easy rosé would make a great partner to cocktail appetizers. The finish shows flavors of wild berry and bitter almond.
title: Masciarelli 2010 Rosé (Colline Teatine)

description: Here's an Italian-styled Pinot Grigio, with a gently nutty nose and earthy low notes. It's faintly oily in the mouth but finishes crisp and light, with a pretty lemon zest accent. Drink up.
title: Redbank 2008 The Long Paddock Pinot Grigio (Victoria)

description: This wine has weight and considerable richness. Spice and an attractive perfume meld with the blackberry fruits and juicy acidity. The Castelão grape is at home in this region, which shows in the sense of terroir in this bold wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Fonte do Beco Castelão (Península de Setúbal)

description: The lightly floral, soapy aroma of this wine shows some varietal character. The palate is buttressed with flavors of talc and a wash of rose water. The complexity stops there, and this seems to be a wine that should be consumed within the first year or two.
title: Château Bianca 2012 Gewurztraminer (Willamette Valley)

description: Light, fresh aromas of tomato and plum are gritty. This feels round for the most part, with rubbery tannins. Medicinal, slightly minty plum and berry flavors end with acceptable rawness and a latex note.
title: Finca del Castillo 2014 Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: This is a simple wine with friendly pear and apple aromas. The palate has modest complexity, with fresh acids and a touch of oak. Core flavors of peach and apple finish with modest accents of toast and popcorn.
title: Santa Helena 2011 Selección del Directorio Gran Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: This Chardonnay has flavors of rich, ripe tropical fruit, tangerine, apricot and lime. The tangy acidity provides a keen finish.
title: Smoking Loon 2011 Steelbird Unoaked Chardonnay (California)

description: Monovarietal wines made from Sangiovese are a new concept for Sicily. The wine exhibits a dark ruby color, with sweet aromas of cherry and blackberry. A touch of white almond marks the finish.
title: Stemmari 2010 Sangiovese (Sicilia)

description: Dark ruby in color, this has soft aromas of cherry, black fruit and cassis. There's a bright point of acidity that would pair with pasta with cheese.
title: Stemmari 2011 Pinot Noir (Sicilia)

description: Pleasant and straightforward, this has notes of pear, mead and herbs. It's full in feel with a big ball of fruit flavors in the middle but less around it. The tannins have a slightly drying feel.
title: Ryan Patrick 2013 Naked Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Green apple is the lead aroma along with yeasty vanilla and a dash of white pepper. There's modest roundness to the palate and nonscouring bright acidity. Slightly candied lime and mango flavors feature controlled bitterness on the finish.
title: Santa Ema 2014 Select Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Aromas of underbrush, grilled mushroom, blue flower and menthol lead the nose. The linear palate offers dried plum, mature blackberry, espresso and licorice while firm tannins provide support. It finishes on a note of graphite.
title: Tenute Girolamo 2013 La Voliera Red (Salice Salentino)

description: An everyday Cabernet that's just barely worth the price. It's soft and sweet in pie-filling cherry and blackberry flavors.
title: Castle Rock 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: A disappointing effort This is earthy and dank, with dark, leathery notes contrasting sharply with bright acids on the finish.
title: Père Anselme 2008 La Grivelière Tete de Cuvee Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: A wood-aged, rich and full wine, benefiting from the year and giving out fine perfumes, rich tannins and dark berry flavors. It's a wine with enough power to age further, already a solid pleasure to drink.
designation: Domaine le Petit Bon Dieu Réserve
title: Paul Buisse 2009 Domaine le Petit Bon Dieu Réserve Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

description: Slightly rubbery black cherry and blackberry aromas are generic but good. This feels round and easygoing, with soft tannins and modest acidity. Black-plum flavors fly solo, while this is nice but hollow on the finish. Drink now.
title: Vega Montán 2014 Mencía (Bierzo)

description: This blend of 70% Pinotage and 30% Merlot shows herbal notes of bramble and black plum skins alongside a rubbery accent. Medium weight with a soft, round mouth and a clean finish.
title: Stellenbosch Hills 2009 Polkadraai Pinotage-Merlot (Polkadraai Hills)

description: Straightforward and approachable with notes of tart cherry and red plum dusted with cocoa powder on the nose and mouth. Drink now.
title: Rooiberg 2008 Shiraz (Robertson)

description: About as typical and pleasant as you'll find in this price range. The nose is snappy, with aromas of fresh peas, bell pepper, citrus and wild herbs. Feels light and fresh, with flavors of lime and apple alongside tangerine.
title: Ventisquero 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: If you are staging an informal outdoor barbecue with franks and burgers, this value wine will meet all your pairing needs. It's soft, plush and round, with exotic spice, ripe fruit and black pepper.
title: Feudo Arancio 2010 Stemmari Cabernet Sauvignon (Sicilia)

description: Here's a solid and accessible Shiraz with medium- intense notes of red cherry, raspberry and cola on the nose and mouth. The mouth is medium weight with delicate tannins and black pepper spice, while the finish offers a glimmer of mocha.
title: Douglas Green 2008 Vineyard Creations Shiraz (Western Cape)

description: A little generic, but overall this is a nice, simple, easy-to-like Cab with clean aromas and good structure and flavors. The nose is snappy, while the palate is driven by cherry, raspberry and plum flavors. Lasting and lively on the finish, with a modicum of complexity.
title: Santa Helena 2009 Selección del Directorio Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Apple, spice and mild yeast aromas are composed and hint at complexity. This feels complete, with a layer or two of depth. Dry flavors of apple and apricot are clean and direct.
title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 Federico Paternina Banda Azul Sparkling (Cava)

description: This fresh, crisp wine has a light salmon-pink color. It bursts with attractive red and citrus fruits to give a bright character plus tight acidity. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Bonhur 2015 Château Merlet Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Fresh apple, peach and generous flavors of vanilla and coconut rest on a pillowy texture. The wine is fruity and light, without noticeable acidity.
title: Belle Ambiance 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: Grapy and perfumed on the nose, this quaffable Garnacha is sound and fresh, albeit a bit acidic. Black-fruit flavors are common and show notes of earth and chocolate, while a grabby finish displays no glaring faults.
title: Beso de Vino 2014 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: Rubbery black plum and berry aromas lead to a fresh, tight palate with astringent tannins. Generic berry flavors are angular, while this everyday Garnacha is tannic and scratchy on the finish.
title: Castillo de Monséran 2014 Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: Spicy, leathery berry aromas are aggressive. This Tempranillo feels grabby and rubbery, while saucy berry and plum flavors lean in the direction of stewy. A finish with rustic berry flavors runs long.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Mano A Mano 2013 Manon Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: A simple, medium-bodied Chardonnay that emphasizes the variety's fruity characteristics. Apple, pineapple and citrus pick up a hint of peppery or clove-like spice on the finish.
title: Stratum 2010 Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: Dry, tannic and acidic, with proper flavors of blackberries and cherries. Perfectly fine for drinking at parties.
title: Firefly Ridge 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: Sweet in apricot, orange and vanilla flavors, this Moscato should appeal to many consumers.
title: Firefly Ridge 2011 Moscato (California)

description: Sweet red-fruit aromas are mild and earthy. This feels rough on its own but will drink well with food. Flavors of plum, berry and chocolate lead to a similar-tasting, medium finish.
title: Alma del Sur 2011 Colección Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: A fruity blend of four local Alentejo grapes, this wine is soft and smoothly rich with fine acidity and a mix of yellow fruit and apple flavors. It has plenty of crisp acidity to bring out a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2016 DJ Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Very fruity and a little spicy, this medium- to full-bodied wine has a smooth texture, nicely concentrated black-cherry and blueberry flavors and a good sense of layering and length.
title: Rare 2014 Purple Blend Red (California)

description: One whiff says this hails from a warmer region like Maule as opposed to someplace cool and coastal. The aromas are tropical more than zesty, with notes of mango and banana. On the palate, this is round but acidic enough, while flavors of tangerine, grapefruit and lime wind down well.
designation: Puerto Viejo Estate Bottled Single Vineyard Reserve
title: Viña Requingua 2012 Puerto Viejo Estate Bottled Single Vineyard Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Simple, sweet and oaky, this Chard has ripe flavors of tropical fruits, pears, lemon tarts and vanilla. It's fine for big parties where Chard is in demand.
title: Sonoma Creek 2006 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Mellow but friendly berry aromas feed into a firm palate with tight red-fruit tannins and then ripe flavors of blackberry and chocolate cake. The finish is toasty, with a chocolate mint-chip note and acidic snap.
title: Trapiche 2012 Oak Cask Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: As always, Loios is a bright and fruity wine that is ready to drink young. With peach, grapefruit and red apple flavors, it's a soft wine with a crisp streak. It is ready to drink now and will be better at the end of 2014.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Simple but well made, it discloses pretty aromas of yellow flowers. The bright palate delivers zesty citrus, pear and melon alongside crisp acidity. Pair with seafood salad or sip as an apéritif.
title: Cantina di Soave 2012 Re Midas  (Soave)

description: Made in the pale modern style, this has modest scents of melon and stone fruit. It's fully dry, with a zesty, clean finish that hints at lime and red berries.
title: Les Trois Couronnes 2015 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Aromas of this wine convey notes of roasted corn on the cob, popcorn and peach. The stone-fruit flavors are sweet and easygoing.
title: Original House Wine 2013 Chardonnay (America)

description: Restrained aromas suggesting acacia flower, nut and honey lead the nose. The subdued palate offers yellow apple skin, hazelnut and mineral alongside fresh acidity.
title: Rocca di Fabbri 2015 Grechetto (Colli Martani)

description: A light and crisp wine that has a creamed apple texture. It is fruity, light with a fine citrus tang to add to the general freshness of the wine. The name suggests a very appropriate pairing.
title: Barton & Guestier 2015 Passeport Lobster & Shrimp  (Muscadet)

description: An earthy, edgy character derives from slightly funky, smoky aromas and flavors, and a rather sharp texture. Savory and earthy flavors dominate the subtle fruit, and a core of dry tannins emphasizes the lean profile.
title: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Pinot Noir (Lodi)

description: Herbaceous and aromatic with a touch of minerality, this is a crisply light wine. It is bright, cool and ready to drink.
title: Chantebelle 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Burnt smelling like charred steak, this also offers raw oak scents along with boysenberry aromas. A dense, pounding, tannic palate holds blackened, peppery flavors of blackberry. A smoky finish smolders with peppery spice and hard tannins.
title: R+ 2012  Ribera del Duero

description: With the lightest, freshest tingle on the tongue, this is an off-dry wine that is crisp and fresh, combining citrus with sweetness. It is light-bodied, bright and ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2014 Encostas do Lima White (Vinho Verde)

description: A lovely flinty character graces the yellow apple, peach and orange cream aromas on the nose of this friendly wine. It's quite round and mouthfilling, with a prevailing smoky flavor on the palate that's reminiscent of baked apple with bacon crumble. Drink now.
title: Robertson Winery 2015 Chardonnay (Robertson)

description: Sharp scents of clove, cherry syrup and tobacco lead into a rough, tart and tannic wine with no particular varietal character.
title: Silver Lake 2005 Syrah (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: To the blend of local Aragonez and Trincadeira, the producer has added the Dão's Alfrocheiro. That gives a ripe and attractively perfumed wine. It is soft and juicy, full of rich berry fruits and with a generous, warm texture. Drink now.
title: Herdade Grande 2014 Audaz Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This smooth, wood-aged wine is ripe with red fruits, soft tannins and a generous, full-bodied character. The acidity keeps the wine in shape, round and ready to drink.
title: Falua 2014 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: A ripe wine that is soft and fruity, this is juicy and with fine acidity. The quinta, situated at the western end of the Douro region, has produced a wine with light tannins and which has fine, ready to drink fruitiness.
title: Messias 2013 Quinta do Cachão Red (Douro)

description: An attractive, creamy textured wine with apple as well as citrus fruits. It is soft, smooth although with plenty of acidity to keep it lively. Drink now.
title: Château du Cèdre 2016 Cedrus le Blanc Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Pure Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp and fruity wine. Its red currants and light tannic structure give it shape and bring out the fruitiness that makes it immediately attractive. Ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Brigando Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This spicy, fruity wine, which includes the rare spicy Egiodola grape, is crisp with acidity and red currant fruit. With its touch of caramel, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Ménard 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This attractively soft wine is as gentle as the Gascony countryside, made with grapes from this region. It brings together many citrus flavors along with hints of pineapple and richer fruits. Drink now.
title: Famille Laplace 2016 Aramis Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: A wiry, fresh, slightly briny smelling nose sets up a pointed, zesty palate with electric, high-strung flavors of red plum and wild berry. The finish is hard, juicy and a little hot and fiery.
title: Zumaya 2013 Tempranillo  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Bramble and burning brush on the nose, while the palate is murky as it delivers tomato leaf, baked plum and carob flavors. Seems sort of cooked and funky, with a muddled mouthfeel. The 2005 is a cleaner, more focused wine.
title: Coto de Hayas 2006 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Campo de Borja)

description: Almost volatile, but with reduced raisin below. If you are familiar with   hot-climate California Zinfandel, this is not unlike that. It has a vinegary attack and then a strange but limited sweetness lurking in the weeds. A   challenged wine.
title: Asensio 2003 Javier Asensio Tinto Red (Navarra)

description: An  everyday Chard, with superripe pear and apricot flavors and a thick coat of smoky oak.
title: Napa Family Vineyards 2005 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: An awkward Chard that tastes unnaturally oaky, with medicinal flavors of toasted, sweet vanilla bean. You'll find hints of pineapples and papayas, but that oaky thing is really strong.
title: Magistrate 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lean, dry raspberry aromas and a slight floral essence carry the nose toward a zesty, semisharp palate with crisp cherry and cranberry flavors. Not bad in a lean, stripped-back way; but there's no excess oak, weight or sweetness. Lean stuff for old-school palates nursing plates of ham or salami.
title: Bodegas Leza García 2006 Arderius  (Rioja)

description: A simple, rugged wine with flavors of berries, chocolate, herbs and something vaguely oak-like. It's dry and full-bodied.
title: McManis 2008 Syrah (California)

description: The wine is all about fresh fruit. Blackberry fruit jumps from the glass with its light tannins and lively acidity. The structure, with just a touch of dryness, is just right to support the boisterous fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: Saucy, stewy plum and licorice aromas lead to a wiry palate with grabby tannins. Lightly herbal berry flavors come with a shading of oak, while the finish is herbal and minty tasting, with a sense of raw freshness stemming from latent acidity.
title: El Solar de Orfila 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Vague melon aromas are strange at best and offputting at worst. This blend of 70% Chardonnay and 30% Moscatel is watery and suggestive of cantaloupe juice. Funky, mushy white-fruit flavors are tough to wade through.
title: Bodegas San Valero 2014 Particular White (Cariñena)

description: Chunky, wayward aromas are vague at best. This has no structural integrity, while waxy green-apple flavors come with bitterness and a flabby, oily finish. Barely passable.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Mureda 2014 Organic Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Compact dark-fruit aromas turn more jammy with airing. This is gripping in feel, with firm tannins. Flavors of spice, herbs and  black fruits finish with pronounced acidity, leftover tannins and a leathery accent.
title: Santa Julia 2012 [+] Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: The cooperative of Reguengos is now a major force in the region. This wine, named after the hilltop town of Reguengos, is a powerful, condensed wine. It has dark black fruits, solid tannins and a smooth texture. Full-bodied and worth aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2012 Reguengos Red (Alentejo)

description: Herbaceous and richly crisp, its acidity is tangy with mineral undertones and bright green- and white-fruit flavors. This is delicious and fruity, with a great final zing.
title: Duorum 2011 Tons de Duorum Branco White (Douro)

description: A sound red wine that, at this price, proves its worth as a versatile, satisfying table companion to all sorts of foods calling for a full-bodied red. A blend of Syrah and Grenache, it's dry and tannic, with pleasant cherry, berry, herb and spice flavors.
title: Infinity 2008 Red (Central Coast)

description: This is a lively, bright young white wine that brims with acid-inspired tangerine, lime, quince and clove flavors. It has a little touch of oak, but is really fruit-driven. Represents a nice value in a dry, fairly complex sipper.
title: Ironstone 2006 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Fairly simple on the nose, but solid, with ripe pears leading the way. The flavors pick up some interesting graphite notes, extending through the minerally finish. Surprisingly full-bodied.
title: Ecco Domani 2002 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Simple, attractive crisp wine, with a pleasant depth of flavor. It has fresh fruit, a light toast touch and soft acidity.
title: Tenuta Cà Bolani 2002 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Aquileia)

description: Pungent, with grapefruit and grassy aromas that are true to the variety. The palate is fresh, the flavors good and fruity. There's mango and tangerine, and also some garden-fresh asparagus in the mix. The finish, too, is perfectly fresh; it's there one moment and gone the next.
title: Viña Casas del Bosque 2002 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Herbal and spicy, with some rubbery notes to the nose and a bit of pickle to the flavors. The plum fruit on the palate is round and peppery, while the wine finishes warm and full. Decent fruit but not rich.
title: Montes 2000 Reserve Oak Aged Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Named after a traditional Portuguese dance, the wine is full of red fruits, soft tannins with a rich texture. It is made to be drunk young, its red berry and red-currant fruits well integrated into the structure and acidity. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2015 Charamba Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Firmly tannic, this wine is richly endowed with a solid structure and also with bold black fruits. It comes from the producer's main Douro vineyard. Concentrated and ripe, it will age and should be drunk from 2018.
title: Borges 2015 Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: There's a surprising amount of structure here that is rarely seen in Italian whites, especially Soave Classico. The wine also delivers ripe aromas of peach, melon and pineapple.
title: Balestri Valda 2011  Soave Classico

description: Light and easy, this is a direct and straightforward Cab that offers pleasant aromas and flavors of ripe red plum, cherry preserves, raspberry sauce, mocha and baking spice. The soft tannins and fruit-forward palate make this an ideal selection to enjoy now.
title: KWV 2014 Classic Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Western Cape)

description: This wood-aged wine shows dark berry fruits and a dusty structure. That goes with the juicy fruitiness that is perfumed, fresh and spicy. The wine has a stalky aftertaste with plenty of acidity. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Cabra Cega Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is smooth, soft and juicy. It has a fine balance, ripe with berry fruits and light with acidity and a easy-going texture. The oak aging has served to smooth any tannins, leaving a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Espiga Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This smells a bit stalky and murky, without much pop or freshness to the nose. A medium-bodied palate feels about right, while this tastes earthy, stalky and like roasted plum. Herbal notes come up on the finish.
title: Árido 2012 Sustainably Farmed Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Apple, vanilla and a hint of sulfur is what you'll find on the nose of this consistently solid value-priced Cava. A slightly soft body and flavors of green herbs, melon and white pepper finish well.
title: Vins El Cep 2014 Kila Sparkling (Cava)

description: Slightly hard, burnt and earthy at first, with dark fruit sitting below that cap. The palate is tannic, thus the mouthfeel clamps down and closes up like a clam. More generous and savory in terms of flavors, with roasted black fruit and aged cheese notes. Narrow and grapey on the finish, but legit.
title: Carmen 2007 Syrah (Maipo Valley)

description: This easy-drinking Pinot Grigio opens with a crystalline appearance and clean citrus, pear and peach aromas. Fresh acidity and a touch of peachy sweetness characterize the mouthfeel.
title: A-Mano 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: With melon and green apple aromas, this mellow, mostly sweet wine cuts the mustard. The palate has a good feel, while core flavors of mango, melon and lime set up a short, unassuming, no-issues finish.
designation: Viña Cornejo Costas High Altitude Vineyards
title: Don Rodolfo 2012 Viña Cornejo Costas High Altitude Vineyards Moscato (Mendoza)

description: This basic Cabernet opens with standard berry, plum and herbal aromas. It's racy and tight on the tongue, with a mix of berry, chocolate and minty green flavors. The finish is spicy but not very fruity or complex. This is good as a pizza wine.
title: Echeverria 2011 Classic Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: This is a fruity wine, and its black currant flavor emerging right away. Next comes the bright acidity, while the tannins form a solid, dark and dry contrast. The wine needs at least two years to soften into something rich.
title: Château de la Bouyère 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is a fruity effort, with a blackberry note that is laced with attractive tannins and acids. With its smooth, ripe texture and full mouthfeel, this is already approachable.
title: Cheval Quancard 2009 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux)

description: Made to be drunk young, this is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. It has a juicy blackberry flavor, plenty of acidity and a soft, smooth aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Rouge Tannat-Syrah Tannat-Syrah (Vin de France)

description: This has a slightly green edge to its tannins. It is balanced, detailed and true to its two varieties. No frills here: just confident and clean winemaking.
title: Snoqualmie 2009 Whistle Stop Red Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This has a big aromatic presence at first, but it elegantly melts into a soft texture and crisp red fruit. It would be a winner with steak.
title: Cable Car 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Fleshy peach and melon aromas comme off as chunky and soft. The palate is just as soft as the nose, with melon and banana flavors. A simple finish is friendly but lacks spine, so drink this Chardonnay before it loses steam.
title: Trapiche 2012 Oak Cask Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Murky grassy berry aromas and a whiff of cinnamon make for a sketchy nose. This feels choppy, while quick-hitting flavors of forced oak, baking spice and murky berry fruits finish hollow.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Mureda 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Leafy burnt aromas of compost lack freshness. This feels lean, raw and grabby, while forced flavors of oak and savory, roasted plum finish rubbery and tannic.
title: Tres Palacios 2014 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

description: Aromas of sulfur and swimming pool blow off and leave citrusy notes. Pyrazinic flavors of bell pepper suggest barely ripe (maybe underripe) grapes. That essence is confirmed on a finish via white pepper and bell pepper flavors.
title: Tres Palacios 2016 Reserva Rosé (Maipo Valley)

description: This is a really soft wine with the minimum of tannins and the lightest fruit. It has just a hint of crisp, clean red berry fruits. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Bons Ventos Rosé (Lisboa)

description: From the first sniff, this crosses the line into the vegetal realm via aromas of canned green beans. A plump round palate is friendly in feel, while flavors of salted beans and canned peas finish fully green.
title: Falernia 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

description: Reduced jammy berry aromas precede a gummy palate. This tastes enriched by sugar and not entirely natural—stewy and candied on the finish. Tasted twice, with one sample refermented and spritzy.
title: Autoritas 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Off the bat this smells weedy, with a hint of generic red-berry fruit to help things along. A green-tasting wiry palate finishes with burnt underripe berry notes.
title: Sombras del Sol 2015 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: Light in color and just as light in body, this Merlot smells like cherry, plum and chewing gum. A lean linear palate generates tart generic red-fruit flavors prior to a sour finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Mureda 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Merlot (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Vibrant, tart aromas of green gooseberries and lime rind elevate the underlying hay and fresh thyme herbal accents. Lean, barely ripe white peach and hard pear add volume to the medium-weight mouth. Balanced and seamless with a clean, refreshing finish. Drink up!
title: Douglas Green 2009 Vineyard Creations Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Leathery aromas blend well with concentrated black-fruit scents. In the mouth, this value-priced Malbec offers juicy purity and plenty of spunk. Flavors of black fruits, licorice and chocolate maintain a sense of freshness, while the finish offers residual blackberry and cassis flavors.
title: Salentein 2012 Portillo Estate Bottled Malbec (Uco Valley)

description: Char, sawdust and black cherry aromas confirm the wine's “oak cask” labeling. Full bodied and ripe, it conveys meaty thickness and bold flavors of berry and spiced plum. A toasty, charred finish is lifted by bright acidity and fresh black-fruit flavors. This will go well with just about anything off the grill.
title: Trapiche 2012 Oak Cask Syrah (Mendoza)

description: Earthy and mildly medicinal smelling, with a healthy, not too stark palate that's dealing pointed cherry flavors and some dry oak. It's a touch sharp and angular, with a dry, peppery finish that's lean, acid-driven and starching.
title: Bodegas Olarra 2009 Otoñal  (Rioja)

description: A simple Merlot, soft and sweet in raspberries, cherries and red licorice. At this price, it's perfectly fine for casual fare and big parties.
title: McManis 2009 Merlot (California)

description: Pretty harsh, with green tannins and minty flavors, relieved by some modest cherry notes.
title: Glen Ellen 2007 Proprietor's Reserve Merlot (California)

description: This Moldovan Cabernet Sauvignon has strawberry jam, saddle leather and raspberry aromas. The palate is marked by smoked meat, clove and baking spice flavors that accent its fruity core.
title: Vinaria din Vale 2011 Rosu Cabernet Sauvignon (Moldova)

description: Basic tropical-fruit aromas settle on pineapple. This unoaked chardonnay is melony on the palate, with ample acidity. Heavy, ripe flavors of peach, melon and pear turn towards mango on the finish.
designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Unoaked
title: Zolo 2016 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: There's a lot of oak on this value-priced Chard, to the point that any fruit aromas are blanketed. In the mouth, there's ample acidity affording good cut, while flavors of pear and apple are spiced up by aforementioned forceful oak. Fortunately a resiny tasting finish isn't too heavy
designation: Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled
title: Santa Alicia 2013 Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Asphalt, crusty leather and herbal berry aromas are the opening on this racy Merlot. Flavors run from herbal, peppery and olive-driven to red-berry fruits. A spicy finish brings enough red-cherry character to make things work.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2012 Petirrojo Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: A single-vineyard wine from property owned by the Messias family, this is structured and packed full of tannins. A chocolate and spice character partners with the red fruits and acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Messias 2014 Quinta do Cachão Red (Douro)

description: The wine is light and crisp with lemon acidity and with a zesty bright texture. There is a touch of minerality and a clean lively aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Domaine de la Grenaudière Sur Lie
title: Ollivier Frères 2016 Domaine de la Grenaudière Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

description: Coming from the series of single-varietal wines produced by this estate, this wine adds a southern warmth to the crispness and elegant green-fruit flavors of the Alvarinho. It is tangy, hinting at minerality and with a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Alvarinho (Tejo)

description: A ripe and perfumed wine, this is well structured with a touch of crisp minerality as well as melon and peach fruits. It is smooth, balanced and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Verdelho (Tejo)

description: Inviting berry and dark plum aromas are matched by spice notes and depth. The palate feels ripe and full, maybe a touch scratchy, with generous flavors of berry fruits, licorice and toast. For a value wine this shows intensity and good flavors.
designation: Para Celsus Made with Organically Grown Grapes
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Bodegas Navarro López 2011 Para Celsus Made with Organically Grown Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Juicy red fruit dominates this wine. It has some firm tannins underneath—just enough to support the delicious raspberry and red-currant flavors. It is maturing well and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Auguste 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A barrel fermented Chardonnay that is uncharacteristically soft and fruity. Aromas of bananas and bubble gum lead to slightly sweet, uncomplicated flavors. The texture and body are light.
title: Campus Oaks 2012 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Labeled dry, this nonetheless carries a hint of sweetness, at 70 g/L residual sugar.  It's fruity and fresh, with melon, citrus and peach prominent. A perfect summer sipping wine.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Dry Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Soft and simple with sugary peach, citrus and vanilla flavors.
title: Cline 2010 Oakley Eighty-Two White (California)

description: Pasty, chemical aromas do little to draw you in. The palate on this everyday Rioja is scratchy, while flavors of tart fruit with rubbery, pasty overtones fail to elevate the wine.
title: Federico Paternina 2007 Banda Azul Crianza Red  (Rioja)

description: This Viura smells waxy and oxidized for a 2011. The palate feels chunky and awkward, while the flavor profile deals maderized pear and apple.
title: Bodegas Valdemar 2011 Conde de Valdemar Viura (Rioja)

description: Odd aromas of talcum powder and bath oils are fragrant but not very wine-like. This is flat on the palate, with very little cut and oily tasting flavors of ripe white fruits.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Casa Solar 2011 Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: The wine is all about fresh fruit. Blackberry fruit jumps from the glass with its light tannins and lively acidity. The structure, with just a touch of dryness, is just right to support the boisterous fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: Everybody needs a dry, tart white wine and Coppola has provided us with one in this crisply citric bottling. It's fresh and uplifting in grapefruit, lime and spicy flavors, at a good price.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Bianco Pinot Grigio (California)

description: An herbal wine, rather green in character and missing fruitiness. Structure and cherry fruits are there but lost in this green stalky character.
title: Casa Cadaval 2011 Vinha Padre Pedro Red (Tejo)

description: This basic, inexpensive Pinot has Syrah and Viognier blended, but overall the wine is fairly generic, with a streak of smokiness in the background.
title: Peltier 2012 Hybrid Pinot Noir (Lodi)

description: Dense and well structured, this is going to be an attractive wine. It has blackberry fruit, plenty of crisp acidity and a structured aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Costis 2015  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and smooth wine, with a rich Port-like aroma, the sweet fruit structured with some fresh stalky tannins. Great herbal and wild berry flavors to finish.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Azul Portugal Red (Douro)

description: A smooth wine for the price where all the dots connect. The nose has black cherry and raisin, while the palate is lush, deep and concentrated, with rewarding flavors of cherry, cassis and roasted plum. Lasting on the finish, with a licorice flavor. Very good wine for the money; Monastrell/Syrah/Tempranillo is the blend.
title: Altos del Cuco 2008 Red (Yecla)

description: Solidly structured, this is a dense wine. Its black fruits add to the density, giving a concentrated, fruity wine. Drink this starting from mid-2018.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2015  Bordeaux

description: Roasted, leathery and rubbery berry aromas are gritty and short on brightness. This feels rugged but good. Jammy cassis and cherry flavors show notes of cocoa and herbs.
title: Bodega Classica 2015 Hacienda Lopez de Haro  (Rioja)

description: Plum and berry aromas are superficially good, but this nonvintage Garnacha feels pulpy and chunky. Forceful berry flavors are a bit flat, as is the finish, which is ripe in feel and flavors but weaker on acidity and vitality.
title: Ignacio Marín NV El Gordo Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: Hot and crusty smelling at first blush and then the nose turns to mocha and smoky berry. Good mouthfeel, rich and balanced, with a fresh quality as well. Solid, complete red wine with a nice berry-packed Merlot character.
title: Andeluna 2007 Merlot (Tupungato)

description: A fresh, lively nose and clean, elegant flavors give this Chardonnay a food-friendly, easy-sipping feel. Pretty and dependable, it will pair well with grilled seafood and light salads.
title: Golden Kaan 2006 Chardonnay (Western Cape)
