title: My Big Fat Greek Wine 2010 Savatiano (Sterea Ellada)

description: Deliciously herbaceous wine, with the freshest green fruit flavors, plus lemon and grapefruit. The Colombard adds a little spice to give it a final burst of freshness.
region_1: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
title: Domaine de Ballade 2010 White (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Light and clean, which compared to other Argentine Pinot Grigios is not something to dismiss. Feels solid and punchy, with orange and mango flavors. Has nice overall clarity and balance, with a citrusy finish.
title: Santa Julia 2011 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: Dense blackberry, licorice, leather and herb aromas come together nicely on this Garnacha-Tempranillo blend. Bracing, racy acidity creates edge and sharpness on the palate, while hickory-smoked plum and raspberry flavors finish with firm tannins and dashing acidity.
designation: Vendimia Seleccionada San Nicolás De Tolentino
title: Marqués de Almonacid 2012 Vendimia Seleccionada San Nicolás De Tolentino Garnacha-Tempranillo (Cariñena)

description: A traditional blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre, this medium-bodied rosé offers delicate floral aromas as well as some slightly confected bubble-gum scents. It's less overtly fruity on the palate, then finishes with a welcome burst of lime zest.
title: Marrenon 2014 Roséfine Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Superripe black cherry and dried plum aromas, generous and rich fruit flavors and a smooth texture make this appealing all the way through. Made from Tempranillo and four other varieties, it's boldly flavored but not especially full-bodied, and feels just grippy enough on the palate to go well with burgers and ribs.
title: Dark Horse NV Big Red (California)

description: Musky aromas of red apple skins and stone fruits are mild but mostly clean. This Shiraz-Cabernet blend feels solid and full for rosé. Peppery, leafy flavors of spiced berry, apple and olive finish chunky, dry and slightly bitter.
title: Valle Hermoso 2015 Rosé (Central Valley)

description: In color, this is almost white. In flavor it is equally light. There is some attractive acidity and the soft wine will slip down easily. The aftertaste is crisp with just a touch of red currant.
title: Domaine de la Forêt 2015 Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Why this basic Garnacha is so oaky is a question that deserves to be asked. That said, it's still a healthy, balanced wine with grabby tannins and good energy. Dry, woody notes of spice and clove accent sappy plum flavors.
title: Bodegas San Valero 2014 Particular Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: A blend of dominant Merlot with Grenache, this is a light, caramel flavored wine. It is full in the mouth with spice and red fruits cut by lemon acidity.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine le Grand Destré Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: A little green, with a minty sharpness to the modest cherry-berry flavors. But it's dry and sound, and a pretty good everyday sipper at this price.
title: Castle Rock 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Strong mint aromas hint to the wood aging in this wine. Currently, they tend to dominate, accompained by bitter wood notes and dark-edged tannins. The wine is firm and needs time express its fruit.
title: Château Bois Redon 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With bright fruitiness, this is an attractive black-currant flavored wine. It has fine acidity that cuts through the wine's gentle, tannic character and leaves a lively, fresh aftertaste.
title: Maison Sichel 2011 Les Hauts de Bel-Air  (Bordeaux)

description: Sweetly aromatic of jasmine, this Chardonnay has a core of honey, apple and caramel, and is pleasantly crisp and balanced. Accessible and well-priced, it's a solid and friendly go-to white for just about any occasion.
title: McManis 2012 Chardonnay (River Junction)

description: Although light, this well-balanced wine has good depth. A dry core of tannins backs up the bright red berry and black currant fruits. Acidity and the tannins promise some aging, although the wine is drinkable now.
title: Producta Vignobles 2011 Mission St Vincent Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine is still settling in, with tiny bubbles coating the glass. The aromas of spice, flowers and lychee are vibrant and the palate drinks dry, showing plenty of richness and intensity.
title: Hogue 2014 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This straightforward quaffer has aromas of plum, woodspice, tire rubber and herb. The fruit flavors are elegant in style with some sugar balancing it out.
title: Sagelands 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Predominantly Grenache, with smaller amounts of Shiraz and Mourvèdre, but the aromas reflect the Mourvèdre's tendency toward dark fruit and tree bark. The flavors show some redder fruit flavors—raspberries—as well as touches of caramel and rhubarb, and this slightly syrupy wine finishes with a tangy edge. It's a little eccentric in style and flavor profile, but savory and tasty in its own way—and a relative bargain.
title: Marquee 2006 Artisan Wines Classic G-S-M (South Eastern Australia)

description: This is a very dry Cab whose blackberry flavors have nuances of green olives and smoky oak. Notable for its balance, it's a nice, inexpensive red wine to have with fancy meals.
title: Napa Family Vineyards 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Spicy and jumpy smelling, with red fruit aromas. The palate is alert, upright and tangy, with both citrus and red raspberry flavors. Reasonably good in terms of mouthfeel, with a light, herbal finish. A bit lean but exceedingly fresh.
title: Carmen 2008 Merlot (Rapel Valley)

description: Not overdone or overripe, here's a rich Chard that boasts fresh peach and red apple notes with notes of tropical fruit acidity. Clean and solid with a medium mouthfeel; an easy-drinking choice that's perfect for company.
title: The Frenchhouse 2008 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Earth, pepper and prickly spice comprise the aromas on this Central Valley Pinot. Feels resiny and warm, with sweet flavors of black cherry, cream and oak. Spicy, chunky and drying on the finish. Good for the price.
title: Viña Requingua 2010 Puerto Viejo Reserve Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)

description: Brambly smelling, with tomato, green herb and rhubarb aromas. Nervy and tight in the mouth, with minty, spicy flavors that keep any fruit character in the distance. Scratchy and tannic as well.
title: Trapiche 2010 Zaphy Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Ebullient with ripe cherry fruit, this intensely aromatic rosé is geared towards the white Zin drinker who's looking for a step up. While soft and a tad confectionery with a sweet, candied cherry palate, there's a crisp acidity throughout that keeps it from becoming too cloying.
title: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2009 Pinot Noir Blanc Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Wild berry, cherry and mint notes are what you'll find on this wine's open, likable bouquet. The feel is clean and crisp, with snappy wild-berry and plum flavors that crackle with finishing acidity and controlled tannins.
title: Bodegas Valdemar 2011  Rioja

description: This is a fruity wine, and its black currant flavor emerging right away. Next comes the bright acidity, while the tannins form a solid, dark and dry contrast. The wine needs at least two years to soften into something rich.
title: Château de la Bouyère 2010  Bordeaux

description: Simple, light strawberry aromas form a good opening. The palate is juicy and bright, with citrus and nectarine flavors. There's nothing complicated or overreaching here; it's easygoing, clean and finishes with pepper and brown sugar.
title: Segura Viudas NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: With clean citrus and tropical aromas as well as a touch of almond skins, this is nice on the bouquet. On the palate, it's round feeling and citrusy, with weighty peach and citrus flavors that hollow out on the finish.
designation: Viña Cornejo Costas High Altitude Vineyards
title: Don Rodolfo 2012 Viña Cornejo Costas High Altitude Vineyards Torrontés (Cafayate)

description: Tart cherry aromas and flavors with tarragon accents are wrapped in oak in this medium-weight, mature red. The wine is evenly textured, but the oak sits well to the fore, really predominating on the very dry, tangy-in-a-woody-way finish. —M.M.
title: Castillo de Almansa 1995 Reserva Red (Almansa)

description: Here's a simple little wine that makes for pleasant drinking at an affordable price. It's lemony and dry and soft in acids, but it is very clean and is fine for fried chicken, fruit salad and other picnic-type fare. —S.H.
title: Stonehedge 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: Fresh grass, vibrant citrus and tart gooseberry fill the nose and mouth, making this an approachable and clean white perfect for pairing with lighter chicken and fish dishes. 70% Chenin Blanc and 30% Sauvignon Blanc; drink now.
title: Stellenbosch Hills 2010 Polkadraai Chenin Blanc-Sauvignon Blanc (Polkadraai Hills)

description: Bolla is an iconic name for Soave and this bright wine delivers all the ease and good cheer you can expect from an easy Italian white. Citrus and stone fruit aromas are followed by a soft, slightly sweet mouthfeel.
title: Bolla 2010 Rétro  (Soave Classico)

description: Acidic and rustic, but rich in fruit, this Cab shows lots of cherries, blackberries and briary wild berries. It's an easy wine to drink, and the price is pretty good.
title: Cable Car 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Light, appley aromas and lively apple and citrus flavors brighten this unoaky wine. It has refreshing acidity, an elegant texture and crisp finish.
title: Peltier 2014 Hybrid Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Hooray for the fruit on this beauty!  Gobs of freshly crushed blackberries, blueberries, plums, espresso, black currants and vanilla are charming, and the flavors are every bit as lush.  Technically, it's bone dry, but it's one of those wines that tastes fruity sweet.  It has elegance and style that belie the value price. Plus, the tannins are soft as velvet
title: Errazuriz 1999 El Decanso Estate Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: A refreshing wine, with nicely ripened fruit and exceptional balance, that's pleasant in every way and a super value, too.  The fruit goes beyond citrus into more deeply flavored apricot and pear, and modest sur lie aging adds creamy, buttery notes.  This is a lovely wine and one of the best values of the year in Sauvignon/Fume Blanc.
title: Errazuriz 1999 La Escultura Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: This defines mainstream, affordable Chardonnay via its soft apple, pear and pineapple bouquet, pleasing mouthfeel and nice, lightly sweet blend of fruit, butter and spice elements on the palate and finish. Best Buy.
title: Jacob's Creek 2000 Chardonnay (Barossa Valley)

description: A great price for a wine this rich and spicy. It's busting with ripe tropical fruit, peach, tangerine and pear notes, and spices, too. And it's dry, with just a hint of residual sugar to make the fruit round and forward. Turns really pretty on the polished, spicy finish.
title: Errazuriz 1999 La Escultura Estate Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: If you didn't know the price and had to guess, you'd probably figure this wine would cost about $18. It's enormously ripe and fruity, with bright peach, tropical fruits and spices and quite a bit of oak. The technical notes say it was partially barrel-fermented. A wine of enormous charm and a great value in Chardonnay.
title: Dreyer Sonoma 1999 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Floral aromas of rose hips and scents of plum and spiced tomato comprise the nose of this light-bodied Rioja. Floral raspberry and exotic spice flavors finish airy juicy and light. Drink this easygoer with a light chill.
title: Viña Palaciega 2014 Joven  (Rioja)

description: Briny pickled aromas are just clean enough to pass muster. This simple Viura is lemony and tangy on the palate, with saline-influenced flavors of citrus fruits and bell pepper. On a snappy finish, a briny flavor leads the way.
title: Conde de Altava 2015 Joven Viura (Rioja)

description: Sugared apple aromas and semi-sweet Fuji apple and honeydew flavors make this wine simply appealing. It's good for very casual meals or big crowds.
title: Fetzer 2015 Sundial Chardonnay (California)

description: This budget-priced rosé sparkler is earthy and mushroomy, with modest berry flavors, a slightly creamy texture and citrus zest on the finish.
title: Yellow Tail 2015 Pink Bubbles Sparkling (South Australia)

description: This is a fat wine with ripe fruits and a strawberry flavors. The palate is dry, with a soft texture. Drink now.
title: Adega Vila Real 2016 Colheita Rosé (Douro)

description: Kerosene aromas and a perfumed character come from the Malvasia in the blend. It is a perfumed wine with touches of green fruits and acidity. The wine doesn't quite hang together.
title: Adega Vila Real 2016 Colheita White (Douro)

description: Lots of dark-fruit flavor, an ultrasmooth texture and a lingering finish raise this medium-bodied and value-priced wine well above average. Black cherry and blackcurrant flavors are sprinkled with spices recalling nutmeg and cardamom.
title: Montevina 2013 Omira Hills Merlot (California)

description: Here's a value wine and a fresh expression of Barbera that can be served with cheeseburgers and fries at an outdoor barbecue. The wine is informal and light and seems to be engineered for immediate consumption.
title: Araldica 2008 Castelvero Barbera (Piedmont)

description: Lime aromas and modest minerality are proper given its origin, but it turns softer and sweeter the more time it airs out. The palate is fairly round, with lemon-lime and pineapple flavors. Citric if a bit pithy on the finish. Fine but average.
title: Lucky7 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: This bargain-priced offering combines tobacco leaf with Green Gage plum in a medium-bodied format. The flavors aren't quite as fresh and vibrant as the best examples, but it'll more than do for many occasions.
title: Lobster Reef 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: There's no shortage of spice in this value Minervois, with strong notes of pepper and garrigue herbs backed by notes of orange rind, red cherry and young raspberry. Medium-light in the mouth with moderate acidity and soft tannins; drink up now.
title: Château Cabezac 2004 Le Petit Arthur Red (Minervois)

description: This highly aromatic wine starts off with bright aromas of white flowers, fynbos, pink apples and white peaches. The lightweight palate offers clean flavors of peach and melon, with zippy acidity and a brisk finish. It's super tasty and easy to like, so enjoy now.
title: Spier 2016 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Ripe red fruits dominate this soft and juicy wine. The light structure and touch of tannin give shape to this easy wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Casa do Lago Red (Lisboa)

description: The is a soft, gentle wine with ripe berry fruit. Minimal tannins are embedded in its fruitiness and rounded texture. Drink now.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 La Châsse Merlot (Vin de France)

description: Crisply aromatic, this is a light, bright wine. Citrus fruit and a tangy orange and mineral texture create a light, bright aftertaste. It is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Bote White (Douro)

description: Named after the quay in the heart of Oporto, this light, simple wine is full of black fruit, balanced tannins and acidity. It will be a good barbecue wine. Drink now.
title: Vinihold 2015 Cais da Ribeira Red (Douro)

description: Pulpy aromas of applesauce are a bit flat. This feels chunky on the palate, with low acidity. White-fruit flavors suggest canned peach and pear, and it tastes sweet on the finish.
title: Black Cabra 2016 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: This ripe, tropical fruit-driven style of Sauvignon Blanc from the south of France is tangy and ready to drink.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Romantic Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: A watery wine that tastes like a fruit juice blend of oranges, mangoes and pineapples, with a squirt of alcohol.
title: Three Pears 2012 Pinot Gris (California)

description: The petillance is faint on this Cava. Aromas of sweat and bread introduce flavors of pink grapefruit and tart apple. An abrasive mouthfeel delivers generic citrus flavors.
title: Jaume Serra NV Cristalino Extra-Dry Sparkling (Cava)

description: A Riesling/Viognier blend, this mixes citrus and peach fruit flavors together, with more than a little bit of sweetness in the finish. It's a fruity, forward, easy-going quaffer, best enjoyed with a good chill on it.
title: Northwest Totem Cellars 2008 Salish White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Gritty, herbal aromas of generic berry don't exactly draw you in. The palate on this rudimentary Cab is rather weak in structure, with herbal, slightly salty flavors of dry, generic berry fruits.
title: San Nicolas 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: A spritzy wine, with strongly herbal flavors. There isn't much in the way of fruit, just stems and herbs and chalky tannins.
title: StoneCap 2011 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Mild peach and quince aromas come with zero zest or edge. This lacks shape on the palate and tastes jumbled, with bland peach and tropical fruit flavors. This finishes flat as a board, with almost no lasting flavor.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Trencalòs 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Tight with shocking acidity, this wine confirms that red Vinho Verde can often be an acquired taste, perhaps best left to the local market back in Portugal.
title: Campelo 2014 Red (Vinho Verde)

description: Herbaceous red-fruit and forced fiery oak aromas give this a spicy, almost Pinot Noir-like nose. Raw as nails on the palate, this tastes like herbal green strawberry and chemicals. Weedy on the finish.
title: Mountain Door 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This opens with a blast of diesel along with tarry asphalt. The mouthfeel isn't bad, but there isn't much life to the wine. It tastes bitter and oceanic, like horseradish and sea shell. Foamy and coarse on the finish.
title: Bodegas Medina NV Marqués de Badajoz Brut Reserva Macabeo (Cava)

description: This has medicinal, sweet-tasting flavors of chocolate and cherry.
title: Fat Cat 2010 Merlot (California)

description: This tastes soft, sweet and simple. The blend is Pinot Gris, Chardonnay, Columbard and Gewurztraminer.
title: Immersion 2011 White (California)

description: Mulchy and gaseous on the nose, this subsequently turns scouring and acidic on the palate, with a leafy, dry red-plum flavor. Herbal, dry and not very fruity overall.
title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2010 Royal  (Rioja)

description: Whispy and lightweight on the nose, with hints of celery, sweat and passion fruit. There's not a ton to say about this pedestrian but well-made Sauvignon. It is citrusy with a touch of bell pepper, and it finishes in a comfortable way. Classic everyday SB from Casablanca is what this tastes, smells and feels like. Drink now.
title: Casas del Bosque 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: A minerally, grassy nose leads on this white blend of 51% Sauvignon Blanc, 25% Chenin and 23% Chardonnay. Intense flavors of honey, almond and spice blend well with a citric, zingy edge. Some tropical fruit curviness rounds the whole thing out. A unique and stylish sip.
title: Nederburg 2008 Lyric White (Western Cape)

description: An interesting wine that walks to the beat of its own drum. Organic wines are almost always a little unusual, and this is no different. It pours on the funky red-fruit aromas and then come herbal cherry, raspberry and plum flavors. As a whole it's a good, well-made wine with decent feel. But hailing from La Rioja, it also has its own unfamiliar identity. Worth a try if organic wines are your thing.
title: Pircas Negras 2007 Organic Cabernet Sauvignon (Famatina Valley)

description: Mostly a blend of Merlot (30%), Syrah (25%) and Cabernet Sauvignon (24%), this wine offers appealing, downright fruity aromas of red currant and raspberry jam. The lightly sweet cranberry and cherry flavors provide a lot of easy-drinking enjoyment.
title: Original House Wine 2014 Red (America)

description: This Sicilian Syrah shows ripe fruit aromas of red cherry, blueberry and succulent spice. It's a plush, chewy wine with mature flavors of blackberry jam.
title: Calatrasi 2010 Terrale Oro Syrah (Sicilia)

description: One of the many inexpensive wines from Aliança, Alabastro has an earthy feel, chunky and fruity. At the same time, it also has richness, perfumed tannins and attractive spicy acidity.
title: Caves Aliança 2010 Alabastro Red (Alentejano)

description: A fine wine, brisk in acidity and clean in the finish, with slightly sweet flavors of oranges, pears, peaches and honey. A nice cocktail sipper, or with Asian fare.
title: Concannon 2010 Selected Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

description: A touch stemmy and cooked smelling, with Cafayate's patented herbal notes. The palate has a regular feel and briary, herbal flavors of pepper, tobacco and red berry fruit. Spicy and warm on the finish, but good in a competent way.
designation: Viña Cornejo Costas High Altitude Vineyards
title: Don Rodolfo 2010 Viña Cornejo Costas High Altitude Vineyards Pinot Noir (Cafayate)

description: Fresh grass, green plum and lime rind notes characterize this easygoing white. There's a lifting prickly sensation to the palate followed by a short but cleansing finish.
title: Fleur Du Cap 2010 Bergkelder Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Dark like a cave in color, this big red blend consists of Zinfandel, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Merlot, all sourced from vineyards in Lodi and Clarksburg. Oaky and tannic, not overdone alcohol-wise, the cherry flavors are just right for the backyard barbecue or other casual meat-eating gathering.
title: un4seen 2009 Red blend Red (California)

description: Producer of one of the first rosé Vinho Verde, Casa do Valle continues to make one of the best. Full of delicious strawberry flavors with great acidity, deliciously fruity.
title: Casa do Valle 2010 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Pale salmon rosé, with peach and melon aromas. It's dry and minerally on the palate, with mouthwatering acids that linger on the finish.
title: Marrenon 2010 Grand Toque Rosé (Luberon)

description: The Malbec in the blend adds its tannins to this wine meant to drink young. The spice and wood aging are balanced with acidity and a juicy aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
title: Château Bélingard 2014 Bélingard Rouge Red (Bergerac)

description: Fresh and fruity with a crisp mineral and textured character, this is a lively wine that's ready to drink. Acidity and a citrus zestiness give a refreshing lightness at the end.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Periquita White (Península de Setúbal)

description: This fresh wine shows fruit tones balanced by a light mineral note. It is bright with acidity and grapefruit flavors alongside a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: An appealing quaffer with notes of passion fruit, papaya and citrus. It drinks a hair off dry (1.2g/L residual sugar), with moderate concentration, and goes down easy.
title: Original House Wine 2013 Fish House Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a simple, straightforward quaffer, with off-dry (5.2 g/L residual sugar) notes of melon, tropical fruit and musk. It's 85% Chardonnay, with 10% Riesling, 3% Gewüurztraminer and 2% Viognier blended in.
title: Two Ponds 2012 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A fruity blend of Tannat, Syrah and Cabernet Franc that has berry fruits, a stalky texture and touches of wood spice. It's an easy, juicy wine, made fresh and ripe to be drunk now.
title: Château d'Aydie 2013 Aramis Red (Vin de France)

description: A medium-sweet wine, with a light prickle on tongue, very much in the style of some Vinho Verde, this is crisp, with lemon candy flavors and bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Azulejo White (Lisboa)

description: This is stalky smelling, with modest fruit and a burnt field aroma. It looks and tastes weak and transparent, with sourness rising up on the palate along with notes of citrus, cranberry and cherry pie.
title: Aconga 2011 Bonarda-Merlot Red (Mendoza)

description: This restrained, salmon-tinged rosé teases with riper fruit, even with a red-berry compote of red currant and strawberry. The plump fruit is held in a dry frame and tempered by freshness. Equally tempting with or without food.
title: Unger 2013 Q Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: Faint notes of citrus lend an edge of freshness to this easy-drinking wine. Slightly dilute notes make for even more lightness but the finish is clean and fresh.
title: Lenz Moser 2014 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: This is a wine that, unlike many Muscadets, can age well. Although only three years old, it will likely go for several more. That comes from the depth of the fruit, the ripe spice and acidity and the rounded white fruits. So drink now and until 2022.
title: Chateau de l'Oiselinière 2014 Les Grands Gâts Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

description: Fresh and lively with flavors of strawberry, cherry, raspberry and red plum pulp. The acidity subdues the stronger fruit flavors on the palate, balancing everything out nicely. Moderate weight with a full texture and a zingy, lingering finish.
title: Les Jamelles 2007 Rosé Cinsault (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Cherry, pepper and spice on the nose are followed by similar flavors in this dry red. Balanced and touched with oak, the wine will pair well with grilled meats and spiced dishes. For fans of softer wines, age this for a few years before drinking.
title: Westerland 2006 Pinotage (Darling)

description: Small amounts of Riesling, Viognier, and Gewürztraminer (3% each) considerably boost the aromas giving notes of peach, dried pineapple and flowers. Coming from the cool 2011 vintage, the flavors are light in style with a lemony lick on the finish.
title: Sagelands 2011 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: For a Vinho Verde, this is rich and full-bodied, showing delicious acidity, crisp apples and a touch of tropical fruit. There's the typical prickle on the tongue that brings out freshness, but in fact this wine could age for a year.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: Broad, sturdy and herbal, this everyday Merlot is a fine choice for simple grilled fare. It's actually a rather interesting blend, with a mix of Cabernet Franc, Lemberger, Syrah and Sangiovese adding to the Merlot base.
title: Avery Lane 2007 Merlot (Washington)

description: A classic Shiraz nose of plum pudding and rubber leads to a medium-weight palate that's got a bit of depth to it, with undertones of humus and fall leaves. Fresh black fruit pops up briefly on the short, crisp finish. Drink up.
title: Bulletin Place 2008 Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)

description: Composed of 40% Viognier, 39% Chenin Blanc and 21% Grenache Blanc, there's an attractive round richness to this wine. A toasty character spices up the fresh pear, melon and orange rind flavors, with a nutty accent lingering on the finish.
title: Boekenhoutskloof 2009 The Wolftrap White (Franschhoek)

description: Crisp and brisk on the palate, with hints of grapefruit, melon and fig accented by herbal, leafy notes. The flavors fade quickly on the finish, but the wine makes for a pleasant apéritif.
title: Terroir 2009 by Ant Moore Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: With 11,000 cases imported, this crisp, clean Steen should be easy to find and well worth the price. Light weight but filled with ripe pineapple and Key lime flavors accented by crushed white flowers. Drink now.
title: The Royal Valley Vineyards Wine Company 2009 Old Vines Steen Chenin Blanc (Swartland)
winery: The Royal Valley Vineyards Wine Company

description: Berry aromas come in front of a tart pie cherry and rhubarb palate. The feel is tight and acidic, so it lacks for mouthfeel and cries out for food. As a bistro or supermarket buy it offers the most potential.
title: Heron 2000 Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Smells a little funky, with a meaty, raw beef aroma on top of scents of green apples. Tastes thin and watery, with a suggested of appley citrus fruit flavor. The finish turns tart and dry.
title: Domaine St. George 2001 Barrel Reserve - Barrel Aged Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Almost tan in color, with neutral aromas and a dull, almondy flavor profile. Round and smooth. but all in all it's boring and fading fast.
title: Domaine de la Courtade 2001 L'Alycastre Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dark and earthy, a thick, heavy wine with plummy, chocolatey flavors and big tannins, although the acidity is soft. The main drawback is residual sugar. Once that sugar hits, the palate is discombobulated.
title: Stonehedge 2001 Petite Sirah (California)

description: This is an aromatic wine with notes of rose water, pear and white flowers. It drinks medium sweet with abundant spice flavors throughout. Pair with spicy Thai dishes.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A widely available offering from Concannon, this Cab is rich in jammy cherry and vanilla, with a backbone of oak, a nice choice for midweek dinners of rib roast and steak.
title: Concannon 2010 Selected Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This brand plays at the lower end of the Côtes du Rhône price spectrum, sometimes successfully. This wine has a subdued nose, then combines cherry, leather and earth notes on the palate. It's a bit astringent for the modest level of fruit, but still solid.
title: Les Trois Couronnes 2014 Grenache-Syrah (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Blackberry and cassis aromas are a touch balsamic but mostly clean. This feels solid and hefty, with slightly overripe black-fruit flavors. A low-acid finish results in flatness.
title: Alto Los Romeros 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Fruity, young and soft, this is an attractive Touriga Nacional-Syrah wine with strawberry flavors and just a touch of crisp red currant acidity. It's made for this summer, ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2016 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

description: Gritty, oily, nutty aromas lead to a tight citric palate. Salty narrow flavors of passion fruit and grapefruit finish steady and briny. Overall, this is basic in every way.
title: Veramonte 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Clean but modest raspberry aromas set up a wiry palate. This tastes of tart plum, tomato and herbs. A minty green note rises up on a snappy palate that includes a touch of oak.
title: Chilensis 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Toast, bittersweet chocolate, vanilla and barrel spice flavors are followed by a palate that mixes equal part fruit and barrel. It goes down easy.
title: Snoqualmie 2014 Whistle Stop Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Robust aromas of ripe berry fruit and bacon give this a full and lusty starting point, while the textured body is rich, with sturdy tannins. Flavors of blackberry and black cherry are sweet, and the wine has good character and bounce. A wine you want to drink on a regular basis.
title: La Mano 2007 Roble Mencía (Bierzo)

description: Calling a wine romantic is perhaps a new approach for Bordeaux. The wine itself is ripe and jammy, with wood tannins that will be softer in a year. Drink from 2016.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2012 Romantique  (Bordeaux)

description: Haras is the base-level label for Haras de Pirque, and frankly this Chardonnay tastes, smells and feels like a base-level wine. There's a damp lack of clarity on the nose as well as sweet apple, cinnamon and spice flavors. Finishes fleshy and bland.
title: Haras 2007 Estate Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Sweet and simple, with flavors of apricot and pineapple jelly.
title: McManis 2007 Chardonnay (California)

description: If it weren't for a pretty well-balanced mouthfeel, this would be pushing daisies. It smells like green beans and a used ashtray, with murky green fruit and milk chocolate flavors backing that up. As we said, mouthfeel is good; aromas and flavors not so much.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Cubo 2006 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Raw and harsh, with green, unripe tannins framing simple berry jam flavors.
title: Arrow Creek 2005 Vintner's Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This tastes bone dry, and it offers acidity that's so clean and racy, it makes your mouth feel like it's shining. The flavors of limes, lemons, hay, white pepper and vanilla are delightful.
title: Geyser Peak 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: Refreshing and simple, this is dryish and spicy, with orange, apricot and peach flavors all accented with crisp acidity. It's easy to drink as a cocktail sipper, with little snacks, like tempura or cheesy puff pastries.
title: McManis 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: It is probably the small soupçon of Moscatel in the blend that gives this wine its irresistible perfumed character. That just brings out the fine acidity and the crisp citrus flavors. It is a refreshing wine, as aromatic at the end as at the beginning. Drink now.
title: Duorum 2016 Tons de Duorum White (Douro)

description: Spice and pepper aromas act as a welcoming party, with cherry and raspberry scents sitting in reserve. The palate is herbal but fairly fruity, with fresh acidity and a solid, if not the most deep and lasting, finish. Despite showing some typical leafy qualities, this is good, young Carmenère.
title: Chilcas 2006 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Lightly perfumed, this white Bordeaux shows the fresh character of the 2006 vintage. The acidity is poised, lifted and goes well with the pink grapefruit flavors. Drink this summer.
title: Mouton-Cadet 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Despite the deep crimson color, the nose is surprisingly delicate; showing strawberries and red cherry. Pleasant, easy drinking and well balanced, but not particularly concentrated, this is a wine that will work easily with a wide variety of food without drawing much attention to itself.
title: Neirano 2003  Dolcetto d'Alba

description: This attractively colored sparkler is a light peachy-pink hue, with fragrant aromas of oranges, lemons and tropical fruit. It's light in weight (only 5.5% alcohol) but also rather sweet, and could use just a little zip to help balance out the sugar.
title: Innocent Bystander 2007 Moscato (Victoria)

description: Upfront scents of blackberry and plum lead the nose of this wine, while denser notes of muddled berries, chocolate raspberry and tree bark unfold on the medium-weight palate. Hints of earth and pepper lend depth to the finish. Drink now.
title: Café du Midi 2015 Merlot (Vin de France)

description: Named after the district of Paris where the food and wine markets were located, this is an attractive, fruity wine. It has apricot, banana and spice flavors, lifted by some perfumed acidity. It is a warm style of Chardonnay that is ready to drink.
title: Maison de la Villette 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Made from Grenache, this fresh and deliciously fruity wine has a soft side from its ripe berry fruits and warm acidity. Produced in Languedoc, the wine has a sunny character, full of life and lightness.
title: Le Val 2015 Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This is a pocket-size blend of 57% Merlot, 38% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Petite Sirah and 1% Cabernet Franc. It's soft and drinkable, marrying red currant and cherry with softened tannins and an easy approachability.
title: FlyWine 2012 The Wing Man Red (Napa Valley)

description: Offered in a 100ml travel size, with fruit sourced from both the Russian River Valley and Sonoma Valley, this is a worthy companion when pocket size is important. Light citrus and green apple show on the nose before an oaky palate of buttered toast enters the fray.
title: FlyWine 2014 The LayOver Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine, a blend of Chardonnay and Gros Manning, forms a pair with a Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat blend from the same producer. Here, the style hails from the cooler southwest of France. Bright and crisp, it offers a hint of honey as well as good acidity cutting through to give a refreshing, lively aftertaste.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 Gabriel Chardonnay-Gros Manseng White (Vin de France)

description: Since this wine comes from a big Rhône producer, it's no surprise the blend is 50% Grenache Blanc. The other 50% is Sauvignon Blanc. It is an effective, balanced medley, with the fat Grenache given a burst of freshness by the Sauvignon. The wine is light, lively and fruity. Drink now.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 La Châsse Sauvignon-Grenache White (Vin de France)

description: The red wine is rich, dense and packed with fruit and tannins. It comes from the heart of the Lisboa region, giving plenty of structure from the cool-climate vineyards. There are fine red-fruit flavors shot through by juicy acidity. The wine has a drier, still developing tannic aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Full in the mouth, this is a ripe, currant- and gooseberry-flavored wine. It has a bright, forward, fruity feel that makes it delicious to drink. Very refreshing in character. Screwcap.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2012 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Earthy plum and berry aromas dominate a fruit-forward bouquet. A layered, proper feeling palate delivers lightly buttered flavors of dark plum, creamy oak and spice. On the finish, this tastes a little toasty and peppery, while the feel is comported.
title: Faustino Rivero Ulecia 2009 Yellow Label Crianza  (Rioja)

description: A blend of Fernão Pires and Moscatel, this is fresh, crisp and perfumed. It's an apéritif-like wine, with light acidity and a creamy, smooth texture.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2011 Portal da Aguia White (Tejo)

description: Generous and very flavorful, this full-bodied wine resembles honey and pear in the aroma, and pear syrup in the flavor. While sweet-seeming, it has a dash of apple-like acidity to keep it lively.
title: McManis 2014 Chardonnay (River Junction)

description: This is an excellent Harvest Select bottling, with bright, sappy flavors that seem not all that sweet. The residual sugar, listed at 47 g/L, is an asset, but doesn't dominate. Flavors remain as crisp as a fresh Macintosh apple, juicy, forward and delicious.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Harvest Select Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This attractive, soft and fresh wine is fruity, with red berry flavors, balanced acidity and warm tannins. With its light touch of spice, it is ready to drink.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2009 Periquita Red (Setubal)

description: Tamaya seems to have turned the corner with its 2008 Cabs (the reserva is also very good). This wine is condensed and concentrated, with blackberry jam and other sweet berry aromas. The palate is pure and tastes of cassis and black fruit, while the finish has cola notes and a slight tannic bite. Generous for the price. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
title: Tamaya 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Limarí Valley)

description: This is a steely, herbal, high-acid Merlot, with pale red fruit flavors of cranberry and currant. Accents of clove and iron are wrapped into stiff, but ripe tannins. Nice structure, ready for steak.
title: Snoqualmie 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Spicy plum and cherry pie aromas offer a note of vanilla before falling off. In the mouth, this is wiry and drawing, with citric acids pushing raspberry and herbal plum flavors toward rawness. The finish is snappy on the surface but hollow beyond that.
title: Aresti 2011 Estate Selection Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Light, fruity and sweet, this is classic Rosé d'Anjou. Bright strawberry fruits are softly linked with a crisp texture and acidity to finish.
title: Barton & Guestier 2011  Rosé d'Anjou

description: Juicy, jammy, tasting of red licorice and bright blackberry fruit, with dusty undertones and a bite of coffee on the finish, this is a good-value Zinfandel from old Lodi vines.
title: Campus Oaks 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: Yeasty aromas lead to a wine that is bright with crisp apples and soft lemon-juice flavors. There is a hint of white bread roll, which rounds it out.
title: Grandial NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Maderized and stalky smelling, with a scratchy palate and grassy, pickled flavors that lean toward strawberry and raspberry.
title: Bodegas Valdemar 2010 Conde de Valdemar Rosado Rosé (Rioja)

description: Clumsy and a bit chemical smelling, with a sticky, thick, candied palate housing bug juice berry flavors in front of a medicinal finish. Bulky, sweet and grabby red wine.
title: Pueblo del Sol 2009 Tannat (Juanico)

description: An elegant nose of strawberry, raspberry and lemon is the start of this poised rosé. Unfolding fruit and citrus flavors keep the wine balanced and clean, but the overall character is feminine and soft. A very pretty wine with a classic touch.
title: Juno 2008 Cape Maidens Rosé (Western Cape)

description: This wine, like so many from the 1998 vintage in Chile, is very light in texture and displays little depth. The flavors are accurate for a claret—mild berry and a touch of earth—and there's even a decent finish. A light quaff; don't expect weight.
title: La Playa 1998 Claret Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Here's a nice everyday drinking wine with some real richness from ripe Chardonnay grapes and a touch of toasty oak. It will satisfy that craving for apple and peach-flavored fruit. Dry and spicy, with the creamy texture of a good wine, but it won't break the bank.
title: Hawk Crest 1998 Chardonnay (California)

description: A soft, round quaffer filled with warmth. Slightly cooked berries are tinged with a hint of wood and dusty earth flavors
title: Camelot 1997 Merlot (California)

description: A light, earthy wine, with violet, berry and tea flavors and a sharp, herbal note verging on grassiness or wet hay. It's very dry and the tannins are soft, but crisp acidity keeps it lively in the mouth.
title: Callaway 1998 Coastal Merlot (California)

description: Some raspberry fruit in the aroma, but things turn rapidly earthy and herbal, suggesting dried tomato, rhubarb and oregano. The flavors are simple and uninspiring. Soft, mild, rustic and thin are other words that come to mind.
title: Camelot 1997 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Despite its Kabinett (off dry) designation, this tastes bone dry, allowing all the crispness of the fruit to shine. It is full of white fruit, lemon and grapefruit flavors, a great burst of freshness. Screwcap.
title: Winzer Krems 2009 Ried Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: This is a fruit-driven wine showing lots of apple and melon aromas, broad peach and apple flavors and a generous texture. It's very tasty and refreshing and has touch of sweetness.
title: Fetzer 2014 Echo Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

description: Enticing, with notes of candle wax, spice and zesty lemon, this off-dry blend of Müller-Thurgau and Riesling is deeply concentrated with white peach and apricot flavors. It's weighty and rich in feel, with streaks of mineral that add delicate complexity to the finish.
title: Karl Josef 2011 Piesporter Michelsberg Qualitätswein White (Mosel)

description: This delightful, off-dry white is a blend of Pinot Gris, Gewürztraminer, Müller Thurgau, Sauvignon Blanc and Riesling,  perfectly matched to deliver crisp, fruity aromatics and flavors of apples, oranges and pears. It's a terrific anytime quaffer.
title: Oak Knoll NV Toasted Cow White Vintners Blend White (Willamette Valley)

description: Honeysuckle and stone fruit aromas take center stage on this breezy white. The lively palate accents unripe peach, crisp green apple and a hint of bitter almond alongside racy acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
title: Umani Ronchi 2014 Exclamation Point  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)

description: With 7% residual sugar and 11% alcohol, this is a Riesling to enjoy with spicy noodle dishes. Sweetness notwithstanding, it's a substantial wine with grip and definition. Melon and peach flavors roll smoothly into notes of caramel and honey. This is rich and delicious.
title: Washington Hills 2011 Late Harvest Riesling (Washington)

description: Abundant tropical fruit and honeysuckle aromas get a fine zesting of lime skin on this surprising bang-for-your-buck Riesling. Semisweet in style, almost with a deeply concentrated fruit palate, it finishes quite dry on a supple, waxy lanolin note.
title: Blue Teal 2010 Riesling (New Mexico)

description: A great value wine, Cusumano's cheerful Syrah is aged in stainless steel to lock in its fresh berry nuances. The wine's texture is clean and simple, but nicely smooth and soft as well.
title: Cusumano 2009 Syrah (Sicilia)

description: This is a refreshing picnic wine with light acidity, touches of pears and some sweetness. Its low alcohol makes it great for summer sunshine.
title: Louis Perdrier NV Brut Excellence Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Neutral on the nose, and then crisp but bland tasting. There's apple and green hints of fresh bell pepper and lettuce, while the finish shows lime, citrus pith and mild bitterness. Light and basic; made from 50% each of Airen and Macabeo (Viura).
designation: White Wine Made With Organic Grapes
title: Vermador 2009 White Wine Made With Organic Grapes White (Alicante)

description: Aged only in stainless steel, this well-priced blend of Corvina, Molinara and Rondinella washes over the palate with ease and good cheer. Pair it with take-out pizza and spicy sausage.
title: Stefano Accordini 2008  Valpolicella Classico

description: Creamy, soft and very floral, this would pair with fruit-based desserts or sponge cake. Thick and foamy layers of sweetness and soapy perlage move slowly over the palate.
title: Luccio 2011  Moscato d'Asti

description: A soft earthy character adds depth to the strawberry and rhubarb fruit aromas and flavors. The palate is clean and bright, with a cocoa-dusted red-berry fruit finish.
title: Le Grand Noir 2010 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: This is mild and lightly citric smelling, with an ocean spray note on the bouquet. On the palate, it is fresh and deep, with a note of nectarine. The finish is solid, but loses some fruit and gains some bitterness.
title: Echeverria 2012 Classic Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: Aromas of toasted marshmallow, lemon juice and papaya swarm the nose. The semisweet palate tastes floral and tropical, and it manages to keep its form with bright acidity. A touch of kiwi marks the finish.
title: Mount Pleasant Winery NV Semi-Sweet Vignoles (Missouri)

description: Nicely dry and tart, with mouthwatering acidity. The flavors are of citrus fruits, with a vegetal undertow of green beans that is not necessarily unpleasant. Clean and vibrant, it's a good cocktail wine.
title: Campus Oaks 2007 Viognier (Mokelumne River)

description: Silly name and label, but not a bad wine. The nose is meaty, medicinal and fails to hold its form over extended airing, but early on it's good and honest, as is the palate of herbal tomato and cassis flavors. A little bit scrappy, but for $10 it's better than most.
title: Sassy Bitch 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Roasted, leafy aromas greet you, followed by familiar scents of cherry and plum. The body is light to medium, with citric acidity turning the raspberry and pie cherry palate in the direction of snappy. Lithe on the finish, with a quick fade-away.
title: Cono Sur 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: A light, sophisticated nose of white flowers and citrus is followed by balanced fresh fruit and acid. The wine has a light touch but impresses with its elegant overall character. Pair with grilled fish or salads. A wine with poise and class.
title: Nederburg 2007 The Winemaster's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: A little cidery and funky smelling at first, but it settles to show stalky notes, scallion, tarragon and citrus flavors. Layered in feel but a bit green tasting throughout.
title: Jaume Serra NV Cristalino Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: This has creamy flavors of vanilla, honey, lime and orange.
title: Bogle 2011 Chardonnay (California)

description: Despite some cherry and blackberry fruit, this is fairly simple and dull. It's soft and sweetly spicy.
title: McManis 2011 Syrah (California)

description: This opens with delicate aromas of black-skinned berry, dark spice and cinnamon. The straightforward palate offers juicy black cherry, clove and a hint of white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Fattoria Zerbina 2015 Ceregio Sangiovese (Romagna)

description: This is an aromatic blend of Colombard, Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc. Fresh, crisp and fruity, it is the ideal apéritif wine with its mineral texture and bright acidity. It is a lively wine, with just a hint of yellow fruit to go with the intense citrus. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Ménard 2015 Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: A warm, sunny blend of local grapes, this is ripe while still having a fresh, fruity character. The acidity at the end reinforces this contrast between richness and crispness. Drink now.
title: Cartuxa 2015 EA Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Subtle and sweet on the nose, it has aromas of honey, peach and melon. Standard nettle, gooseberry and slightly-mealy citrus flavors mark the palate. This finishes chunky yet easygoing. Drink immediately.
title: Moonday Night Harvest 2011 Verdejo (Rueda)

description: Red in color, with sweet aromas of sugar beet, Red Delicious apple and cherry. It feels zesty, with simple flavors of red fruit and red apple. The finish is dry and a touch peppery. Drink immediately while it's fresh.
title: Pradorey 2011 Rosado Joven Tempranillo Rosé (Ribera del Duero)

description: A nice selection for poolside entertaining, this bright and accessible Chenin Blanc offers attractive aromas and flavors of guava, melon and orange marmalade that are balanced by vibrant acidity. Ripe and flavorful without being overdone.
title: Frisky Zebras NV Sultry Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: This is tightly crisp, with plenty of acidity to give it a mouthwatering character. It is balanced, with orange and caramel flavors. Great with food. Screwcap.
title: Winzer Krems 2011 Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: A good everyday Merlot that's dry and softly tannic, with pleasant cherry, cola and spice flavors.
title: Grayson 2010 Lot 6 Merlot (California)

description: An easy, fruity wine, this is full of blackberry and red currant flavors. Its fruitiness is tempered with a firm tannic core that gives a light structure.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2011 Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A lightly botrytised wine, with sweet raisins and orange zest. The wine is soft, missing acidity, but the freshness is just right.
title: Yvon Mau 2007 Seigneurs de Monbazillac  (Monbazillac)

description: A good everyday wine. It's dry, full-bodied and has enough berry-cherry flavors to get by, wrapped into a smooth texture.
title: Montevina 2008 Merlot (California)

description: The wine has blackberry fruits that give attractive acidity and add to the light structure. It is fruity, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Capitão Rayeo Red (Alentejano)

description: A soft banana and cherry-flavored wine that has attractive acidity and only the lightest of tannins. It is bright, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Henry Fessy 2015  Beaujolais

description: Basic plum and black cherry aromas come with hints of baking spices and cinnamon. This feels a bit high in acidity and pinchy. While a quick wash of grapy, black-fruit flavors finishes without much noise.
title: Beso de Vino 2015 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: High-toned cherry and floral notes blend with scents of plum and raspberry. This is narrow and jammy in feel, such that it collapses a bit. The preserved-berry flavors are more generic than specific.
title: Caliterra 2014 Reserva Shiraz (Colchagua Valley)

description: This wine is ripe, full of black fruits and with hints of licorice and dark chocolate. The spice from the wood aging still shows strongly although that will integrate over the next few months. Drink this ripe wine from 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Bons Ventos Red (Lisboa)

description: The land of wolves, Terra de Lobos, is a dense, balanced wine that brings together acidity and fresh red berry fruits. The tannins are not aggressive, but are just enough to give the wine shape. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Terra de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: This cherry-fruited wine is spicy, but a strong acid streak gives a raw aftertaste that should have softened by now. It is ready to drink.
title: Boutinot 2016 Les Violettes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine is fairly soft and muted, with delicate aromas of straw, apple and underripe white melon. The palate is similarly light in feel and intensity, with low acidity and a short finish.
title: Les Jamelles 2016 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

description: My Moon is a thin and watery Sauvignon that offers just enough aromatic intensity in terms of peach, sage and honey to make it mildly interesting. Pair with with spicy Thai spring rolls.
title: My Moon 2011 Sauvignon (Delle Venezie)

description: There's no shortage of funky wildness to the nose: leather, juniper and rubbery berry scents are all accounted for. The palate carries minimal tannic grip, while flavors of herbal berry fruits rekindle the juniper from the nose, leaving an herbal aftertaste.
title: Santa Alicia 2011 Reserva Shiraz (Maipo Valley)

description: Not sure what's going on at StoneCap, but after a couple of outstanding Merlot vintages, it seems to have lost its way in 2011. Spritzy, bitter and herbal, there's a big splash of vanilla, as if intended to cover the vegetal flavors of unripe grapes.
title: StoneCap 2011 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Iodine and briny citrus aromas are hardly the red carpet entry you might hope for. In the mouth, this is cushioned, with briny flavors of apple and nectarine that finish bitter. This will probably go down best with a splash of orange or peach juice. On it's own it struggles.
title: Berberana NV Gran Tradición Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: This wine's light, rusty color and herbal, dilute nose tell you most of what you need to know about this weakly constituted Monastrell-led blend. Tea, leafy fruit flavors, pepper and rooty flavors are what it's about.
title: Caracol Serrano 2010 Red (Jumilla)

description: Scratchy rhubarb aromas run tart and weedy. The palate on this basic Merlot is high in acid and thus shrill, with sharp raspberry and cherry flavors. A short, choppy finish with sour plum flavors closes out this marginal, crisp wine.
title: San Nicolas 2011 Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: Initially tannic, this concentrated wine shows itself to be young, with its structure still waiting to open. A dry texture lies over the big berry flavors that will develop over the next year.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2010 Monsaraz Red (Alentejo)

description: The ripe, appetizing zestiness of Amalfi lemon peel, paired with a green streak of lime and herb conquers nose and palate immediately. The palate brings out more lime freshness on a very linear, concentrated and taut palate. Both deliciously bracing and wonderfully refreshing.
title: Johann Donabaum 2015 Point Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)

description: Sweet on the nose, with a lot of mocha, vanilla and candied fruit. The palate is tannic and very oaky for a wine of this level. Flavors of toffee, cocoa, mocha and generic berry fruit show more oak than purity. A good wine but heavy handed with the oak. Contains 15% Syrah.
title: Ventisquero 2009 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: A typical southern Rhône blend of 60% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre mixed up behind a modern label, this is creamy and supple in texture, with colluding notes of cherry and black olive. Drink now.
title: The Rhôning Stones 2007 Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Aromas of tobacco, mild raisin, dry oak and berries are simple and pleasant, while the palate is light in weight, a touch dilute but very fresh and easy, with cherry, plum and even some citrus for flavor. Light and transparent on the finish, with barely any excess.
title: Bodegas Ondarre 2007 Ursa Maior Crianza  (Rioja)

description: Dry, thin and simple, with a green, minty streak and lots of acidity. Still, with some decent blackberry fruit, it's not a bad wine for the price.
title: Lyeth 2011 Fleur de Lyeth Red (California)

description: This offers that tempting aroma of toasted baguette with a dab of butter, then the flavors flow fresh and peachy, while the texture feels smooth and the body not too full. Well balanced between flavors, acidity and body, it brings refreshment to sip after another.
title: Gnarly Head 2013 Chardonnay (California)

description: With 7% residual sugar and 11% alcohol, this is a Riesling to enjoy with spicy noodle dishes. Sweetness notwithstanding, it's a substantial wine with grip and definition. Melon and peach flavors roll smoothly into notes of caramel and honey. This is rich and delicious.
title: Washington Hills 2011 Late Harvest Riesling (Washington)

description: Grapy and lusty, this is a barbecue-style wine for easy drinking. It floods the mouth with freshly crushed berries, plums and milk chocolate. Good value for an everyday, big red wine.
title: Virgin 2006 Shiraz (California)

description: Grapy and floral with loads of rose petal notes, this Moscato is perfumey on the nose and palate. Exuberantly frothy and mouth-filling, the palate is fleshy with sweet ripe grapes, with just a hint of stems and leaves on the finish.
title: Exclusiv NV Rose Spumos Moscato (Moldova)

description: This is a softly delicious red wine. It's strong and jammy in raspberries, cherries and milk chocolate, and is a little sweet, with a spicy finish. Nice barbecue wine. Mainly Zinfandel, with Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot and a few others.
title: DC Flynt MW Selections 2009 First Timer Red (California)

description: White peach and papaya aromas are sweet and tropical, while saline notes play second fiddle. Feels tangy, juicy and lean, with dilute lemon and green banana flavors. Wet and watery on the finish.
title: Salentein 2011 Portillo Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Uco Valley)

description: Labors from the start via soft, punchless aromas of generic red fruit. Feels a little flabby, with dry, basic flavors of red apple and cantaloupe. Turns pithy and slightly bitter on the finish. Drink now.
title: Señorio de Uñuela 2010 Rosado Tempranillo (Rioja)

description: Red fruits and spice along with mineral acidity give this wine interest as well as freshness. Juiciness dominates, with subdued tannins behind the wall of fruit. Age maybe for 1–2 years.
title: Castello d'Alba 2009 Red (Douro)

description: This starts off as a deceptively simple berry-cocktail sort of rosé, but then adds lime and crushed stone on the finish to provide added interest and refreshment. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Gournier 2010 Rosé (Vin de Pays des Cévennes)

description: With Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, this is a strongly structured wine. It is dark and tannic, acidity laced with dark plum flavors. This firm wine is still young and should be aged for at least a year, so drink from 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Portuga Red (Lisboa)

description: This wine leans toward the brown-orange side of the Pinot Noir scale, with burnt orange, cranberry and whiffs of anise. Cooked fruits dominate the palate, with fruitcake and gingerbread flavors.
title: Pietra Santa 2012 Route 152 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Floral and fresh, with a supercharged personality and plenty of sugary sweetness. On the plus side, it's racy and lithe, and that's despite being as candied as it is. But ask yourself, what's not to like about lemon-lime and apple? And when there's smoothness and palate feel thrown in, you wind up with a warm-weather winner.
title: Parxet 2002 Marques de Alella Clasico White (Alella)

description: Fleshy apple and peach aromas lead to a medium-bodied palate. Standard flavors of stone fruits are nice but simple, while this blend of Viura and Malvasia finishes with light notes of apple and nectarine.
title: Baron De Ley 2015 White (Rioja)

description: Drink this Merlot with burgers at a party. It's dry and tannic, with some satisfying black currant, licorice and green tea flavors.
title: Fog Head 2012 Merlot (California)

description: Aromas of white fruits and apple are slightly mealy and set up flavors of melon and tangy but pithy citrus. The finish is even more pithy. Overall this wine feels like it's starting to fade.
title: Santa Julia 2013 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

description: Sweet in jammy apricots and oranges, it has a creamy mouthfeel and a good burst of acidity for balance.
title: Tin Roof 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: Weight and a mealy character combine with bath soap aromas on the nose. This is pulpy in feel, with flavors of generic citrus and lychee. The finish is fresh at first and then turns hollow.
title: Fat Gaucho 2012 Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: Apricot, peach pit and matchstick are the lead aromas on this basic Chardonnay. Flavors of melon and apricot are lightly oxidized and nutty, while the finish is salty and slightly bitter, with a dab of honey for an offset.
title: San Felipe 2012 Oak Cask Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Drinkable with just about anything that calls for red wine, it has currant, licorice and oak flavors.
title: Fog Head 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This bargain-priced offering is simple, fruity and direct, marked by peach and pineapple notes and a silky texture. Drink now.
title: Settlers Rise 2016 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: This ripe, smooth wine is juicy with attractive red fruits. A barnyard character at the back spoils the natural fruitiness. Tannins and blackberry flavors provide a happier finish.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Casaleiro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This wine comes from a large 300-acre estate on the island's east coast. It has subtle raspberry fruit and plenty of acidity. With its crisp aftertaste, filled out with a touch of caramel, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine Vetriccie 2016 Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: This warm style of Sauvignon Blanc has apricot and citrus flavors. Packed with fruit and with refreshing acidity, it makes a fine apéritif.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2016 La Châsse Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: A hard coating of woodspice sits atop herbal plum and berry aromas. This feels tough and nearly impermeable. Spicy, briary plum flavors are lean and taste woody on a dry, tannic finish.
title: Salentein 2016 Portillo Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Valle de Uco)

description: This Mediterranean blend of Syrah and Grenache is soft and open. It has the lightest touch of tannin, adding texture to its blackberry fruit and crisp acidity. It finishes with an attractive perfumed character.
title: Vinadeis 2016 Appetit de France Red (Vin de France)

description: This is a medium-bodied, crisp and tangy wine with fresh parsley aromas and lemon and Granny Smith apple flavors. It's well balanced, restrained and will be very versatile with food.
title: Fetzer 2015 Echo Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

description: Although a bit stalky and weak on the nose, this offers reasonably fresh red-berry aromas in front of a fair, slightly jammy palate. Herbal red-berry and plum flavors show a hint of chocolate on the finish.
title: Tussock Jumper 2013 Malbec (San Juan)

description: Ripe and very dry, this has flavors of raisins, blackberries and dark chocolate, with a hint of smoky oak that adds richness.
title: McManis 2011 Merlot (California)

description: This easygoing Verdeca delivers slightly oxidized aromas of apricot and butterscotch, with bright touches of lemon zest and honeysuckle.
title: Miali 2010 Pizzo del Vento Verdeca (Salento)

description: Winemakers Mark Shannon and Elvezia Sbalchiero have crafted a light blend of Fiano and Greco with loads of lemon and lime flavors at the front. The palate is superlean and bright.
title: A-Mano 2011 White (Puglia)

description: Light in color, this shows red cherry and strawberry flavors. The tannins are soft, creating an easy wine that is ready to drink.
title: Barton & Guestier 2011  Beaujolais

description: Fresh floral and peach-like aromas emerge from the nose of this pristine expression of Pinot Grigio from sunny Sicily. You'll get aromas of chopped herb, lemon and yellow rose. The mouthfeel is zesty and bright. Highly recommended at this low price.
title: MandraRossa 2008 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)

description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are simple as pie, while this feels a touch astringent and drawing. Tart but fresh plum and raspberry flavors are slightly briny. Juicy and satisfactory on the finish.
title: Vicente Gandia 2014 Hoya de Cadenas Organic Tempranillo (Spain)

description: Clear and lucid to the eye, this Verdejo shows pine, grapefruit, orange and apple aromas along with oily pith. The mouthfeel is more plump and wet than defined, while lychee and melon flavors are offset by tolerable bitter pyrazines and grapefruit flavors.
title: Nebla 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)

description: This wine carries aromas of blackberry and olive. Its dominant flavor of berry with an herbal-rhubarb twist is solid. The finish lifts, with a hint of tomato.
title: Santa Alicia 2011 Reserva Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

description: Fresh and floral, this is abundantly fragrant with notes of sweet cherry blossom and freshly cut herb. The palate is crisp and dry, with zesty hints of underripe stone fruit and lemon. Brisk and clean on the finish.
title: Targovishte 2011 Premium Quality Dry Muskat Ottonel (Black Sea Coastal)

description: Brisk acidity and a lean but smooth profile characterize this taut, somewhat tart wine.  A very inviting vouquet with cherry, cinnamon, clove, cedar, and tobacco notes sets a pretty stage for the palate, but after the great setup the wine delivers rather uninspired and predictable tart berry and sour cherry Barbera flavors.  The sour plum and earth finish is full but quite dry.
title: Marchesi di Barolo 1998 Barbera (Monferrato)

description: I know Bordeaux isn't known for being fruit-driven, but this paucity of fruit in a wine that's 50% Merlot (from a vintage that favored this variety's development) is hard to fathom. Leather and old wood combine with earth and mushrooms. There's decent weight and intensity here, so if these are flavors you look for this is an example to seek out.
title: Château Ducla 1998  Bordeaux

description: The wine balances the sweet spiciness of Gewurztraminer with a good level of acidity. That gives the wine a light touch while allowing the rose and bergamot character of the grape to shine through. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Michel Léon 2013 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Showing the warmth of an Alentejo wine, this is ripe and full in the mouth, offering red berry fruits cut with juicy acidity. It's a rich wine tinged with spice, finishing with a fresh aftertaste.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Ramos Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Made entirely with Nerello Mascalese, this offers aromas of scorched earth, ripe berry and clove. The lithe palate delivers juicy cherry, crushed raspberry, ground white pepper and a mineral note alongside polished tannins.
title: Murgo 2012 Rosso  (Etna)

description: The 50% Malvasia in the blend gives this wine its perfumed character. It is ripe, touched by honey and spice. The wine has a fine, fresh streak at the end. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection White (Douro)

description: Lemon, spice and pepper flavors are the keys to this easy, accessible wine. It is full of fresh fruit that has bitter almond and ripe pear flavors. With acidity and a crisp aftertaste, the wine is ripe and ready to drink.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2014 Dona Ermelinda White (Palmela)

description: This is a fruity, juicy wine that Heifara Swartvagher made to be drunk young. With black currant freshness over firm, dry tannins, it's ripe, packed with attractive fruitiness and ready to drink.
title: Château Saint-Sernin 2012 Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)

description: Wiry plum and green-tobacco aromas transition to red-fruit scents as this breathes. A fresh, forward palate is medium in body, while a mix of spice, green herb, olive, plum and berry notes comprise the flavor package. A tight, juicy palate maintains the wine's core flavors.
title: Caliterra 2014 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: This Chardonnay-based wine, with 10% Chenin Blanc, opens with aromas of pressed yellow flowers, peach blossom and just-ripe tropical fruit. There's good zip to the bright fruit flavors, finishing fresh and clean. Drink now.
title: Domaine Rives-Blanques 2016 White (Pays d'Oc)

description: Lightly roasted berry and cassis aromas are a touch hot but good. This wine is solid on the palate, with hard-smacking tannins. Flavors of chocolate, spicy berry fruit and a touch of campfire finish more roasted than fruity.
title: Echeverria 2015 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

description: Modest cherry and plum aromas are weighty. This is holding onto its freshness, with flavors of citrus pulp and peel. Drink up now.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Peñascal 2012 Tempranillo Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: The green apple, apple skin and flower aromas pop. The off-dry peach flavors keep you coming back for more.
title: Whispering Tree 2014 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Too sweet, with a sugary finish that tastes like lemonade and pineapple juice.
title: Cycles Gladiator 2006 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Simple and candied, with flavors of pineapple juice and not enough acidity for balance.
title: Cycles Gladiator 2007 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

description: Simple, with blackberry, cherry, carob and herb flavors wrapped into a jagged texture.
title: Grayson 2007 Merlot (California)

description: Tough in the mouth, with green, minty tannins framing jellied flavors of blackberries and cherries. Okay for fast foods and such.
title: Grayson 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Sugary sweet and soft, with candied flavors of cherries and berries.
title: Cycles Gladiator 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: An aggressive wine with very little charm or character to back up its edgy verve. The nose is skunky while the palate tastes of pickled red cabbage and sharp berry flavors. A weak product reflective of a cool, nongiving vintage.
title: Condado de Oriza 2007  Ribera del Duero

description: Seemingly more candied and sweet than prior years, but still a reasonably good generic-style Cabernet if you don't mind a little sucking candy and gumball along the route. Flavors of strawberry and cassis are sticky but ripe, while the finish is chewy and sweet.
title: Santa Julia 2007 Organica Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Soft and on the fat side, this is an easy wine, with its pear and melon flavors, spiced up by some pepper and lime. An attractive, ripe mouthful.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Casa do Lago Fernão Pires (Estremadura)

description: A ripe, spicy wine, with attractive, easy black fruits. It is soft and full, with forward fruitiness and sweet tannins. Very ready, very drinkable.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Soft and simple, but the price makes it a pretty good value. Shows cherry, violet, cocoa and smoky oak flavors in a smooth package that finishes dry and spicy.
title: Mandolin 2005 Merlot (Central Coast)

description: This Sicilian Chardonnay presents stone fruit, pear and honey backed by a slightly pungent, acetone-like note in the background that doesn't disturb too much. It tastes smooth, fresh and offers tingling spice on the finale.
title: MandraRossa 2007 Chardonnay (Sicilia)

description: Fruity and ripe, this is a spicy wine, with red cherry and berry flavors, livened by dried raisins. There is a rustic edge that puts it simply in its place, but the acidity is fine and so is the dry tannic core.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2006 Farizoa Red (Alentejano)

description: A light, bright and breezy wine with an attractive citrus character and tight acidity. Great for an apéritif or with shellfish.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2010 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Bricco al Sole is proudly made with organically grown grapes and exhibits aromas of black fruit, sweet spice and black olive. It's streamlined and fresh on the finish, with a bright berry aftertaste.
title: Cantine Volpi 2008 Bricco al Sole  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: Jammy strawberry and raspberry notes fill the nose and mouth, and a soft accent of chocolate-covered cherry adds just the right amount of decadence. A slight peppery lift keeps things vibrant on the finish.
title: The Frenchhouse 2010 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Ripe and rich, it's full of tropical fruit, pineapple and mango flavors. Fresh acidity balances the full fruitiness. The aftertaste brings out a more mineral character.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Made in an overtly oaky manner, this wine imitates the big barrel-fermented style pretty well. It has smoky, buttery aromas, good pear and peach flavors and a smooth, soft texture.
title: Replica 2015 Knockoff Chardonnay (California)

description: The aromas of herb, kiwi and citrus are quite light. The tropical flavors are elegant and spritely, tingling the palate with a light effervescence.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This bold, ripe blend even contains some Muscat that gives richness and a touch of honey and spice to what is otherwise a dry rosé. The acidity acts as a balance to this attractive wine.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Jas des Vignes Rosé

description: Although this Zinfandel, Carignane and Petite Sirah blend is rustic, the price makes it a good value in a dry, full-bodied red wine. With its strong tannins and flavors of currants and black pepper, it will be nice with Mexican food.
title: Laurel Glen 2008 Reds Red (Lodi)

description: Dark in color and aromas. The nose starts out sulfuric and gassy, but settles on rubber and earthy black fruit. In the mouth, there's poking, prodding acidity and basic flavors of blackberry, herbal tea and leather. Grabby on the finish, with a mild acidic scour.
title: Enrique Foster 2009 Ique Malbec (Mendoza)

description: With bright red fruits and acidity, this shows structure, piles of red cherry flavors, followed by firm tannins.
title: Mommessin 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

description: The lightest feeling wine, attractive in its acidity, its slight sweetness and its creamed apple flavor. A perfect summer apéritif.
title: Broadbent 2010 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Bright berry fruit is jammy and simply fruity, but clean and soft. Drink this medium-bodied, supple Shiraz over the next year or so.
title: Oxford Landing 2009 Shiraz (South Australia)

description: The nose offers up aromas of sweet pea, honeysuckle and fresh sliced peaches. Light to medium body and strong crisp acidity lead into a clean, refreshing finish.
title: Recanati 2006 Kosher Yasmin White White (Galilee)

description: Here's a solid everyday Zin, lusty and rustic, offering up a big gulp of fruity flavor. Blackberries, cherries, mulberries, root beer, licorice, and just about every spice you can name shows up. It's a dry, tannic wine that will love rich, fatty meats and cheeses.
title: Renwood 2005 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

description: Comes down on the rustic side, but for the price it's pretty good for a dry Cabernet. Shows the variety's full-bodied fanciness in the blackberry, currant, cocoa and licorice flavors, with a rich steak of vanilla oak.
title: Meridian 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Ripe and rustic, this is a good everyday Merlot made for simple fare. It's rich and direct in blackberry pie, cherry jam, cola, cocoa and smoky vanilla flavors.
title: Little Black Dress 2005 Merlot (California)

description: The aromas are quite reticent, with notes of herb, purple fruit and abundant wood spices. Still, the palate delivers plush-feeling fruit flavors, speckled with attractive barrel accents.
title: Snoqualmie 2014 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine from Southern Moldova is aged six months in oak barrels, which give it a creamy texture. There are aromas of apple and orange flowers, and flavors of lemon pith and Granny Smith apple juice.
title: Bostavan 2014 Via Etulia Reserve Chardonnay (Moldova)

description: This is a dense, complete wine with good Garnacha character and generous berry, spice, char and minty aromas and flavors. Rubbery tannins are fair and just, while flavors of grilled meat and baked plum finish oaky, with a slightly raw feel.
title: Niel Santofimia 2011 Red (Almansa)

description: Harkens back to the value days of the Diamond Label—but the style has been updated to reflect more freshness and focus. Pineapple and melon notes display cool, citrusy overtones, picking up just a hint of caramel on the finish. Drink now.
title: Rosemount 2011 Diamond Label Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: More than most wineries, Bogle knows how to make fairly priced varietal wines that stand up to the competition. The wine has plenty of Chardonnay character, with oak-infused tropical fruit, green apple and pear flavors. With production at 600,000 cases, it's a remarkable achievement. The fruit is from Clarksburg and Monterey County.
title: Bogle 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: Full in the mouth, this is a ripe, currant- and gooseberry-flavored wine. It has a bright, forward, fruity feel that makes it delicious to drink. Very refreshing in character. Screwcap.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2012 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Floral tones of peony, honeysuckle and verbena are upfront on the nose of this pretty white wine, with core fruit tones of pink apple and sweet citrus.
