description: An elegant wine that slides easily over the palate. Its red berry flavors have a firm edge that stiffens the initial softness. Its tannins and acidity make this a serious, food-friendly wine that could age.
title: Alente 2009 Trincadeira-Aragonez Red (Alentejo)

description: With a strange pink color and powdery nondescript aromas, this is shapeless and lacking in structure. Weak bitter flavors are completely fruitless; overall this seems to be going nowhere good.
title: Echeverria 2016 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: Cusumano is a terrific Sicilian estate that offers both high-end expressions and a consistent line of value wines. This well-priced Nero d'Avola is fresh, clear, fruit-forward and easy to drink.
title: Cusumano 2009 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: A consistent wine, year in and year out, MandraRossa's fresh Nero d'Avola would pair perfectly with pizza or simple spaghetti and tomato sauce. It shows loads of cola, licorice, dark fruit and bright acidity on the close.
title: MandraRossa 2010 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: Piercing woody aromas create a fiery nose of spicy red-fruit scents. Narrow, gritty and scratchy in feel, this tastes of red-berry fruits, vanilla and buttery oak. The finish hints at buttered movie popcorn.
title: In Situ 2013 Reserva Estate Bottled Carmenère (Aconcagua Valley)

description: A nose of black cherry and red berry leads on this Romanian Merlot, followed by flavors of cherry and spice. Backed by a solid tannic structure but slightly acidic, this wine will pair well with grilled meats.
title: Cramele Recas 2008 La Putere Merlot (Recas)

description: Sharply defined with fruit flavors of melon and green berry, this has real cut and drives through the palate with confidence. It's a great food wine, neither wimpy nor too assertive, and it's made to be chilled and set out with any white-wine-friendly food.
title: Snoqualmie 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine is produced from organically grown grapes. It is aged in tank, giving a wine that is all blackberry fruit with a crisp texture as well as generous tannins. With touches of Dão minerality, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Global Wines 2013 Cabriz Biologico Organic Red (Dão)

description: Refreshing and fruity, this is quintessential Muscadet. It has a zesty character that brings out the lemon and orange flavor. Adding to the citrus fruits, there is also pink grapefruit in this fruity mix. The wine is crisp, lively and ready to drink.
title: Guilbaud Frères 2016 Cuvée du Lion  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

description: Classic Viognier apricot flavors are prominent in this ripe, full wine. It's as poised as it is rich—full of fruit, with a warm, rounded aftertaste.
title: Maison de la Villette 2016 Viognier (Vin de France)

description: This Alicante leads with red-skinned berry, rose petal and cooking spice aromas that carry over to the juicy, straightforward palate. They're joined by a gamy flavor and smooth tannins that leave an easygoing impression. Enjoy soon.
title: Marilena Barbera 2015 Ciàfu Alicante (Menfi)

description: Made entirely from Nero d'Avola, this opens with mature plum, blackberry and cooking spice aromas. It's juicy and easygoing on the palate, with fleshy black cherry, raspberry and ground pepper hints accompanied by round, smooth tannins. Drink soon.
title: Stemmari 2015 Estate Grown Sustainably Farmed Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: Rich black berry flavors lead in this delicious blend of 80% Montepulciano and 20% Sangiovese. The juicy fruit carries over to the palate, with notes of balsamic herbs alongside big, ripe tannins. It's a straightforward wine for everyday pleasure. Drink now.
title: Fattoria Laila 2012  Rosso Piceno

description: Made from a typical Gascon blend of Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng, this zesty wine is dry, herbaceous, fresh and crisp. Its full of citrus and green apple fruits, with a tangy finish. Screwcap.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 Villa Grand Cap White (Vin de France)

description: This smooth, easygoing blend of 70% Grenache and 30% Syrah is a pleasant surprise, offering up bright raspberry fruit and a hint of chocolaty richness. Drink it over the next year or so.
title: Les Vignobles Foncalieu 2009 Bastide de Beauvert Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Great price for a Chardonnay that tastes like it costs a lot more. Although it's unoaked, it's very rich in passionfruit, pineapple, peach and vanilla cream flavors, with a honeyed finish. Easy to find, with 5,000 cases produced.
title: Healdsburg Ranches 2009 Unoaked Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Labeled off dry but with little or no sweetness, this is a unique effort, a rosé style with unusual length and focus. Chill this wine and drink it as an apéritif. It is most unusual—dusty, musky, and concentrated, with a fine finish that resonates with a Grand Marnier note.
title: Hyatt 2009 Black Muscat (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: A blend of Malvasia Fina and the great local grape Encruzado, this rich, wood-aged wine is perfumed and offers great fruitiness. Citrus and green plum fruits mingle with pineapple. The texture and the light toast give weight and add another dimension. The wine can be drunk now, but will be better from 2015.
title: Pedra Cancela 2012 White (Dão)

description: With touches of wood and spice, this is round, soft and ready to drink. It has a core of red fruit flavor and an attractive touch of cool-climate acidity.
title: Falua 2011 Tâmara Red (Tejo)

description: Made in a semisweet style, this smells almost dry, with notes of cheese and vanilla. On the palate, it's simple, where the sugary flavors quickly emerge before fading away to almost nothing.
title: Floria 2010 Semi Sweet Cabernet Sauvignon (Molina)

description: Pretty decent for a 10-spot, with slightly floral aromas, a hint of ginger and underripe pear fruit. It's medium bodied, with a dry, lightly textured, bitter finish. Drink now.
title: Oxford Landing 2016 Pinot Grigio (South Australia)

description: Minty berry aromas settle well and hold up to airing. This everyday Merlot is more than competent on the palate. Berry and spice flavors finish chewy, with standard ripeness and follow through.
title: Cuyen 2016 Merlot (Central Valley)

description: A soft, simple, fruity Merlot. Tastes like a cherry, blackberry, roasted almond, cocoa and cinnamon granola bar, melted into wine.
title: Cable Car 2007 Merlot (California)

description: The wine tastes sulphured, with suppressed fruit. There is some weight, with caramel and red berry fruit flavors, but it is all muted.
title: Les Vignerons de Grimaud 2010 Cuvée du Golfe de Saint-Tropez Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Showing the ripeness of the vintage, this is a smooth, lightly textured wine, with plenty of yellow and citrus fruits. The wine needs a few months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Château de Costis 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Light-bodied and easygoing, this has delicate whiffs reminiscent of spring flower and red berry. The extremely simple fruity palate shows sour cherry and a hint of raspberry.
title: Monte Zovo 2016  Bardolino Chiaretto

description: A candy-pink-colored wine, this is crisp, fruity and off dry. There is a touch of caramel that fills out the otherwise acidic and red-currant-flavored palate. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2016 Arca Nova Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: It's obvious there has been some oak aging here, because the wine is packed with spiciness and toast. That rather diminishes the fruit. Made to be drunk young, it may miss the target.
title: Ribafreixo 2014 Barrancôa Red (Alentejano)

description: Full dark berry aromas and flavors and classic pepper accents mark this very likeable wine. Cocoa and meaty elements add a bit of complexity not necessarily expected at this price. Kept lively by its brisk, but not sharp acidity, it finishes peppery with a tart-sweet profile.  This straightforward, delicious wine exemplifies how competitive California can still be, despite the trend to priciness.
title: Cline 1999 Zinfandel (California)

description: Tight as a drum, but a little cherry fruit escapes from the nose. It opens up into a sweet, lovely bottle of wine, with a bit of cocoa and coffee in the finish. Well-balanced, with sweet, clean fruit.
title: Cartlidge & Browne 1998 Zinfandel (California)

description: With its bold, jammy blackberries and a hint of black pepper on the nose, this wine is all about delivering a flavor punch. Straightforward berry fruit is tinged with licorice in a bulky but satisfying package.
title: Château Val Joanis 1998 Estate Bottled Red (Côtes du Luberon)

description: This well-balanced Merlot displays a deep ruby/purple color and plenty of plum flavors. Coffee and herb notes add a touch of complexity and the texture is smooth and even. The finish has good length for a modestly priced red.
title: Longridge 1999 Bay View Merlot (Stellenbosch)

description: This medium weight example shows Pinotage fruit in a forward, correct manner. Tart plum and berry, cherry, and leather aromas abound. Earth and dried plum flavors on the palate are kept lively by decent acidity; touches of tart red berry, rhubarb and anise show on the moderately long finish.
title: Longridge 1999 Bayview Pinotage (South Africa)

description: Dark in color, with plum, berry and medicinal aromas. Round, full and in good shape, with dark plum, blackberry and a lot of oak for a $10 wine. Finishes creamy and big, with a spicy aftertaste. Plump and solid for value-priced Graciano.
title: Rio Madre 2010  Rioja

description: Jammy raspberry aromas come with a minerally kick and toastiness. The palate is fresh and delivers pointed acidity in support of toasty berry, herb and licorice flavors. Finishes with a lightly baked and chocolaty note, confirming that this is well-made, value-priced wine.
title: Medrano 2011 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This acidity-driven wine has a sheer veneer of tannins over thinned red fruit, earth and cocoa powder. With such a light, simple touch, this wine is a good choice for those who usually order white wine.
title: Robertson Winery 2001 Merlot (Robertson)

description: Decent, with ripe flavors of cherries and spice, dry tannins and good acidity. Yes, it's a common wine, made for everyday consumption, but you can't drink expensive stuff every day. This will do in a pinch, or for your next block party.
title: Forest Glen 2000 Merlot (California)

description: The aromas are a bit too prickly and pickled to call the nose clean, and thus the wine never really achieves solid footing. The raspberry and strawberry fruit is there, but it's marred by sharp, pickled accents, which ultimately don't work in its favor. The feel is nice, as the acidity and tannins are proper. But with too much funk to the nose and palate, it misses the upper echelon.
title: La Legua 1999 Crianza Tempranillo (Cigales)

description: This dark cherry-red wine has aromas of red plums and dried black plums that flow to the palate. An easy drinking wine, with pleasantly tart cherry flavors.
title: Vini 2012 Veni Vidi Vici Pinot Noir (Thracian Valley)

description: This is a very fragrant and floral rosé, reminiscent of peach gummy candies, orange blossom and orange-ginger tea. The palate is surprisingly lush, with round ripe-fruit flavors that are just barely lifted on the finish. Drink now.
title: Vintales 2015 Sunset Rosé (Western Cape)

description: This dry, firm wine shows a hint of bitter extraction, but the core of the wine is smooth. Give it several years' aging.
title: Château des Judes 2011  Bordeaux

description: Nectarine and tangerine aromas come with a floral note and a whiff of sea foam. This is light in acidity, so the palate is round and chunky. Flavors of citrus and melon finish pithy and slightly bitter.
title: Vaya Vadiso 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Neutral, dusty and a bit damp-smelling, with a leanness to the palate feel as well as flavors of semitart melon and peach. Decent but fails to excite. Drink now.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Tapeña 2010 Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Smells grassy, jumpy and foxy, and while it sports a decent feel on the palate, it's herbal and tomatoey in terms of flavor, with a vegetal undertone. Green and oaky on the finish.
title: Viñas de Vila 2009 Reserva Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Asphalt, crusty leather and herbal berry aromas are the opening on this racy Merlot. Flavors run from herbal, peppery and olive-driven to red-berry fruits. A spicy finish brings enough red-cherry character to make things work.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2012 Petirrojo Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: Light-bodied, straightforward red, with blackberry aromas, this wine could be accentuated with chilling and is a solution for cuisine such as mixed charuterie platters or liver terrines. A friendly, uncomplicated red made for the moment, with gracious, cheerful fruitiness.
title: Forstreiter 2011 ZVY-GELT Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)

description: This delightful, off-dry white is a blend of Pinot Gris, Gewürztraminer, Müller Thurgau, Sauvignon Blanc and Riesling,  perfectly matched to deliver crisp, fruity aromatics and flavors of apples, oranges and pears. It's a terrific anytime quaffer.
title: Oak Knoll NV Toasted Cow White Vintners Blend White (Willamette Valley)

description: The nose on this strange Cabernet is mostly about cinnamon and funky smelling fruit. This feels flat, with gum drop flavors that end in a grabby, cloying finish.
title: YaYa 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: This is the weak link in an otherwise increasingly enjoyable range of wines from Barton & Guestier. Positioned somewhere between off dry and medium sweet, it has an edge of bitter sulphur along with almond and quince fruit flavor. The final acidity jars.
title: Barton & Guestier 2011  Vouvray

description: This spritzy, weird wine opens with grassy aromas that are backed by a coarse, bubbly palate with flavors of banana, lettuce and bitter greens.
title: Tussock Jumper 2011 Moscato (Valencia)

description: Jammy black fruit aromas are pleasant, while the palate has a feel and flow that rolls along nicely. Tastes of baked black fruits and vanilla, while the finish is solid and keeps its form. Slightly herbal if you did deep, but good overall especially when you consider the price.
title: Bautista Simona 2008 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: As per usual, this wine offers solid berry fruit aromas as well as good balance and varietal correctness. The palate feel is balanced and fresh, while the flavors of cassis, berry and oak are properly welded together. Finishes with a touch of chocolate and wood spice.
title: Calina 2008 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Regular but inviting, with good berry aromas and only a modicum of baked-fruit grit to the nose. The palate is solid and fruity, with lively, grapey berry and black-cherry flavors. Finishes smooth, with chocolate notes. Easygoing, simple Malbec from San Juan province.
title: Casa Montes 2008 Ampakama Malbec (San Juan)

description: A great selection for those seeking an affordable organically grown Merlot. Ripe red berries along with notes of mocha and spearmint unfold on the nose, while red plum and cherry take center stage in the mouth. With solid structure and good balance, this is sure to be a crowd pleaser.
designation: Originel Made with Organically Grown Grapes
title: Barton & Guestier 2008 Originel Made with Organically Grown Grapes Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Syrah offers varietally blended aromas of black currant, charred hardwood and black pepper. It's very jammy and hedonistic on the palate, with hot blueberry pie and toasted vanilla-bean elements, yet the tannins and acidity hold the powerful flavors in check.
title: Ringer 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: This bold, purple-colored wine is fruity and soft. Its acidity combines with black fruit and a juicy, lightly tannic texture. Drink now.
title: Château du Cèdre 2016 Cedrus Malbec

description: A mix of melon, tropical fruit and passion fruit aromas lead to a tight palate with just enough body weight to not be austere. Flavors of white pepper, citrus and celery are modest on the finish, which tastes briny.
title: Tres Palacios 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: The wine is dominated by crisp, herbal flavors. With acidity, citrus notes and just a touch of spice, it's fruity and bright. Drink now.
title: Château Lacaussade Saint-Martin 2016 Trois Moulins  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Salinic and simple on the bouquet. The palate is narrow and citric, with lean, sour tangerine, lemon and lettuce-like flavors. Tangy and lemony on the finish as well.
title: Terrapura 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

description: Generic pear and apple aromas are simple but good. This wine runs light on oak and feels juicy and correct. Flavors of apple, pear and vanilla turn more briny and salty on the finish, which circles back with sweetness as it fades away.
title: Tilia 2014 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Showing Cannonau's lighter side, this simple red has fruity aromas of wild berry and a hint of dried aromatic herb. The easygoing, informal palate offers red cherry, raspberry and a hint of white pepper alongside soft tannins.
title: Vigneti Zanatta 2013 Salana  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Chiseled aromas of lemon-lime and spring flowers are lean but clean, and that pretty much describes this blend of Treixadura, Torrontés and Palomino. Lime and green banana are the key flavors, and the finish brings back lemon-lime and minerality. More basic than flashy, but nice in a neutral way.
title: Pazo Ribeiro 2008 White (Ribeiro)

description: A soft-textured, rather light-bodied and fruit-forward offering, this smells and tastes like pear, apple and grape juices with a touch of sweetness and low acidity.
title: Koz 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: There is an openly fruity, uncomplicated personality in this medium-bodied, easy-to-drink wine. It show fresh raspberry and cherry flavors, a juicy rather than tannic texture, and nicely dry balance. It blends Syrah, Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Mad Crush 2011 Red (California)

description: Chopped herbs, licorice and a bit of smoke lead the nose on this affordable wine. It's thinner on the palate, with more licorice that spices up the red fruit flavors. The finish shows some tannic grip.
title: Mandolin 2012 Syrah (Central Coast)

description: This is a rather light wine in both density, flavor and impact. Some dilute citrus fruit flavors are framed with the lightest hint of cracker. Drink it chilled or use it as a mixer.
title: Maryhill 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Raspberry aromas are simple but friendly. This feels condensed and a bit jammy, without a lot of stand-up structure. Candied, lightly loamy flavors of plum and currant finish modest and short.
title: Burgo Viejo 2012 Tinto  (Rioja)

description: Grapy and jammy smelling, this feels narrow and high in acid, bearing plum and tart cherry flavors that turn more sour with time. The finish is tomatoey and abrupt.
title: Canoas 2010 Estate Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)

description: Twizzler and other red candy aromas lead to a creamy feeling yet acidic palate that tastes like raspberry extract. Sharp acidity prevents what would otherwise be a cloying wine.
title: Bodegas Valdemar 2011 Conde de Valdemar Rosado Tempranillo-Garnacha (Rioja)

description: This is attractive in a bright, fruit-driven style. Bright berry fruit is tinged with apricot and cocoa on the midpalate, then finishes firm and dusty.
title: Père Anselme 2012 La Fiole Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: A really good wine for the price, this offers a dark color and varietal aromas of black cherry, black olive and faint dried herbs. Next it layers handsome oak on the rich and fruity flavors. The texture is quite dense without being heavy; while somewhat tannic the mouthfeel is not drying.
title: Dark Horse 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Vinified by the winemaking team of Dão Sul, this is a blend of Touriga Nacional, Alicante Bouschet and Syrah, a rich, wild blend, with smooth blackberry jelly fruits, an edge of astringency, and a layer of toast from the eight months wood aging.
title: Quinta do Gradil 2006 Red (Estremadura)

description: Composed and dry Merlot made somewhat in an Old World style. Cola, tobacco and basic berry fruit aromas come in front of a juicy, high-acid palate. Tastes spicy and toasty, with plum and red berry flavors. Fresh and clean; best with food.
title: Gouguenheim Winery 2009 Merlot (Mendoza)

description: This light and approachable wine boasts easy notes of green apple, melon rind and a touch of hay. The mouth shows more citrus dominance, with a brisk lemon-lime character staying through the finish. Drink now.
title: Two Oceans 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Tangerine and citrus aromas give the bouquet an orangey element, and there's a pinch of oak and tarragon in there as well. The palate has a mild, buttery texture and creamy flavors of peach and apple. Honeyed and creamy on the simple finish.
title: Trapiche 2010 Oak Cask Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Opens with gumball aromas and also foresty spice and bramble. The palate is tight and tannic as it delivers standard red licorice, berry and leathery flavors. Finishes with some salty leather and that's about it.
title: Los Nevados 2008 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Smells almost as much like a pizza as wine with its herbal notes of basil, fresh tomato and pepper. Along with those saucy aromas come berry and plum fruit; but again, any fruit on the nose or palate is mixed with a strong dose of herbal essence. Soft and chewy in terms of feel. Standard Chilean Merlot.
title: Viña Requingua 2006 Puerto Viejo Reserve Merlot (Curicó Valley)

description: Cantaloupe melon and white peach set the stage aromatically. The wine follows through to the palate with fresh crispness and a clean, compact style.
title: Marcato 2010 I Prandi Colli Scaligeri  (Soave)

description: There's a distinct salinity to this Chard, complementing the green apple and hard peach flavors. Notes of sweet lemony citrus linger on the mouthwatering finish.
title: Marrenon 2009 Les Grains Chardonnay (Mediterranée)

description: Here's a light and easy-drinking white with soft notes of green plum, citrus and melon rind in the nose and mouth. A hint of tropical fruit acidity unfolds on the brisk finish. Drink now.
title: Indaba 2010 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Rubbery and warm on the nose, with earthy plum and blackberry aromas. The palate is full and bouncy, with appropriate plum, berry and cassis flavors. Nice for standard New World Cab, with fig, chocolate and no buttery, sloppy oak.
title: Bodega Norton 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Generic black fruit aromas are accompanied by mocha, heat and lemony oak. Feels tannic and choppy, with herbal berry fruit flavors. Lively but pointed and jagged on the finish.
title: Santa Ema 2010 Selected Terroir Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Blackberry, leather, clove and dark cooking spice aromas lead the way while the ripe palate extends dense wild cherry, raspberry jam and a dusting of cocoa. It's easy drinking and enjoyable, with round, velvety tannins.
title: Tenute Orestiadi 2014 Molino a Vento Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

description: Here's a great value wine that opens with aromas of ripe plum and blue flower. The simple but well made palate offers juicy black cherry and a hint of vanilla alongside soft, round tannins. Drink now.
title: MandraRossa 2014 Costa Dune Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: Soft and fruity, this simple, easy-drinking red offers aromas and flavors of ripe blackberry, dark raspberry and hints of wild Mediterranean brush. Round tannins support the juicy flavors.
title: Cantine Ermes 2014 Vento di Mare Bio Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

description: This blend of Petit Verdot (40%), Grenache (29%), Shiraz (29%) and Mataro (2%) ends up being a pleasing recipe at an even more pleasing price. Mulberry, plum and vanilla flavors emerge from the glass, while the mouthfeel is full and lush. Probably best over the next year or so.
title: Rocland Estate 2007 Ass Kisser Fine Red Wine Red (South Australia)

description: Green plum and tart gooseberry aromas and flavors lead the way of this lively selection. Linear and direct on the palate, it has refreshing notes of lime rind, sweet grass and a touch of white flower. Clean and balanced; drink now.
title: Indaba 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Classic Carmenère aromas of oregano, basil and tomato vie with ripe plum and spice to create an herbal-leaning but honest bouquet. Feels good, with balance and lift to flavors of berry, olive, tobacco and herbs. Mild and short on the finish, but nice for $10.
title: oops 2010 Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Nice yet quiet on the opening, with lime, apple and minerally aromas. Feels tangy, maybe a touch sharp and pointed, with standard Casablanca flavors of lime, bell pepper and green apple. Short and tangy on the finish, with washing acidity.
title: Quintay 2011 Clava Coastal Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Simple and silky, this is fairly sweet in apricot and raspberry fruit. This is easy to drink at picnics and similar everyday occasions.
title: Rare NV 4 Grape Blend Rosé (California)

description: This is a finely tuned wine. On the one hand, it is crisp and fruity. On the other, it has fine concentration, with a zingy mineral texture. The wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Paxis Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This wine has enticing aromas of jasmine, white peach and orange blossom. It is well balanced with flavors of apricot and tangerine on the palate and a touch of bright orange flavor in the finish.
title: Domaine Boyar 2015 Muscat (Thracian Valley)

description: Wiry plum and green-tobacco aromas transition to red-fruit scents as this breathes. A fresh, forward palate is medium in body, while a mix of spice, green herb, olive, plum and berry notes comprise the flavor package. A tight, juicy palate maintains the wine's core flavors.
title: Caliterra 2014 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Delicately scented, this has subtle aromas evoking acacia, orchard fruit and a whiff of honeyed nut. The medium-bodied palate offers yellow apple and Bartlett pear that merge with bitter almond. It closes on a saline note.
title: La Mormoraia 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

description: Soft, supple and seductive, Modà is a simple wine that is propped up by notes of mature cherry fruit, spice and tobacco. It's easy in the mouth, with a rich, velvety texture.
title: Talamonti 2009 Modà  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: This is a soft, fruity wine that has attractive citrus and ripe apricot fruits. It has just a touch of spice to balance the acidity and the tangy texture. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A fresh, lightly herbal blend of most of the grapes of Gascony. It is crisp, lemon, currant and grapefruit flavored and bright as a button. The wine is made to be drunk young.
title: Domaine de Joÿ 2015 L'Eclat White (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This unbaked wine in a can tastes a bit tired, but it has an earthy appeal. The color is a brownish red and the aromas seem dusty and mature. The flavors are beefy and peppery while the texture is nicely tannic.
title: Sans Wine Co 2016 Poor Ranch Vineyards Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

description: This extracted wine has too hard an edge for the Vin de France category. Softer, more accessible black currant fruit is just hinted at underneath all its structure.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: This is a thin, fruity, simple wine with some red cherry flavors. Acidity and a touch of tannin completes the picture.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2016 La Châsse Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Leafy and herbal, with green tomato and pineapple flavors that mesh surprisingly well. It's medium-bodied, with a slight tang on the finish.
title: Zeal 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is a very informal and easygoing red table wine that would taste great with pizza. It opens with a bright ruby color and shows aromas of cherry, raspberry and toasted almond.
title: Bellini 2008 VYD Red (Toscana)

description: There's not a ton of intensity to the bouquet of this wine, but some serious sniffing can coax out suggestions of red apple and white florals. The mouth offers a bit more by way of full, juicy cantaloupe and grapefruit supreme flavors. Fresh and easy; drink now.
title: Domaines Paul Mas 2009 Domaine Lugel White (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A tight note of spearmint defines the nose. The palate follows suit: It's pinched and hard, with outsized acidity leading to a lemony palate, with searing cherry and red plum flavors. It doesn't waiver on the finish.
title: Raimat 2007 Castell de Raimat Cabernet Sauvignon (Costers del Segre)

description: Seemingly sweet and simple, this has orange and butterscotch candy flavors.
title: Lost Angel 2010 Chardonnay (California)

description: This seems so sweet, you could almost classify it as a dessert wine. It has simple orange, pineapple and vanilla flavors.
title: Rare NV 4 Grape Blend White (California)

description: After light scents of butter and spiced apple surface, the wine turns briny and pickled, both in aromas and flavors. It feels fleshy on the finish, with briny stone-fruit and citrus flavors.
title: Trapiche 2011 Oak Cask Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Lean and austere, this brings out the mineral character of the Dão region without expressing the richer fruit side. It has tannins, juicy acidity and a tight, severe finish.
title: Vidigal 2010 Red (Dão)

description: Rubbery on the nose, this has berry aromas lurking below. On the palate, it feels acidic, with tart raspberry flavors. It's lean on the finish, with a touch of oak.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Bodegas Fariña 2010 Peromato Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: This is an herbal Merlot that tastes of toasty oak and finishes slightly sweet.
title: Cable Car 2009 Merlot (Lodi)

description: An easy, fruity wine, this is full of blackberry and red currant flavors. Its fruitiness is tempered with a firm tannic core that gives a light structure.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2011 Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is an aromatic, sweet smelling Riesling with notes of ripe peach and honeysuckle. Though labeled as dry, at 1.86% residual sugar it drinks almost medium-sweet. Misdirection aside, it provides good value.
title: Williamson Vineyard 2011 Dry Riesling

description: This structured and dense wine hails from the steep, sloping hills of the Lisboa region. While aged in Portuguese oak, which provides spice and dark tannins, the delicious black fruit core is not overpowered. Drink now–2016.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Reserva do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: A year in the barrel has given this powerful wine structured, yet polished tannins. While still young, it is powered by ripe red berry notes and driving juicy acidity. It's a wine for further aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Caves Aliança 2011 Quinta da Garrida Red (Dão)

description: Vanilla and butter touches give this medium-bodied, rather oaky wine extra richness. Its soft, creamy texture and muted fruit flavors are a bit unusual for the type, but it's still quite enjoyable to sip.
title: Save Me San Francisco 2016 Bulletproof Picasso Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: For a wine that is not a Dão appellation to be made by the cooperative union that under the old Fascist regime controlled all of Dão's wine production, this is possibly an irreverent wine. Otherwise it is a fine, accessible blend of all the Dão red grapes in a mélange that is full of blackberry fruits and acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: UDACA 2014 Irreverente Red (Terras do Dão)

description: Ripe and spicy, this attractive forward wine is ready to drink. Made from local grapes with the addition of Syrah, it is juicy with red fruits, soft tannins and fragrant. Drink now.
title: Herdade das Servas 2013 Vinha das Servas Red (Alentejano)

description: Thin and lean, with herb, tobacco and cherry skin flavors that finish dry and sharp. Drink up.
title: Concannon 2007 Selected Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: Subtle, fresh, green aromas like celery and cut grass are followed by light cucumber flavors, a soft texture and short finish. It's a delicate wine at a good price.
title: Fetzer 2013 Echo Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: With aromas like butter and custard, and flavors that suggest ripe apple and crisp lemon, this is both refreshing and multifaceted. It feels light bodied and has a bit of a sweet-tart balance going for it.
title: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: A lightly herbaceous aroma and bright citrus flavors make this light-bodied wine fresh and easy to drink. It smells like fresh-cut grass and lemon, tastes like grapefruit and honeydew melon, and feels soft and smooth.
title: Pepi 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Green apples and citrus flavors dominate this fresh, fruity wine with its finishing acidity. It's light, bright and ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Millet 2014 Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: The nose is light and attractive, with peach and floral accents. The mouth is perfectly smooth, with apple, melon and a hint of flint or steel. On the finish, some cinnamon spice adds character to the baked-apple flavors. With no flaws, this is the epitome of affordable, drinkable Chardonnay. Best Buy.
title: Montes 2002 Reserve - Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: This medium-pink rosé shows some heft but is mostly about refreshment. Passion fruit and peach notes give way to citrus zest on its crisp, vibrant finish. Drink now.
title: Marrenon 2016 Les Grains Rosé de Merlot (Mediterranée)

description: Leather, raisin, cherry and mild green aromas feed into a full, chewy palate that's kind of blocky. Medicinal, herbal plum and berry flavors are standard and finish with herbal, spicy notes.
title: Finca Las Moras 2016 Alma Mora Malbec (San Juan)

description: This crisp, clean and zesty wine is lightly herbal and immediately appealing. It's full of citrus and gooseberry flavors and is ready to drink.
title: Vindivin 2016 La Belle Saison Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Red currant and dried-herb aromas lead into sweet cranberry and cherry flavors. It goes down easy.
title: Original House Wine 2013 Mountain Merlot (America)

description: This medium-bodied wine has bold aromas of black pepper, tobacco and clove that merge with straightforward cherry and herb flavors for a nicely complex profile. It has way more depth and interest than the price tag would suggest.
title: McManis 2014 Merlot (California)

description: This opens with a blast of bell pepper and leafy berry aromas. The palate is juicy but scratchy, while flavors of plum, raspberry and herbs finish tart, with no evolution.
title: Santa Ema 2011 Select Terroir Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

description: Fermented in 100% stainless steel, this priced-to-sell Syrah has some red fruit and violet character. On the finish it tastes slightly burnt.
title: McManis 2012 Syrah (California)

description: Herbal aromas, a chunky palate and herbal cherry and plum flavors finish earthy and with a raisiny element. This is sort of amorphous and mealy on the palate.
title: Santa Alicia 2012 Reserva Espiritu de los Andes Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)

description: This smells pretty good: cherry and plum aromas with mild oak are solid. The palate, however, is hard and has a plastic-like feel. Flavors of plum and berry finish bitter like espresso.
title: Château Los Boldos 2012 Momentos Reserva Syrah (Cachapoal Valley)

description: The aromas are bright, with notes of guava, pineapple and citrus. The palate is lightly spritzy with plenty of grapefruit flavors that keep the interest high.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: While muted on the nose, this refreshing off-dry Riesling offers concentrated tangerine and yellow peach flavors. Light in body with a spry, zesty mouthfeel, it finishes brisk and clean. Enjoy now.
title: Heinz Eifel 2016 Shine Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Murky, earthy aromas mark the nose—a blend of tomato, herb and meat notes. It feels good, with herbal-berry flavors and grapy thickness. It finishes with a flash of acidity, a note of coconutty oak and a final herbal blast.
title: Calina 2010 Carmenère (Central Valley)

description: Round and fruity, this is cleanly made, with its soft character coming from the ripe strawberry fruit. It's a good candidate to pair with a fruit dessert or to serve as an apéritif.
title: Veuve du Vernay NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: This is dry, silky and easy, with pleasant berry, tobacco and spice flavors. It's not complicated—just a fine, affordable sipper.
title: Main Street 2009 Merlot (Monterey County)

description: Although it's not very aromatic, the nose on this wine is easygoing, with mild peach and apple aromas. It feels fresh and medium bodied, with apple, peach and melony flavors, the latter perhaps due to the blend's 14% white Carmenère. It shows mellow oak notes and latent acidity on the finish.
title: oops 2011 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Clean, fruity and solid smelling, with a fresh, lightweight palate housing flavors of ginger, lime, lemongrass and powdered sugar. Easy on the finish. Textbook quaffing Cava if you like it a little sweet.
title: Segura Viudas NV Extra Dry Sparkling (Cava)

description: This attractive wine has a fine, dusty structure that balances well with the rich berry fruits. Sweet tannins and layers of acidity meld well. Ripe while also elegant, it needs a short period of aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2012 Vale das Donas Red (Tejo)

description: Aromas of pear, cantaloupe and apple are followed by broad, dry fruit flavors, with a spritzy finish. There's not much complexity, but the wine goes down easy and is very varietal.
title: 14 Hands 2016 Pinot Gris (Washington)

description: Raspberry and rubber-band aromas lead to a saturated palate with full tannnins and flavors of plum and plum skins. A mildly hot finish with grapeskin residue maintains the high volume this Malbec is putting out.
title: Marco Zunino 2014 Estancia Argentina Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this informal red has subdued aromas suggesting dark spice and plum. The simple palate delivers prune fruit with a sprinkling of clove and laid-back, fleeting tannins. Drink soon.
title: Poggio Nicchiaia 2014 Filetto  (Chianti)

description: A fruity wine with soft tannins that reflects the crispness of the vintage. The wine, full of blackberry fruit and balanced acidity comes from an estate in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region of Bordeaux. Drink now.
title: Château les Terrasses de Bouey 2014  Bordeaux

description: Aromas of stone-fruit pit and citrus peel are punchy. This blend of Viura and Tempranillo Blanco feels solid. Pithy grapefruit and salty flavors carry over to the finish of this everyday white.
title: Carlos Serres 2015 White (Rioja)

description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this has black-skinned fruit and dark spice aromas. The simple palate delivers red cherry fruit and the slightest hint of white pepper with a frame of easygoing tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Uggiano 2015 Prestige  (Chianti)

description: Grapefruit aromas, bright kiwi and apple flavors and appetizing acidity make a lively, refreshing wine. This will be thirst-quenching on hot summer days and good with seafood, goat cheese and many other dishes any time of the year.
title: Bogle 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: A maderized gold color and oxidized aromas are not inviting. This feel heavy and clunky, with oily, nutty tasting white-fruit flavors. An almondy bitterness drives the finish.
title: Mancura 2012 Guardián Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Hard to like this Pinot. It has flavors of beets, cola and asparagus, but it's drinkable.
title: Wild Hare 2012 Legendary Pinot Noir (California)

description: Vanilla cookies and sulfuric match stick are about all you can draw from the bouquet. This is flat in feel, with candied, flabby flavors of green fruits. The finish is bland.
title: Santa Ema 2012 Select Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: This wine offers a balance of apple and citrus crispness with a touch of buttery oak. The nose is redolent of crisp fruits; on the palate it's refreshing and seafood-friendly. Pair with shellfish or creamy egg dishes.
title: Indaba 2009 Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: Hard spice, fresh-cut oak and dark berry aromas make for a serious, stout bouquet. This is bright and lively in the mouth, with mouthfilling tannins and flavors of boysenberry and vanilla. A quick, slightly hot finish is aggressive but sturdy.
title: Mancura 2011 Guardián Reserva Carignan (Maule Valley)

description: A big, bold, fruity wine, this has great tannins, ripe black-currant fruit and an attractive sense of structure. It has all the juiciness and freshness of 2010, but is a wine for aging over 3–4 years.
title: Château Fontenelle 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Inviting berry and dark plum aromas are matched by spice notes and depth. The palate feels ripe and full, maybe a touch scratchy, with generous flavors of berry fruits, licorice and toast. For a value wine this shows intensity and good flavors.
designation: Para Celsus Made with Organically Grown Grapes
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Bodegas Navarro López 2011 Para Celsus Made with Organically Grown Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Here's an easy Italian wine (made with the native Corvina grape) that occupies a space somewhere between red wine and rosé. You could easily serve Re Midas chilled and pair it with hamburger or pizza.
title: Cantina di Soave 2010 Re Midas Corvina (Venezie)

description: Good price for a dry summer blush wine for drinking with barbecue, sandwiches or just about anything easy. With berry and spice flavors, it has a nice bite of acidity.
title: Pedroncelli 2010 Dry Rosé of Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A little funky and pickled on the nose, with vanilla and oak aromas. The palate has an average feel and tangy acidity to push citrus, green banana and vanilla flavors. About as regular as Chardonnay gets.
title: Vistamar 2010 Sepia Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: This big bottle of Pinot Grigio has strong aromas of peach and is pretty full in flavor though not in finish. Not a lot of acidity here, but the wine is fine for the price and volume. No problem next to a plate of spicy paella.
title: Glen Ellen 2010 Proprietor's Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Straightforward and easy-drinking, this delivers ripe black cherry, succulent raspberry, violet and a dash of white pepper. It's smooth, with round, polished tannins that support the juicy palate.
title: Torrevento 2012 Torre del Falco Uva di Troia (Puglia)

description: If you like the Australian Rieslings, which often push petrol, mineral and shy fruit, than this is for you. It hails from cool and southerly Bío Bío, and it's an honest Riesling with lemony freshness and grapefruit on the palate, followed by a juicy finish. A potential by-the-glass favorite.
title: Cono Sur 2006 The Southern Cone Riesling (Bío Bío Valley)

description: Sheltered by a coastal range of hills from the Atlantic Ocean, this vineyard has produced a ripe soft wine that has gentle tannins and succulent red fruits. The aftertaste is fresh, continuing the fruit theme. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Quinta das Amoras Red (Lisboa)

description: Trincadeira, Moreto and Castelão form the blend for this stalky, fruity wine. It shows no signs of wood aging, boasting only fresh red fruits and balanced acidity. The aftertaste is fresh, continuing the fruity theme.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Alandra Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Heady aromas suggesting tropical fruit, honeysuckle and citrus zest lead the nose. Bright and refreshing, the lively palate offers mature white stone fruit, tangerine peel and a pleasantly bitter-almond note.
title: Stemmari 2016 Estate Grown Grillo (Sicilia)

description: For whatever reason, this wine consistently fails to impress. Once again, it's vegetal and pickled, with forced flavors of candy and too much residual sugar. Forget it if you only drink dry rosé.
title: Miguel Torres 2009 Santa Digna Reserve Rosé Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Drinkable, but just barely, even at this everyday price. It's soft and cloyingly sweet, with raspberry and cocoa flavors.
title: Shiloh Road 2007 Merlot (North Coast)

description: Dull and uninteresting, with some simple apricot flavors and unripe vegetal notes. Acceptable for its dryness and crispness, period.
title: Soleau 2008 Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

description: Like the label says, this red is sweet. It's also full-bodied and fruity. The winery doesn't tell us what the grape mix is, but who cares. Drink and be happy.
title: Totally Random NV Sweet Red Wine Red (California)

description: Tart and angular on the nose, with sharp red berry and plum aromas. Crisp and acidic, with sweet-and-sour flavors in front of a tight, clean, short finish. Fresh but high in acidity and veering towards tart.
title: Venta Morales 2009 Made With Organic Grapes Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: This wine is fresh without being too herbaceous. Sauvignon Blanc controls crispness with flavors of almonds, citrus and quince. The tangy, steely aftertaste will soften from the end of 2015.
title: Château Taussin 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Looking more like a light red wine than a supposedly pink one, this smells like ripe cherries and boysenberries, has a luscious, smooth texture and a soft, almost sweet finish.
title: Drytown 2014 Estate Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

description: Generic peach and apple aromas are light and easy. This blend of Merseguera and Macabeo feels pulpy and citrusy, while pithy flavors of peach and orange finish fresh, but with limited complexity.
title: Bocopa 2014 Alcanta White (Alicante)

description: Veramonte is one of the early proponents of Casablanca, and this wine sings a pretty tune. The bouquet offers apple, melon, pear and a kiss of solid oak, while the palate shows vanilla along with soft pear and apple flavors. Balanced and a touch sweet, but not too oaky or resiny. Imported by Huneeus Vintners, LLC.
title: Veramonte 2006 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Soft and richly fruity, this has all the right red cherry and banana flavors that are immediately attractive. A delicious, juicy wine. Screwcap.
title: Mommessin 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: Tight and intense for a $10 varietal, with crusty, charred oak aromas on top of ripe berry fruit. The palate is thick and full, with clamping tannins and flavors of lemony oak, plum and blackberry. Vanilla and mocha work the woody finish.
title: Trapiche 2009 Oak Cask Syrah (Mendoza)

description: Not complex but if you're looking for size, red fruit flavors and balance, it has that. The nose shows compost and horse hide but for the most part it's fruity and welcoming. The mouth is fresh and a bit sheer, with direct berry, plum and creamy flavors. Finishes smooth for a $10 Tempranillo-Garnacha blend.
title: Coto de Hayas 2007 Crianza Tempranillo-Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

description: This luminous Chardonnay from southern Italy imparts notes of spice, fresh herbs and little fruit. It is, however, rounded off by mineral notes and some citrus or pineapple-like aromas. It's an easy-drinking white with a chalky, almost sweet sensation in the mouth.
title: Cantine Due Palme 2005 Rocca Normanna Le Sciare Chardonnay (Salento)

description: This is a fruit bomb supreme. Bright, effusive strawberry, raspberry and boysenberry aromas and flavors seem to spread out in all directions, first in the aroma, then repeating in the flavors and finish. With a sip or two some deeper black cherry notes emerge, and full body and gripping tannins become more apparent.
title: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Petite Sirah (Lodi)

description: Bursting with Conference pear flavor, this supple, fun and crisp all-rounder should be drunk as soon as possible to make most of the primary fruit.
title: Forstreiter 2015 Grooner Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: This bold, ripe blend even contains some Muscat that gives richness and a touch of honey and spice to what is otherwise a dry rosé. The acidity acts as a balance to this attractive wine.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Jas des Vignes Rosé

description: A simple Chardonnay, with a soapy mouthfeel, lemony fruit and a hint of almond in the finish.
title: Hoodsport 2007 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Sweet and simple, with flavors of apricot, pineapple, peach and pear juice.
title: Napa Family Vineyards 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tannic and chewy, this is simple, sturdy and solidly in the herbal camp. Flavors are short and the finish leans into veggies.
title: Hoodsport 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Cortegaia is a thin, ruby-colored red wine with easy aromas of small berry and white cherry. The mouthfeel is compact and watery but its also refreshingly crisp. You could drink it chilled with appetizers.
title: La Scolca NV Cortegaia Red (Piedmont)

description: Simple and rather sweet, but balanced with zesty acidity and minerality. The flavors are of honey, pineapples and ripe nectarines.
title: Castle Rock 2010 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This rich and integrated wine is full of ripe berry fruit and firm tannins. It is a full, concentrated wine, densely textured and structured. There is a good sense of juiciness behind the youthful, firm surface. Give this fine, great-value wine at least four years.
title: Château Mayne Guyon 2011  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This smells strange, with a mix of herbal blueberry, leather and green tobacco aromas. An awkward, fiercely tannic palate leads to herbal, minty flavors of boysenberry and blackberry that finish with dry, abrasive tannins.
title: Zorzal 2012 Tempranillo (Navarra)

description: Funky, unfresh aromas suggest clove and compost. A flat, wide palate is low on definition, while pithy citrus and apricot flavors finish bitter and bland, with a shot of acidity.
title: Restivo 2013 Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: Sweet and sour in apricot, orange and vanilla flavors, this simple Chardonnay is fairly priced for the quality.
title: Napa Family Vineyards 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Here's an easy, no-fuss white wine to pair with rice salad or grilled vegetables. Citrus, almond blossom and stone fruit are capped by a slightly sweet feel in the mouth.
title: Corvo 2010 Fiore White (Sicilia)

description: Easy, fresh and crisp, this well-priced Grillo would make a great choice for, predinner sipping. Aromas include citrus zest, white almond and wild flower.
title: Calatrasi 2010 Terrale Oro Grillo (Sicilia)

description: There is a layer of tannins here that impart a dry edge to what is otherwise sweetly fruity wine. It is full and juicy, with strawberry fruit flavors.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: Green apple and lime aromas are well presented and clean. This has a citrusy feel to go with lime, passion fruit and grapefruit flavors. A mildly pithy and citric finish delivers plenty of youthful kick.
designation: Puerto Viejo Estate Bottled Single Vineyard Reserve
title: Viña Requingua 2014 Puerto Viejo Estate Bottled Single Vineyard Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: This white blend of Gros Manseng and Petit Courbu, both local grapes for Saint-Mont, produces a ripe, floral wine with touches of honey. It is refreshing as well, with lime juice acidity that sails right through to the end.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2013 Hat Trick  (Saint-Mont)

description: Sweet and simple, with pineapple and apricot jam flavors.
title: Glen Ellen 2010 Proprietor's Reserve Chardonnay (California)

description: Stalky smelling, with a minerally streak. Feels tangy and lean, with lemon, sour apple and white currant flavors. Short on the finish.
title: Carlos Serres 2010 Serres Viura (Rioja)

description: Strained from front to back. The nose smells pickled and funky, while the palate is boring in feel and tastes candied but also a lot like brine or caper juice. Sweet on the finish.
title: Torito Bravo NV Sweet Chardonnay-Moscato White (Spain)

description: The wine offers candied, medicinal aromas and a bland, fruit-juice-like palate. Grape and red-fruit flavors are tart and scouring.
title: Bodega Tintoralba 2012 BT Spanish Inspiration Garnacha (Almansa)

description: A bit narrow and medicinal, but overall this Cab delivers reasonably good cherry and herbal berry aromas and flavors along with some oak, coconut, citric acid and earth. It's a touch muddled and all over the map, but for $10 it's a pretty good wine.
title: Siegel 2008 Crucero Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Here's a luminous and crystalline white wine in a screwcap bottle with linear and direct aromas of white mineral, kiwi and pear. The mouthfeel is crisp and compact and this easygoing white would drink well with fish, summer foods and salads.
title: Castelvero 2008 Cortese (Piedmont)

description: Here is a sweet and fragrant dessert wine with aromas of white flower, honey and stone fruit accented by a slightly drying mineral characteristic. Firm, tonic effervescence keeps the palate refreshed even when paired with whipped cream or creamy fruit desserts.
title: Gancia NV Grand Reale White (Piedmont)

description: Serve this affordable Merlot at big parties. It's a fairly dull wine, but serviceable, with currant, spice and oak flavors.
title: Coyote Creek 2012 Merlot (California)

description: Hints of dusty mineral and hazelnut lend a slightly earthy tone to this otherwise bright, lemony Gewürztraminer. Delicately sweet, it offers easygoing citrus refreshment with a brisk finish. Drink now.
title: St. Christopher 2015 Gewürztraminer (Nahe)

description: Candied cherry and plum aromas are light and not that convincing. This is a wiry, choppy, light-bodied red with tart, juicy plum and raspberry flavors. A short yet fresh finish hollows out quickly.
title: Pata Negra 2012 Roble  (Toro)

description: What a delicious Sauvignon Blanc, and look at that everyday price. It's so easy to like the creamy, yet tart flavors of peaches, with a slight touch of sour lees for complexity. From Mason Cellars, with a case production of 48,000.
title: Pomelo 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: This generous, fruity and lightly sweet wine should please a crowd with its butter and vanilla aromas, rich apple, pear and baking-spice flavors and rounded mouth-filling texture.
title: Save Me San Francisco 2014 Calling All Angels Chardonnay (California)

description: Big and fruity, and for the most part holds together and exhibits more good qualities than its faults. The flavor profile drives full-bodied black fruit and a finish that cuts out quietly. Not over the top in any way.
title: Doña Paula 2006 Los Cardos Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

description: Cherry, rubber and leather aromas are tight and announce a punchy, bright, raw palate with raspberry and plum flavors. Snappy and rubbery feeling on the finish, this is a fresh Monastrell with red-fruit tendencies.
title: Finca Hispana 2012 Joven Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: A red blend from the eastern end of the Entre deux Mers region, this is a smooth and already accessible wine. Attractive black fruits and soft tannins accompany touches of vanilla. It's ready to drink.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2012 Luna B  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is all about fruit with only a passing reference to tannins. Red berry flavors come with just a dash of minerality and a firmer, wood-aged core. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Tuilerie Pagès 2012  Bordeaux

description: Dry Vinho Verde that is packed with citrus, crisp apple fruits and a light sparkle. A great apéritif wine, but also try it with any shellfish.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2010 Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional with a more local grape, Jaen, gives a juicy, light and fragrant wine. There's a tannic structure, but the wine is more to do with red fruits and acidity. Drink in 2015.
title: Vidigal 2012 Red (Dão)

description: This wine is ripe, with attractive red cherry fruit flavors. It bursts with fruitiness, fresh acidity and just the lightest structure.
title: Henry Fessy 2014 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: Alluring aromas of citrus, white flower and a whiff of tropical fruit come together on this. The racy palate offers lemon zest, mango, sage, saline and an almond note alongside vibrant acidity.
title: Stemmari 2015 Grillo (Sicilia)

description: Purple and extracted, with aromas of roasted meat and ripe black fruits. A vigorous blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot that's full-bodied and offers commendable balance and flavors of baked berries, molasses and hoisin sauce. Thick and creamy on the finish.
title: Carlos Basso 2008 Dos Fincas Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Uco Valley)

description: Tastes like unsugared lemonade, with a splash of pineapple and cherry concentrate. Crisply acidic, it's bone dry. Clean and easy, a nice cocktail wine.
title: McManis 2008 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is rough and gritty smelling, with burnt, stalky berry aromas. It feels straightforward, with rubbery-tasting berry flavors that lead to a sweet, warm finish.
title: Árido 2010 Sustainably Farmed Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Light, bright and with lively acidity, this is already a juicy, delicious wine. It offers good fruitiness, with pink grapefruit flavors and a tangy, zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Merlet 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Deeply savory tones of bramble and earth are juxtaposed against fresh tangerine and lemon in this light-footed, semidry Riesling. It's not a deeply complex wine but sprightly and crisp, with a clean, slightly honeyed finish. Drink now.
title: HXM NV Riesling (Landwein Rhein)

description: Generic plum and berry aromas are borderline volatile and include a forced note of chocolaty oak. This Tempranillo is abrupt and choppy on the palate, with flavors of candied plum and milk chocolate. A chocolaty oak character remains on a blocky finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Eguren 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Dusty, spicy and a little scratchy on the nose, this has leather, vanilla and mild fruit aromas. It feels tangy, with a light herb flavor working in tandem with dry plum and berry notes. Briary, spicy and drying on the finish.
title: Federico Paternina 2010 Monte Haro Red  (Rioja)

description: A mellow, neutral nose doesn't push the envelope. In the mouth, this is round but punchy, with some excess weight. Flavors of apple juice, pear and melon finish with flavors of lime, apple cider and powdered sugar.
title: Tarantas NV Sparkling (Spain)

description: Bland berry aromas precede a pasty feeling, cloying palate with lactic, creamy flavors of oak and generic berry fruits. This is drying on the finish.
title: Tierra de Antes 2011 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Grassy, compost-like aromas carry a peanut accent and not much vivid fruit. This pinches down on what amounts to a clampy palate, while crisp, mildly green berry flavors finish minty and peppery.
title: Paso a Paso 2011 Made with Organic Grapes Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: Burnt hay, grapefruit and waxy apple aromas lead to a palate with briny citrus flavors. Pithy grapefruit and orange flavors carry the finish, which is quick and light in weight.
title: Monte Clavijo 2012 Viura (Rioja)

description: Interesting notes of cumin and clove accent berry and leather aromas on this well-made red. Roasted, earthy, meaty, spicy berry flavors lead into a mildly burnt, toasty finish with modest oak.
title: Adoquin 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Dark aromas of black cherry and plum are spicy and suggestive of crude oil. In the mouth, this everyday Cab shows juicy balance and clean lines. Standard black-fruit flavors come with spice notes and a harmonious, long finish.
title: Adoquin 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Here's a fresh, delicious Syrah for drinking now. It's lush and smooth in black raspberry and cherry purée, fennel, beef jerky and black pepper flavors, backed up with a juicy hit of acidity.
title: McManis 2009 Syrah (California)

description: Calina usually makes a nice value Chardonnay, and this vintage is no different. The wine has a chunky dry-peach opening, which is backed by a round, smooth palate and flavors of sweet pear, baked apple and roasted corn. Honey and orange notes make cameo appearances. Good for the price.
title: Calina 2009 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Light and basic Macabeo with melon and other sweet, mellow aromas. The palate is a bit flat in feel but otherwise there's nothing wrong. Tastes of light citrus, kiwi and white grapes. Chalky and slightly stony on the finish.
title: La Purísima 2010 Capa Rota Macabeo (Yecla)

description: Attractive, softly fruity wine, with some citrus character as well as pear and apple juice. It is crisp, fresh, ready to drink. Winebow.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2010 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Big, powerful, dominated by dark tannins and dense fruit. The alcohol is apparent in the burnt rubber edge, although the richness of the fruit, with its bitter chocolate edge, does help to mask it. The acidity at the end gives freshness.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2005 Héritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A good value, this Chardonnay delivers plenty of mouthfilling flavor for the price. Pineapple and melon fruit is tinged with a touch of mint, and while the flavors may be somewhat simple, at least they're assertive.
title: Jindalee 2007 Circle Collection Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

description: Air freshener and tropical aromas lead to a juice-like palate with green tannins. Lime, nettle and nopal flavors finish heavy.
title: Vaya Vadiso 2012 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: This is light and fresh, with melony aromas. It's plump and waning on the palate, with a splash of citric acidity. Mealy nectarine flavors lead to a stalky finish that loses steam.
title: Leyendas de Familia 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: This mild Sauvignon Blanc offers simple citrus and passion fruit aromas in front of an oily-feeling, pulpy palate. Flavors of vinaigrette, cactus and grapefruit finish with mealy lemon and orange notes.
title: Misiones de Rengo 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Light vanilla and chunky tropical fruit aromas open this basic Chardonnay. The palate is weighty, while flavors of pineapple, mango and oak run sweet. On the finish, it falls off and doesn't hold up.
title: Arauco 2012 Chardonnay (Central Valley)

description: Soft aromas of sea shell, stone and mango appear in the bouquet. In the mouth, this is big and clumsy, with cidery flavors that continue onto the finish. Like many 2012 Chilean Chardonnays, this is overly ripe and not in the best balance.
title: Viña La Fortuna 2012 Culpeo Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: This blends almost-sweet fruit flavors of strawberry and red cherry with savory and spicy notes, making a nicely complex and multi-dimensional, medium-bodied wine. It's smooth and fruity, with no harsh tannins.
title: Belle Ambiance 2013 Red (California)

description: The Muscat Canelli in the blend really stands out, offering tangerine aromas and flavors. But additional fruit and spice complexities are offered by Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier, among other varieties. Crisply acidic and dry, this is an outstanding white wine, and a versatile one at the table. Sommeliers, buy this by the case.
title: Big House 2007 White White (California)

description: On the lighter side of the Côtes du Rhône spectrum, with a slightly briary note to the cherry fruit. Turns more olivaceous on the silky-textured finish. Drink now.
title: Michel Picard 2007 Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Dry, minty and spicy, with cool, lightweight berry and cola aromas. The palate is fairly light and easy, with lean red-fruit flavors, dry spice and a creamy tasting accent. Spice more than fruit carries the finish. Pedestrian wine that's competent.
title: Baron de Escal 2009 Tempranillo, Garnacha, Mazuelo  (Rioja)

description: Very good price for a Cab of this quality. It's dry and full-bodied, with ripe, attractive flavors of blackberry jam, cherries, minty chocolate and smoky oak.
title: Line 39 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)

description: An ordinary but competent Rioja. The fruit is light but young and fresh; the palate touches on raspberry and plum. A bit of mineral and natural bitterness work the finish, and overall this is a no-complaints kind of $10 wine.
title: Criadores de Rioja 2006 Monte Clavijo  (Rioja)

description: This maintains good harmony between aromas of ripe fruit and elegant spice. It's an easy-drinking, approachable wine that would wash down well with simple roasted meats. Imported by Racke USA.
title: Vitae 2005 Sangiovese (Puglia)

description: Apple cider, night jasmine, ripe pears and orange cream aromas show on this sweeter bottling. The palate is quite clean and crisp, with rich apple juice flavors and a tactile acidity that fades fairly quickly. It's quite sweet.
title: Fetzer 2014 Goosefoot Road Riesling (Monterey County)

description: Aromas like dried herbs and flavors like green apple and pear nectar make a colorful combination in this medium-bodied wine.
title: Castle Rock 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

description: This is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat, not often found although working well here. The perfumed Muscat nicely softens the herbal Sauvignon to give a wine that is almost honeyed, certainly attractive as an apéritif.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 Gabriel Sauvignon Blanc-Muscat White (Vin de France)

description: This is a gentle and easy-going Chardonnay. It is soft, lightly buttery and conveys apricot and ripe pear flavors. The aftertaste just touches on acidity.
title: Café du Midi 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Capitalizing on the fashion for Malbec, this wine is closer to Argentina than Cahors. It has soft tannins and a ripe and juicy flavor of red-berry fruits. Acidity and a soft aftertaste reinforce this New World feel.
title: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Malbec (Vin de France)

description: With the largest production in the entire Northwest, it is important that this wine express clean, varietal flavors with characteristic brightness and focus. And it does. Lightly herbal, fresh and clean, its fruit flavors suggest lemongrass, orange and ripe apple. Excellent balance and persistence
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This medium-sweet offering has aromas of lime leaf and jasmine that lead to apricot and floral flavors. There's not a lot of complexity but it offers easy drinking enjoyment.
title: Perimeter 2014 Riesling (Washington)

description: Dry and crisp, this is a fruity, red currant-flavored wine. Bright acidity and a light texture give a final bite of structure to an otherwise soft and ready to drink release.
title: Cave de Rauzan 2014 Duprais Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Earthy, grassy, cherry aromas are lightly medicinal in front of a slightly narrow, almost citric palate that comes with a note of vinegar. Black-plum flavors are simple on the midpalate, while modest notes of plum and berry show on the finish.
title: La Casa Maguila 2013 Angelitos Negros  (Toro)

description: An earthy, smoked meat and plum nose leads into luscious berry and pepper flavors in this affordable Shiraz. Balanced acidity and fruit offer freshness and zest with dimension. The mouthfeel is full and pleasing. Pair with smoked meat or grilled spicy chicken.
title: Blue Cove 2007 Shiraz (Western Cape)

description: Luscious peach and mango flavors with a hint of fresh green peas mark this wine. It has enough acidity to balance the ripeness.
title: Guenoc 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: Bitter extraction hinders this wine. It does have some attractive fruitiness in the background, but it's lost amidst all the toughness. The rigid edge will soften, although the wine's fruitiness may well never materialize.
title: Château de Seguin 2011 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Candied, flat aromas of cherry and red licorice announce a chunky palate, with sweet plum, raspberry and brown sugar flavors. Drink now.
title: Cruz de Piedra 2012 Garnacha Rosado (Calatayud)

description: Beautifully fruity wine, bright, citrus and yellow fruit dominated. Packed with crisp acidity, light floral flavors and a steely texture. It's for drinking now. Screwcap.
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2012 Classic White (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Earth, rubber, leafy notes, spice and plum aromas carry the nose on this 50/50 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tempranillo. The mouthfeel is full and tomatoey, with snappy acidity pushing minty, herbal flavors of red plum, currant and raspberry. A light, medicinal flavor defines the finish.
designation: Vertus Wine Made with Organically Grown Grapes
title: Bodegas Iranzo 2011 Vertus Wine Made with Organically Grown Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon-Tempranillo (Utiel-Requena)

description: Cecchetti Wine Company makes a lot of Line 39 Sauvignon Blanc, but does it well, offering an affordable wine that tastes great. Grassy and tropical, it's true to Lake County, with just a touch of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc character. Crisp and easy to drink.
title: Line 39 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

description: Always a consistent rosé from Rioja. The nose is candied but fresh and nice, while the palate is full but standard, with plump melon, citrus and raspberry flavors. Finishes short but sturdy, with balance and good acidity.
title: El Coto 2010 Rosado Rosé (Rioja)

description: Aromas of melon, pear and candied apple lead to medium-bodied fleshy-feeling fruit flavors. It brings a pleasing sense of acidity—a delightful white.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2016 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a perfectly solid, fresh Torrontés, with lime, pineapple and banana aromas and similar flavors. Add in some acid-based agility and lift, and this ranks as an everyday quaffer of the first order. Drink immediately.
title: Fat Gaucho 2011 Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: This is a fine wine, with great structure and ripe fruit. Dark tannins, a tense mineral texture and blackberry tones are all there, giving a wine that's rich and full bodied. Drink from 2017.
title: Caves Aliança 2011 Aliança Reserva Red (Dão)

description: A crisp nose of lemon, grass and spice leads this Traminer from Bulgaria. On the palate, the wine is light and pretty, and while simple, offers a delightful pairing with cheeses, poultry.
title: Vinex Slavyantsi 2007 Slavyantsi Estate Traminer (Thracian Valley)

description: Smoky, pungent and earthy, with cola and plum notes that fill the mouth, then turn crisp on the finish.
title: Oxford Landing 2007 Merlot (South Australia)

description: Raspberry, plum and cherry aromas are light, pure and fully inviting, with nothing off-putting. This tastes bright and balanced, with cherry and berry flavors that are impossible not to like. A dash of oaky cocoa blends with leftover red fruit flavors on a nice finish.
title: Viña Cumbrero 2010 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: A wine that is soft, fragrant and very fruity. There's a touch of spice, pepper as well as tangy lemon zest. Sandgrube 13 is the address of the Krems cooperative. Screwcap.
title: Winzer Krems 2012 Sandgrube 13 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: Something seems off here, or perhaps it is just a young wine throwing off some bottling aromas. In any event, it's thin, simple and sugary, without the complexity of the excellent 2010.
title: StoneCap 2011 Estate Grown Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This has intense aromas of spearmint and eucalyptus. The palate is lean, with licorice and mineral but not enough fruit.
title: Pierluigi Zampaglione 2010 Don Chisciotte Fiano (Campania)

description: The aromas are quite faint here but the apricot flavors are in abundance on this off-dry, medium-bodied easy drinker.
title: Radius 2012 Chardonnay (Washington)

description: Here's an absolutely terrific, but informal sparkling rosé from southern Italy (made with Negroamaro grapes). Sweet berry, chopped mint and peach come to the fore and the wine is soft and slightly sweet. It's easy, fresh and would make a great cocktail choice.
title: Villa Mottura NV Rosé Extra Dry Negroamaro (Salento)

description: The name and packaging scream “concept wine,” but what's in the bottle will win you over. It's full and rubbery, with pleasant yet generic berry aromas. The palate is racy and fairly hefty and tannic, with black raspberry, plum and mild herbal flavors. Grabby, with good acidity on the finish.
title: Vintage Sun 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: A hint of honeysuckle and orange blossom graces the red apple and juicy melon fruit flavors. Tangy and a touch astringent in the mouth with a finish of bitter citrus pith.
title: Rooiberg 2011 Chenin Blanc (Robertson)

description: A perennial Best Buy, Sangre de Toro always delivers a quality red-wine experience that does not bowl you over. Here the aromas are light and jammy, with strawberry. The body is medium in weight and intensity, with pure but basic cherry, raspberry and plum flavors. Like all other parts of the wine, the finish is easy and clean, with carry-over flavors of berry fruit.
title: Torres 2006 Sangre de Toro Red (Catalunya)

description: Young, jumpy and slightly candied, but that's just fine given the price range it's playing in. To get old-vines Garnacha for a song is not uncommon, yet this wine's thick, fruity palate goes beyond the norm. And with a round mouthfeel built on light-framed tannins, it's easygoing as can be. Drink now, but don't put it under the microscope.
title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2007 Menguante Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: This a bit sweet, with flavors of pineapple, orange and buttered that are brightened by brisk Central Coast acidity.
title: Firefly Ridge 2011 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Green aromas of oregano and basil blend with tomato and red plum. It feels grabby and thick, with heavy flavors of carob and herb-accented red berry.
title: Viñas de Vila 2009 Reserva Merlot (Mendoza)

description: Sweet and soft, this has pineapple, orange and vanilla flavors. The firm acidity helps to maintain some balance.
title: Dominican Oaks 2011 Unoaked Chardonnay (California)

description: This is a simple, rustic wine, with flavors of raspberry and cherry.
title: Firefly Ridge 2010 The Red Flash Red (California)

description: On the nose, the red berry aromas are rough and scratchy. The palate feels acidic and clipped, with tart flavors of red plum, cranberry and pie cherry. The finish is long and acidic.
title: Tierra de Antes 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This is rough and gritty smelling, with burnt, stalky berry aromas. It feels straightforward, with rubbery-tasting berry flavors that lead to a sweet, warm finish.
title: Árido 2010 Sustainably Farmed Malbec (Mendoza)

description: There's no oak on this simple Sauvignon Blanc. It's made in a softer style, which makes the apricot, orange and lime flavors taste riper than they really are.
title: Tin Roof 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: An off-dry wine, with crisp apple fruits and a light, bright texture. It's tangy, full of lemony acidity with a light prickle. It's for drinking immediately.
title: Pátria 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This off-dry white blend offers primary stone-fruit and tangerine flavors in a brisk light-footed package. It's harmoniously sweet with a slightly earthy dusty finish. Drink now.
title: Peter Mertes 2015 Platinum Spätlese White (Rheinhessen)

description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tinta Roriz, this wine has a good sense of structure, with  vibrant acidity and black-currant fruits. Touches of oak give a spicy edge to this juicy, fruity wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Pedras do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: What a great price for a Chardonnay this balanced and savory. It's bright in acidity, with keen flavors of limes, oranges, tropical fruits and vanilla, and just a touch of buttered toast. Easy to find, with a production of 6,000 cases.
title: Line 39 2011 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Off-dry, with initial flavors of orange candy and a slight medicinal graininess. It develops some honeyed lemon in the midpalate, and smoothes into a pleasant-drinking, low alcohol and high acid Riesling.
title: Snake River 2010 Arena Valley Vineyard Riesling

description: Made with 85% Sangiovese, 5% Ciliegiolo, 5% Merlot and 5% Alicante, this informal red has aromas suggesting prune and scorched earth. The aromas carry over to the simple palate along with a resin note. Drink soon.
title: Vignaioli del Morellino di Scansano 2015 Golden Boar Red (Toscana)

description: Basic apple, melon and bready aromas are fine but not distinct or complex. Ditto the palate, which feels balanced but highly basic. Simple papaya and melon flavors finish flat.
title: Chilensis 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: Gritty citrus aromas are oily but adequate. This basic SB tastes of citrus and green vegetables. Beyond that, it's mostly fresh in feel.
title: Santa Luz 2015 Alba Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: This is a good value in a soft, easy-drinking wine. It has very ripe fruit flavors, hints of brown sugar, a relaxed texture and a seemingly sweet finish.
title: Belle Ambiance 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Cedary, spicy aromas and flavors rather than a strong fruit character define this medium-bodied, soft-textured wine. It is heavy on the spice and light on acidity and tannins.
title: Leaping Horse 2014 Merlot (California)
